course_title: WSQ Make Muffins and Scones
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Make Muffins and Scones
course_objective: The objective of this module is to equip the learners with the knowledge and techniques in the preparation of muffins and scones. To this end, the learners will acquire the knowledge and skills to prepare additional muffins and scones that are relevant to their work places or food and beverage establishment.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Identify workplace hazards and their prevention
- Identify workplace safety and health management
- Identify slips, trips and falls in food & beverage industry 
- Identify and apply food hygiene guidelines
- Identify different indicators of doneness and quality characteristics of muffins and scones
- Identify common faults in muffins and scones and how to prevent them
- Identify trends in the food and beverage sector, in particular the baking industry for muffins and scones
- Demonstrate methods of preparing ingredients for making muffins
- Demonstrate methods of preparing muffin batter for baking
- Demonstrate methods of baking muffins
- Demonstrate methods of cooling, finishing and storing muffins 
- Demonstrate methods of preparing ingredients for making scones
- Demonstrate methods of preparing scones for baking
- Demonstrate methods of baking scones
- Demonstrate methods of cooling, finishing and storing scones
- Demonstrate methods of reinstating work station
course_entry_req: Able to read and write in English
full_course_desc:
# course provider
BELLS INSTITUTE OF HIGHER LEARNING PTE. LTD.

# course title

# course url

# course mode of training

# full course fee

# subsidised course fee

# course number of hours
24.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
The objective of this module is to equip the learners with the knowledge and techniques in the preparation of muffins and scones. To this end, the learners will acquire the knowledge and skills to prepare additional muffins and scones that are relevant to their work places or food and beverage establishment.

# course learning outcomes
- Identify workplace hazards and their prevention
- Identify workplace safety and health management
- Identify slips, trips and falls in food & beverage industry 
- Identify and apply food hygiene guidelines
- Identify different indicators of doneness and quality characteristics of muffins and scones
- Identify common faults in muffins and scones and how to prevent them
- Identify trends in the food and beverage sector, in particular the baking industry for muffins and scones
- Demonstrate methods of preparing ingredients for making muffins
- Demonstrate methods of preparing muffin batter for baking
- Demonstrate methods of baking muffins
- Demonstrate methods of cooling, finishing and storing muffins 
- Demonstrate methods of preparing ingredients for making scones
- Demonstrate methods of preparing scones for baking
- Demonstrate methods of baking scones
- Demonstrate methods of cooling, finishing and storing scones
- Demonstrate methods of reinstating work station

# course entry req
Able to read and write in English

course_title: Perform Work At Height
course_title_cleaned: Perform Work At Height
course_objective: - Identify the Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Act/ Regulations/ Approved Codes of Practice/ Singapore Standards relevant to work-at-height  - Recognise risk assessment methods relevant to work-at-height hazards  - Follow organisational preventive measures relevant to working-at-height  - Use and Care for fall prevention systems and equipment  - Follow workplace Fall Protection Plan in accordance with organisational procedures
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, learners will acquire the knowledge and skills that would facilitate them to be able to:
1. Perform checks before and after use of Work at Height (WAH) equipment.
2. Perform proper use of WAH equipment in accordance to relevant legislation and guidelines, including evaluating use of fall arrest and fall prevention systems.
3. Perform self-relief techniques during harness suspension trauma situations.
course_entry_req:
• Employability Skills (ES) Workplace Literacy level 3 and above.
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES Workplace Numeracy level level 3 and above.

course_provider: ACADEMY OF DESIGN ARTS AND MEDIA PTE. LTD.
course_title: 3D Jelly Art
course_title_cleaned: 3D Jelly Art
course_objective: There are 2 learning units in this course.  Learning Unit 1 - The recipe and preparation steps is a short theory module to provide foundational knowledge.  The focus of the course is on learning unit 2 - Hands-on Lesson where you will learn to make 3D Jellies with decorations that are stunning and unique.
course_learning_outcomes: In this 1-day course, you will be introduced to 3D Jelly and the ingredients and tools required to make it.  Most of all, you will learn the technique to pipe decorations into the jelly canvas to make 3D decorations that are visually stunning and unique. We will provide the ingredients, your personal set of 3D Jelly Art Kit and completed Jelly for you to bring home. You only need to bring yourself.
course_entry_req: We require learners to be able to read and write English. Learners should be keen to learn to make 3D Jellies which requires patience.

# course learning outcomes
In this 1-day course, you will be introduced to 3D Jelly and the ingredients and tools required to make it.  Most of all, you will learn the technique to pipe decorations into the jelly canvas to make 3D decorations that are visually stunning and unique. We will provide the ingredients, your personal set of 3D Jelly Art Kit and completed Jelly for you to bring home. You only need to bring yourself.

course_title: Manage Work At Height (Classroom + Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Manage Work At Height (Classroom + Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the professionalism of the workforce. This Competency Unit aims to equip the knowledge and skills in planning, supervising, assessing and managing of work at height.
course_learning_outcomes:
“Manage Work At Height” is a Competency Unit under the GMS WSQ Framework.
The Performance Statements covered are:
PS1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant Workplace Safety and Health
(WSH) legislation/Approved Code of Practice/Singapore Standards
applicable to work at height
PS2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of stakeholders,
competent and responsible persons.
PS3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for work at height PS4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safeexecution of work at height
PS5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
PS6. Establish and implement a system for an effective monitoring and controlof WAH risks PS7. Don, check and correct Individual Fall Protection Equipment and respond to a fall emergency
course_entry_req:
WSQ Employability Skills System (ESS) Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 4 and above or equivalent.
Ability to carry out hazards identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

course_provider: SINGAPORE INSTITUTE OF POWER AND GAS PTE....
course_title: High Voltage Switching Operations & Procedures
course_title_cleaned: High Voltage Switching Operations & Procedures
course_objective: This course will equip participants with the necessary theoretical foundation and practical application skills to carry out the work for HV switching operations and procedures
course_learning_outcomes:
Protection Scheme
•	Understand the Protective Devices and characteristics of circuit breakers and fuses
•	Understand Current Transformer ratings and specifications
•	Carry out Secondary and Primary Injection tests
•	Practise the internal setting of Moulded Case Circuit Breaker of LV switchboard as well as setting of the Earth Leakage relay
•	Explain fault level for LV switchboard
Operation and Maintenance of Distribution Transformer
•	Types of distribution transformers
•	Apply transformer concepts in voltage regulations such as tap changing
•	Understand de-energisation and on-load tap changing and what LV customer would experience with the different tap changes
•	Explain the protection schemes for distribution transformer as well as power transformer
•	Explain purpose of tests on distribution transformer and its connection to the LV ends of the LV Board/LV Switchboard
•	Carry out the tests conducted on distribution transformer
•	List the maintenance procedures for distribution transformer
•	Case histories of transformer faults and the effects on customers
Switching Operations and Procedures
•	Role of LE and LET under supervision of AHVSE
•	Procedure and requirement for LEE to issue PTW
•	Understand the procedures for 22kV and 6.6kV switching operations
•	Carry out switching on HV switchgear under direct supervision of AHVSE. Switchgear includes Gas Insulated Switchgear (GIS), Air Insulated Switchgear (AIS), Switch-fuse and Fuse Switches, controlling Distribution Transformers
•	Understand the PTW and SDRE where competent persons are needed to account for during feeder isolation
•	Apply electrical safety and switching procedures for practical sessions on HV switching on feeder-feeder and feeder to transformer of 22kV and/or 6.6kV distribution system
course_entry_req:
Applicants are required to have:
• At least 5 years as a Practicing Licensed Electrician; or
• Diploma in Electrical Power Engineering from Singapore Polytechnic or Ngee Ann Polytechnic, and at least 1 year of relevant practical work experience (only required to complete the practical modules by SIPG)
The course is optional for applicants with:
• Diploma in Electrical Power Engineering from Singapore Polytechnic or Ngee Ann Polytechnic, and o At least 2 years of relevant practical work experience

course_title: DevSecOps Engineering and Automation
course_title_cleaned: DevSecOps Engineering and Automation
course_objective: "At the end of the course, the participants will be able to: - Apply Agile practices for software delivery. - Implement DevSecOps practices within the agile method of software delivery. - Implement Software Configuration Management activities using tools. - Implement DevSecOps Methodology, Workflow and Tools - Implement Software Build Management using leading tools. - Evaluate Threat model and secure build and deployment environment - Implement effective risk assessments and threat modeling in a rapidly changing environment - Implement Agile Automated Testing using leading tools. - Perform Automated Testing using the tools in the agile development environment. - Evaluate the need for continuous integration (CI) and build a CI system - Perform Continuous Integration methods - Apply and Implement Continuous Delivery techniques in an Agile environment - Perform Continuous Delivery using an automated continuous integration approach. - Implement Security into Continuous Deployment (CD) pipeline - Implement cloud DevSecOps automation pipeline tools on a leading Cloud platform. - Implement Design and write automated security tests and checks in CI/CD
course_learning_outcomes:
The process to release software to users is often painful, risky and time consuming. Continuous Delivery can help large organisations to become lean, agile and innovative by having reliable and low risks releases, making it possible to adapt continuous updates in line with user feedback, market shifts and changes to business strategies.

As a result, the entire delivery process is accelerated while improving the quality. Teams from test, support, development and operations function and work together as one delivery team.

Over the past several years, information security has struggled to keep up with the fast-paced DevOps movement. DevSecOps — an extension of DevOps — aims to remedy this by embracing security as an essential part of DevOps culture. 

This DevSecOps Engineering and Automation short course aims to provide a 5 Days in-depth understanding of DevSecOps Engineering and Automation concepts, practices and tools.

Participants will learn both the theoretical concepts and practical modules in lectures and hands-on workshops.
course_entry_req:
Have experience in software development
Be Familiar with Software Configuration Management
Be experienced in installing and configuring software
Know Shell scripting
Have experience deploying code to production
Pre-reading of the materials such as: Puppet, Dockers, Containers, GitHub and Jenkins
full_course_desc:

# course learning outcomes

Continuous Delivery can help large organisations to become lean, agile and innovative by having reliable and low risks releases, making it possible to adapt continuous updates in line with user feedback, market shifts and changes to business strategies.

As a result, the entire delivery process is accelerated while improving the quality. Teams from test, support, development and operations function and work together as one delivery team.

Over the past several years, information security has struggled to keep up with the fast-paced DevOps movement. DevSecOps — an extension of DevOps — aims to remedy this by embracing security as an essential part of DevOps culture.

course_title: Private Chef (Classroom & Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Private Chef (Classroom & Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the programme, learners are able to: •	Recall basic food safety requirements for food preparation. •	List and use various types of cooking tools and equipment for          preparation of different cuisines. •	Identify the preparation methods for soups, stocks, and sauces. •	Recall the types of dishes in a set menu for French, Chinese, Thai,          and Singaporean cuisines. •	Prepare tools and equipment to set a table for dining. •	Describe the principles of nutrition and the techniques for healthy          cooking. •	Apply techniques of healthy cooking to produce selected dishes. •	Practice knife skills through cutting of various vegetables. •	Prepare basic soups, stocks, and sauces. •	Prepare tools, equipment and ingredients in the preparation and          presentation of selected dishes of French, Singaporean, and Thai          cuisines. •      Demonstrate skills in selected Chinese recipes.  •	Assemble tools, equipment, and baking ingredients to prepare          basic pastry products.   •	Reinstate workstation according to required standards.  Course fees displayed are eligible for course fee funding support by SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG). Please note that additional fees that apply are not covered by SSG subsidies or SkillsFuture Credits. For a complete breakdown of all course fees, please visit the At-Sunrice (ASR)’s website or contact ASR directly at recruitment@at-sunrice.edu.sg or 6416 6688.
course_learning_outcomes: A 48-hour non-WSQ programme taught by a team of global chefs, which  will enable learners to be equipped with the knowledge and skills to be a Private Chef. Learners are taught the fundaments of different cooking techniques used in the preparation of Eastern and Western cuisines.  Learners will be introduced to basic food safety and knife handling techniques for food preparation. Basic pastry techniques will also be taught to learners as part of a dessert offering in a set dining menu.
course_entry_req: Be able to speak, read and write in English.

course_title: Basic Cardiac Life Support + AED (Practical and Asynchronous)
course_title_cleaned: Basic Cardiac Life Support + AED (Practical and Asynchronous)
course_objective: This course aims to provide  relevant knowledge and skills on CPR and relief of relief of foreign body airway obstruction in a conscious and unconscious infant and adult casualties. This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) on an adult casualty.  - Recognizing and managing heart attack - Understanding the chain of survival - Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an adult victim - Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an infant victim - Use of automated external defibrillator on an adult victim - Recognizing and managing an adult choking victim - Recognizing and managing an infant victim
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is accredited by SRFAC and aims to provide participants with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate cardiac arrest and choking in adults and infants.

This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defi brillator (AED) on an adult casualty.
course_entry_req:
- Able to speak, read and understand English effectively as our courses are conducted in English.
- No history of underlying medical heart and lung conditions
- Physically fit with no pre existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury.
- Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons.

course_provider: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
course_title: Standard First Aid Course (NROC Trainees)
course_title_cleaned: Standard First Aid Course (NROC Trainees)
course_objective: The Standard First Aid Course comprises of an in-depth approach to performing critical emergency interventions while equipping participants with the practical and theoretical skills to perform effective CPR and AED on adult victims.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Essentials of First Aid – Definition and Aims of First Aid, Roles / Limitations of a First Aider, Universal
Precautions, First Aid Kit Contents and maintenance, Primary and Secondary Survey, SCDF My Responder App.
- Unconscious Casualty (Non – Cardiac Arrest) – Head injuries, Heat Disorder Heat cramps, Heat exhaustion, Heat
stroke, Fits, Fainting, Low blood sugar, stroke, The recovery position.
- Respiratory Problems – Adult Foreign body Airway Obstruction (Conscious & Unconscious), Asthma,
Hyperventilation, Fumes inhalation, Allergic Reaction.
- Shock, Bleeding and Wounds – Shock, Bleeding, Wounds, Bandaging.
- Musculoskeletal injuries - Fracture and Dislocation, Soft tissue injuries, Immobilization & Bandaging.
- Burn injuries – Burns Depth and Severity of Burns, Classification and treatment of burns, scalding,
Radiation / Sunburn, Chemical, Electrical, Thermal.
- Eye injuries – Chemical, Foreign Bodies, Blunt – force Trauma.
- Transportation of Casualty – 1 & 2 Rescuer carry, Improvised methods.
- CPR (Hands – Only) + AED, includes theory and practical.
course_entry_req: Primary PSLE

course_title: WSQ Advanced Design Thinking
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Advanced Design Thinking
course_objective: Feeling stuck in your career and not progressing with your promotion?  Faced with complex problems everyday and not knowing how to solve?  Companies are spending thousands on "Design Thinkers" and you want to elevate your value to be a problem-solver?  This is it! You need a certification to progress!  Problems right now are VUCA and has to be solved by Design Thinking:  Volatility (V) require an adaptable mindset to align rapidly changing demands. Uncertainty (U) require a spirit of learning and experimentation. Complexity (C) require a critical thinker that focus on the root of the problem.  Ambiguity (A) require empathy and deep insight of the situation and context.  And that’s not all..   Do you think your customers are not heard enough and you hoped you can do something for them?  Do you feel some of your projects are just plain pointless and wished that you are targeting the right problem?  Do you feel you could get your team to be more creative and think out of the box?  Do you roll out some projects which you have absolutely no idea whether it will crash and burn?    3 most important skills (according to Forbes) in Digital Transformation: - Critical Thinking (Problem-Solving) - Creativity (Think Outside the Box) - Collaboration (Working with Others)  One of the most comprehensive and professional 3-day WSQ Advanced Design Thinking in Singapore. It will empower you with effective framework and mindsets of a problem-solver, project manager and innovator in order to solve real-world problems.
course_learning_outcomes:
Course Outline:
LO1: Interpret Key Characteristics and 5 Action Phases of Design Thinking
LO2: Identify Problem through Empathizing with Users
LO3: Define Clear Project and Business Objectives
LO4: Generate New Ideas to Solve the Defined Problem
LO5: Build Prototype to Visualise Ideas
LO6: Review Ideas to Decide on a Best Solution

Agenda:
Day 1- AM
Introduction to DT and Action Plan
• What is Design Thinking?
• 7 Types of Design Thinker / DT Checklist
• Speed Design Thinking

Day 1- PM
Empathize Phase
• How to Build Rapport
• How to Create Discussion Guide
• Compile Insights in Empathy Map
• What's a Persona and JTBD
• How to Convey Empathy by Storytelling

Day 2- AM
Define Phase
• Write the Design Brief
• 5 Types of Questions
• How to React to Your Boss
• Propose a DT Action Plan
• Power of CJ Mapping and Fieldwork
• Standup Huddles

Day 2- PM
Ideate Phase
• Brainwriting
• Creative Exercises
• Affinity Map
• Prioritization Map
• Idea Evaluation

Day 3- AM
Prototype and Test Phase
• Prototype your Design Solution
• Physical Prototypes / Wireframes
• Storyboarding / Roleplays
• Assumptions and Questions
• How to Conduct a User Test
• What is the Outcome of User Tests?

Day 3- PM
Innovation Techniques
• What is Innovation and Design Thinking?
• Drawing Activities
• Value Proposition Canvas
• Creative Matrix
• What If?
course_entry_req:
Entry Requirement:
21 years and above
Possess minimally a Diploma Level and/or listen, speak, read, and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6
Use numeracy skills equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 6
Minimum 3 months of working experience

Suitable For:
Successful professionals who are c-suites, managers, executives and stakeholders involved in innovation, change management, problem-solving and digital transformation in any corporate industry
Entrepreneurs and startup owners interested in good customer experience and innovation ideas for business
Mid-career professionals who want to pivot career to provide consultation / problem- solve in any industry
Freelancers or design students who are starting out in business-related industry
Corporate trainers / educators  interested in Design Thinking, Innovation and Creativity

course_title: Adopting Internet of Things into Operations
course_title_cleaned: Adopting Internet of Things into Operations
course_objective: Participants will be given an overview of the different digital technologies and how business operations have changed as a result of these technologies. They will have the opportunity to develop and take back an Internet of Things (IoT) device. The data gathered from the device can be remotely monitored via dashboards, and they can perform analytics and machine learning techniques on it.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Identify the different digital technologies and the new business models that arise from them
- Build an IoT device and visualize the data gathered from the sensors via a IoT platform
- Apply Analytics and some Machine Learning techniques on the data
- Relate on how business operations can change with these technologies.
course_entry_req: GCE O Levels or quivalent

course_title: Recommend Wines with Asian Food Pairing (for Licensed Tourist Guides only)
course_title_cleaned: Recommend Wines with Asian Food Pairing (for Licensed Tourist Guides only)
course_objective: At the end of the lesson, learners will be able to: •	Differentiate wines based on varietals, types, and style •	Recommend the appropriate wine glasses for each type of wine •	Demonstrate the 7 steps of wine tasting •	Evaluate the structural components of wine based on the wine tasting method •	Interpret wine labels  •	Advise on wine serving temperature •	Recommend wines to pair with Asian food based on flavor interactions of wine and food
course_learning_outcomes: Singapore is known for its multitude of authentic and delectable Asian food (including local dishes) that offers a wide variety of flavor. Can Asian and local food pair with wines? By understanding the flavor interactions of wine and food’s structural components will aid to pair appropriate wine with food. This will promote a pleasurable dining experience and avoid unpleasant taste combination. These knowledge and skill will equip TGs to recommend appropriate wine with Asian and local food to tourists who enjoy wines with food.

course_title: Creating a Self-Directed Learning Environment
course_title_cleaned: Creating a Self-Directed Learning Environment
course_objective: The design of the physical space plays a primary role in facilitating the development and maintenance of relationship of the occupants. The space sends a message that getting to know one another is important, constructing expectations of how we work, live and play in those settings. Effective environments are comfortable, interesting, attractive and appropriate for the child, holding intrinsic interest and giving children myriad ways to practice and refine skills across all aspects of learning.  A self-directed learning environment is about children having opportunities to choose, extend their play, interest and learning. Children will have purposeful opportunities to become absorbed and engrossed, develop skill of concentration and perseverance. A self-directed learning environment not only provides opportunities to apply learning from other curricular areas, but also helps children to work collaboratively, which can be transferred and applied to all learning that takes place in the centre, at home and in all aspects of life. Thus, paving the way for lifelong learners.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:

1.	Recognize the effects of learning environments on preschool-age children.
2.	Identify features of learning environment that help preschool-age children feel secure, comfortable, welcome and ready to explore and learn.
3.	Acquire knowledge on how to design and maintain a developmentally appropriate environment for preschoolers.
course_entry_req:
LON Certification Status: L1 , L2 , EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator

course_title: Handling Difficult Customer Situations

course_title: Professional Presence & Networking for Effective Stakeholder Engagement
course_title_cleaned: Professional Presence & Networking for Effective Stakeholder Engagement
course_objective: (i)	Develop a personal brand to project professional presence, create positive first impressions and establish trust at initial stakeholder meetings. (ii)	Synthesise business etiquette and social intelligence skills to exude finesse in stakeholder engagements. (iii)	Enhance gravitas, confidence and influence through dressing and grooming, body language and conversational competencies. (iv)	Network with impact to build rapport and foster business relationships.
course_learning_outcomes:
In today's fast-paced business world, it's not just what you know, but how you present yourself that matters. This comprehensive training programme will equip you with the skills and knowledge to develop a personal brand, project professional presence, and network with impact.

The course seeks to help enhance your gravitas, confidence and influence through dressing and grooming, body language, and conversational competencies. Leverage this opportunity to consider how you can stand out from the crowd as you seek to define and refine your personal brand.

This course also delves into the art of networking with impact. You'll learn how to build rapport and foster business relationships through effective communication, active listening, and relationship-building strategies. Gain insights into how to identify and connect with key stakeholders, leverage different platforms for networking, and create a personal elevator pitch.

Whether you're a seasoned professional looking to enhance your executive presence or a new graduate seeking to make a positive impression in your first job, this training programme will empower you with the skills and knowledge you need to succeed. So, join us today and take the step towards developing your professional presence and networking with impact!

course_title: Digital Safety Fundamentals
course_title_cleaned: Digital Safety Fundamentals
course_objective: In today's highly digitised world, digital safety isn't defined by robust systems alone. It is distinguished by every user's ability to recognise, respond to, and prevent cyber threats amidst invasive attacks and evolving scams.  Digital Safety Fundamentals is a powerful, practical course designed to help individuals understand common cyber threats, interpret crucial data protection laws, and develop the essential skills needed to navigate and secure their digital lives in Singapore's high-risk environment.  Through a combination of interactive learning, real-world case studies, and practical application, this course provides you with the tools to transform digital risks into resilience and uncertainty into confident self-protection.
course_learning_outcomes:
Understand Digital Threats and Their Context
Learn about the common types of data breaches and security incidents that target individuals daily. Understand the legal and ethical implications of personal data handling under the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) in Singapore.

Identify and Analyse Incident Impact
Use practical scenarios to measure and assess the potential impact of cyber incidents on personal systems and user groups, gaining insights into their real-world consequences.

Develop Effective Incident Response Protocols
Master practical techniques for detecting suspicious activities, categorizing the importance of incidents, and reporting them accurately in line with established management protocols.

Build Incident Management and Documentation Skills
Strengthen your ability to document troubleshooting steps and maintain real-time incident logs, ensuring effective management and clear communication during digital safety events.

Cultivate a Proactive Security Mindset
Reframe past incidents and vulnerabilities as opportunities for learning and personal development. Foster a more prepared and empowered approach to digital safety.

Implement Best Practices for Long-Term Protection
Learn sustainable habits and apply proven best practices that help you mitigate repeat incidents and develop long-term digital resilience.
course_entry_req:
Aged 21 and above
Hold a minimum of PSLE or an equivalent qualification.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
FIRSTCOM ACADEMY PTE. LTD.

course_title: The Art and Science of Colour Grading
course_title_cleaned: The Art and Science of Colour Grading
course_objective: By the end of this course learners will be able be able to use industry standard tools to colour grade video content to meet creative and technical requirements.  They will be able to perform the following       • Analyse media content based on cinematography principles and acquisition formats      • Set up a colour grading project according to the technical requirements of the production      • Apply colour grading techniques to meet aesthetic and technical requirements of a project       • Export the final project for the appropriate media delivery specifications and standards
course_learning_outcomes:
Colour Grading used to be a very expensive process available only to high budget productions. However with the emergence of more affordable tools it has become a norm for more content to be colour graded. While colour grading has become more prevalent it is still a specialised ability that involves both technical and aesthetic expertise.

This hands-on course gives learners a firm foundation in the art and science of Colour Grading.

We start with balancing and primary correction, then move on to the finer points of secondary grading, including controlling selected tones/colours of the image using keying and curves. We also teach learners to use Masks to isolate & track regions, practise Continuity Matching between shots, animate grades, perform round-tripping with an editing program, and much more. We also help learners understand the basics of setting up their own grading suites.

Hands on practice begins with the colour grading tools within Adobe Premiere Pro, then we dive deep into the industry standard DaVinci Resolve so learners develop  a clear understanding of the principles of colour grading and the ability to use industry standard software to perform complex colour grades for both aesthetic and technical purposes. The course is conduced on Mac workstations but all software and techniques are applicable to Windows also .
course_entry_req:
Basic computer literacy is required with at least the ability to open and close programs, create folders and copy and paste files. 

Basic spoken and written English required as the course materials and software interface is in English 

Target Educational profile is Polytechnic Diploma or equivalent 

Experience with image editing, video editing and /or motion graphics tools is an advantage but is not compulsory

course_title: Essentials of Leadership (ESLP) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Essentials of Leadership (ESLP) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This course introduces learners to self-leadership as a teacher and extends that to leading colleagues and aligning to Centre’s mission, vision, and core values. Learners will examine common practices of leaders in the local settings and how they are categorised into the leadership theories in Early Childhood settings.  Practical and essential skills such as communication, building trust and relationships, teaming strategies, and handling challenging situations will be covered.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will be able to:
1.	Examine Centre’s mission, vision, and core values in relation to self.
2.	Guide colleagues to understand complementary roles of all staff members in the Centre’s operations;
3.	Explore leadership practices in local context and identify them in relation to ECE leadership theories;
4.	Demonstrate strategies for building relationships. 
5.	Demonstrate the use of effective communication with others and handling challenging situation
6.	Develop team leadership skills to work with a diverse group of staff members.
course_entry_req:
1) Be ECDA-certified as EY2/L1/L2 teacher
2) Currently employed in a childcare registered or licensed with ECDA

course_title: Generative AI  (Bundled) (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Generative AI  (Bundled) (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The Gen AI Design & Development module offers AI application developers a comprehensive training program centered on harnessing AI technologies for enhanced productivity. Covering fundamental concepts of prompt design, participants learn to craft effective prompts for ChatGPT interactions, optimizing them to elicit desired responses efficiently. The course delves into GitHub Copilot, providing a deep dive into its capabilities and practical applications, including prompt-driven programming and business use cases. Through hands-on exercises with JavaScript and Python, participants gain proficiency in leveraging GitHub Copilot to expedite coding tasks.  Moreover, the curriculum introduces Microsoft Copilot Studio, focusing on its functionalities and integration into software development projects. Learners learn to enable seamless communication between applications and chatbots using APIs, unlocking the potential of Microsoft Copilot Studio in enhancing productivity. Through a combination of Flipped classes, assignments, and real-world case studies, this course equips learners with the knowledge and practical skills necessary to revolutionize their software development workflow, ultimately empowering them to leverage advanced prompt engineering techniques for maximum efficiency.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to  target the audience who would like to gain Full stack web Development skills  using Generative AI   skills. Duration of this course is 80.5 hours. This is delivered in blended mode. 
This course comprises the following 5 instructional units 
1.	Generative AI Models & Tools
2.	Prompt Engineering Strategies
3.	Content and Design Generation with GenAI and GitHub Copilot
4.	Application Development with GenAI and GitHub Copilot
5.	Testing and Documentation

Knowledge Learning Outcomes 
-	Understand generative AI Models, their architectures and applications 
-	Develop effective prompt engineering strategies for controlling generative AI outputs
-	Gain proficiency in using Gen AI co pilot for content, design and code generation
-	Learn to integrate generated content and code into application development workflows 
-	Master testing and documentation practices for evaluating and documenting generative AI systems 
Skills outcomes 
-	Formulate system requirements effectively using prompts 
-	Plan and design user interface elements for a user-friendly experience 
-	Generative dynamic and engaging content to meet specific requirements 
-	Automate design tasks using generative AI algorithms
-	Implement web applications powered by AI models and integrate external APIs 
-	Conduct comprehensive testing to ensure functionality, performance, and compatibility across devices and browsers
course_entry_req: Minimum one credit in Nitech in STEM or its equivalent

course_title: Digital Advertising for Businesses
course_title_cleaned: Digital Advertising for Businesses
course_objective: Trainees will be able to gain knowledge of key digital channels and develop strategic objectives based on business needs. This will be a step up from executive level where knowledge and application is restricted to limited platforms. This proposed course will be able to upskill the individual to take on managerial role.  LO 1: Identify advantages, constraints and interactivity of various marketing channels, technologies, and tools  LO 2 : Determine key elements of a marketing strategy based on organisational requirements and use them to create marketing objectives for various marketing channels  LO 3: Determine the impact of different digital marketing platforms and their suitability of different channels, platforms, technology and tools to be utilised for marketing activities and programs for various products and services.  LO 4: Select marketing channels mix with a defined marketing plan that fulfils the expectations of target markets.  LO 5: Appraise digital marketing programs that are best suited for the business product/service offerings.  LO 6: Identify the various performance indicators of each digital marketing channel.  LO 7: Evaluate customer response and sales performance to determine the effectiveness of each marketing channel and the impact on overall business performance.   LO 8: Monitor key elements and considerations of marketing channel mix against overall sales performance  LO 9: Recommend steps to integrate traditional and digital marketing approaches to achieve sustainable online presence
course_learning_outcomes:
This 3-day course teaches you how to advertise online and turn your business goals into an online marketing campaign to attract new customers and optimize your ad spend.

You will learn how to set up and run successful Google Ads and Facebook campaigns to meet your advertising goals, remarketing to maintain top-of-mind (brand and product) awareness, and more importantly, how to measure and maximize results to improve your return on investment across various advertising channels.
course_entry_req:
Participants should preferably possess the following skills:

1. Speak, listen, read and write English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5.

2. Basic IT knowledge such as using laptop and managing documents.

3. Navigate Internet using web browsers and using Google or Facebook.

Participants should preferably be above 18 years old.

Learners who are not able to fulfil basic literacy requirements for the program will be advised to register for the WSQ Work Place Literacy (WPL) Program.

# course number of hours
15.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
This course equips learners with the knowledge, skills and dispositions to support the social emotional development in infants and toddlers by first understanding very young children’s behaviour.  Developmentally appropriate strategies on helping young children express their feelings; how educators and families can respond to the social and emotional needs of very young children; supporting development of prosocial behaviour, self-regulation skills and delayed gratification will also be covered.

# course learning outcomes
Learners will be able to:
1.	Understand the key concepts underlying the social and emotional development in infants and toddlers and their emerging behaviours such as self-awareness, stress-related behaviours, self-regulation and delayed gratification;
2.	Apply Maslow’s Hierarchy of needs in the classrooms and using appropriate strategies to respond to children’s needs;
3.	Utilise the Wheel of Emotions and apply appropriate strategies to respond to children’s emotional needs; 
4.	Apply strategies to develop prosocial behaviours, empathy and responding appropriately to others;
5.	Collaborate with families in supporting the social emotional development in infants and toddlers


# course entry req
1. Be ECDA-certified as EY1/ EY2/L1/L2 Educator.
2. Currently employed in a childcare registered or licensed with ECDA.

course_title: 营养对婴幼儿心理发展的影响 (Nutritional needs of Infants and Toddler’s mental health and well-being)
course_title_cleaned: 营养对婴幼儿心理发展的影响 (Nutritional needs of Infants and Toddler’s mental health and well-being)
course_objective: 均衡良好的饮食习惯应从小开始灌输，因早期发展起来对食物的偏好往往会延续到婴儿成年以后。提供婴幼儿所需营养不但能促进婴幼儿大脑健康的发育、对其生理和社会情感发展也至关重要。培育师应了解婴幼儿各方面的发展且顺着他的发展为其计划所需营养并合理地配搭；并以尊重、回应及互动的态度喂养婴幼儿；让喂食的时段是婴幼儿学习和被关爱的时光。培育师的观察、聆听、无条件地接纳与关爱婴幼儿，与家庭积极分享育儿经验，能令婴幼儿正面、理解自己与他人、自信、健康与快乐地成长。  Understanding the nutritional needs of Infants and Toddlers' mental health is crucial; meals should be well-balanced and appropriate for each developmental stage. Inculcating healthy eating habits from a young age is paramount. Food preferences developed during these early years often persist into adulthood. Hence, proper nutrition is critical in the early years of life to support healthy brain development, as well as physical and socio-emotional development. Children with good mental health are generally positive, confident, happy, contented, and able to relate to familiar adults and peers. Educators should contribute to a child’s mental health by being nurturing, responsive, positive, and unconditionally accepting. They should observe, listen, pay attention to each child, respond appropriately, share with parents the proper way to handle their child, understand their child’s needs and feelings, and enhance their wellness, ensuring they grow up happily and healthy.
course_learning_outcomes:
在本课程结束时，参与者将能够：
• 分析营养与婴幼儿生理和心理发展的关系
• 掌握制作婴幼儿配餐的方案
• 能为婴幼儿提供身心愉悦的用餐环境

At the end of this course, participants will be able to: 
• Examine the interconnection between nutrition and the physical and mental development of Infants and Toddlers
• Master nutrition balanced menu plan for Infants and Toddlers
• Provide a conducive eating environment to promote young children’s well-being
course_entry_req:
LON Certification Status: L1, L2, EY1, EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Infant Educator, Infant Educator, Senior Infant Educator, Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Lead Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator, Deputy Centre Leader, Centre Leader

course_title: Creative Idea Generation and Selection Techniques
course_title_cleaned: Creative Idea Generation and Selection Techniques
course_objective: All executives are expected and required to formulate ideas and solutions when presented with a challenge at various stages of work. However, what really catches companies' attention are executives who can move beyond standard brainstorming. They are seeking those who can employ proven methods to create innovative ideas.  In this 2-day course, discover the top strategies and approaches that will distinguish you from other executives who might struggle to think creatively and produce ideas that align perfectly with the organisation's requirements. Learn idea generation techniques such as "Reverse Brainstorming" and "Round Robin Brainstorming", as well as knowledge and application of models such as "Dialectical Inquiry" or "Devil's Advocacy" to integrate diverse perspectives and arrive at informed decisions.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Creative and Innovative Thinking: Develop the ability to foster creativity in problem-solving and constantly generate innovative ideas

- Adaptability and Flexibility: Use diverse brainstorming techniques such as Reverse Brainstorming, Round Robin Brainstorming etc. and consider different perspectives to become more adaptable in responding to various challenges and viewpoints

- Effective Communication and Conflict Resolution: Integrate differing opinions and utilise models such as Dialectical Inquiry or Devil's Advocacy to improve on the ability to merge differing perspectives and derive at a sound decision

- Data-Driven Decision-Making: Implement data analytical methods and tech-enabled tools to make informed decisions based on data-driven insights and enhance overall decision-making capabilities
course_entry_req:
Aged 18 and above
Have basic computer literacy Level 2
Have minimum GCE “N”, “O” or “A” Level / NITEC or a diploma qualification and minimum 2 years of working experience;  
Have an English language proficiency equivalent of higher of any of the following - GCSE N/O Levels pass in English / WPLN Level 5 / IELTS 5.5 / TOEFL (internet based total) 46-59.

course_title: Social Media Marketing Fundamental 2
course_title_cleaned: Social Media Marketing Fundamental 2
course_objective: This module prepares the learner to be competent in social media marketing in the real-world context. Competency training starts with understanding the strengths and weaknesses of major social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter & LinkedIn. Next, the impact of social media on a customer journey needs to be examined. Effective strategies to develop a practical social media plan in addition to detailed steps to executing both paid and organic social media campaigns will also be covered. As social media channels are best utilised to create awareness, encourage engagement and generate leads, this syllabus will focus particularly on lead generation strategies using social media. By the end of the course, the learner will not only understand how to effectively leverage social media to build brand awareness and engagement, the learner will also be able to successfully plan, manage and execute an effective social media lead generation campaign.
course_learning_outcomes:
LU 1: Set social media marketing objectives
LU 2: Plans for social marketing campaign
LU 3 Review social media marketing opportunities
LU 4: Review the effectiveness of social media marketing
LU 5: Evaluate the use of different types of social media platforms
LU 6: Evaluate usage of social media
course_entry_req:
• Have some secondary or tertiary education, or minimum WPL of level 5 and WPN of level 5
• Have working experience of slightly more than three years for supervisors and team leaders

course_title: Safety & Connection Process
course_title_cleaned: Safety & Connection Process
course_objective: This course will equip participants with the necessary theoretical foundation and practical application skills to carry out the work for safety and connection process
course_learning_outcomes:
Safety & Licensing Requirements
•	Understanding and interpreting Electricity Act (Cap. 89A) and its Subsidiary Legislation
•	Case study on electrical incidents  
•	Licensing requirements of Supply and Electrical Installations
•	Roles and responsibilities of the Licensed Electrical Worker and the Licensee
•	Understand the concept of TNS and TT systems
•	Introduction to ELISE and Step-by-step guide in submitting online application to EMA using ELISE for a LEW license or EI/SI license.
The Supply Connection Process
•	Understand the importance of completing the appropriate forms under COC, SOTO and their requirements in the Supply Connection Process
•	List the procedures stated in "How to Apply for Electricity Connection"
•	Introduction to SP Portal and Step-by-step guide in  applying test date for unit testing and meter installation
course_entry_req:
Applicants are required to have at least:
• 5 years of relevant practical work experience; and
• GCE “N” Level with pass in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5 

The course is optional for applicants with:
• NITEC in Electrical Engineering and at least 2 years of relevant practical work experience; or
• At least 10 years of relevant practical work experience

The learners will be able to apply the concepts of information technology (IT) to facilitate the usage of technical drawing software to produce drawings and specifications that conform to the requirements of relevant standards for discipline specific uses. course_title: Budget Management
course_title_cleaned: Budget Management
course_objective: This course equips executives and managers with the essential skills to effectively manage budgets and drive organizational success. Learners will learn how to develop and implement operational budgets, analyse financial data, make data-driven decisions, and optimize resource allocation. Through a combination of theoretical knowledge and practical applications, learners will gain a comprehensive understanding of budget management principles, best practices, and tools.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:
• Comply with key principles of accounting, financial management and budgetary controls in budget preparation
• Comply with the organisation's financial controls throughout the process of budget preparation 
• Analyse business function’s strategies, objectives and operational plans 
• Derive the business unit’s cash flow requirements and financing needs for the financial year 
• Conduct forecasting and budgeting for the financial year 
• Compare budget forecasts and estimates with relevant data to highlight discrepancies
• Report on budget forecasts and discrepancies to management using set templates to facilitate decisions on budget allocation
course_entry_req:
Entry Requirements
- 2 years of working experience in any sector; and
- Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) 5 or equivalent

*Learners without the right WPLN or equivalent qualifications can be accepted if they have at least 3 years of relevant working experience, subject to the MR’s approval.

course_title: Querying Data with Microsoft Transact-SQL (SF)
course_title_cleaned: Querying Data with Microsoft Transact-SQL (SF)
course_objective: •	Describe key capabilities and components of SQL Server. •	Describe T-SQL, sets, and predicate logic. •	Write a single table SELECT statement. •	Write a multi-table SELECT statement. •	Write SELECT statements with filtering and sorting. •	Describe how SQL Server uses data types. •	Write DML statements. •	Execute stored procedures •	Program with T-SQL •	Implement error handling •	Implement transactions •	Write queries that use built-in functions. •	Write queries that aggregate data. •	Write subqueries. •	Create and implement views and table-valued functions. •	Use set operators to combine query results. •	Use window ranking, offset and aggregate functions •	Implement pivoting and grouping sets
course_learning_outcomes:
The main purpose of this course is to give students a good understanding of the Transact-SQL language which is used by all SQL Server-related disciplines; namely, Database Administration, Database Development and Business Intelligence. As such, the primary target audience for this course is: Database Administrators, Database Developers and BI professionals.
Leaners will learn to:
•	Use the basic components of SQL Server querying tools.
•	Manage data with Transact-SQL
•	Query data with advanced Transact-SQL components
•	Program databases by using Transact-SQL
The course will very likely be well attended by SQL power users who aren’t necessarily database-focused; namely, report writers, business analysts and client application developers.
course_entry_req: •	Basic knowledge of the Microsoft Windows operating system and its core functionality.

course_title: GO E.A.S.T. (Experience Arts & Science with Toddlers)
course_title_cleaned: GO E.A.S.T. (Experience Arts & Science with Toddlers)
course_objective: Young Children are naturally curious. This sense of wonder drives children to observe, explore and act on their ideas. As children explore, work and experiment with nature and material in their environment, they discover and observe changes, cause and effect, patterns and seeing relationships between objects. Young children construct scientific concepts and knowledge through these natural explorations.  The use of art and natural materials is a great way to work with young children to encourage exploration with materials and motivate construction of knowledge.   This workshop provides hands-on opportunities for Educarers to explore and experiment with art materials; and learn to plan activities to lead young children to discoveries such as cause and effect. It is aimed through observation of children’s skills, careful planning and guidance, children will be motivated to explore, discover and have fun.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:

1.	Recognise the importance of sensory experiences, exploration and play in young children’s growth and learning. 
2.	Explore how science process skills can be integrated with arts explorations.
3.	Develop age-appropriate activity that integrate science and arts elements.
course_entry_req:
LON Certification Status: L1 , L2 ,  EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator

course_title: Cyber Security 101
course_title_cleaned: Cyber Security 101
course_objective: In summary, Cyber Security 101 course proposed by Caretech168 aims to educate: •	the public on how to mitigate cyber-attacks on their desktops to protect their personal data and the business environment they are connected to  •	Security Personnel on the importance of mitigating cyber-attacks so that they are better equipped to move on to providing services that involve use of technology
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, learners will develop an awareness of their own cyber risks and motivated to take steps to protect personal and business data through the following 3 outcomes:

Learning Outcome 1: Explain the importance of cyber security for personal and work environments
Mapped to skills statements
K1. Cyber security threats
A1. Identify potential risks and threats associated with cyber security, such as viruses, hacking, and identity theft

Learning Outcome 2: Identify cyber threats and recognise own cyber risks
Mapped to skills statement
K2. Areas prone to cyber security threats

Learning Outcome 3: Develop action plan to protect personal and business data against cyberattacks.
Mapped to skills statements
K3. Best practices to safeguard against threats
A2. Protect personal and business information from cyber security threats
A3. Interpret cyber security threats that require escalation to relevant team members
course_entry_req:
This course is applicable for beginners with little or no prior knowledge of cyber security. There is no pre-requisite in terms of working experience.   However, to be able to complete the course successfully, learners should:

•	Have some digital literacy in terms of using a desktop or mobile device.
•	Completed at least primary school education or demonstrate basic English language literacy equivalent to WPLN level 1 or 2.

course_title: HR Graduate Certification - Talent Management and Succession Planning
course_title_cleaned: HR Graduate Certification - Talent Management and Succession Planning
course_objective: This module focuses on the development of a holistic talent management strategy that includes, talent review, succession planning, and talent development.  With stiff competition for talent and increasing emphasis on productivity, key performance indicators (KPIs) and return on investments (ROIs), Human resource practitioners must have a well thought out strategy that will allow them to put in place the right structure, system and processes, to deliver, capture and track manpower value for their company. Through actual case studies on talent management practices in companies, participants will have a better understanding of the application of these talent management concepts in companies. Participants will be exposed to real industry practices in identifying talent risks from an employee database, followed by the development of an appropriate succession plan plus the identification of any necessary talent development plans. The combined approach of actual case studies and hands-on practice is to provide course participants with a realistic view of what talent management is like in practice and enable them to apply what they have learnt back at the workplace.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this 2-day module, participants will be able to:
- demonstrate understanding of talent management and succession planning concepts and the activities and tools involved.
- understand how companies approach talent management and succession planning in reality and challenges faced by human resource practitioners.
- adopt a process to develop a talent management strategy.
- analyse employee data to identify talent risks.
- develop a workable succession plan.
- put in place implementable talent development plans.
course_entry_req:
Participants should:
- have a degree from a recognised university; and
- have minimum 2 years of working experience in HR/OD related roles; and
- currently a HR/OD practitioner in a private or public sector organisation

course_title: (SCTP) WSQ Advanced Certificate in Infocomm Technology (Infrastructure) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning) (Full-Time( TA-Eligible)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) WSQ Advanced Certificate in Infocomm Technology (Infrastructure) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning) (Full-Time( TA-Eligible)
course_objective: The Advanced Certificate in Infrastructure Support equips learners with the essential skills for successful careers in IT infrastructure support. Graduates can pursue roles such as Server Administrators, Network Technicians, Desktop Support Engineers, IT Support Executives, and Infrastructure Support Engineers.  The course includes six modules covering critical IT infrastructure topics. The Server Basics module provides foundational knowledge of server administration, including hardware management, operating systems, network configuration, and data security. In Networking Basics, learners gain expertise in network design, configuration, security, and troubleshooting. The IT Operating Systems Deployment module focuses on Microsoft 365 configuration, security, and compliance, while IT Operating Systems Support emphasizes endpoint management, application configuration, and security in both on-premises and cloud environments.  The Cloud Fundamentals module introduces learners to Azure architecture, cost management, and cloud governance, enabling them to design and manage cloud solutions. The Linux Fundamentals module provides practical knowledge in Linux administration, user and file management, networking, and shell scripting. The IT Customer Service module hones customer support skills, including troubleshooting, case documentation, and performance management.  Finally, the Capstone Project integrates all acquired skills, involving network configuration, system compatibility, authentication, storage implementation, and OS upgrades.  Graduates emerge with hands-on experience and a solid foundation in IT infrastructure, ready to contribute to organizational efficiency and support digital transformation initiatives across various industries.
course_learning_outcomes:
Candidates need to complete the following 6 modules to get this Advance Certificate qualification 
M1.	Server  & Network basics 
M2.	IT Operating systems deployment
M3.	IT Operating systems support
M4:  Cloud  & Linux Fundamentals
M5: IT Customer service 
M6.	Capstone Project - IT Infrastructure support
All the modules are delivered in blended mode
Knowledge Learning Outcomes 
•	Demonstrate a solid understanding of server administration and virtualization concepts.
•	Explain the fundamentals of networking, including implementation, operations, security, and troubleshooting.
•	Describe the key components and features of cloud technologies and their role in modern IT infrastructure.
•	Identify and analyze different operating systems, their installation, configuration, and support requirements.
•	Discuss the essential principles and practices of Linux administration, including user management, file permissions, and shell scripting. 
Skills Outcomes 
•	Configure and troubleshoot operating systems, applications, and network configurations.
•	Implement and maintain data security measures for servers and operating systems.
•	Design and deploy network components, ensuring connectivity and troubleshooting network issues.
•	Provide effective customer service and support, including IT issue troubleshooting and documentation.
•	Apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve operating system and network-related issues.
course_entry_req:
Academic Qualification: Minimum 1 credit in N Level or its equivalent 
English Proficiency - IELTS 5.5 or its equivalent
Experience - Not Mandatory

In Networking Basics, learners gain expertise in network design, configuration, security, and troubleshooting. The IT Operating Systems Deployment module focuses on Microsoft 365 configuration, security, and compliance, while IT Operating Systems Support emphasizes endpoint management, application configuration, and security in both on-premises and cloud environments.  The Cloud Fundamentals module introduces learners to Azure architecture, cost management, and cloud governance, enabling them to design and manage cloud solutions. The Linux Fundamentals module provides practical knowledge in Linux administration, user and file management, networking, and shell scripting. The IT Customer Service module hones customer support skills, including troubleshooting, case documentation, and performance management.  Finally, the Capstone Project integrates all acquired skills, involving network configuration, system compatibility, authentication, storage implementation, and OS upgrades.  Graduates emerge with hands-on experience and a solid foundation in IT infrastructure, ready to contribute to organizational efficiency and support digital transformation initiatives across various industries. 

# course learning outcomes
Candidates need to complete the following 6 modules to get this Advance Certificate qualification 
M1.	Server  & Network basics 
M2.	IT Operating systems deployment
M3.	IT Operating systems support
M4:  Cloud  & Linux Fundamentals
M5: IT Customer service 
M6.	Capstone Project - IT Infrastructure support
All the modules are delivered in blended mode
Knowledge Learning Outcomes 
•	Demonstrate a solid understanding of server administration and virtualization concepts.
•	Explain the fundamentals of networking, including implementation, operations, security, and troubleshooting.
•	Describe the key components and features of cloud technologies and their role in modern IT infrastructure.
•	Identify and analyze different operating systems, their installation, configuration, and support requirements.
•	Discuss the essential principles and practices of Linux administration, including user management, file permissions, and shell scripting. 
Skills Outcomes 
•	Configure and troubleshoot operating systems, applications, and network configurations.
•	Implement and maintain data security measures for servers and operating systems.
•	Design and deploy network components, ensuring connectivity and troubleshooting network issues.
•	Provide effective customer service and support, including IT issue troubleshooting and documentation.
•	Apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve operating system and network-related issues.

English Proficiency - IELTS 5.5 or its equivalent
Experience - Not Mandatory

course_objective: The " Cloud Virtual Desktop ” module imparts essential knowledge and skills to learners in effectively managing and optimizing cloud-based infrastructure using Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD). Through the instructional units (IU), learners will gain expertise in various areas. They will learn to plan and implement AVD, understanding the key considerations and requirements for successful deployment. Learners will acquire hands-on experience in configuring and optimizing AVD infrastructure, ensuring it aligns with organizational needs. They will also develop proficiency in managing access, security, user environments, and applications within the AVD environment. Additionally, learners will learn to monitor and maintain AVD infrastructure, ensuring its performance, reliability, and scalability. The module's projects enable learners to apply their knowledge and skills in practical scenarios. By developing and implementing a strategic IT infrastructure plan, learners will oversee and synchronize the performance of infrastructure elements. They will ensure smooth operations and optimal resource utilization. Ultimately, learners will gain practical experience in cloud administration, empowering them to contribute to the successful management of cloud-based infrastructure. In conclusion, the "Cloud Virtual Desktop" module prepares learners for cloud administration roles, equipping them with competencies to support the development and optimization of strategic IT infrastructures in a dynamic cloud environment.

course_objective: In the "HubSpot CRM" module, learners will acquire essential knowledge and skills encompassing various facets of HubSpot CRM. Introduction to HubSpot CRM will familiarize learners with the foundational aspects of HubSpot CRM, including its features and significance in modern marketing practices. Learners will be equipped with the expertise to manage and efficiently organize contacts within the CRM system, utilizing custom properties and dynamic lists for effective segmentation. It will further delve into the intricacies of creating and overseeing a robust sales pipeline, empowering learners to track and optimize deals throughout the sales process. Marketing Integration and Lead Management unit will help to explore the seamless integration of marketing tools with HubSpot CRM, enabling learners to capture and monitor leads generated through marketing efforts. Learners will learn to utilize the CRM system to handle customer support tasks proficiently, including ticket and case management. Learners will complete projects that reinforce their knowledge and practical abilities by incorporating the learning units. Upon successful completion of the module, participants will be proficient in optimizing HubSpot CRM, encompassing the importation and organization of contacts, efficient deal management, marketing integration for lead tracking, and the provision of exemplary customer support.

course_title: Cyber and Data Breach Incident Management
course_title_cleaned: Cyber and Data Breach Incident Management
course_objective: 1.	Deep Understanding of Cybersecurity Threats: Learners will gain a profound understanding of various cy-bersecurity threats, including malware, phishing, ransomware, and insider threats. They will be able to iden-tify and assess the risks associated with these threats. 2.	Effective Incident Response: Graduates will be skilled in formulating and executing incident response plans. They will know how to react swiftly and efficiently when a cyber or data breach occurs, minimizing damage and downtime. 3.	Legal and Regulatory Compliance: Learners will comprehend the complex legal and regulatory landscape surrounding data breaches. They will be equipped to ensure their organizations comply with relevant laws, which is essential for avoiding legal penalties. 4.	Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Graduates will be able to assess cybersecurity risks within their organiza-tions and implement effective mitigation strategies. This skill is critical in proactively protecting against po-tential threats. 5.	Incident Investigation: Learners will acquire the ability to conduct thorough investigations into cyber and da-ta breaches. They will know how to gather evidence, analyze it, and determine the extent of a breach. 6.	Communication and Reporting: Graduates will be proficient in transparently communicating incidents to rel-evant stakeholders, including senior management, legal teams, and affected parties. They will prepare comprehensive incident reports. 7.	Cybersecurity Best Practices: Learners will be well-versed in cybersecurity best practices, including network security, access control, encryption, and user awareness. They will know how to implement these practices effectively. 8.	Security Technologies: The course will introduce learners to various security technologies and tools com-monly used in incident management. They will gain hands-on experience with these tools. 9.	Business Continuity Planning: Graduates will understand the importance of business continuity plans
course_learning_outcomes:
: Introduction to Cyber and Data-Related Incidents
 Types of security incidents 
 Types of data breaches.
Gather relevant information about incidents
Topics: 
•	A clear breakdown of what constitutes a cyber incident vs. a da-ta-related incident. 
•	The impact of such incidents on businesses, economies, and in-dividuals.
•	Case studies of notable cyber and data-related incidents.
•	The implications of under-reporting or delaying the reporting of incidents. Discussion: Real-world impacts of cyber incidents.
•	Case Study Review: Analyzing the steps taken during a past incident.
: Detection of Incidents
Incident detection and reporting protocols
Report incidents, in line with incident management protocols.
System and User Group Identification
Impact of incidents on systems and users
Categorisation guidelines for incidents
Identify the systems and user groups affected by the incident based on information gathered
Topics: 
•	Tracing Methods: Techniques to trace back to affected systems after a breach.
•	User Groups: How to categorize and identify groups at risk. 
•	Data Safeguarding: Immediate steps to secure data after detection.
•	Workshop: Identifying affected users in a mock data set. 
•	Group Task: Crafting a response plan based on the user group affected.
Effective Communication During Incidents
Communication strategies and protocols for cyber and data incidents
Perform first responder troubleshooting on cyber-related, data-related or security incidents, by following pre-determined procedures
Topics: 
•	Importance of Timely Communication: Impact on trust and brand reputation.
•	Crafting Alerts: How to frame alerts to be clear and actionable.
•	In summary, learners completing this level 2 course will possess the knowledge to identify, categorize, and respond to cybersecurity incidents. They will develop practical skills in incident detection, reporting, and mitigation, ensuring a proactive and effective approach to incident management.
course_entry_req: GCE "N" levels or its equivalent or three years working experience.

course_title_cleaned: WSQ Inventory Control and Equipment Maintenance in Rehabilitation Care (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Perform inventory control and maintain equipment for the therapy department.  Therapy Assistants (TAs) play an integral role in the rehabilitation of the patient. They are key players in supporting the therapists in carrying out the relevant routine interventions and reporting to the thera-pists if any changes are observed in the client’s performance while they are exercising with the client. A competent TA is able to follow the instructions of the therapist duly and perform the interventions as accurately as possible. He/she also helps in inventory management and maintaining the equipment that is used for therapy intervention. This course will teach the relevant skills required for the TA to perform inventory control and maintain therapy related equipment.

2: Recognise and Appreciate Therapy Appliance and Equipment
3: Maintain Therapy Related Inventory
4: Report Inventory Related Matters

course_title: Oriental Wellness Tourism through The Lens of the West (for Tourist Guides) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Oriental Wellness Tourism through The Lens of the West (for Tourist Guides) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: According to the Global Wellness Institute, Wellness is defined as ‘The active pursuit of activities, choices and lifestyles that lead to a state of holistic health. Not only is the global market size of wellness consumers increasing (estimated to be around US$4.4 trillion in 2020), there is also an increasing trend of these consumers indulging in wellness activities while they are on the move. There are great opportunities for tourist guides to incorporate wellness related activities and story-telling into their tours. Upon completion of the course, tourist guides would have the necessary knowledge and skillsets to create holistic and authentic wellness experiences for tourists.
course_learning_outcomes:
The course content is as follows:

1. Part 1 will explain what wellness and wellness tourism are and how wellness tourism differs from medical tourism. It will also look into the growing Asia-Pacific market in wellness tourism which is today the biggest in the world.
2. Part 2 will look at how the west perceive oriental wellness. This will be useful in creating wellness activities in tours which will appeal to or fascinate western tourists. 
3. Part 3 will bring the participants through a research study that has been conducted recently to help them understand the competitive landscape in wellness tourism in Southeast Asian and how Singapore  could differentiate itself.
4. Part 4 will look into some basic principles of TCM and TIM (Ayuverda) that shape oriental wellness, as well as the relevant knowledge and skillsets in herbs, food and alternative therapies in oriental wellness context that participants should have in order to run wellness tours effectively and with confidence. 
5. Part 5 will bring the participants through a case study in wellness tourism.
6. Part 6 will look into how to market wellness centric tours.

References:
The Science and Art of Fengshui Course, Singapore Polytechnic
Skillsfuture Course on Accupressure and Meridian by Doctor Clement Ng
Global Wellness Institute Report
Survey Report on Western Perception of Oriental Wellness by Wine Resources
Complete Wellness by Susan Curtis
Strengthen Your Immune System, Reader's Digest
course_entry_req: STB Tourist Guide License
full_course_desc:
# course provider
WINE RESOURCES PTE. LTD.

# course title
Oriental Wellness Tourism through The Lens of the West (for Tourist Guides) (Synchronous e-learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2022014727

# course run
16 Nov 25

# course duration
1-2 days

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$150.00

# subsidised course fee
$75.00

# course number of hours
7.50 hours

# course language
Mandarin

# course objective
According to the Global Wellness Institute, Wellness is defined as ‘The active pursuit of activities, choices and lifestyles that lead to a state of holistic health. Not only is the global market size of wellness consumers increasing (estimated to be around US$4.4 trillion in 2020), there is also an increasing trend of these consumers indulging in wellness activities while they are on the move. There are great opportunities for tourist guides to incorporate wellness related activities and story-telling into their tours. Upon completion of the course, tourist guides would have the necessary knowledge and skillsets to create holistic and authentic wellness experiences for tourists.

# course learning outcomes
The course content is as follows:

1. Part 1 will explain what wellness and wellness tourism are and how wellness tourism differs from medical tourism. It will also look into the growing Asia-Pacific market in wellness tourism which is today the biggest in the world.
2. Part 2 will look at how the west perceive oriental wellness. This will be useful in creating wellness activities in tours which will appeal to or fascinate western tourists. 
3. Part 3 will bring the participants through a research study that has been conducted recently to help them understand the competitive landscape in wellness tourism in Southeast Asian and how Singapore  could differentiate itself.
4. Part 4 will look into some basic principles of TCM and TIM (Ayuverda) that shape oriental wellness, as well as the relevant knowledge and skillsets in herbs, food and alternative therapies in oriental wellness context that participants should have in order to run wellness tours effectively and with confidence. 
5. Part 5 will bring the participants through a case study in wellness tourism.
6. Part 6 will look into how to market wellness centric tours.

References:
The Science and Art of Fengshui Course, Singapore Polytechnic
Skillsfuture Course on Accupressure and Meridian by Doctor Clement Ng
Global Wellness Institute Report
Survey Report on Western Perception of Oriental Wellness by Wine Resources
Complete Wellness by Susan Curtis
Strengthen Your Immune System, Reader's Digest

# course entry req
STB Tourist Guide License
