course_title: Drive Traffic and Sales with TikTok Video Marketing (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Drive Traffic and Sales with TikTok Video Marketing (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Unlock the power of TikTok to boost traffic and drive sales for your business. This course will guide you through developing an inbound marketing strategy that fosters a customer-centric culture on TikTok. You'll learn how to manage content effectively, implement viral marketing tactics, and grow a loyal follower base organically while converting leads into customers.  Discover how to set up and optimize TikTok advertisements for lead generation, understand the TikTok algorithm, and master creative best practices for content. Evaluate the effectiveness of your TikTok marketing strategies and make data-driven decisions to enhance performance and ROI.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1 - Develop and inbound marketing strategy driving customer-centric culture on TikTok 
LO2 - Manage content and implement a viral content marketing strategy on TikTok.
LO3 - Grow organic followers, convert leads to customers and evaluate TikTok inbound marketing strategy.

Topics Covered
Topic 1 Get Started with TikTok Marketing Strategy
•	TikTok marketing strategies and understand how TikTok works 
•	TikTok inbound marketing implementation plan and setup your TikTok accounts 
•	Driving a customer-centric and value-creation culture on TikTok 

Topic 2 Create  and Manage TikTok Content
•	TikTok interface and features 
•	Developing a viral content strategy 
•	Understanding TikTok algorithm 
•	Creative best practices 

Topic 3  Monetizing TikTok
•	How to set up TikTok advertisement for lead generation 
•	Types of advertisements – driving customer decision journey 
•	How to monitor the advertisement performance 
•	Evaluate the effectiveness of TikTok marketing strategy

Attitude

•	Enthusiastic Learner

•	Minimum 18 years old

course_title: Enhance Work Productivity with Microsoft 365 Copilot
course_title_cleaned: Enhance Work Productivity with Microsoft 365 Copilot
course_objective: Dive into the world of Microsoft 365 Copilot with our comprehensive course designed to enhance work productivity. This course provides an in-depth understanding of Microsoft 365 Copilot, including a comparison between the free Copilot, paid Copilot Pro, and Copilot for Microsoft 365. Learn how to create compelling content, improve PowerPoint presentations, and harness Copilot Pro for advanced Microsoft Office tasks. We'll also cover the utilization of Copilot for Excel, exploring the insertion of columns with formulas, creating charts and pivot tables, and conducting data analysis to streamline your workflow.  Transition smoothly into using Copilot for Teams and Outlook, where you will grasp the basic features of Microsoft 365 Chat, get summaries for meetings, work with prompts, and learn to draft and summarize email conversations efficiently. The course will also delve into Microsoft Loop and Copilot Studio offering insights into generating and managing content in Loop Workspace, sharing information seamlessly, managing projects effectively, and even creating custom chatbot using Copilot Studio. By the end of this course, you will have developed a solid plan to integrate Microsoft Copilot into your workflow, ensuring a seamless transition from legacy systems, and be equipped to design a staff training plan on using Microsoft Loop and Copilot GPTs.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1: Predict and mitigate challenges in integrating Microsoft Copilot to workflow.
LO2: Develop a plan for implementing Microsoft Copilot to ensure seamless transition from legacy workflow.
LO3: Evaluate opportunities in using Microsoft Copilot for Teams and Outlook.
LO4: Design a training plan for staff to use Microsoft Loop and Copilot GPTs

course_title: Customer Experience Management with Customer Orientation Level 2 (Asynchronous and Synchronous eLearning)
course_title_cleaned: Customer Experience Management with Customer Orientation Level 2 (Asynchronous and Synchronous eLearning)
course_objective: The performance gaps in many food services establishments with customer facing services include lack of knowledge in PDPA compliance and limited abilities to recognise and select the appropriate methods to portray professional etiquette when responding to customers over various platforms.  To address the performance gaps, this course will include learning content related to customer engagement platforms, communication etiquette,  customer behavioural patterns, service evaluation models and customer experience metrics, customer experience and relationship strategies and PDPA  to better engage customers over various platforms and improving the overall customer experience.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
1. Identify the various customer engagement platforms to interact with customers to better understand customer behavioural patterns.
2. Recognise the structure of the customer service knowledge base and the importance of the compliance of Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA).
3. Apply effective communication techniques to portray professional etiquette when using various customer engagement platforms including using appropriate service evaluation models and customer experience metrics to address and manage customers’ needs and expectations.
4. Distinguish customer experience management strategies and customer relationship management strategies, including recommendations to improve customer experience and implementation of appropriate strategy to maintain relationships with customers.
course_entry_req:
- Basic numeracy and English literacy (Level 3)
- Basic computer and digital literacy 
- Age 18 years old and above

course_title: Child First Aid Full Course (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_title_cleaned: Child First Aid Full Course (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_objective: This course provides 3 Licenses after completion. Accredited by the Singapore Resuscitation and First Aid Council (SRFAC) and recognized by ECDA and MSF, this blended 2022 version of the Blended Child First Aid Course was specifically designed for childcare, preschools and kindergarten teachers and meets the requirement for center licensing.  Includes Standard / & Child First Aid and BCLS+AED Certification. Participants will undergo 7 hours of online learning at their own pace, followed by 1.5 days of practical training in class.
course_learning_outcomes:
First Aid treatment is critical in preventing further injuries and pain to the victim before the arrival of medical professionals.

For Childcare related Environment, they have their own challenges with Children around and we teach Childcare professionals to address to first aid emergencies. In this course you will get 3 Licenses namely, Adult First Aid, Child First Aid and BCLS AED.

Must be able to understand
To have Singpass registered to mark attendance

course_title: GenAI For Everyone
course_title_cleaned: GenAI For Everyone
course_objective: This course introduces the fundamentals of Generative AI and its applications in the workplace. Learners will explore how Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) and AI tools like chatbots, prompt engineering, and media generation can enhance organizational productivity, creativity, and efficiency. Through practical, hands-on learning, participants will understand how to apply AI in various industries, from marketing to decision-making, and solve workplace challenges using data-driven insights.  Key Outcomes:  1. Understand the basics of Generative AI and its role in improving workplace productivity. 2. Apply AI tools to drive innovation and organizational efficiency. 3. Identify industry-specific applications of AI for enhanced collaboration and decision-making. 4. Use Generative AI for marketing, ideation, and problem-solving.
course_learning_outcomes:
After training, learners will be able to:

LO1: Explain the fundamentals of Generative AI and its role in leveraging Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) to enhance workplace productivity and support organizational activities (K1, A1).

LO2: Apply AI-powered tools, including prompt engineering, chatbots, and media generation, to create innovative solutions and improve organizational efficiency and engagement (K2, A1, A2).

LO3: Identify and apply Generative AI in sector-specific scenarios, demonstrating the use of AI tools to enhance productivity, collaboration, and basic decision-making in workplace contexts.

LO4: Utilize Generative AI tools to create marketing assets, generate innovative ideas, and solve workplace challenges through data-driven insights (K2, A1, A2).

These outcomes will enable learners to integrate Generative AI effectively into their work, leveraging AI to enhance productivity, creativity, and decision-making across various organizational functions.

course_title: Project Management Professional PMP ISO 21500 ISO21502 Training
course_title_cleaned: Project Management Professional PMP ISO 21500 ISO21502 Training
course_objective: At the end of this interactive workshop, participants will be able to: 	Demonstrate professionalism in project management 	Understand the responsibilities and accountability of a Project Manager 	Manage the time, cost, and quality constraints of a project 	Learn about the methodology and concepts used behind project management 	Refine your knowledge and skills in various project management methodology 	Apply proven and practical skills in project management to your job and daily tasks 	Execute project in a structured and strategic approach 	Communicating and handling multiple stakeholders across different teams, time zones and countries 	Master the Best Practices/Strategies for running a project successfully 	Improve the productivity and effectiveness of your project teams and your entire organization 	Prepare and pass project management certification exams such as PMI Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Risk Management Professional (PMI-RMP), Scheduling Professional (PMI-SP) 	Attain Certificate of Attendance
course_learning_outcomes:
	5-Day Live Training (approximately 45 hours of learning)
	Welcome to join us for future runs with new and updated content for free
	Access to our online learning resources with videos, guides, templates, mocks exams and hand-on practices
	Prepare for and pass your PMP certification exam with confidence
	As a preferred training provider, we will provide 10% discount code for the PMP exam
	Visit us at https://pmtraining.singaporeprojectmanagement.org/ for more information

This training program covers all the essential topics for a project management professional. It includes knowledge such as the core competencies required from a project manager; as well as the capability to manage the triple constraints of cost, time and quality. With an emphasis on strategic and business knowledge, this training program will help you to become an adaptable & multi-purpose project manager.

In this interactive workshop, you will work with others in simulated project teams and learn how to create a realistic project plan using proven tools and techniques. You will also learn how to manage the triple constraints of scope, time and cost. At the end of the workshop, you will be able to develop a schedule and budget; actively manage the risks that could affect your project; and how to manage your team effectively to ensure the highest certainty of success.

This course includes Program and Project Management methodologies such as Agile, Six Sigma, Scrum, Waterfall. The course is aligned to PMI Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Risk Management Professional (PMI-RMP), Scheduling Professional (PMI-SP). Learners will attain Certificate of Attendance upon course completion.
course_entry_req:
This course is suitable for people of at least 21 years old with at least a diploma or a university degree.

Learners should be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 3.

Working experience is not required, but if the learner do not have the necessary educational qualifications, he will need to have at least 3 years of working experience.

course_title: Machine Reasoning
course_title_cleaned: Machine Reasoning
course_objective: Identify needs of machine reasoning technology in various industrial applications. Acquire knowledge of core machine reasoning techniques, including rule-based logical reasoning, domain expert’s knowledge representation and acquisition, knowledge discovery, and handling uncertainty during reasoning process Apply machine learning technique to extract industrial domain knowledge and express business rules in computer readable format. Compare the architectures and main techniques used in contemporary reasoning systems, e.g. Google AlphaGo, IBM Watson, and Amazon Alexa. Design knowledge based machine reasoning software modules based on expected business outcomes and industrial domain knowledge Build software application by applying learnt machine reasoning techniques and computer programming.
course_learning_outcomes:
Artificial intelligence (AI) exists in modern computer systems, most times behind the scene. In this course, we reveal those intelligent techniques leading to reasoning ability and smart behaviours embedded in intelligent software systems, which make use of knowledge (digitized data useful to business), learn, reason and take actions automatically, in various business contexts and industry domains.
Participants learn comprehensive knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) fundamentals, automated computer/machine reasoning methods, knowledge discovery & modelling, decision support technologies, and intuitive graphics-based programming skills to design and create intelligent machine reasoning systems to solve real-world problems.
course_entry_req:
Participants should have intermediate mathematics and statistics knowledge, e.g. calculating boolean algebra (logic), and probability.
Participants should have intermediate computer literacy and software engineering fundamentals, e.g. using Windows or Linux or MacOS, Microsoft Office or LibreOffice, VMware or VirtualBox, and aware of web application, and client-server software architecture.
Participants should have current or prior hands-on coding experience in one or more high-level computer programming languages, preferable in Java. Experiences with Python, R, or structured query language (SQL) would have added advantages.
Participants without programming experience should self-study basic Java or Python.

course_objective: 1: Utilise Procurement principle and practices	 Utilise Procurement Principles and Practices to meet organizational needs •	Procurement principles, theories and practices •	Apply procurement process and procedures  2: Conduct Inventory Checks	 Ascertain Inventory level by performing inventory Checks •	Inventory control policies and procedures •	Conduct inventory checks  3: Identify suitable supplier	  Identify suitable supplier from approved vendors list •	Methods of reviewing approved suppliers •	Methods to determine supplier lead-time to delivery •	Identify potential approved supplier for the required goods  4: Raising Purchase Orders/Requests Raise request for quotation (RFQ) or purchase order (PO) •	Policies and procedures for raising a purchase order request •	Raise a RFQ or PO for approval  5: Receive and check products	 Verify quality of products received against specifications. •	Equipment and materials qualification policies and procedures •	Receive goods and goods conformed to technical specification
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is aimed for Procurement Executive/Sourcing Executive from the Wholesale Trade and all other sectors who supports the development of procurement strategies by monitoring inventory movement and reconciling supplies with established procedures. He/She able to analyse the suitable supplier from the approved supplier list so as to rise Request For Quotation (RFQ) or Purchase Order (PO) for approval.
This course will help the learner to analyse the suitable supplier from the approved supplier list so as to rise Request For Quotation (RFQ) or Purchase Order (PO) for approval.
This course will help the organisation to manage the ordering, receipt, review and approval of items from suppliers so as to meet business goals.
course_entry_req:
The following section explores the entry requirements to be considered for entry into the course:

Years of Experience: 
There are no minimum requirements for entry although any experience in Wholesale Trade industry or Purchasing or Procurement would be able to aid the learner in making sense of the learning materials presented throughout the course.

Assumed Attitude:
•	Willingness to learn and apply the knowledge and skills to the workplace

Assumed Skills and Knowledge
•	Read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES WPL level 4 or above.
•	Communicate information effectively and work in a team.
•	Understand and apply factual and procedural knowledge.
•	Apply basic cognitive and technical skills to carry out defined tasks and solve routine problems using simple procedures and tools.
•	Use limited discretion in resolving issues or enquiries.


Measures to ascertain learner suitability
Check the Statement of Attainment (SOA) for WPLN certificate

course_title: HR Graduate Certification - Strategic HR
course_title_cleaned: HR Graduate Certification - Strategic HR
course_objective: This module uses the Strategic Human Resource Management (HRM) framework to enable participants to provide a strategic angle in implementing Human Resource (HR) processes and practices that communicate the clear goal of HR – that of the businesses’ strategic partner. That is, HR understands the business and is actively involved in every step of the strategic planning process. Thus, HR is no longer a staff function with a focus on operations; HR is an important partner in delivering business strategies and outcomes in organisations.  In addition, we will also explore the competencies needed for a mid-level HR professional to acquire to step up to the role of delivering Strategic HRM. That is, this module is developed with the mid-level HR professionals to enable them to prepare themselves for a strategic HR role.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this 2-day module, participants will be able to:
A. General Knowledge
- understand the difference between Human Resource Management (HRM) and Strategic Human Resource Management (HRM), and
understand what is involved in implementing Strategic HRM – the Strategic HRM framework.
B. General Skills
- analyse important considerations in thinking through the Strategic HRM framework, and develop competencies to enable the delivery of Strategic HRM practices.
C. Action-oriented Attitude
- learn to use the Strategic HRM framework; and
be proactive in developing personal competencies that will enable them to enact Strategic HRM in organisations.
course_entry_req:
Participants should:
- have a degree from a recognised university; and
- have minimum 2 years of working experience in HR/OD related roles; and
- currently a HR/OD practitioner in a private or public sector organisation

course_provider: ACADEMY OF DESIGN ARTS AND MEDIA PTE. LTD.
course_title: WSQ Drone Build and Beta Flight
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Drone Build and Beta Flight
course_objective: This course guides you step-by-step to build a DIY drone, which you can keep to continue practising after the training.   There are 3 learning units:  LU1 – Drone Components: The first step is to understand the pros and cons between ready-made versus DIY drones, enabling informed choices. When a DIY drone is more suitable, the next step is to choose the components and tools needed to build it sustainably, without unnecessary extras.  LU2 – Build the Drone: With the components understood, the next step is moving on to the DIY drone's actual construction. This hands-on unit ensures that the components are put together following best practices and abiding by risk management protocols.  LU3 - Calibrate the Drone: When the drone is built, the next step is calibration. This step involves integrating the DIY drone with the flight controller software, exploring the various parameters found on the tuning software and integrating these into the DIY drone.  LU4 – Optimise the Drone: After calibration, the DIY drone can take flight but may not yet operate at peak efficiency. The next step is to optimize the drone. This involves reviewing the flight logs, evaluating various performance metrics, aligning them to intended business usage and fine-tuning for optimal efficiency.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completing this course, you will achieve the following learning outcomes.

1. Able to select the components and tools required to build a DIY drone for intended business usage

2. Able to apply risk management protocols when building a DIY drone

3. Able to calibrate a drone according to intended business usage by exploring the parameters available on the tuning software.

4. Able to use flight logs to interpret the performance metrics used to measure the effectiveness of calibration for intended business usage
course_entry_req:
Prerequisite: Basic familiarity with drone operation is required.

full_course_desc:
# course provider
ACADEMY OF DESIGN ARTS AND MEDIA PTE. LTD.

# course title
WSQ Drone Build and Beta Flight

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2024050929

# course run
27 Nov 25

# course duration
3-5 days

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$1,400.00

# subsidised course fee
$700.00

# course number of hours
16.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
This course guides you step-by-step to build a DIY drone, which you can keep to continue practising after the training.   There are 3 learning units:  LU1 – Drone Components: The first step is to understand the pros and cons between ready-made versus DIY drones, enabling informed choices. When a DIY drone is more suitable, the next step is to choose the components and tools needed to build it sustainably, without unnecessary extras.  LU2 – Build the Drone: With the components understood, the next step is moving on to the DIY drone's actual construction. This hands-on unit ensures that the components are put together following best practices and abiding by risk management protocols.  LU3 - Calibrate the Drone: When the drone is built, the next step is calibration. This step involves integrating the DIY drone with the flight controller software, exploring the various parameters found on the tuning software and integrating these into the DIY drone.  LU4 – Optimise the Drone: After calibration, the DIY drone can take flight but may not yet operate at peak efficiency. The next step is to optimize the drone. This involves reviewing the flight logs, evaluating various performance metrics, aligning them to intended business usage and fine-tuning for optimal efficiency.  

# course learning outcomes
Upon completing this course, you will achieve the following learning outcomes.

1. Able to select the components and tools required to build a DIY drone for intended business usage

2. Able to apply risk management protocols when building a DIY drone

3. Able to calibrate a drone according to intended business usage by exploring the parameters available on the tuning software.

4. Able to use flight logs to interpret the performance metrics used to measure the effectiveness of calibration for intended business usage


# course entry req
Prerequisite: Basic familiarity with drone operation is required.
Language and Literacy: Able to read, write and communicate in English Minimum education level: at least secondary school 
Target age group: At least 21 years old

course_title: Automate Your Excel Processes using VBA Macros
course_title_cleaned: Automate Your Excel Processes using VBA Macros
course_objective: By the end of the course, participants will be able to write their own macros and process large sets in Excel efficiently.  Participants will be able to: •	Recognise the broad applications and benefits of using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA). •	Demonstrate basic concepts of VBA programming, such as data types, variables, and subroutines. •	Create dialogue boxes for user inputs into VBA Userform. •	Identify common errors in VBA. •	Apply basic debugging techniques in VBA. •	Construct VBA macros and custom functions using conditional statements, loops, arrays, and/or string functions. •	Construct VBA macros to interact with MS Outlook. •	Create commonly used charts using VBA.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is a 2-day hands-on training designed to empower participants with the knowledge to automate and customise their processes in Excel through the use of VBA. This can help save time and reduce human errors. At the end of the course, you will have enhanced your skills in Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).

You will be guided using easy to follow ‘Use Cases’ during the hands-on exercises, where the trainers will show you step-by-step how to write your own VBA macros.

You will learn how to process large sets in Excel efficiently through the use of common programming techniques such as conditional statements and loops, arrays and string functions.

Basic interactions with Outlook, the creation of commonly used charts using VBA, and some basic debugging techniques to rectify common VBA errors  will also be introduced.
course_entry_req: Participants must have a good working knowledge of Excel, and are expected to be familiar with the general concepts of spreadsheets. Prior programming knowledge is not necessary.

course_title: Singapore Accredited Mortgage Planner Course (SAMP)
course_title_cleaned: Singapore Accredited Mortgage Planner Course (SAMP)
course_objective: By the end of the course, participants would be able to: –  Work out a financial blueprint before a property purchase; Identify the factors that banks use to assess loan eligibility; Recognise the different types of loans; Select a loan most suitable to a property purchase; Describe what a bridging loan is and illustrate its use; Outline the steps in arranging for commercial property investment; Explain how an equity term loan can unlock value from a property without selling; Identify the conditions favorable to refinancing; Describe the factors to look out for in managing a construction loan; Create a plan to pay off the loan earlier; and Identify the protection plan most relevant to the home buyer and the property.
course_learning_outcomes:
Written with the real estate professional in mind, the course is also suitable for financial planners and property investors alike. Rich in both concepts and hands-on practices, this course will equip the course participant with the knowledge and skill to both plan and manage a mortgage. Course participants will also be introduced to advanced financing strategies, as well as the effective use of leverage – a critical element that will improve borrowing capabilities and help create greater wealth.

A real estate professional who has the requisite knowledge and skill in mortgage planning will be able to add value to the buying and selling process that he undertakes to serve his client. A financial planner who has an in-depth knowledge of mortgage planning will be able to chart out his client’s finances holistically and recommend the right instruments to generate more wealth. A property investor, on the other hand, will get to know the features of the different types of loans available, and take on the loan most suitable for his/her investment profile.

course_title: Data Visualisation Using SafetyCulture
course_title_cleaned: Data Visualisation Using SafetyCulture
course_objective: Assure Safety, recognizing the importance of supporting Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and digital transformation, highlighted the role of technology in enhancing Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) at the recent STAS-WSH Council Workplace Safety Forum 2023. By aligning with Industry Digital Plans (IDPs) released by the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), Assure Safety identified SafetyCulture as a key digital application to improve WSH performance and productivity. However, successful implementation requires trained users to maximize its potential. Additionally, the recent Approved Code of Practice (ACOP) on Chief Executives and Board of Directors' WSH Duties underscores the need for digital solutions like SafetyCulture to meet leadership principles in WSH management. This training targets sectors such as construction, manufacturing, healthcare, hospitality, and retail, equipping participants with skills for real-time inspections, incident reporting, and data-driven decision-making. The training also covers data visualization techniques to develop effective dashboards for monitoring and strategic insights. The target audience includes anyone who is interested in using the SafetyCulture platform, but is not limited to Company Directors, Chief Executives, WSH Professionals, and various managerial and supervisory roles, among others.
course_learning_outcomes:
LO1: Learners will be able to identify the basic functions and features of the SafetyCulture platform.

LO2: Learners will be able to navigate the SafetyCulture platform and select appropriate visualization techniques to effectively convey data and findings.

LO3: Learners will be able to interpret data analysis and findings by identifying trends, averages, and outliers in inspection data.

LO4: Learners will be able to compare different types of information displays and organize the presentation of data to reflect trends and correlations in a visually compelling way.

LO5: Learners will be able to evaluate the suitability of different data representations for specific contexts and justify their selection.

LO6: Learners will be able to develop dynamic data displays using the platform.

LO7: Learners will be able to enhance data displays by incorporating interactive features such as filters and drill-down options.

LO8: Learners will be able to create basic dashboards and scorecards to display data effectively.

LO9: Learners will be able to incorporate external benchmark data into scorecards to compare internal performance against industry standards effectively.

LO10: Learners will be able to share SafetyCulture templates and inspection results within their organization.

LO11: Learners will be able to communicate the limitations and uncertainties of data findings clearly and effectively.
course_entry_req:
- Basic knowledge of workplace safety and health.
- At least 3 months of work experience with some related experience.
- Able to speak, listen, write, and read English with numeracy skills at a minimum proficiency level of the Employability Skills System, i.e., Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 2.

course_provider: SMF CENTRE FOR CORPORATE LEARNING PTE. LTD.
course_title: Perform Warehouse Operations
course_title_cleaned: Perform Warehouse Operations
course_objective: This course is developed to enable learners to acquire the skills and knowledge to receive, check, prepare, pack and deliver stocks with proper documentation.   Upon successful completion of this training programme, learners should be able to acquire the following learning outcomes:   1.	Receive, check, handle, order and return various incoming products and in-store stocks and merchandise in accordance with organizational procedures. 2.	Record details of incoming stocks, stock discrepancies and transfers using relevant documents and/or certificates in accordance with organizational procedures. 3.	Receive, sort, label, display and store products with proper documentation in accordance to organizational procedures, quality standards, legal and storage temperature requirements. 4.	Perform routine stock rotation of products, order stocks and conduct stocktaking and/or cyclical counts in accordance with organizations policies and procedures. 5.	Handle undelivered orders, stocks returns, exchanges and/or transfers with respective store outlets, departments, central warehouses, suppliers and/or manufacturers.
course_learning_outcomes: Warehouse operations is an important piece of supply chain. Warehousing and inventory storage affect everything from sourcing raw materials and, efficiently managing inventory, to getting orders delivered to customers on time.  Warehousing is the process of storing physical goods or inventory in a warehouse or storage facility before they are sold or distributed. Warehouses safely and securely store and protect products in an organized way, making it easy to track an item’s location, when the items arrived, how long the item has been there, and the quantity on hand.
course_entry_req:
•	Minimum age requirement: 21
•	Able to speak, listen, write, and read English with Numeracy skills at a minimum proficiency level 4 of the Employability Skills System (i.e., Workplace Literacy and Numeracy, WPLN).
•	Non-PMEs who have the relevant work experience from other industry sectors wanting to enhance their knowledge and skills, wanting to expand their job portfolio, or are seeking national certification/qualification specializing in inventory control.
•	Non-PMEs and career switchers, or individuals in other related industries or wanting to join the manufacturing industry specializing in inventory control.

course_title: Practical Electronics Design with Arduino Microcontroller
course_title_cleaned: Practical Electronics Design with Arduino Microcontroller
course_objective: The WSQ Practical Electronics Design with Arduino Microcontroller course equips participants with the essential skills to design and implement real-life applications using Arduino. Beginning with an introduction to embedded systems, the course explores key concepts in basic electronics, including digital input/output and Pulse Width Modulation (PWM). Participants will gain hands-on experience in creating circuits, controlling actuators, and interfacing with various sensors and transducers.  Through comprehensive modules, learners will apply the Arduino microcontroller to both analog and digital sensors, enabling them to build responsive and interactive systems. The course also covers advanced topics such as servo and stepper motor control, providing the knowledge necessary to implement actuator networks. By the end of the course, participants will be able to confidently analyze and develop practical electronics solutions using Arduino technology.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcome:
- analyse real life applications using Arduino microcontroller
- implement basic electrical circuits using Arduino microcontroller
- apply Arduino microcontroller to analogue sensors and transducers
- apply Arduino microcontroller to digital sensors and transducers
- implement actuators with Arduino microcontroller

Course Outline:
Topic 1 Introduction of Embedded Systems
Overview of Embedded Systems
Applications of Embedded Systems
Introduction to Arduino Microcontroller
Serial Communication

Topic 2 Introduction to Basic Electronics
Basic Electronics Concepts
Digital Input/Output
Pulse Width Modulation (PWM)

Topic 3 Analog Sensors and Transducers
Overview of Analog Sensors and Transducers
Analog Input/Output
Servo Control

Topic 4 Digital Sensors and Transductors
Overview of Digital Sensors and Transducers
Light Activation by Motion Detection

Topic 5 Actuators
Overview of Actuator Networks
Stepper Motor Control
course_entry_req:
Knowledge and Skills
•	Able to operate computer functions with minimum Computer Literacy Level 2 based on ICAS Computer Skills Assessment Framework
•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience. 
•	Minimum 18 years old

Coordinate the implementation of WSH management programmes with the necessary resources in compliance with the relevant WSH management system elements, Coordinate WSH trainings for relevant stakeholders to meet legal and other organisational WSH requirements Coordinate and document a management 	review on WSH management system, Maintain and update records of WSH legal documents in accordance with legal and other requirements Communicate legal compliance requirements to relevant stakeholders and government agencies, Coordinate governmental agency visits or inspections and compliance audits at the workplace in accordance with organisational procedures to maintain WSH legal compliance.

course_title: Data Wrangling (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Data Wrangling (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Participants will learn: - How to import data from various sources such as flat files, excel files, json. - Use SQL to navigate and extract data stored in structured database - Understand the various types of data types: nominal, ordinal, continuous, text, date etc. - Perform preliminary data analysis on a data set to produce a data summary. - Understand how to deal with badly formatted data - Process data to prepare data for further analysis
course_learning_outcomes:
This course introduces the various techniques to import data, clean data and process data for analysis. The course will cover simple statistical analysis that can be performed on the processed data.

The course covers the following:
- Importing Data from various sources such as CSV, JSON, Excel files
- SQL language to manipulate data stored in a structured database
- Cleaning Data to ensure proper formatting, dealing with missing values, assigning proper data types to fields etc.
- Processing Data which includes transforming data into different structure formats, encoding data, normalisation of data values etc.

course_title: WSQ Support Patient Care Delivery (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Support Patient Care Delivery (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The inability to accomplish activities of daily living (ADL) and other essential daily tasks may lead to unsafe condition and poor quality of life in patients. Healthcare workers should be aware of the importance of assessing ADL to identify and help patients who require assistance. This course introduces learners the basic care needs of patients. It equips learners with knowledge and skills that will enable them to perform basic patient assessment and to assist patient in ADL and other essential daily care activities. The course also provides learners with fundamental knowledge on infection control and prevention which is required in performing patient care activities.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcome 1:
Describe the basic biopsychosocial needs of patients.

K1. Basic structure and functions of heart, sensory organs and excretory organs
K3. Basic mental health awareness
K4. Cultural awareness and person-centred care
K5. Communication skills
K12. Cognitive, affective and psychomotor skills

Learning Outcome 2:
Explain basic infection prevention and control practices in performing patient care activities.

K14. Infection prevention and control process
A8. Comply with infection prevention and control practices in performing patient care activities

Learning Outcome 3
Perform basic patient assessment using appropriate equipment, tools and techniques.

K6. Types of equipment, tools and techniques used for measurement of height, weight, and vital signs
K7. Normal range of vital signs
A6. Operate equipment and tools and pick up signs of abnormality before or during care processes

Learning Outcome 4
Demonstrate assisting patients with ADL using proper equipment and interventions.

K2. Basic functional assessment tools
K8. Types of equipment used to assist patients for activities of daily living
K10. Organisational procedures and guidelines in documentation
K11. Types of nursing interventions to assist patients in activities of daily living
A3. Perform nursing care and support patients’ activities of daily living
A4. Report abnormalities in patients’ condition to trained staff
A7. Maintain accurate and complete documentations in accordance with organisational procedures

Learning Outcome 5
Describe essential care activities that support patients’ treatments within a healthcare setting.

K9. Admission and discharge procedures
K13. Organisational policies, standards and practices in patient care delivery
A1. Assist patients in admission and discharge procedures
A2. Support clinical procedures
A5. Assist in transfer of patients to another unit for clinical procedures
course_entry_req: Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualifications (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5.

course_provider: LEARNING EXPLORER LANGUAGE CENTRE PTE. LTD.
course_title: Conversational Vietnamese Beginner 1 Course
course_title_cleaned: Conversational Vietnamese Beginner 1 Course
course_objective: The Conversational Vietnamese Beginner 1 course is for non-native Vietnamese Speakers. This course focuses on communication skills, basic grammar, listening & reading skills necessary for success in introductory Vietnamese as a Foreign language. By the end of this course, students will be able to hold a basic conversation in Vietnamese with improvement in all four essential skills speaking, listening, reading & writing.  Students also gain a grounding in Vietnamese pronunciation, grammar, and essential vocabulary to understand basic phrases and terms used in day-to-day situations. The course focus is less technical and improvements can be seen fast. Contents focus on more breadth and exposure rather than technical semantics. Course Objectives After completing 20 hours of learning from this course, learners will achieve a good basic Vietnamese proficiency level needed for business people, which means they will acquire certain listening, speaking, reading and writing skills and be able to use Vietnamese to fulfil business and social communication activities and tasks encountered in their business workplace life, study and work requirements.
course_learning_outcomes:
Course Description:
Learners will master the basic pronunciation rules, vocabulary and grammar of Vietnamese for business people use as well as basic information about Vietnamese characters, acquire preliminary listening, speaking, reading and writing skills and be able to make simple conversations about everyday topics in a Business situation set up for the Vietnamese language.
The level teaches more than 150 words frequently used in business and social communications and more than 20 grammar items, as well as the topics second language learners, are most likely to encounter in their Business workplace life, study and work requirements.
We will introduce activities that take place outside the classroom, especially using social networks for high acceptance, because students can meet people with the same interests and because it is important to encourage self-learning. 


Content consists several topics that will be covered an introduction to Vietnamese language, Greetings, Self-Introduction, Asking for personal details & contacts, Identifying things. Telling where do you work. Talk about Jobs & Professions with Countries & Nationalities, Asking Questions in Office, Transportation and Everyday activities in social and workplace situations.
Cultural: Formal and informal speech contexts, Overview of the Vietnamese speaking world, Curiosities of the Vietnamese speaking country Vietnam. 
Total course duration is 10 sessions of 2hrs each (20 training hours)

course_title_cleaned: Post-Diploma Certificate in Advanced Concepts in Emergency Nursing (part of Advanced Diploma in Nursing (Emergency))-ADEM1
course_objective: The Post-Diploma Certificate in Advanced Concepts in Emergency Nursing course will offer the following modules: (1) Evidence-Based Practice (45 hours) (2) Psychosocial and Special Population Groups Emergencies (60 hours) (3) Disaster Management and Trauma Emergencies (60 hours)  Total Training hours:  165
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NANYANG POLYTECHNIC

# course title
Post-Diploma Certificate in Advanced Concepts in Emergency Nursing (part of Advanced Diploma in Nursing (Emergency))-ADEM1

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2024047988

# course run
5 Jan 26

# course duration
1-3 months

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$4,306.50

# subsidised course fee
$603.57

# course number of hours
165.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
The Post-Diploma Certificate in Advanced Concepts in Emergency Nursing course will offer the following modules: (1) Evidence-Based Practice (45 hours) (2) Psychosocial and Special Population Groups Emergencies (60 hours) (3) Disaster Management and Trauma Emergencies (60 hours)  Total Training hours:  165

# course learning outcomes
At the completion of the PDC, learners will be able to:
(1) Apply evidence in emergency nursing in the development of nursing practices using principles of evidence-based practice and appropriate appraisal framework;
(2) Perform physical assessment for appropriate clinical decisions and interventions using a systematic, comprehensive and focused approach;
(3) Plan for care of special population clients, clients with trauma emergencies and during disasters in emergency setting using a systematic, comprehensive and focused approach;
(4) Demonstrate competency in the requisite skills for special population clients, clients with trauma emergencies and during disasters in emergency setting according to evidence-based clinical guidelines; and
(5) Apply the psychosocial concepts in the care of clients and families in emergency setting with reference to appropriate principles and models.


# course entry req
•	Diploma in Nursing from a local Polytechnic or an equivalent qualification;
•	Singapore Nursing Board registration;
•	2 years post registration experience with a minimum of 1 year in the discipline of study.

course_title: People Change Management - Level 4 (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_title_cleaned: People Change Management - Level 4 (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_objective: This programme is designed to provide leaders essential skills to operate in the VUCA business world. Designed to equip leaders with the tools to map the interrelations with the operating variables as they facilitate innovation and lead change in the workplace. Tools such as change management aim to strengthen their ability to better facilitate change and lead people to the desired future state.
course_learning_outcomes:

* Manage the implementation of change strategies and processes
* Monitor and evaluate impact of change on team leaders

•	Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the ES WSQ WPL level 5

course_title: Modular Certificate in Fire Protection Systems - Part of Diploma in Engineering (Building Services & Fire Safety) (DEBF1)
course_title_cleaned: Modular Certificate in Fire Protection Systems - Part of Diploma in Engineering (Building Services & Fire Safety) (DEBF1)
course_objective: (a)	Fire Science  This module provides the students with the fundamentals of fire science and fire behaviour of building materials and products. It also covers the factors affecting the development of fire in compartments and fire hazards of smoke in enclosed buildings.   (b)	Fire Engineering  This module provides students with the knowledge of active fire protection systems such as fire alarm, fire extinguisher, fire hose reel, wet & dry riser, automatic fire sprinkler and smoke control system. This module equips students with the skill and knowledge to design, install and maintain fire protection systems in buildings.  (c)	Performance Based Design In this module, students are introduced to the regulations and principles of performance-based fire safety design. It also equips students with the knowledge and skills to use the various types of computational tools for evaluation, fire/evacuation simulation and prediction of fire situations.
course_learning_outcomes:
The Modular Certificate in Fire Protection Systems - Part of Diploma in Engineering (Building Services & Fire Safety) (DEBF1) is a part-time CET course, consist of the following modules:
1) Fire Science (60hrs)   
2) Fire Engineering (60hrs)   
3) Performance Based Design (60hrs)
course_entry_req:
The following GCE ‘O’ Level grades and with at least 1 year of relevant work experience:
– English Language (Grade 1-7)
– Mathematics (Grade 1-6)
– Science (Grade 1-6)
OR NITEC with GPA >= 3.5
OR NITEC with GPA >= 3.0 and with at least 1 year of relevant work experience
OR Higher NITEC with GPA >= 2.0
OR Higher NITEC with GPA >= 1.5 and with at least 1 year of relevant work experience
OR NITEC in Technology or Services with GPA >= 3.5 and with at least 1 year of relevant working experience
OR Higher NITEC in Technology or Services with GPA >=2.0 and with at least 1 year of relevant working experience
OR relevant Advanced WSQ Certificate (or higher) and Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA and with at least 1 year of relevant working experience
OR applicants with at least 2 years of relevant working experience may apply for the course

course_title: Manage Change
course_title_cleaned: Manage Change
course_objective: To equip retail service staff with the essential skills and competencies to develop and implement change management initiatives, change management strategies and programmes.  Learning Units: LU1: Communicate change management programmes to employees - LO1 Communicate change management strategies, components of change management programme plans, objectives and implementation plans to employees   LU2: Factors and resources supporting change management programmes - LO2 Identify factors and apply resources that support change management programmes and initiatives   LU3: Implementing change management programmes - LO3 Implement change management programmes and initiatives successfully   LU4: Resistance and environments impacting change management programmes - LO4 Recognise the internal and external environments that influence change programs, as well as the challenges and resistance to change management programmes and initiatives   LU5: Assessing change management process and managing resistance - LO5 Assess the progress of change management processes and to mitigate actions to manage change resistance and opportunities  LU6: Evaluating and monitoring change management programmes - LO6 Analyse and evaluate change needs and monitor the effectiveness of change management programme for improvement   LU7: Presenting project performance outcomes to stakeholders - LO7 Manage the needs and expectations of stakeholders and effectively present project performance outcomes in accordance with organisation procedures
course_learning_outcomes: This course aims to provide learners with the opportunity to develop change management strategies implementation and be able to communicate these strategic plans to their teams effectively.
course_entry_req:
• Be above 18 years of age to 65 years of age 
• Have an understanding of the organisation’s product and service offering 
• Have an understanding of the organisation’s structure, standard operating procedures and guidelines on a relevant area of work. 
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification Literacy Level 5.

course_title_cleaned: Modular Certificate in Business Fundamentals - Part of Diploma in Business Practice (Administration & Management) (DBAM3)
course_objective: This course is designed for any learner who is keen to:  •acquire a working knowledge of managing human resource, digital marketing strategies and entrepreneurial strategies;  •plan, administer and improve business operations and governance in the areas of service operations, business communications and corporate governance;   •apply fundamental knowledge and skills in business analytics, accounting & finance, and international business & economics;   •apply digital skills, green skills and I4.0 skills in supply chain management to create innovative business models for a sustainable future;      •adopt a more global and professional outlook; •develop critical core skills, particularly creative thinking, self-management and influence which are essential for supporting business transformation;  •demonstrate greater confidence, resourcefulness and a more enquiring, enterprising and quality-focused mindset; and  •be more equipped for further education and career advancement, with a mindset of independent life-long learning.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will gain knowledge and skills from the Certificate in Business Fundamentals, which comprises
•Business Statistics & Application (60hrs)
•Accounting & Finance (60hrs)
•International Business & Economics (60hrs)
course_entry_req:
The following GCE ‘O’ Level grades and with at least 1 year of relevant work experience:
•	English Language (Grade 1-6)
•	Mathematics (Grade 1-6)
•	One other subject (Grade 1-6)

Or NITEC with GPA ≥ 3.5
Or GPA ≥3.0 and at least 1 year of relevant work experience; or

Or Higher NITEC with GPA of ≥ 2.0
Or GPA ≥ 1.5 and at least 1-year relevant work experience; or

Or NITEC in Technology or Services with GPA ≥ 3.5 and at least 1 year relevant work experience
Or Higher NITEC in Technology or Services with GPA ≥ 2.0 and at least 1 year relevant work experience

Or Relevant WSQ Diploma qualifications (or higher) and Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA and 1-year relevant work experience

Or applicants with at least 2 years of relevant working experience may apply for the course

course_title: Essential Construction Project Management Skills for Engineers & Technical Officers (Virtual Classroom)
course_title_cleaned: Essential Construction Project Management Skills for Engineers & Technical Officers (Virtual Classroom)
course_objective: To achieve good quality construction works, it is important for the engineer to be able to manage the design process and supervise the construction work on site effectively. This course will also cover the effective management of design process by the engineers and effective supervision of construction works by the engineers and RTOs. This course will also cover the risk assessment and safety management of construction works, to provide a safe environment for all personnel working on site. In addition, this course will also touch on the skill sets required for managing projects overseas, particularly in China. To equip participants with the essential knowledge and skills of Project Management so that they will be able to manage construction projects competently.
course_learning_outcomes:
Course Outline 
1. Introduction to Project Management for construction projects 
2. Management of Schedule, Quality and Cost for construction projects 
3. Management of design process 
4. Safety considerations during design stage 
5. Effective supervision of construction work on site 
6. Risk assessment of construction site 
7. Safety management of construction site 
8. Managing construction projects in China

course_title: Video Editing (Level 3)
course_title_cleaned: Video Editing (Level 3)
course_objective: This course covers the principles of video theory, pacing, and rhythm that are appropriate for various themes. Participants will learn about video enhancement software, the features, functions, and limitations of video editing software and equipment. They will also learn the techniques to execute technical edits and relevant editing standards and guidelines. At the end of the course, participants will be able to execute video edits to organise video footage in a sequence that matches the narratives in the script.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
- Analyse requirements in each scene to identify types of edits and effects needed 
- Import footage from multiple source files and arrange them in a logical sequence for editing 
- Create editing logs to outline details of edits required for selected footage 
- Make editing decisions to determine the appropriate shots, pacing, and the transitions needed to convey the story and emotions in each scene 
- Collaborate with production teams to resolve problems encountered in the editing process 
- Inspect edited video footages to ensure alignment with the technical requirements of production 
- Clean up noise and imperfections in edited video footages to optimise the video quality
course_entry_req:
- Minimum Age: 18
- Academic Requirement: Obtain Pass Grade in GCE N-Level subjects including English (or IELTS overall band score 5 and above or equivalent) and 2 other subjects or equivalent
- Applicants who do not meet the minimum requirements may still apply and will be considered based on: At least 1 year working experience in any industry; and/or Oral interview or evaluation test by Singapore Media Academy to determine suitability for the course
- Applicants may be called for interview at the discretion of Singapore Media Academy.

course_title: Cloud Technologies Essentials and Architectural Design + Preparing for Cloud Certification (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Cloud Technologies Essentials and Architectural Design + Preparing for Cloud Certification (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: Cloud technologies have changed the way we approach IT (Information Technology) solutions and have brought tremendous advantages to both IT personnel and businesses. Learners will acquire the knowledge of cloud computing and architectural design principles to support solutions deployment, maintenance, and scale. Learners will be acquainted with cloud products and administer them to IT personnel such as software developers and DevOps (Development + Operations) engineers.
course_learning_outcomes:
• Acquire the knowledge of full and hybrid cloud models. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Infrastructure as a Service. • Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Database as a Service. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Platform as a Service. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Data Storage as a Service. • Acquire the knowledge and skills to set up firewall and network security configurations. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to configure permissions and policies to other users. 
• Acquire the knowledge in deployment needs of IT solutions. 
• Acquire the knowledge in cloud architectural design and principles. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills in architectural diagramming for technical documentation and communication s purposes. 
• Cloud Certification Ready
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NANYANG TECHNOLOGICAL UNIVERSITY

# course title

# course url

# course number of hours
150.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
Cloud technologies have changed the way we approach IT (Information Technology) solutions and have brought tremendous advantages to both IT personnel and businesses. Learners will acquire the knowledge of cloud computing and architectural design principles to support solutions deployment, maintenance, and scale. Learners will be acquainted with cloud products and administer them to IT personnel such as software developers and DevOps (Development + Operations) engineers.

# course learning outcomes
• Acquire the knowledge of full and hybrid cloud models. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Infrastructure as a Service. • Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Database as a Service. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Platform as a Service. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to administer Data Storage as a Service. • Acquire the knowledge and skills to set up firewall and network security configurations. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills to configure permissions and policies to other users. 
• Acquire the knowledge in deployment needs of IT solutions. 
• Acquire the knowledge in cloud architectural design and principles. 
• Acquire the knowledge and skills in architectural diagramming for technical documentation and communication s purposes. 
• Cloud Certification Ready

# course entry req
Applicants should have some related background that is relevant to the programme:

• Individuals with an IT background looking to diversify/expand their skills and/or intending to switch to a cloud engineering role;
• Employed full-time and seeking upskilling within the tech industry (E.g. System Admin to beCloud Engineer);
• Those with engineering degree/diploma; or
• Those with professional engineering experience.

(Applicants are subjected to pre-course assessment and interview before being accepted)

course_title: Interdisciplinary Collaborations in Special Education
course_title_cleaned: Interdisciplinary Collaborations in Special Education
course_objective: • Attain skills that could help them in their current job scope (i.e. Preschool teacher, special needs educator, allied educator etc.) • Learn based on interest in the topic • Not be tied to complete modules that they are not interested in just to attain a qualification • Short duration for students who prefer short courses due to other commitments • The College brings a grounded, holistic experience with its focus on theory as well as real-world, practical case studies and examples delivered by lecturers who actively practice in their respective fields. • With our continued post course support, we wish to instill confidence in the learners such that they will be confident in teaching and managing children with special needs.
course_learning_outcomes:
LO1: Communicate with other services, professionals and volunteers (A1, K1)
•	A1: Liaise with other services and social service professionals
•	K1: Techniques for working with other services, professionals and volunteers

LO2: Describe the principles and applications of professional and ethical conduct (K5)
•	K5: Principles and applications of professional and ethical conduct

LO3: Contribute to the goals and activities of different types of collaborative teams or network (A2, K2)
•	A2: Contribute to the goals, objectives and activities of the collaborative teams or network
•	K2: Types of collaborative practices

LO4: Describe the Social service sector networks and forums (K4)
•	K4: Social service sector networks and forums

LO5: Identify the different multidisciplinary roles of social service professionals (A3)
•	A3: Recognise the different multidisciplinary roles of social service professionals

LO6: Describe the roles and functions of professionals and stakeholders (K3)
•	K3: Roles and functions of professionals and stakeholders

LO7: Implement the common goals and record the workplace operations of collaborative teams (A4, A5)
•	A4: Implement common goals for the collaborative teams
•	A5: Document and retain workplace operations of collaborative teams

LO8: Describe the procedures to document and report workplace operations of collaborative teams (K6)
•	K6: Procedures to document and report workplace operations of collaborative teams
course_entry_req:
•	Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualifications (ES WSQ) & Workplace Literacy Numeracy (WPLN) level 3
•	The entry requirement will be ‘N’ level/’O’ level qualification and above and be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the ES WSQ WPLN level 3 
•	Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES WSQ Workplace Numeracy (WPN) level 3/’N’ level
•	At least 2 years working experience in the early intervention care and education sector.

course_title: Prepare Basic Sushi

course_objective: This course is designed for culinary enthusiasts and professionals to learn about sushi preparation.  Learners will explore the history, ingredients and techniques behind the creation of authentic sushi.  Learners will get the opportunity to create a variety of sushi styles.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this unit, learners will attain knowledge and skills in the following areas: 

1. Understanding  the cultural significance and history of sushi
2. Learn about the essential ingredients and tools required for sushi making 
3. Master the foundational sushi-making techniques including rice preparation, seafood handling and rolling techniques. 
4. Learn different sushi presentation guidelines
5. Develop skills to troubleshoot on sushi making issues.

course_title: (SCTP) Advanced Professional Certificate in Software Engineering (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) Advanced Professional Certificate in Software Engineering (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: • Trainees will gain well-rounded employment opportunities with tech companies by receiving fundamental training in the necessary programming languages that is most in demand today.  • This programme aims for a spread readiness in terms of familiarity with the latest technologies.  • Trainees will learn the skills, tools and techniques relevant in launching a successful career as a Software Engineer.
course_learning_outcomes:
This 6-month course has been designed by industry experts to provide all the knowledge and skills of Software Engineering to enable graduates to excel in a career in this exciting and highly in-demand field.

You will gain essential hands-on experience on how to be an effective coder, build and test software products, understand how information technology works in our society, and learn the key tools and frameworks for different software development roles to launch a successful career.

The SCTP in Software Engineering Programme seeks to equip you with the most popular front-end web frameworks (React) and the time tested programming languages (Java and Spring Boot), that are well adopted by the government sector and financial services industry. On top of software development, you will also be equipped with DevOps skills where you will leverage on automation tools to achieve Continuous Integration and Deployment.

Throughout the course, you will learn the critical aspects of the Software Development processes, including requirements gathering, planning, coding, and testing. They will also learn the foundations of product management - including Scrum and Agile - to provide them with the core skills to work in technical development teams, start-ups, agencies, and product companies, etc.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NANYANG TECHNOLOGICAL UNIVERSITY

# course title
(SCTP) Advanced Professional Certificate in Software Engineering (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)

• Trainees will gain well-rounded employment opportunities with tech companies by receiving fundamental training in the necessary programming languages that is most in demand today.  • This programme aims for a spread readiness in terms of familiarity with the latest technologies.  • Trainees will learn the skills, tools and techniques relevant in launching a successful career as a Software Engineer.

# course learning outcomes
This 6-month course has been designed by industry experts to provide all the knowledge and skills of Software Engineering to enable graduates to excel in a career in this exciting and highly in-demand field.

You will gain essential hands-on experience on how to be an effective coder, build and test software products, understand how information technology works in our society, and learn the key tools and frameworks for different software development roles to launch a successful career.

The SCTP in Software Engineering Programme seeks to equip you with the most popular front-end web frameworks (React) and the time tested programming languages (Java and Spring Boot), that are well adopted by the government sector and financial services industry. On top of software development, you will also be equipped with DevOps skills where you will leverage on automation tools to achieve Continuous Integration and Deployment.

Throughout the course, you will learn the critical aspects of the Software Development processes, including requirements gathering, planning, coding, and testing. They will also learn the foundations of product management - including Scrum and Agile - to provide them with the core skills to work in technical development teams, start-ups, agencies, and product companies, etc.

# course entry req

• Employed full-time and seeking upskilling within the tech industry. (e.g. System Admin to be Software Developer);	
• Those with engineering degree/diploma; or
• Those with professional engineering experience.

course_title: Certified Data Centre Professional (CDCP®)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Data Centre Professional (CDCP®)
course_objective: The CDCP® course is a 2-day course (2-day ILT/VILT).CDCP® training will address how to setup and improve key aspects such as power, cooling, security, cabling, safety etc. to ensure a high-available data centre. CDCP® training will also address key operations and maintenance aspects.  CDCP® is the first training in the EPI Design and Build training track under the EPI Data Centre Training Framework.  After completion of the course the participant will be able to: •	Choose an optimum site for mission-critical data centre based on current and future needs •	Describe all components that are important for high availability in a data centre and how to effectively setup the data centre. •	Name and apply the various industry standards; •	Describe the various technologies for UPS, fire suppression, cooling, monitoring systems, cabling standards, etc, and to select and apply them effectively to cost-efficiently enhance the high-availability of the data centre. •	Review the electrical distribution system to avoid costly downtime. •	Enhance cooling capabilities and efficiency in the data centre by using existing and new techniques and technologies for the increased cooling requirements of the future •	Design a highly reliable and scalable network architecture and learn how to ensure installers apply proper testing techniques •	Setup effective data centre monitoring ensuring the right people get the right message •	Ensure proper security measures, both procedural and technical, are established to safeguard your company's valuable information in the data centre •	Select equipment racks and components suitable for ICT equipment and its cooling requirements •	Select the correct light levels for the various areas of the data centre. •	Select appropriate fire safety/protection controls to detect and suppress potential fire
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1: Translate infrastructure blueprints into technical specifications by assisting in outlining components and technologies for business environments.
LO2: Apply design techniques to draft specifications for data centre infrastructure systems that meet performance, usage, and security requirements.
LO3: Produce infrastructure prototypes and refine design specifications for data centre infrastructure in accordance to stakeholder feedback.

Course Outline 
Topic 1: Fundamentals of Data Centre Design 
Topic 2: Design Policies for Data Centre 
Topic 3: Modification on Data Centre Specifications
course_entry_req:
Knowledge and Skills
•	Able to operate using computer functions
•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)
Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner
Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience

Target age group: 21-65 years old

course_title: SCD (Supply Chain Digitalisation)-Ready
course_title_cleaned: SCD (Supply Chain Digitalisation)-Ready
course_objective: STEP-SCD helps companies deepen competencies in the areas of supply chain planning, sourcing and delivery.
course_learning_outcomes:
SCD (Supply Chain Digitalisation)-READY will enable participants to gain key supply chain management skills and identify digitalisation opportunities to achieve business outcomes. 
 
This workshop will be conducted in different phases and includes:
•	Phase 1: Bite size training in critical supply chain management skills using mainly Microsoft Office 365 or/and Google Workspace applications. 
 
•	Phase 2: Participants to identify process improvement and digitalisation quick wins and longer-term improvement opportunities for a process in their company. They are expected to implement some quick wins.
 
After SCD-READY, program participants can look forward to sustaining this capability through process mapping and identifying quick wins and longer-term process streamlining, digitalisation and automation/robotics implementation opportunities.

course_title: WSQ Digital Branding and Brand Strategy
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Digital Branding and Brand Strategy
course_objective: By the end of the class, participants will:  • Distil the essence of your brand identity • Research, visualise and test branding initiatives • Lead your stakeholders and work with them to co-create a dynamic brand • Establish branding guidelines and a code of conduct for internal stakeholders • Know what to monitor and how to respond to external stakeholder comments • Identify and implement the correct steps to manage and avert a PR crisis
course_learning_outcomes:
Whether you are intending to start your own business or if you are looking at revitalising your brand, it is critical to understand what branding and brand strategy entails in order to develop marketing, communications, and public relations initiatives that will make your organisation highly appealing to internal and external stakeholders.

Before proceeding with branding and developing a brand strategy, it is important to distinguish between your business and your brand. Your business is focused mainly on generating revenue while your brand is the visible and experiential aspects of your organisation as perceived by your internal and external stakeholders.

Branding is how you present and position your brand to your stakeholders while brand strategy is the long-term planning behind the development of an irresistible and successful brand. Brand Strategy comes before and informs the branding process; it takes into consideration what the brand stands for, what it promises its stakeholders, how it conducts itself internally and externally, etc.

In today’s digital landscape where communication is two-way, the development of the brand becomes a co-creation process with its stakeholders. Brands have to accept that they are no longer in total control, and that the best way forward is to work with their stakeholders to build a winning brand.

Brands also need to be vigilant regarding what they put out and what their stakeholders are saying about them. When something goes wrong, brands need to take the necessary steps to resolve it quickly. This is especially critical in our cancel culture as it may result in a boycott of your products and services as well as long-lasting damage to your brand reputation.
course_entry_req:
• Minimum age: 18
• Years of working experience: 1
• Possess basic ICT knowledge such as browsing the web, opening of folders and documents, and basic navigation of software interface
• Motivated learners
• Able to interact with fellow peers
• Proficient in spoken English with at least a PSLE certificate or equivalent

course_title: Communication Skills for IT Professionals (Classroom and Synchronous eLearning)
course_title_cleaned: Communication Skills for IT Professionals (Classroom and Synchronous eLearning)
course_objective: Learners will be able to: 1)	Understand Communication Channels and Information Processing Techniques. 2)	Adopt Listening Strategies for Effective Communication. 3)	Effectively use different Questioning Techniques for Seeking Clarity and Enhancing Understanding of problem statement. 4)	Utilise Concise Language, Technical Vocabulary, Writing Techniques, and Emotional Intelligence when Communication problems. 5)	Master Verbal and Non-Verbal Communication for Effective Information Exchange in problem processes. 6)	Set Clear Objectives for Information Exchange with Defined Desired Outcomes and Ensure Confidentiality of Information
course_learning_outcomes: This course will focus to equip learners with the essential skills necessary to effectively communicate with stakeholders regarding the projects they have undertaken. Building upon the knowledge acquired in earlier modules, where they explored how companies integrate AI and digital technologies to streamline processes and the fundamentals of project management for IT professionals, this module will provide learners with the necessary tools to articulate the value, progress, and outcomes of their projects to various stakeholders. Effective communication is paramount in the success of any IT project. Whether it is conveying technical complexities to non-technical stakeholders, updating project sponsors on milestones and deliverables, or addressing concerns from team members, mastering communication techniques is vital. Throughout this module, learners will delve into strategies for tailoring their message to different audiences, crafting clear and concise project updates, and leveraging various communication channels to ensure their message resonates effectively.

Language Proficiency:

# course objective
The Advanced Diploma in Nursing (Critical Care) course will offer the following modules: (1) Evidence-Based Practice (45 hours) (2) Neurological, Gastrointestinal and Endocrine Critical Care Nursing (60 hours) (3) Renal and Multisystem Critical Care Nursing (60 hours) Total training hours: 165

# course learning outcomes
At the completion of the PDC, learners will be able to:
(1)  Apply evidence in critical care nursing in the development of critical care nursing practices using principles of evidence-based practice and appropriate appraisal framework;
(2)  Perform physical assessment for appropriate clinical decisions and interventions using a systematic, comprehensive and focused approach;
(3)  Plan for care of critically ill client with complex multisystem dysfunctions in critical care setting using a systematic, comprehensive and focused approach;
(4)  Demonstrate competency in the requisite skills for complex problems and surgeries of critically ill client with complex multisystem dysfunctions in critical care setting according to evidence-based clinical guidelines; and
(5)  Apply concepts of care in critically ill clients and families with terminal illness, end of life and bereavement in critical care setting with reference to appropriate psychosocial concepts and models.

# course entry req
•	Diploma in Nursing from a local Polytechnic or an equivalent qualification;
•	Singapore Nursing Board registration;
•	2 years post registration experience with a minimum of 1 year in the discipline of study.
