English Language (EL1 or EL2) Grade 1 – 7
Any mathematics subject Grade 1 – 6
One other subject Grade 1 - 6
and 3 years of relevant working experience OR
Higher Nitec	
GPA ≥ 2.0 OR GPA ≥ 1.5 and 1 year of relevant working experience OR

Nitec	
GPA ≥ 3.5 OR GPA ≥ 3.0 and 1 year of relevant working experience OR

Higher Nitec in Technology/Services	
GPA ≥ 2.0 and 1 year of relevant working experience OR
Nitec in Technology/Services 
GPA ≥ 3.5 and 1 year of relevant working experience OR
WSQ Qualification	
Relevant WSQ Qualification with 3 years of relevant working experience and WSQ Workplace Literacy Statement of Attainment (SOA)(Level 6) AND Workplace Numeracy Statement of Attainment (SOA)(Level 6)

course_title: Content Creation & Storytelling using Generative AI
course_title_cleaned: Content Creation & Storytelling using Generative AI
course_objective: In this course, we will aims to provide a comprehensive understanding on the emerging field of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI), for example Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (ChatGPT), Bard, or Adobe Firefly. Students will learn the role of visual storytelling in communicating complex ideas and its applications for the purpose of rolling out digital marketing initiatives. It will be an exploration on the principles of design, visual storytelling, and the use of generative AIs. It aims to develop skills in creating dynamic visual narratives using these tools to engage, inform and inspire the targeted audience. The students will also gain knowledge and understanding of cutting-edge tools for creating compelling narratives and a range of visual designs, including animations, videos, graphics, and interactive media.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, 
1.Understand the nature of Content and Stories : Participants will be equipped with the skills to create visually compelling narratives that effectively convey brand messages and engage target audiences.
2.Strategic Implementation of Content: Participants will develop the knowledge and strategies required to integrate AI-generated content seamlessly into their digital marketing initiatives, optimizing their effectiveness and impact.
3.Mastering Generative AI Tools: Participants will have a deep understanding of various generative AI technologies and their practical applications in digital marketing and content creation.
course_entry_req: Basic understanding in AI and Digital Marketing

course_title: SFQB: RISE For Business - Digital Growth and Innovation Module 1 of 4: Specialisation Foundation (Sync and Async E-learning)
course_title_cleaned: SFQB  RISE For Business - Digital Growth and Innovation Module 1 of 4  Specialisation Foundation (Sync and Async E-learning)
course_objective: This module provides a solid foundation in strategic business growth and digital maturity, enabling you to set clear ambitions and identify key growth levers within their organizations. It emphasizes leadership development, structured decision-making, and the assessment of digital opportunities, preparing you to effectively lead in the digital age. Through focused exploration of leadership styles and the assessment of digital maturity, you will gain the insights and tools needed to navigate and capitalize on emerging digital trends.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Master strategic growth planning by setting business ambitions and identifying key growth levers, shaping a robust foundation for digital transformation. 

- Apply structured problem-solving process to define and solve real-world business problems which they can apply to drive growth within their organizations.  

- Enhance your communication skills by learning to deliver compelling presentations and craft clear, persuasive stories using the Pyramid Principle.  

- Gain insights into the critical success factors of digital transformations and learn how to effectively apply these within own business contexts. 

- Enhance understanding of key digital trends and technologies, gaining the skills to effectively assess digital opportunities. 

- Deep dive into disruptive digital technologies such as AI, Gen AI, IoT, and RPA, understanding their applications and implications for business transformation.  

 - You will be introduced to your mentors and collaborate to identify strategic growth levers that will maximize business impact.

About RISE 
Created by RISE by BCG U, RISE for Business is a corporate edition of the original RISE Programme designed to help companies upskill their own employees to capture new digital opportunities. Tapping on BCG’s industry experts, trainees will undergo a specially curated application-based curriculum that includes live work case examples and the opportunity to apply learnings directly back into their company contexts.
course_entry_req:
Company requirements:
- Company must be registered or incorporated in Singapore 

Learner requirements:
- Minimum education level - Diploma (or equivalent) and above 
- Language and literacy proficiency level – English (minimum intermediate) 
- Target age group – Minimum 21 years of age and above
- Required years of experience in relevant domain – Minimum 2 years (Open to fresh grads) 
- Other requirements: Singapore Citizen, PR and LTVP+ and (2) Basic computer literacy in operating a computer, familiar with MSOffice and browsing the internet

course_title: Source Control
course_title_cleaned: Source Control
course_objective: Note: This course is offered as a module in the (SCTP) Junior Data Engineer programme. We do not offer this module on its own. Please scroll down to proceed to the main SCTP site for more information and to register interest.   This course curriculum prepares entry level professionals to handle the data management activities such as collecting the data from internal and external data sources (big data), building the data structure to store the data captured, and loading the data into the data systems (such as data lake) as well as have a good understanding in different types of database systems such as traditional relational databases and modern big data management platforms, and the data transformation techniques. There are behavioural skills and mindsets elements integrated into both the technical and practice sessions.
course_learning_outcomes: Participants will learn about version control, how to manage the versioning of codes as well as popular source control tools such as Git and Github.
course_entry_req: Pass screening which includes a basic technical test and interview

course_title: ISACA Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) (SF) (Sychronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: ISACA Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) (SF) (Sychronous e-learning)
course_objective: The ISACA Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) is a 5-day training program designed for professionals responsible for managing, designing, and overseeing an enterprise’s information security. Over five intensive days, participants gain comprehensive knowledge across four key domains: Information Security Governance, Risk Management, Security Program Development and Management, and Incident Response. This globally recognized course prepares attendees for strategic roles by equipping them with the skills to align cybersecurity initiatives with business objectives, manage risks effectively, and lead security teams. It is ideal for professionals aiming to become Information Security Managers, Risk Officers, or Cybersecurity Consultants.
course_learning_outcomes:
CISM – Certified Information Security Manager – is the most widely accepted certification for an Information Security Manager who is effective able to secure his Enterprise by managing the risks and threats. Certification holders are consistently recognized among the most-qualified professionals in the information security and risk management fields. CISM holders are also able to promote international security practices.

The 5 days or 40 hours curriculum is aimed for the candidates to demonstrate their skill and competency in 38 Task areas and 72 Knowledge areas under the 4 Domains.

The purpose of the uniquely management focused CISM certification promotes international security practices and recognizes the individual who manages, designs, and oversees and assesses an enterprises information security.
course_entry_req:
•	5+ years of experience in technical IT security or Cybersecurity
•	Experience in information security management is mandatory
•	Experience in general information security optional
•	At least a graduate degree qualification, with or without a major (honours)
•	Appropriate managerial skills with knowledge of relevant tools and techniques
•	Proficiency in English language equivalent to the GCE O Level is expected
•	Recommended to possess CISA and CRISC certificates
•	Recommended for Career Path Advancement - CGEIT to get to an overarching governance role
full_course_desc:

course_title: Registered Scrum Master and Product Owner (RSMPO) (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Registered Scrum Master and Product Owner (RSMPO) (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Upon successful completion of this course, participants will:  •	Understand the design logic and the origin of Scrum •	Gain insights on the why and the how of the 3 roles, 5 events and 3 artifacts in Scrum •	Understand the three roles of Scrum – Scrum Master, Product Owner, and Team Members – and create a hyper-productive Scrum team.  •	Simulate the entire Sprint by enacting the three roles of Scrum - Scrum Master, a Product Owner, and Team Members in your Scrum Team. •	Execute the five events in Scrum - Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective. •	Master the lean theory, Daily Scrum, and the Scrum board. •	Continuously improve product deliveries using Sprint Reviews and Sprint Retrospective •	Acquire additional skills for Product Owner proficiency and Scrum Master mastery
course_learning_outcomes:
The Registered Scrum Master and Registered Product Owner (RSMPO) course is an interactive three-day course for participants who want to accelerate their project or product delivery by improving team collaboration. Participants in this course will learn crucial insights and strategies of high-performing Scrum Masters and Product Owners. 

Optimizing team collaboration requires a strong understanding of the Agile mindset and operating a Scrum system, beginning with the creation of a strong Scrum team. This course will give participants the tools and foundation to create a strong Scrum system and Scrum team. Continuous improvement is one of the core values of the Agile mindset. Students taking this course will be able to use the Scrum framework and tools to iteratively improve their product or project delivery. 

Participants attending this course will be given 2 coupons to attempt Scrum Inc. Certification Examination for 1. Registered Scrum Master and 2. Registered Product Owner. These internationally recognized certifications enable participants to spearhead all Scrum projects in any industry.
course_entry_req: Diploma holder. Applicants should have some familiarity with Agile concepts and principles.

This course will give participants the tools and foundation to create a strong Scrum system and Scrum team. Continuous improvement is one of the core values of the Agile mindset. Students taking this course will be able to use the Scrum framework and tools to iteratively improve their product or project delivery. 

Participants attending this course will be given 2 coupons to attempt Scrum Inc. Certification Examination for 1. Registered Scrum Master and 2. Registered Product Owner. These internationally recognized certifications enable participants to spearhead all Scrum projects in any industry.

# course entry req
Diploma holder. Applicants should have some familiarity with Agile concepts and principles.

course_title: Harnessing Play for Intentional Teaching (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Harnessing Play for Intentional Teaching (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This two days interactive workshop focusses on harnessing play for intentional teaching by using a ‘Play Kit’ designed and packaged with an objective to implement and incorporate play into the curriculum for children ranging from 18 months to the age of 6.  The sessions will help to reinforce the importance of play development in young children and its relationship to learning. The interactive activities in the sessions will be focused on; the quality of play, play as a means of self-expression, and play as a channel of communication in achieving social sense in early childhood care and education.  Relevant theories, latest researches and policies related to play encompassing the effects of culture, media and technology will be examined alongside the play activities.  Emphasizing on the value of play in relation to holistic development; cognitive, social emotional, and physical development of young children.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:

1. Demonstrate knowledge of the functions and values of play in the holistic teaching and learning of young children.

2. Implement intentional teaching by means of the ‘Play Kit’, which is designed to harness play encompassing all the six areas (DOW, NUM, L&L, SED, MSD, and ASC).

3. Apply principles of learning through play, using the interests and abilities of young children incorporating all six areas based on the NEL.

4. Develop their professional skills covering some of the core competencies based on the four core knowledge areas of CPDF.

5. Provide inventive and imaginative strategies and approaches for working with the inherent creativity of young children that would enhance by means of aesthetic and creative, motor skills development, social and emotional development, discovery of the world, numeracy, and language and literacy skills.

6. Linking play theories and activities to emerging understandings of the development of the human brain based on contemporary research findings.
course_entry_req:
LON Certification Status: L1 , L2 , EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Lead Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Governance, Risk Management and Data Compliance Module 4: Policy and Third Party Management of Data (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Governance, Risk Management and Data Compliance Module 4  Policy and Third Party Management of Data (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Monitor and review the resources and effectiveness of policies and procedures • Develop strategies for policy implementation     • Develop strategic vendor management plans and set KPIs for vendors • Devise risk mitigation strategies to pre-empt and address potential risks associated with the vendor relationship
course_learning_outcomes: Businesses now operate in an increasingly interconnected world, sharing sensitive data and access with third parties. This makes many processes easier, but also increases the levels of risk originating from third parties. it is imperative to have capabilities at hand to continuously monitor and manage third party risk and performance.This module provides participants with the understanding of vendor and policy management. In particular, the course discusses due diligence in selecting third party vendors and the types of data protections that should be included in the contract with the vendor.
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably have tertiary qualifications and/ or with at least 3 years of working experience.

# course learning outcomes
Businesses now operate in an increasingly interconnected world, sharing sensitive data and access with third parties. This makes many processes easier, but also increases the levels of risk originating from third parties. it is imperative to have capabilities at hand to continuously monitor and manage third party risk and performance.This module provides participants with the understanding of vendor and policy management. In particular, the course discusses due diligence in selecting third party vendors and the types of data protections that should be included in the contract with the vendor.

course_title: ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management Systems Internal Auditor
course_title_cleaned: ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management Systems Internal Auditor
course_objective: The ISO 22301 course is designed to provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of Business Continuity Management Systems (BCMS) based on the ISO 22301:2019 standard. The course covers the principles and concepts of business continuity, including risk assessment, business impact analysis, and the development and implementation of business continuity plans. Participants will learn how to establish, implement, maintain, and improve a BCMS, ensuring organizational resilience in the face of disruptions.   Additionally, it addresses the process of auditing and continuous improvement to ensure ongoing compliance and enhancement of the BCMS. They will learn the roles and responsibilities of an internal auditor, and the stages of the audit process, including planning, execution, reporting, and follow-up. Participants learn how to assess an organization’s compliance with business continuity policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements, and how to identify opportunities for improvement.
course_learning_outcomes:
ISO 22301
Background and Context of Business Continuity Management
Business Continuity Alignment with Organisational Goals
Business Continuity Planning
Business Continuity Implementation Requirements
Business Continuity Performance Evaluation and Reporting
Business Continuity Management System Continuous Improvement
Business Continuity Management System Internal Audit
course_entry_req: GCE O Levels

course_title: Account Management for Growth
course_title_cleaned: Account Management for Growth
course_objective: This comprehensive course equips professionals with essential skills to excel in strategic account management and drive business growth through enhanced customer relationships.  Learn how to develop and implement effective account management plans that align with your organization's objectives and key performance indicators. Master the creation of frameworks that enhance customer satisfaction and deliver measurable results.  Discover proven strategies to improve customer service across your organization, utilizing best practices that engage clients and foster long-term loyalty. You will analyze customer trends and evaluate account management effectiveness to optimize performance and identify growth opportunities.  The course provides practical tools for monitoring sales performance and generating detailed reports that drive informed decision-making. You will also learn valuable techniques for building strategic partnerships that consistently deliver increased sales results.  Through hands-on learning activities, you will develop practical plans for customer service improvement, performance enhancement, and partnership development. This course is ideal for account managers, sales professionals, and business leaders seeking to strengthen their client relationships and achieve sustainable growth.
course_learning_outcomes:
In this course, you'll master the essential skills to align sales strategies with your organisation's vision and create effective account management plans. You'll discover how to establish robust frameworks that enhance customer satisfaction and lead the management of critical accounts.

You'll learn proven techniques for developing customer service strategies that effectively engage and retain clients while fostering growth. Through practical applications, you'll gain expertise in analysing customer trends and measuring account management effectiveness.

The course teaches you to utilise enterprise-level monitoring tools and oversee sales performance across your organisation's customer accounts. You'll also acquire valuable skills in building and nurturing long-term strategic relationships that drive business growth.

Learning Outcomes:
LO1: Develop organisational objectives and KPIs aligned with business direction to produce an account management plan demonstrating strategic alignment.
LO2: Establish an account management framework and lead critical account management to create a customer satisfaction enhancement plan.
LO3: Develop an organisational customer service strategy using best practices to engage, retain, and grow customers, producing a customer service improvement plan.
LO4: Analyse customer trends and review account management effectiveness to produce a performance improvement report.
LO5: Oversee organisation-wide sales performance using monitoring tools to generate comprehensive sales performance reports.
LO6: Build long-term strategic relationships using client relationship techniques, creating a partnership development plan to drive sales.
course_entry_req:
• 21 years and above
• At least one month work experience in a sales capacity
• Speak, write, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6, and at a Workplace Numeracy Level 5
• Diploma or equivalent

course_title: CSE Certified Sustainability (ESG) Practitioner - Advanced
course_title_cleaned: CSE Certified Sustainability (ESG) Practitioner - Advanced
course_objective: This course offers a comprehensive exploration of sustainable engineering through a structured Part-to-Whole sequencing approach. It begins with foundational concepts in sustainability and innovation, progresses to assessing the economic, ecological, and engineering dimensions of sustainability, and culminates in developing strategies to enhance market success and community well-being. Participants will gain critical skills in integrating sustainability, evaluating impacts, and applying industry best practices, addressing the growing need for expertise in sustainability. Relevant to both current professionals and those seeking job advancement, the course prepares learners to lead sustainability initiatives, ensuring compliance with regulations and driving impactful organizational practices. Suitable for intermediate to advanced learners, this course equips professionals to meet industry demands and elevate their careers in sustainable engineering.
course_learning_outcomes:
1. Examine sustainable engineering solutions for organisation 
2. Propose organisation offerings benchmarked to industry best practices 
3. Evaluate the impacts on the sustainability dimensions and endorse suitable 
    sustainable solutions
4. Establish organisation’s strategies and practices with engineering expertise 
    on sustainable solutions

course_title: The Future of Adult Education: Generative AI-Enhanced Case-Based Learning
course_title_cleaned: The Future of Adult Education  Generative AI-Enhanced Case-Based Learning
course_objective:
In the dynamic landscape of adult education, traditional training methods often fall short in preparing learners for real-world complexities. The incorporation of Case-Based Learning (CBL) enhanced by Generative AI (GenAI) addresses this gap by leveraging real-world scenarios to develop critical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills. This approach is particularly relevant for adult learners who benefit from practical, experiential learning that directly applies to their professional and personal lives.

The program also supports adult education by teaching educators to design effective CBL experiences that meet learning objectives through well-crafted case studies. Strategies for facilitating CBL sessions promote active participation and insightful discussions.

GenAI tools streamline content creation and data analysis, allowing educators to focus on design and facilitation, while AI-enhanced case studies provide dynamic, adaptive learning experiences. Educators also gain skills in assessing learner progress with tailored formative and summative assessment techniques, receiving constructive feedback to improve their practical application skills.
course_learning_outcomes:
This session empowers adult educators with Case-Based Learning (CBL), an approach that leverages real-world scenarios for impactful learning. The session will explore the core principles of CBL, its relevance for adult learners, and its connection to authentic situations.

The session will dive into practical strategies for designing and facilitating CBL lessons, incorporating generative AI to create interactive and engaging case studies. Learners will also discover how to foster critical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills in adult learners - essential skills for thriving in today's dynamic environment.

Knowledge-based learning objectives:

1. Explain the theoretical underpinnings of Case-Based Learning (CBL).

2. Describe the benefits and relevance of CBL for adult learners.

3. Analyse the effectiveness of CBL in fostering critical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills in adult learners.

4. Identify the key components of effective CBL design, including learning objectives, case selection, and guiding questions.

5. Discuss various assessment techniques for evaluating learner progress within CBL activities.

Skills-based learning objectives: BR>
1. Design and develop engaging CBL scenarios and activities, incorporating generative AI tools and techniques.

2. Facilitate effective CBL sessions for adult learners, fostering active participation, promoting critical thinking, and guiding insightful discussions.

course_title: Effective Data Governance and Quality – Enabling the Future of your Business
course_title_cleaned: Effective Data Governance and Quality – Enabling the Future of your Business
course_objective: At the end of the the 2-day course, participants will be able to:  • Understand the role of data management in the role of business strategic decisions  • Demonstrate an understanding of the full spectrum of data management along the entire lifecycle of data • Show a strong understanding of the drivers of sustained good data quality and how people and technology can support this • Show an appreciation of the trends and driving forces behind the evolution of data management
course_learning_outcomes:
It is an increasing trend for companies to collect huge volumes of data as they recognise the value of data which is now considered a strategic asset for digitalisation, innovation of products and services and cost management. Hence, this has given rise to the need for reliable data management practices to produce good quality data for various consumption needs.

This course aims to provide participants with an understanding of what good data management is, the key components of data management and how these have a direct impact on business performance. Participants will learn how data management is integral to the strategic direction of the business, how data is governed through its entire lifecycle, the benefits of various components of strong data management, and how it may be best leveraged to drive business outcomes. They will be equipped to best deploy effective data management practices for whichever business function they are in to create strategy and make better informed business decisions.
course_entry_req: NIL

course_title: (ACEY) Supervised Teaching Practice 2
course_title_cleaned: (ACEY) Supervised Teaching Practice 2
course_objective: In this practicum phase, students are given the opportunities to under study and work with both young children and other practising educarers already in the field. Students will initiate and carry out effectively required roles and responsibilities in an infant / toddler care centre. They will take on the role of a warm and nurturing educarer and implement a variety of child-centred activities appropriate for very young children. Students are also required to work as part of the teaching team using effective communication techniques and resources.   Using all the theoretical study knowledge that the student has now amassed up to this point, it is expected that the student uses and shows competencies in linking theory to practice expected of an educarer, including planning of activities, child observation, learning environment planning, making teaching aids, and carrying out of caregiving routines. The practicum has intended to help educarers to develop an appreciation of responsibilities and roles of centre, educarers and parents working in partnership for benefits of young children.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the practicum, students should be able to:

1. Demonstrate the ability to observe, document and assess toddlers’ and
nursery children’s development and learning.
2. Gain practical experience in caring for toddlers and nursery children.
3. Demonstrate the ability to prepare and carry out routine care with young children.
4. Demonstrate the ability to observe safety and hygiene when dealing with young children.
5. Use positive strategies to guide children’s behaviours.
6. Demonstrate the ability to plan, implement and evaluate developmentally appropriate activities for toddlers and nursery children.
7. Demonstrate the ability to select and develop appropriate materials and resources and setting up of the learning environment.
course_entry_req:
Applicants should have:

a. Minimum Secondary 4 education* or completed 10 years of formal education* and

b. At least an average SOA in the WPL series, including an SOA 5 for WPL-Writing

*Official documents are required to show completion of 10 years of education. Medium of instruction is to be in English.

course_title: Fi-Fai-Fonik : Learning Phonics in Malay through Play (Malay)
course_title_cleaned: Fi-Fai-Fonik   Learning Phonics in Malay through Play (Malay)
course_objective: Fi-Fai-Fonik, is a creative approach to introduce Malay phonics through a holistic blending of authentic experiences by the learner. In Loris Malaguzzi's book, The Hundred Languages of Children, she stated what children learn does not follow as an automatic result from what is taught, rather, it is in large part due to the children's own doing, as a consequence of their activities and (teacher's) resources.  In this workshop, multimodal forms that diversify the possibilities for children to construct or express meanings and their understanding will be explored. For example, using a dance to illustrate the words of the same initial letter [bodily kinaesthetic/ musical intelligence] or a treasure hunt map to find the words belonging to a letter [spatial intelligence]   Consequently, drawing inspiration from the classic folktale, 'Jack and the Beanstalk', Fi-Fai-Fonik's strategies seek to challenge the child to chart and take control of their own learning of phonics, moving away from traditional rote learning to become independent learners.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will be able to:
1.	Recognize the diverse learning styles of children in order to implement a creative phonics lesson that motivates children to learn Malay
2.	Assess appropriate information from case studies to create multimodal projects that enhances pupil's learning experience
course_entry_req:
Be ECDA-certified as L2 teacher
Currently employed in a childcare registered or licensed with ECDA
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF EARLY CHILDHOOD...

course_title: Storytelling Techniques and Theories for Creative Content Advertising
course_title_cleaned: Storytelling Techniques and Theories for Creative Content Advertising
course_objective: 1. Develop engaging themes and plots that appeal to the audience with elements of storytelling 2. Analyse various styles and techniques with audience engagement techniques 3. Enhance character development and plot progression using principles of storytelling and character psychology 4. Apply techniques to create content that generates new experiences with emotional maps of plots. 5. Resolving loose ends of storylines with mechanisms and devices to convey time, events, and emotions. 6. Modify narratives to meet different designs, technical, and production requirements by applying cross-media and non- linear storytelling principles 7. Collaborate effectively with creative teams to streamline the creative process and achieve desired outcome.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is targeted at businesses in the retail industry and aims to train learners to improve their content advertising using effective storytelling. The use of storytelling techniques in content advertising has become increasingly popular in recent years, as marketers seek new and innovative ways to engage audiences and build brand awareness. However, using storytelling effectively requires a deep understanding of the principles and techniques involved, as well as the ability to adapt narratives to meet the needs of different platforms and audiences. According to HubSpot1, the use of storytelling in advertising requires a clear narrative structure, relatable characters, and a consistent tone and style. In addition, the article states that successful storytelling involves creating an emotional connection with the audience, as emotions are a powerful driver of engagement and loyalty.

One key need for training in using storytelling techniques for content advertising is the development of a deep understanding of storytelling principles and techniques. This includes an understanding of narrative structures, character development, and plot progression, as well as the ability to use storytelling devices and mechanisms to convey time, events, and emotions. By mastering these techniques, marketers can create compelling stories that resonate with their target audience, building engagement and loyalty over time.

Another important aspect of training in storytelling for content advertising is the ability to leverage cross-media and non-linear storytelling techniques. In today's digital landscape, audiences expect to engage with content across a range of platforms and devices, and using techniques such as transmedia storytelling and interactive narratives can help to create immersive and engaging experiences that build stronger connections with viewers. According to a report by HubSpot2, the average engagement rate for short-form video content is 53.9%
course_entry_req:
Aged 21 and above
Have basic computer literacy Level 2
Have minimum GCE “N”, “O” or “A” Level / NITEC or a diploma qualification and minimum 2 years of working experience;
Have an English language proficiency equivalent of higher of any of the following - GCSE N/O Levels pass in English / WPLN Level 5 / IELTS 5.5 / TOEFL (internet based total) 46-59.

course_title: PL-900 Microsoft Power Platform Fundamentals
course_title_cleaned: PL-900 Microsoft Power Platform Fundamentals
course_objective: Master the fundamentals of Microsoft Power Platform with this comprehensive PL-900 course. Learn to identify opportunities for integration and perform feasibility assessments for middleware solutions. Explore the core components of Power Platform, including Power Apps for app development, Power Automate for workflow automation, Power BI for data visualization, and Power Virtual Agents for building intelligent chatbots. Gain insights into connecting data, implementing API-level integrations, and ensuring compliance with data security and privacy standards.  This course also covers testing and verifying the functionality of Power Platform applications, troubleshooting issues, and optimizing performance across integrated platforms. Participants will acquire hands-on skills to transform data into insights, streamline processes, and enhance business efficiency through the implementation of robust Power Platform solutions.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1: Identify opportunities with Power Platform and perform middleware feasibility assessments for application integration.
LO2: Utilize Power Platform to integrate data, functions and supporting API-level integration.
LO3: Perform tests and verify the functioning of Power Platform applications.
LO4: Implement integration solutions and highlight performance improvements in Power Platform.
course_entry_req:

•	Able to operate computer functions with minimum Computer Literacy Level 2 based on ICAS Computer Skills Assessment Framework
•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience. 

Miniumum Age Group: 21-65 years old

course_title: Evaluate the preparation of shipping documents associated with the import and export of goods.
course_title_cleaned: Evaluate the preparation of shipping documents associated with the import and export of goods.
course_objective: The course aims to address the following performance gaps for Head of Operation and Head of Trade Finance: 1. Analyse the evolving standards, market dynamics and trends in shipping documentation requirements. 2. Develop strategies to streamline cargo documentation procedures based on INCOTERMS, IATA and FIATA standards. 3. Develop logistics solution in response to changing standards in car-go documentation.  4. Develop negotiation techniques to facilitate discussion on documentation terms in case of dispute. 5. Evaluate the impact of changing standards in cargo documentation.
course_learning_outcomes:
The target sector for evaluate the preparation of shipping documents associated with the import and export of goods is wholesale trade. As part of Singapore Economy 2030, the Trade 2030 strategy will deepen and widen Singapore’s trade and help enterprises grow beyond our borders.
Through growing trade volume, diversifying trading activities, expanding trade with more parts of the world, and attracting more global traders and new trade flows through Singapore, the trade industry will see more reexports and transhipment flows and plug Singapore more deeply into global supply chains.

Hence, companies from wholesale trade sector will need to learn import and export documentation administration to ensure compliance with these regulations, reducing the risk of penalties, delays and legal issues. By understanding import and export documentation requirements, professionals can streamline operations, reduce processing times and avoid unnecessary delays in customs clearance and logistics. Lastly, International trade practices and regulations evolve over time. Learning import and export documentation administration helps professionals stay updated on the latest industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices. This enables them to adapt to new requirements and maintain a competitive edge in the global marketplace.

The “Import and Export Documentation Administration” Proficiency Level 4 is one of the Technical Skills and Competency (TSC) identified in the Skills Map for Trade Finance Directors or Operations Directors who work on ensuring trades performed are aligned with regulations and organisational guidelines, guides the development of procedures that enables timely and safe handling and deployment of products as well as driving execution of the organisation’s trade finance activities and strategies. The course aims to engage learners, primarily Head of Operation and Head of Trade Finance, to keep abreast of local and regional market developments and regulation
course_entry_req:
Learners are Head of Operation and Head of Trade Finance in wholesale trade sector. 

Learners have to declare their employment status, organisations they work for or used to work for, the numbers of years of relevant experience in the registration form and declared the information they provided are genuine and current either via CV/ Resume or submit a letter from Head of Human Resource Department of the respective organisation to certify that:
1. GCE ‘O’ level Credit passed in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) score: Level 6 for Reading, Listening and Numeracy.
2.Able to operate a personal desktop computer / laptop.
3. With at least 1 years supervisory/managerial working experience in wholesale trade or Professional.

course_title: Be an Entrepreneur: Steps to a Successful Business
course_title_cleaned: Be an Entrepreneur  Steps to a Successful Business
course_objective: Through the utilization of tools, case studies, break out groups and specific assignments participants will learn to:  1. Take a case study based a product/service concept and define its value proposition 2. Identify customer segments for the product/service concept 3. Develop the product/service concept 4. Validate the product/service concept through customer interviews and data analysis 5. Translate validated product/service concept into a product/service prototype with specific requirements and a related roadmap
course_learning_outcomes: This two-day bootcamp is intended to equip participants to think about being future entrepreneurs through applicable knowledge to increase the success in launching and commercializing new start-up ideas.  The bootcamp will utilize product/service validation tools to provide practical ways to build product/service concepts and translate them into actual product/service builds.  It will teach participants how to systematically approach ideation, develop a product/service concept and value proposition, conduct customer validation, build a product/service prototype, develop product/service requirements and a roadmap.  This will be done through a combination of case studies and and practical application.

course_title: TOGAF EA Foundation & Practitioner (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: TOGAF EA Foundation & Practitioner (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: Upon the completion of this course, participants will acquire the knowledge and skills to: • To understand and apply TOGAF® Architecture Development Method (ADM) phases in the development of an Enterprise Architecture journey. • To understand the importance of the role of IT Architecture Governance in the context of an Enterprise Architecture, and how that can help in tracking business metrics. • To understand the Architecture Building Block (ABB) and how the Solution Building Block (SBB) can be implemented and mapped according to the ABB. • To analyse the IT stakeholders and how to apply the appropriate Stakeholder Management Technique to ensure in getting the buy-in and support. • To apply TOGAF® Technical Reference Model and customize it to meet an organisation’s needs. • To adapt and incorporate IT Security and Cloud/SOA into the TOGAF® framework. • To understand how to fit the technology/platform solutions into the TOGAF® framework
course_learning_outcomes:
The Open Group TOGAF EA Foundation & Practitioner standard is the global industry standard Enterprise Architecture framework utilized by the world’s leading organizations to improve efficiency. TOGAF® certification is the most widely-recognized certification in the Enterprise Architecture sphere, a distinct credential that makes a difference on any CV. Consider the following:
- According to Certification Magazine, TOGAF-certified architects earn 22% more than non-certified ones.
-According to LinkedIn research, 26% of Enterprise Architects are TOGAF-certified.
-According to The Open Group, 50 thousand professionals today are TOGAF-certified.

This course furnishes the participants with a variety of tools, building blocks and resources that facilitate the design and process of Enterprise Architecture across four domains: Business, Data, Application and Technology. It offers the means of uniting different methodologies in business planning, Enterprise Architecture and project management.

course_title: Introduction to Cybersecurity Programme (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Introduction to Cybersecurity Programme (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This course aims to provide participants with a foundation in:  • Overview of cybersecurity requirements • Key cybersecurity techniques, including encryption, authentication, and secure channel • Recognize common vulnerabilities and attacks on hosts, networks, and web servers • How to use cybersecurity tools and Operating-System related commands for data encryption and network traffic analysis • Identify insecure programming practices and apply more secure practices instead At the end of the course, participants will be able to: • Explain the Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) security requirements and recognize their breaches in recent security incidents • Describe and apply key concepts and mechanisms of principal protection mechanisms in cybersecurity, such as encryption, authentication, and secure channel • Identify the limitations of classical cryptographic schemes, and also recognize well-known attacks on vulnerable hosts, networks, and web servers • Utilize some basic security tools (e.g., OpenSSL, Wireshark) and security-related Linux commands to perform encryption and network traffic analysis • Pinpoint flaws in programs due to common insecure programming practices, and suggest improvements using more secure practices instead
course_learning_outcomes: We now live in the information age, where digitised information and computerisation play an ever-increasing role. Unfortunately, cyberthreats and cyberattacks are also on the rise. Given these worrying trends, cybersecurity is thus very important to safeguard our sensitive information as well as governmental and industrial information systems from data theft and other damage attempted by cybercriminals. This module serves as an introductory module on cybersecurity. It covers the foundations of cybersecurity, and explains important key cybersecurity concepts and basic techniques, including: cryptography, Public-Key Infrastructure (PKI), secure channels using Transport Layer Security (TLS)/Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), network security protocols, access control in Operating Systems, secure programming, as well as Web security. The module also illustrates the fundamentals of how systems can fail due to malicious attacks, and how they can subsequently be protected and hardened. Several cybersecurity tools are also used to demonstrate how relevant cybersecurity techniques can work in practice. The module is targeted at those who need to learn the foundations of cybersecurity in order to help support security systems, operations administration, monitoring and maintenance of cybersecurity systems and applications.
course_entry_req: Knowledge of basic computer programming, and preferably some experience in using Linux Operating System

course_title: Docker and Kubernetes Foundations (SF)
course_title_cleaned: Docker and Kubernetes Foundations (SF)
course_objective: •	Understand what Docker containers are •	Identify the benefits of using Docker containers •	Use Docker containers to deploy and scale applications •	Use Docker containers to manage Images and containers •	Perform debugging in Docker containers •	Work with Docker registries •	Run containers in production •	Solve problems of orchestration such as high availability, service discovery, and reconciliation •	Deploy and configure Kubernetes clusters  •	Manage Pod’s services and replication controller
course_learning_outcomes:
Docker containers aren't just for app deployment. They can also be used for persistent data storage. Virtual machines are not being used as much as they with the adoption of Docker, this has made docker the standard in the software industry.

This course introduces the basics of Docker storage, including configuring drivers, volumes, bind mounts, and cluster storage.  Learn how to use Docker containers to deploy and scale your applications. Create and run your first Docker container. Then, learn how to run containers in production and solve problems of orchestration such as high availability, service discovery, and reconciliation.
course_entry_req: •	Linux basic skills (like working file and directories)

course_title: The AI Innovation Express: A One-Day Innovation Sprint
course_title_cleaned: The AI Innovation Express  A One-Day Innovation Sprint
course_objective: Embark on a fast-paced, hands-on journey through design innovation with "The AI Innovation Express", where cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) integration meets human-centered creativity. This immersive one-day program equips participants with the tools and techniques to tackle real-world challenges by combining design thinking principles, AI-driven insights, and interdisciplinary collaboration.  Using a streamlined approach to the 4D framework—Discover, Define, Develop, Deliver, the course emphasises "learning by doing." Participants will apply AI-enhanced tools to ideate, prototype, and refine solutions in emerging fields such as the Digital Economy, Green Economy, and Industry 4.0. Along the way, they will develop actionable strategies and low-fidelity prototypes, showcasing their ability to integrate AI technologies into sustainable, user-focused solutions.  Designed for innovators, professionals, and changemakers, The Innovation Express delivers a high-energy sprint where participants learn to navigate complexity, embrace collaboration, and adapt AI-driven approaches to systems thinking and design applications. Whether you are seeking to advance your career, build better products, or reimagine experiences, this program offers the tools, mindset, and inspiration to accelerate your innovation journey.
course_learning_outcomes:
1. Participants will leverage design thinking principles and AI-driven tools to identify and solve real-world challenges, focusing on fields like interaction design, user experience (UX) / user interface (UI) design, and product development.

2. Participants will create low-fidelity prototypes and actionable strategies using the 4D framework (Discover, Define, Develop, Deliver), showcasing their ability to integrate innovation and technology into problem-solving.

3. Participants will explore and apply AI-driven insights and data analytics to systems thinking applications, addressing complex problems with sustainable and user-centric approaches.

4. Participants will enhance their teamwork, adaptability, and communication skills by engaging in collaborative sprints, refining ideas through iterative feedback, and presenting innovative solutions.

5. Participants will gain foundational expertise in user experience design, interface design, and sustainability-driven innovation, empowering them to drive impactful change in their industries and careers.
course_entry_req: Minimum is diploma or A-Levels (Undergraduate degree from an Institute of Higher Learning (IHL) is preferred)

course_title: Advanced Certificate in AWS Cloud Architecting and DevOps Module 4: Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment (CI/CD) on AWS
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in AWS Cloud Architecting and DevOps Module 4  Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment (CI CD) on AWS
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Know how to set up a Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment (CI/CD) workflow with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Code Services  • Know how the various services in AWS Code Service relate to each other and can be used in different combinations to adapt to different software development scenarios  • Utilise the AWS CloudTrail service by using its features and components for tracking applications
course_learning_outcomes:
AWS Code Services allows you to build, test and deploy code continuously on AWS, serving millions of customers. It accomplishes that through code automation, eliminating manual tasks and introducing continuous integration, continuous delivery and continuous deployment of applications on AWS. AWS Code Services provides an extensive set of services that work together to set up, operate, monitor and manage CI/CD pipelines for you automatically—so you can focus on building software rather than spend time setting up servers or performing routine tasks. 

This module will help participants understand the concept of CI/CD as an amalgamation of pipelines to automate code actions like building, testing, releasing and deploying software and how to set up a CI/CD workflow with AWS Code Services.
course_entry_req: Participants with at least a diploma qualification

course_title: Implement Lean Manufacturing
course_title_cleaned: Implement Lean Manufacturing
course_objective: This course module aims to provide students with fundamental skills and knowledge on lean implementation to identify and reduce waste and improve productivity.  At the end of the course, the learner will be able to: •	Describe manufacturing environments or own work place  •	Identify critical wastes in selected area   •	Collect data of operations & wastes  •	Measure wastes   •	Analyze root cause of wastes  •	Propose Kaizen project  •	Plan implementation tasks  •	Define lean organizational structure  •	Demonstrate outcomes of implementation
course_learning_outcomes:
This program will focus on basic lean tools which will consist of two components. The first component will focus on training of lean fundamentals such as understanding different types of wastes & relevant KPIs, ways to identify & measure wastes, Lean principles, various lean techniques, Kaizen approach & A3 report and so on

 The second component will focus on identifying wastes and implementing lean techniques through mentoring participants at their workplaces. It will allow participants to identify wastes in their working areas, set KPIs, analyze root-causes of the selected areas, propose changes and finally make the changes.
course_entry_req: Diploma with relevant experience or Degree

course_title: Data and Statistical Analytics 2.2
course_title_cleaned: Data and Statistical Analytics 2.2
course_objective: Upon completion of this course, learners will be able to support the collection of data required for data analytics application.
course_learning_outcomes:
The purpose of this training is to give an introduction to the use of a spreadsheets tool like Excel to support the collection of data required for data analytics application. At the moment, many such businesses are attempting to convert manual paper-based processes to digital computer-based processes. However, the workforce may not have a deep understanding of the use of a common tool such as Excel and how to properly and systematically perform data scrubbing for computational interpretation. 

This is a continuation of our first course on Data and Statistical Analysis (Level 1), in response to learners looking to progress to a higher level of data interpretation using Excel. 


Performance Gaps / Needs that the Course Will Address:
- Lack of understanding how to interpret data effectively using appropriate features and functions 
- Lack of experience in using such data collection / storage software 
- Lack of knowledge in data cleansing 

Intended situation: 
- Knowledge of data interpretation using appropriate features and functions 
- Able to collect data for analysis, processing and improvement 
- Able to clean data in Excel spreadsheets
course_entry_req:
The learner should have at least GCE ‘N’ level holder. Those without GCE certification should minimally possess WSQ Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 5.

Have some willingness to improve their technology skills and knowledge.

course_title: Testing & Maintenance of Electrical Systems (Classroom & Synchronous)
course_title_cleaned: Testing & Maintenance of Electrical Systems (Classroom & Synchronous)
course_objective: This module provides students with knowledge and understanding of the testing and maintenance of electrical systems. Student will learn about the types, construction and configurations of switchboards, metering and protection requirements, maintenance, inspection and testing of switchboards, electricity code of practices and regulations, tests conducted before and after turn-on, lock-out tag-out procedures. This module will also cover operation, control and maintenance of standby generators and the design and testing of photovoltaic systems
course_learning_outcomes:
Testing of Switchboards
•	Provide an understanding of types, construction and configurations of switchboards, metering and protection requirements, and inspection and testing of switchboards
•	Types of switchboards for approved loads not exceeding 45kVA or 63A
•	Construction and configurations of LV switchboards
•	Metering and protection requirements
•	List the procedures for inspection and testing of switchboards and its similarities with those of downstream distribution boards
Maintenance of Switchboards 
•	Provide an understanding of maintenance procedures, lockout and tagout procedures, right sequence of tests for switchboards and distribution boards.
•	Energy lockout and tagout procedures
•	Maintenance procedures for circuit breakers, protective devices, auto-transfer switches and contacts
•	Conduct the right sequence of tests for switchboards/distribution boards as prescribed in CP 5
•	Explain the procedure for checking the integrity of the system by inspection and testing
•	Describe the earth loop impedance measurement and earth electrode resistance test and understand their setup
Standby Generators
•	Provide an understanding of operation of standby generator and procedures of checking and maintenance of standby diesel generator
•	Explain the operation of standby generator and its control system
•	Explain the procedures of checking and maintenance of standby diesel generator
Photovoltaic System
•	Introduction of different PV systems, design and testing considerations
•	Introduce different types of PV systems
•	Identify different parts of a PV system
•	Identify types of cables and colour code
•	Understand design considerations of a PV 
•	Perform the hands-on testing and commissioning of a grid-tied solar PV system 
•	Understand requirements for Grid Tied PV systems with reference to CP 5
course_entry_req:
"Applicants are required to have at least: 
-5 years of relevant practical work experience; and 
-GCE “N” Level with pass in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5  
The course is optional for applicants with: 
-NITEC in Electrical Engineering and at least 2 years of relevant practical work experience; or
-At least 10 years of relevant practical work experience "

course_title: Industrial Rope Access Course � IRATA Level 3
course_title_cleaned: Industrial Rope Access Course � IRATA Level 3
course_objective: To be a professional and certified IRATA rope access technician, with the ability to work in any difficult to access or work at height situation
course_learning_outcomes:
IRATA level III certification provides advanced training in theoretical concepts, safety legislation, systems analysis, equipment inspection, risk assessment and site management. Once certified, Level III Safety Supervisors are responsible for the safety and supervision of a team of workers.You Will�Learn How To: a) Preform all basic and advanced rope access maneuvers and techniques. b) Self and team-rescue, with special usage and understanding of a variety of hauling and lowering skills. c) Effectively lead aid climbing, deviation, rebelay and rope transfers. d) Demonstrate a basic knowledge of systems analysis, including fall factors, impact forces and resultant forces. Additional technical skills and safety methods will be studied and mastered. In addition to all IRATA level I technical methods, you will be proficient in multi-point anchoring, structural and load distribution by the end of the course. You will be advanced at horizontal and vertical aid climbing  You will learn how to: a) Demonstrate proficiency in all Level I and II techniques. b) Provide site supervisory capabilities for rope access work projects. c) Discuss and apply relevant legislation and work techniques. d) Manage rope access teams and responsibilities. e) Utilize in-depth knowledge of advanced rescue techniques.
f) Demonstrate suitable emergency first aid training and skills. g) Understand IRATA certification, training and assessment. h) Working knowledge of the IRATA Industrial Code of Practice (ICOP) and training and certification sceheme (TACs). An in-depth coverage of practical skills are covered including all technical and complex access and rigging skills, fall protection methods, complex rescues, lead climbing methods and pulley system application

course_title: Additive Manufacturing and 3D Printing
course_title_cleaned: Additive Manufacturing and 3D Printing
course_objective: This course, "Additive Manufacturing and 3D Printing," is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of Additive Manufacturing (AM), also known as 3D printing. Students will gain a foundational understanding of AM. The course will introduce the history of AM and various AM technologies, such as Fused Deposition Modeling (FDM), Stereolithography (SLA), and Selective Laser Sintering (SLS). Pre-processing challenges will be covered, including Design for AM (DfAM) principles, software tools for 3D modeling, and data preparation. They will learn about process optimization, fine-tuning, and techniques to enhance the overall AM process.
course_learning_outcomes:
Topic 1: Overview of Additive Manufacturing (AM)
Topic 2: Process Related Issues for AM
Topic 3: Process Improvement for AM

It provides a complete overview of the financial/ wealth planning process, a review of all the financial products and instruments, as well as a review of the legal, ethical and regulatory issues affecting financial planning in Singapore. Upon successful completion of the course, participants are eligible for the Associate Financial Planner (‘’AFP’’) designation and IBF Level 1 certification.

course_title: Cybersecurity Threat Management
course_title_cleaned: Cybersecurity Threat Management
course_objective: Upon completion of this course, participants will have achieved the following objectives:  Possess a clear and consistent understanding of the Cyber Ecosystem, Real Threats, Cyber Security Management framework, and Cyber Security strategy & implementation within the BFSI Industry.  Analyze and evaluate cybersecurity incidents, enabling them to identify vulnerabilities and respond rapidly and effectively to any potential threats.  Understand the legal, ethical, and social implications of cybersecurity incidents, providing them with a comprehensive perspective on cybersecurity issues.  Implement security measures to protect organizational assets against cyber threats. Gain an understanding of Cyber Threat Monitoring & Cyber Threat Intelligence, Security Incident Handling, and Data Protection & Privacy.  Be well-prepared to identify, assess, and mitigate cybersecurity risks within the BFSI Industry. Develop effective cybersecurity strategies and procedures, ensuring that their organizations are equipped to respond rapidly and effectively to any cybersecurity incidents that may occur.
course_learning_outcomes:
The BFSI industry faces a significant national security threat in the form of cybercrime. Hackers and cybercriminals are using increasingly sophisticated tactics to extort money from governments, businesses, and public organizations by stealing valuable data. Rapid deployment capabilities and forensic analysis are essential for both responding to and recovering from a cybersecurity issue. As the number of cyberattacks continues to rise, businesses are developing strategies and procedures to protect their systems, creating high demand for professionals with cybersecurity training.

To address these growing concerns, we offer a two-day course that provides an in-depth understanding of cybersecurity threats, their implications, and the strategies and tools necessary to manage them. Participants will learn about the latest cyber threats and their impact on organizational security. They will also acquire the knowledge and skills to identify, assess, and mitigate cybersecurity risks. By completing this course, individuals can enhance their expertise in cybersecurity, making them valuable assets to their organizations.

course_title: CERTIFICATE IN CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY
course_title_cleaned: CERTIFICATE IN CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY
course_objective: The construction industry is advancing with newer and more complex construction technology.  The supervision team at site would need to be constantly upskill to keep up with changes.  They will need to possess both key engineering knowledge and emerging technological skills to be competent in the field.  Construction Technology is an emerging technological skill for site supervisors to adopt creative construction method and approach to achieve higher productivity on site.
course_learning_outcomes:
Construction landscape is revolutionising to embrace the global trend
of digitalisation. Increasingly, projects are using advanced technology,
software applications and new method of construction to improve
quality, safety and construction productivity. There is a strong demand for
competent professionals to play the key role of managing and supervising
these projects.
Whether you are currently in the Built Environment (BE) sector seeking to
upgrade your knowledge and progress in your career, or someone who
aspire to start a new career in the BE sector, this programme will provide
you with the technical knowledge and practical skills to assist in the design
works and supervise construction project works in the knowledge based
economy.
course_entry_req:
a) GCE ‘O’ LEVEL English (Grade 1 - 7);
b) GCE ‘O’ LEVEL Mathematics (Grade 1 - 6);
c) • a relevant GCE ‘O’ LEVEL subject (Grade 1 - 7), and at least 3 years of relevant working experience; OR
• Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 6, and at least 3 years of relevant
working experience; OR
• HIGHER NITEC / ITC or GCE ‘N’ LEVEL and NITEC/NTC 2 with minimum
GPA of 2.75 in relevant disciplines, and at least 1 year relevant working
experience; OR
• Any ONE of the following certificates with at least 3 years of relevant
working experience:
- Advanced National Building Qualification (NBQ)
- National Certificate in Construction Supervision
- Certificate in Interior Finishing Coordination
- Certificate in Waterproofing Supervision
- Certificate in Precast Concrete Construction Supervision
- Certificate in Building Measurement

course_title: (ACEY) 实习3
course_title_cleaned: (ACEY) 实习3
course_objective: 实习是任何一个幼教老师培训课程里基本和必须的部分。在实习过程中，通过观察幼儿我们能够增加对他们行为、发展和学习的理解。实习提供机会让理论付诸实践，去开发、创造和连接我们与孩子一起工作时的理念。         (ACEY) 婴幼儿培育高级证书课程是注重婴幼儿教师个人能力和专业能力的发展，这两方面的发展是延续性的，他们既是婴幼儿教育在工作前的准备，同时也将持续贯穿其整个职业的发展。  要成婴幼儿教育组织里面一名专业的婴幼儿教育工作者：  1.1	使个别幼儿受益  1.2	有意识去看待儿童的综合发展;  1.3	有效地与幼儿，家长，同事一起携手合作与工作  1.4	担负起对婴幼儿悉心照顾的责任和致力于促进婴幼儿的发展。
course_learning_outcomes:
为了有幼儿教育工作者提供机会：

2.1	以专业的态度观察并了解幼儿和教师的活动以及教室和幼儿教育机构的环境设施；
2.2	与幼儿一起工作，并在实习导师的督导下进行教学工作，包括对幼儿的个别指导、小组的教学；
2.3	解析幼儿教师所应扮演的角色，同时在教育实习中获得教师应具备的能力；
2.4	在实习导师的指导和社会发展青年及体育部的指导方针下实施
course_entry_req:

KLC INTERNATIONAL INSTITUTE PTE. LTD.

# course title
(ACEY) 实习3

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2024045462

# course duration
6 days - 1 month

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$508.75

# subsidised course fee
$152.62

# course number of hours
116.00 hours

# course language
Mandarin

# course objective
       实习是任何一个幼教老师培训课程里基本和必须的部分。在实习过程中，通过观察幼儿我们能够增加对他们行为、发展和学习的理解。实习提供机会让理论付诸实践，去开发、创造和连接我们与孩子一起工作时的理念。         (ACEY) 婴幼儿培育高级证书课程是注重婴幼儿教师个人能力和专业能力的发展，这两方面的发展是延续性的，他们既是婴幼儿教育在工作前的准备，同时也将持续贯穿其整个职业的发展。  要成婴幼儿教育组织里面一名专业的婴幼儿教育工作者：  1.1	使个别幼儿受益  1.2	有意识去看待儿童的综合发展;  1.3	有效地与幼儿，家长，同事一起携手合作与工作  1.4	担负起对婴幼儿悉心照顾的责任和致力于促进婴幼儿的发展。

# course learning outcomes
为了有幼儿教育工作者提供机会：

2.1	以专业的态度观察并了解幼儿和教师的活动以及教室和幼儿教育机构的环境设施；
2.2	与幼儿一起工作，并在实习导师的督导下进行教学工作，包括对幼儿的个别指导、小组的教学；
2.3	解析幼儿教师所应扮演的角色，同时在教育实习中获得教师应具备的能力；
2.4	在实习导师的指导和社会发展青年及体育部的指导方针下实施

	Minimum Secondary 4 education* or completed 10 years of formal education* and
	A GCE ‘O’ level credit (C6) in CL1 or other Chinese Language Acceptable Alternatives or HSK Level 5, HSKK Advanced Level

course_title: Observation and Planning for the Holistic Development of Infants and Toddlers (Chinese) 观察与制订促进婴幼儿全面发展计划 (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Observation and Planning for the Holistic Development of Infants and Toddlers (Chinese) 观察与制订促进婴幼儿全面发展计划 (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: In  this  course  learners  will  focus  on  observation  of  children  from  birth  to  36 months to understand their development, interests, needs and abilities. With the information documented, they will learn to share with parents as well as plan purposeful  experiences  to  support  children’s  physical,  cognitive,  social  and emotional  development  and  develop  their  sense  of  agency.  Reflections  on documentations, planning and examining their role in individualising, adapting and monitoring the effectiveness of the intentional experiences to cater to the specific needs of the individual children, in collaboration with parents to support children’s development and learning, will also be included.  在本课程中，学员将着重于观察出生至 36  个月大的婴幼儿，以了解他们的发展、 兴趣、需求与能力。通过记录的信息，学员将学习与家长分享，并规划有意义的体验活动，以支持幼儿在身体、认知、社交和情绪方面的发展，并培养他们的自主意识。此外，学员将会对记录进行反思，同时检测自身的角色，是否能够为满足每位幼儿的特定需求而规划个别化、有意义的体验活动，调整及监测体验活动 的有效性，并与家长协作以支持幼儿的发展和学习。
course_entry_req:
☒ Be ECDA-certified as EY1
☒ Be ECDA-certified as EY2
☒ Be ECDA-certified as L1 teacher
☒ Currently employed in a childcare (with infant care) registered or licensed with ECDA
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF EARLY CHILDHOOD...

# course title
Observation and Planning for the Holistic Development of Infants and Toddlers (Chinese) 观察与制订促进婴幼儿全面发展计划 (Synchronous e-learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2021003724

# course duration
1-2 days

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$469.00

# subsidised course fee
$234.50

# course number of hours
14.00 hours

# course language
Mandarin

# course objective
In  this  course  learners  will  focus  on  observation  of  children  from  birth  to  36 months to understand their development, interests, needs and abilities. With the information documented, they will learn to share with parents as well as plan purposeful  experiences  to  support  children’s  physical,  cognitive,  social  and emotional  development  and  develop  their  sense  of  agency.  Reflections  on documentations, planning and examining their role in individualising, adapting and monitoring the effectiveness of the intentional experiences to cater to the specific needs of the individual children, in collaboration with parents to support children’s development and learning, will also be included.  在本课程中，学员将着重于观察出生至 36  个月大的婴幼儿，以了解他们的发展、 兴趣、需求与能力。通过记录的信息，学员将学习与家长分享，并规划有意义的体验活动，以支持幼儿在身体、认知、社交和情绪方面的发展，并培养他们的自主意识。此外，学员将会对记录进行反思，同时检测自身的角色，是否能够为满足每位幼儿的特定需求而规划个别化、有意义的体验活动，调整及监测体验活动 的有效性，并与家长协作以支持幼儿的发展和学习。 

# course learning outcomes
On completion of this course, learners will be able to:       
1.  observe, document, interpret and reflect on the observations;
2.  identify abilities and needs of children from birth to three;
3.  plan  play  experiences  to  support  the  physical,  cognitive,  social  and emotional development, and develop the sense of agency of children;
4.  individualise and adapt interactions and experiences to enable children to feel secure and confident; 
5.  evaluate and reflect on the effectiveness of the experiences; and  
6.  collaborate  with  parents  to  support  the  young  child’s  development  and learning. 

完成本课程后，学员将能够：
1.  观察、记录、诠释并反思观察结果；
2.  识别出生至三岁婴幼儿的能力与需求； 3.  规划游戏体验活动以支持幼儿的身体、认知、社交和情绪发展，并培养其的自主意识； 4.  规划并调整对个别化的互动与体验活动，使幼儿能感到安全感和自信；
5.  评估和反思体验活动的有效性；和
6.  与家长协作，以支持幼儿的发展与学习。


# course entry req
☒ Be ECDA-certified as EY1
☒ Be ECDA-certified as EY2
☒ Be ECDA-certified as L1 teacher
☒ Currently employed in a childcare (with infant care) registered or licensed with ECDA

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Future Workforce Architecture Module 2: Re-designing Work For The Future Workplace
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Future Workforce Architecture Module 2  Re-designing Work For The Future Workplace
course_objective: The ongoing digital transformation and advancement in everyday technology solutions and applications have necessitated a relook at how work is performed so as to keep the workforce optimally engaged and productive.    Using the SHRM Work Redesign Process, participants will get to practise the 6 steps in the framework, each with a specific set of deliverables, to arrive at the desired end outcome of redesigned job roles that would both leverage technology and at the same time elevate the value of work done by the existing workforce.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 1-day module, participants will be able to:
• Identify opportunities for job redesign at the workplace
• Analyse and design job roles that would reduce redundancy and elevate job value
• Deploy project management tools and methods 
• Conduct evaluation on the effectiveness of the redesigned job roles

course_title: [LPIA] Leading and Managing Change (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_title_cleaned: [LPIA] Leading and Managing Change (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_objective: Change is the only constant—but humans are hardwired to resist change. As a leader, how can you get your team on board with new ways of working?  Gain the tools to guide your team through transformation with our course for aspiring leaders: Leading and Managing Change.   Our change management experts will help you unpack the psychology of change, understanding why people resist change and how you can transform change aversion into trust.   In this course, you will:    -	Learn to craft strategies for change management that harmonize your people’s needs with your organization’s vision.  -	Enrich your change leadership toolkit with discussions and insights from your fellow leaders.  -	Gain the skills to inspire sustainable change.   Emerge as a confident, change-ready leader—prepared to thrive amidst today’s complexities. To get started on mastering change, sign up today.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, you’ll be able to: 

 -	Use the change curve model for deeper insight into the emotions and fears that change provokes in people.
 -	Demonstrate empathy with those resisting change, and craft unique strategies to build trust and engagement with them.
 -	Perform a stakeholder analysis to understand what support each stakeholder needs to commit to the change agenda.
 -	Develop and implement an effective change management plan, from communicating your vision for change to engaging stakeholders and managing resistance.
 -	Tailor your influence strategies to move different stakeholder groups from 'change averse or neutral' to “change positive”.
 -	Build a toolkit of contingencies to manage unexpected challenges during the change process.
course_entry_req:
- Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents
- Able to commit to the full duration of the programme

Gain the tools to guide your team through transformation with our course for aspiring leaders: Leading and Managing Change.   Our change management experts will help you unpack the psychology of change, understanding why people resist change and how you can transform change aversion into trust.   In this course, you will:    -	Learn to craft strategies for change management that harmonize your people’s needs with your organization’s vision.  -	Enrich your change leadership toolkit with discussions and insights from your fellow leaders.  -	Gain the skills to inspire sustainable change.   Emerge as a confident, change-ready leader—prepared to thrive amidst today’s complexities. To get started on mastering change, sign up today.

# course learning outcomes
At the end of this course, you’ll be able to: 

 -	Use the change curve model for deeper insight into the emotions and fears that change provokes in people.
 -	Demonstrate empathy with those resisting change, and craft unique strategies to build trust and engagement with them.
 -	Perform a stakeholder analysis to understand what support each stakeholder needs to commit to the change agenda.
 -	Develop and implement an effective change management plan, from communicating your vision for change to engaging stakeholders and managing resistance.
 -	Tailor your influence strategies to move different stakeholder groups from 'change averse or neutral' to “change positive”.
 -	Build a toolkit of contingencies to manage unexpected challenges during the change process.

# course entry req
- Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents
- Able to commit to the full duration of the programme

course_provider: MAGES INSTITUTE OF EXCELLENCE PTE. LTD.
course_title: ENVIRONMENT DESIGN FOR FILM/GAMES (Blended Learning)
course_title_cleaned: ENVIRONMENT DESIGN FOR FILM GAMES (Blended Learning)
course_objective: This course aims to satisfy the industry needs of skilled workforce in the areas of concept art for the following sectors: Games, Animation, Visual Effects, Education (Training and Development), Art and Design, Marketing, Media.  Concept artists are responsible for the style and look of a game. They are the first to draw the characters (Design a Character) or its props. Working with a brief from the producer, their sketches are used to help 3D artists, producers, programmers and publishers understand how the game will look. The drawings of the concept artist are a vital part of the game’s development as they are the starting point of all the artwork and an important part of the marketing plans. A common misconception is that concept art is about doing cool and pretty drawings or illustrations. Concept Art is about ideas and solving problems for the 3D artists and game designers. Drawing is only a tool used to that end.  As more and more people play games, gaming industry is looking for highly skilled people to design and develop this game. The rise in gaming job opportunities have been fuelled by the expansion of 5G and the fact that more people are playing games due to Covid-19 social distancing restrictions. The audience for video games has also shifted—no longer the exclusive practice of hardcore gamers, video games have gained mass appeal in the form of serious and casual gaming, on the internet, on consoles, and smartphones.
course_learning_outcomes: In this course students will continue to learn how to conceptualize and produce environment designs for film and games using a variety of techniques and strategies. Students will assume the role as a concept artist (Environment Specialization) in a production setting and develop visual ideas for illustrations and carry an idea through the stage of roughs to a comprehensive and finished image, using digital media. Students will analyze the production pro-cess of existing films and games and strategize pipelines for their projects.
course_entry_req:
•	Media Graduates & Professionals, Designers, Artists, Freelancers interested to up-skill themselves in preparation for career switch to Broadcast industry – specializing in Motion Design.
