course_title: Manage Customer Loyalty
course_title_cleaned: Manage Customer Loyalty
course_objective: Customer loyalty is a customer’s commitment to your brand. A loyal customer will always choose you over the competition, maybe because of your excellent customer service, unbeatable product selection or something that differentiate you from the rest.  Building customer loyalty gives you a high return on the time, effort and money you invest in providing good customer service. Loyal customers buy more, more regularly, and the cost of selling to them is low. They will also frequently recommend your business to others.  Loyal customers are the most valuable asset for any brand to hold onto. This is because returning customers spend, on average, 67% more than customers who are new to your brand.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course will help learners acquire the ability:
1)	To understand the different type of customer loyalty and retention programmes and identify the ones that work for your organisation
2)	To introduce customer loyalty and retention programmes that is align to organisation policies and procedures and engage with stakeholders effectively 
3)	To evaluate the success of customer loyalty and retention programmes and coordinate re-sources to achieve them
4)	To train and coach staff in promoting customer loyalty and retention programmes as well as managing service challenges

course_title: Post Diploma Certificate in Advanced Palliative Care Nursing - Part of Advanced Diploma in Palliative Care Nursing (ADPCN)
course_title_cleaned: Post Diploma Certificate in Advanced Palliative Care Nursing - Part of Advanced Diploma in Palliative Care Nursing (ADPCN)
course_objective: The certificate equips the learners with advanced knowledge and skills essential for delivering palliative care to individuals facing life-limiting illnesses. Four modules in this certificate are palliative nursing specialty, including Principles and Practice of Palliative Care, Serious Illness Management, Symptom Management in Serious Illness, and Communication and Psychosocial Skills. Learners will learn the management of serious illnesses and their symptoms, and effective communication and psychosocial skills that are fundamentals in palliative care nursing.
course_learning_outcomes:
The PDC in Advanced Palliative Care Nursing has 4 modules:
1. Principles and Practice of Palliative Care (60 hours)
2. Serious Illness Management (60 hours)
3. Symptom Management in Serious Illness (60 hours)
4. Communication and Psychosocial Skills (60 hours)
course_entry_req:
All applicants should possess the following requirements at the point of application: 

-A local Polytechnic Diploma (Nursing), Degree in Health Sciences (Nursing), or nursing qualification equivalent; 
-A valid practising certificate from the Singapore Nursing Board; and 
-At least 2 years of clinical practice and with a minimum of 1 year in the discipline of study.

course_title: Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
course_title_cleaned: Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
course_objective: The 5-day course aims to  •	provide a comprehensive understanding of sustainable transportation systems, including their environmental impact, societal implications, and economic feasibility.  •	explore global trends and innovations in green transportation technologies, including electric vehicles, fuel cells, hydrogen, and alternative fuel vehicles.  •	examine the technical, economic, and social considerations in the adoption of sustainable transportation systems, identify challenges and opportunities associated with implementation, and evaluate the major systems and components of electric vehicles and fuel cells.  •	assess the performance and sustainability of batteries and charging infrastructure for electric vehicles, analyze the impact of electric vehicles on transportation of goods and people, and evaluate the integration of electric vehicles in public transportation systems. •	examine the impact of autonomous vehicle technology on the future of transportation and mobility and evaluate the advantages of electric vehicles in supporting autonomous vehicle technology.
course_learning_outcomes: The course is designed to provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of the latest trends and technologies in sustainable transportation, with a focus on electric vehicles and associated infrastructure. Participants will learn about the environmental impact of transportation, the challenges and opportunities of adopting green transportation systems, and the technical and regulatory considerations associated with electric vehicles.
course_entry_req: A degree or diploma in engineering or disciplines related to land transport, sustainability, energy or environment.

course_title_cleaned: Solar Photovoltaic Systems
course_objective: This course provides students with the skills and knowledge to operate, monitor and perform data-driven predictive maintenance of electrical installations in residential, commercial and industrial premises as well as intelligent control systems and renewable energy systems according to engineering specifications, codes of practice and regulations.
course_learning_outcomes:
In this course, students will learn how to design and install Home Automation Control Systems to control home appliances away from home and will learn how to install, maintain and troubleshoot faults in industrial automation and process control systems and will acquire knowledge in the latest Clean Energy Technology.

Solar Photovoltaic Systems (EE5007FP) is one of the modules leading to HIGHER NITEC IN TECHNOLOGY - ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance - Practical Training in Maintenance Practices
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance - Practical Training in Maintenance Practices
course_objective: This course is aligned with Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) SAR-66 Aircraft Maintenance Licensing requirements that provide the essential basic practical skills necessary for Cat B1 (Mechanical) and Cat B2 (Avionics) trainee aircraft engineers to obtain his or her licenses.  The Practical Training in Maintenance Practices is part of the Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance, comprises practical elements of the CAAS SAR-66 Module 7 (Maintenance Practices). This includes practical skills in assembly/disassembly of aircraft components, sheetmetal practices, EWIS, and basic maintenance practices of aircraft.  This course is 1 of the 4 modules that will stack to an Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance, with a Certificate of Recognition (COR), recognized by CAAS, issued for the completion of the CAAS SAR-66 Modules 1 to 10 (Category B1 and B2).
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to: 
1. Demonstrate practical skills relevant to aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) for maintenance practices as specified by Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) Singapore Airworthiness Requirements Part 66 (SAR-66) Module 7 Maintenance Practices.
2. Perform aircraft maintenance practices in accordance with applicable technical manuals and organisational procedures. This includes application of safety practices on aircraft, hangar and workshop facilities, use of appropriate tools, equipment and methods and interpretation of engineering drawings. 
3. Select appropriate tools, equipment, materials and methods for maintenance and repair of sheet metal structures.
4. Conduct functional checks after maintenance work to verify serviceability of Electrical Wiring Interconnection System (EWIS).
course_entry_req: Diploma qualification from recognised institutions.

The Practical Training in Maintenance Practices is part of the Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance, comprises practical elements of the CAAS SAR-66 Module 7 (Maintenance Practices). This includes practical skills in assembly/disassembly of aircraft components, sheetmetal practices, EWIS, and basic maintenance practices of aircraft.  This course is 1 of the 4 modules that will stack to an Advanced Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance, with a Certificate of Recognition (COR), recognized by CAAS, issued for the completion of the CAAS SAR-66 Modules 1 to 10 (Category B1 and B2).

By the end of the course, participants will be able to:

course_title: Bridge and Engine Room Resource Management (Management and Leadership Skills)
course_title_cleaned: Bridge and Engine Room Resource Management (Management and Leadership Skills)
course_objective: This course is about prioritizing tasks, managing high workload and manage the resources available (bridge team, engine control team, shore side emergency response, external resources such as tugs, etc.) in abnormal and emergency situations. The course will give all Masters and officers the education and training in the human element leadership and management at management level meeting the Knowledge, Understanding and Proficiency (KUP) requirements set out in the following: Table A-II/2 (masters and chief mates on 500 gross tonnage or more) Function: Controlling the operation of the ship and care for persons onboard at management level Competence Use of leadership and management skills Function: Navigation at the management level Competence Respond to navigational emergencies The other aim is to provide bridge procedural training applying Company Bridge Procedures in Abnormal and Emergency Situations), by doing so the trainee can apply the (KUP) in a contextual environment.
course_learning_outcomes:
Working knowledge of shipboard personnel management and training
•Organization of crew, authority structure, responsibilities
•Cultural awareness, inherent traits, attitudes, behaviour, cross-cultural communication
•Shipboard situation, informal social structures on board
•Human error, situation awareness, automation awareness, complacency, boredom
•Leadership and team working
•Training, structured shipboard training programs
•Knowledge of personal abilities and behavioural characteristics

Need for international maritime conventions, recommendations and national legislation
•International maritime conventions – SOLAS, MARPOL, STCW, MLC,– role of IMO, ILO
•Recommendations and national legislation

Ability to apply task and workload management
•Planning and coordination
•Personnel assignment
•Human limitations
•Personal abilities
•Time and resource constraints
•Prioritization
•Workloads, rest and fatigue
•Management (leadership) styles
•Challenges and responses

Knowledge and ability to apply effective resource management
•Effective communication on board and ashore
•Allocation, assignment and prioritization of resources
•Decision making reflecting team experience
•Assertiveness and leadership, including motivation
•Obtaining and maintaining situational awareness
•Appraisal of work performance
•Short and long term strategies

Knowledge and ability to apply decision-making techniques
•Situation and risk assessment
•Identify and consider generated options
•Selecting course of action
•Evaluation of outcome effectiveness
•Decision making and problem solving techniques
•Authority and assertiveness
•Judgement
•Emergencies and crowd management

Self-awareness, personal and professional development
•Knowledge of personal abilities and behavioural characteristics
•Opportunities for personal and professional development

Development, implementation, and oversight of standard operating procedures
course_entry_req: Participants must have Class 2 and Class 1 Certificate of Competency (Deck and Engine), and held supervisory or management level in the capacity of a Master, Chief Officer, Chief Engineer Officer and Second Engineer officer on board a ship. Parrticipants in shore based ship management position may also be considered.

course_title: Energy Sustainability and Energy Management Systems
course_title_cleaned: Energy Sustainability and Energy Management Systems
course_objective: After completing the course, participants will acquire the following competencies: •	Ability to critically analyze and evaluate energy sustainability issues in industrial settings and global context. •	Advanced knowledge of energy management systems, standards, and protocols. •	Skills to identify energy-saving opportunities, set performance targets, and develop and implement effective energy management systems. •	Ability to engage employees, develop business cases, and explore financing options for energy management projects. •	Knowledge and skills to assess and report on greenhouse gas emissions and carbon footprint reduction. •	Ability to design and present practical solutions for improving energy management in industrial settings. •	Capacity to make informed decisions and implement effective energy management strategies that reduce operating costs, comply with regulatory requirements, and make a positive impact on the environment.
course_learning_outcomes:
Effective energy management and sustainability practices are critical for industrial organizations to reduce operating costs, comply with regulatory requirements, and mitigate environmental impact to meet global energy sustainability and environmental challenges. 

This comprehensive 5-day course covers the latest trends, best practices, and technologies in the field, including energy sustainability and decarbonisation, energy conservation strategies, renewable energy technologies, energy management systems and software, and reporting on greenhouse gas emissions and carbon footprint reduction. Participants will learn how to identify energy-saving opportunities, set performance targets, and develop and implement effective energy management systems, as well as engage employees, develop business cases, and explore financing options for energy management projects.

The course aims to:
•	Provide participants with advanced knowledge of energy sustainability issues and energy management systems in industrial settings and with a global perspective.
•	Enable participants to develop effective energy management strategies and systems that align with international standards and protocols.
•	Equip participants with the skills to identify energy-saving opportunities, set performance targets, and develop and implement effective energy management systems.
•	Enable participants to engage employees, develop business cases, and explore financing options for energy management projects.
•	Provide participants with the knowledge and skills needed to assess and report on greenhouse gas emissions and carbon footprint reduction.
course_entry_req: Diploma holders aged 25 to 65 years old.

course_title: People, Playscapes and Possibilities: Exploring New Lenses for Outdoor Learning (Chinese) 人物、游戏场景与各种可能性: 探索户外学习的新视角
course_title_cleaned: People, Playscapes and Possibilities  Exploring New Lenses for Outdoor Learning (Chinese) 人物、游戏场景与各种可能性  探索户外学习的新视角
course_objective: The 2-day workshop aims to equip educators with knowledge and skills by using the Understanding Action in a Space (UAiS) model to identify and resolve barriers that hinder the possibility of children learning in outdoor spaces. Educators will use the model to make sense of the individual child, the environments, the people and the culture(s) to help them troubleshoot and provide opportunities for children to participate and enjoy learning outdoors. Educators will have opportunities to deepen their skills when addressing stakeholders' risk tolerance.   Educators will also have opportunities to deepen their skills in facilitating and stimulating outdoor playscapes using learning in, through, and about the outdoors. In addition, educators can deepen their skills in integrating the outdoors in planning their curriculum and provide holistic learning experiences that support children's social, emotional, and cognitive development.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will be equipped with the following knowledge and skills:       
1.	Explain that educators, family and other community members have a role in facilitating the potential of the outdoors.
2.	Apply the UAiS model to plan for outdoor learning, maximise the possibilities, and strengthen communications with parents, families, and other stakeholders.
3.	Understand and reflect on Learning In, About and Through playscapes based on social-cultural considerations of Gibson's Affordance theory. 
4.	Extend understanding of the educator's role in facilitating and stimulating outdoor experiences for children using the UAiS model.
5.	Examine the current curriculum of their preschools and identify the possibilities for integrating outdoors into their curriculum. 
6.	Extend understanding of the educator's role in designing and facilitating outdoor learning experiences for children using the UAiS model, Planning Cycle, Outdoor Learning Guide, and National Frameworks.
course_entry_req:
Be ECDA-certified as EY1, EY2 , L1 or L2 teacher and completed any of the following Outdoor Learning courses offered by NIEC:
•	Outdoor Experiences for Infant and Toddlers (CL)
•	Creative Outdoor Learning Experiences for 3 and 4-year olds (CL)
•	Outdoors as the Extended Classroom for 5 and 6-Year-Olds （CL）
•	Leading and Supporting Outdoor Learning
full_course_desc:
# course provider

# course title
People, Playscapes and Possibilities: Exploring New Lenses for Outdoor Learning (Chinese) 人物、游戏场景与各种可能性: 探索户外学习的新视角

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2024048747

# course duration
1-2 days

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$469.00

# subsidised course fee
$234.50

# course number of hours
14.00 hours

# course language
Mandarin

# course objective
The 2-day workshop aims to equip educators with knowledge and skills by using the Understanding Action in a Space (UAiS) model to identify and resolve barriers that hinder the possibility of children learning in outdoor spaces. Educators will use the model to make sense of the individual child, the environments, the people and the culture(s) to help them troubleshoot and provide opportunities for children to participate and enjoy learning outdoors. Educators will have opportunities to deepen their skills when addressing stakeholders' risk tolerance.   Educators will also have opportunities to deepen their skills in facilitating and stimulating outdoor playscapes using learning in, through, and about the outdoors. In addition, educators can deepen their skills in integrating the outdoors in planning their curriculum and provide holistic learning experiences that support children's social, emotional, and cognitive development.

# course learning outcomes
Learners will be equipped with the following knowledge and skills:       
1.	Explain that educators, family and other community members have a role in facilitating the potential of the outdoors.
2.	Apply the UAiS model to plan for outdoor learning, maximise the possibilities, and strengthen communications with parents, families, and other stakeholders.
3.	Understand and reflect on Learning In, About and Through playscapes based on social-cultural considerations of Gibson's Affordance theory. 
4.	Extend understanding of the educator's role in facilitating and stimulating outdoor experiences for children using the UAiS model.
5.	Examine the current curriculum of their preschools and identify the possibilities for integrating outdoors into their curriculum. 
6.	Extend understanding of the educator's role in designing and facilitating outdoor learning experiences for children using the UAiS model, Planning Cycle, Outdoor Learning Guide, and National Frameworks.

# course entry req
Be ECDA-certified as EY1, EY2 , L1 or L2 teacher and completed any of the following Outdoor Learning courses offered by NIEC:
•	Outdoor Experiences for Infant and Toddlers (CL)
•	Creative Outdoor Learning Experiences for 3 and 4-year olds (CL)
•	Outdoors as the Extended Classroom for 5 and 6-Year-Olds （CL）
•	Leading and Supporting Outdoor Learning

course_title: Certificate in High Voltage Operation & Protection
course_title_cleaned: Certificate in High Voltage Operation & Protection
course_objective: This course aims to deepen the existing knowledge and skills of the participants in the areas of:  • power system protection • high voltage operation • power transmission and distribution • power system planning and control • electricity overview, acts and regulations • power quality and energy system • computer methods for power system analysis  The participants would have much exposure to computer applications and the use of computer systems for the analysis, protection, control, planning and utilisation of electrical power. They would also be introduced to smart sensors technologies for effective monitoring and smart operation of the power systems
course_learning_outcomes:
Electrical power plays an essential role in the development of a nation. Power systems form the backbone of Singapore’s economy and critical infrastructures such as transportation, utilities and buildings. Singapore’s total electricity consumption rose by 7.8% from 46TWh in 2014 to 49.6TWh in 2017 [Source: Singapore Energy Statistics 2018, EMA], and this rising demand for energy is expected to grow in tandem with the economy.

A reliable and economic supply of electrical power is thus essential for the effective and productive operation of Singapore’s industry. This can be only achieved by having an efficient and well-planned power system operated by skilful operators.
course_entry_req:
Applicants must possess a relevant engineering Polytechnic Diploma (Diploma in Electrical Engineering, Diploma in Electrical & Electronic Engineering and other power relevant diploma) from a recognised institution or an equivalent qualification. Preference will be given to those with relevant working experience.

Applicants should not have a colour deficiency.

Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted will have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

course_title: Certified Information Privacy Professional/ Europe (CIPP/E)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Information Privacy Professional  Europe (CIPP E)
course_objective: At the end of the 3-day course, participants will be able to:  • Gain an overview of European Data Protection • Know European Regulatory Institutions • Understand Legislative Framework • Gain an understanding of the compliance with European Data Protection Law and Regulation • Learn about cross-border data transfers
course_learning_outcomes:
The Certified Information Privacy Professional/ Europe (CIPP/E) is IAPP's training on European Data Protection. It provides an in-depth review of the GDPR and critical data protection concepts. Principles of Data Protection in Europe covers the essential pan-European and national data protection laws, as well as industry standard best practices for corporate compliance with these laws. 

This course is seasoned with lots of different business scenarios as well as practical tools participants can take home for immediate use on the job. Those taking this course will gain an understanding of the European model for privacy enforcement, key privacy terminology and practical concepts concerning the protection of personal data and trans-border data flows.

The CIPP/E certification covers the following body of knowledge: 
• Introduction to European Data Protection
(a) Origins and Historical Context of Data Protection Law
(b) European Union Institutions
(c) Legislative Framework
• European Data Protection Law and Regulation
(a) Data Protection Concepts
(b) Territorial and Material Scope of the General Data Protection Regulation
(c) Data Processing Principles
(d) Lawful Processing Criteria
(e) Information Provision Obligations
(f) Data Subjects’ Rights
(g) Security of Personal Data
(h) Accountability Requirements
(i) International Data Transfers
(j) Supervision and enforcement
(k) Consequences for GDPR violations
• Compliance with European Data Protection Law and Regulation
(a) Employment Relationship
(b) Surveillance Activities
(c) Direct Marketing
(d) Internet Technology and Communications
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably be a degree holder with at least 2 years of working experience.

course_title: Building a High-Performance Team
course_title_cleaned: Building a High-Performance Team
course_objective: This course covers essential skills required by leaders in the twenty-first century workplace. These include managing for team performance, impactful communication and skills for complex problem-solving. To acquire effective team management skills, participants will learn how to generate clear and understandable team goals, identify productivity indicators and apply strategies needed to close performance gaps. They will also be equipped with tools for decision-making and problem-solving.
course_learning_outcomes:
Participants should be able to:

1. Monitor and Assess Team Performance by:
- Generating clear and understandable team goals
- Identifying examples of quality work and successful standards
- Using team discussion and reflection to compare team performance to goals
- Identifying strategies needed to close performance gaps

2. Acquire skills for task-focused team roles, which include:
- Organizing skills essential to getting tasks done
- Decision-Making skills for options evaluation and decision
- Problem-Solving skills to develop solution options
- Communication skills to communicate ideas and performance
- Delegating skills to manage job distribution
- Feedback skills to give constructive feedback
course_entry_req: Not Applicable

course_title: Data and Statistical Analytics 1
course_title_cleaned: Data and Statistical Analytics 1
course_objective: Targeted Sector: Learners who are in roles across various engineering services such as trade, manufacturing, electronics and others. While many of these learners have extensive experience in various deep-engineering equipment, they lack the knowledge and skills required to use common software for data collection, and interpretation of that data for reporting and recording keeping tasks. The purpose of this training is to give a light touch introduction to the use of a spreadsheets tool like Excel to store, manipulate and manage data. At the moment, many such businesses are attempting to convert manual paper-based processes to digital computer-based processes. However, it is clear that the workforce has a very poor understanding of the use of a common tool such as Excel and a basic introductory course is necessary to ensure success in their careers.   Performance Gaps / Needs that the Course Will Address Current situation: 1.	Lack of understanding how data collection software is intended to be used 2.	Lack of understanding how to store data effectively using data collection software 3.	Lack of experience in using such data collection / storage software 4.	Lack of knowledge in collecting, storing and maintaining data.  Intended situation: 1.	Knowledge of data collection 2.	Knowledge of data storage 3.	Able to collect data for analysis and processing 4.	Able to collect, store and maintain data meaningfully
course_learning_outcomes: Upon completion of this course, learners will be able to carry out the collection of data for data analytics processing.
course_entry_req:
Cognitive (Medium)	
-	Possess at least GCE N Level or WSQ WPLN 5
-	Good ability in written and spoken English
-	Visual and kinaesthetic learners with basic problem-solving abilities
-	Most have not been formally assessed in a long time so may be intimidated by assessments

Affective (Medium)
-	Mid motivation level with some work experience
-	Mid level of readiness to learn
-	Mid level of proactiveness

Physiological (Medium)
-	Energetic and healthy
-	Ranges from 30 – 55 years old
-	High tendency towards kinaesthetic learning style but supported by visual and auditory styles

Social (Medium)
-	Most would prefer the involvement in interaction between facilitator and fellow learners
-	Fairly cooperative towards learners and trainer
-	Requires communication and discussion between and among facilitator and fellow learners
-	Possess average IT skills

course_title: Working with stakeholders (Classroom & Asynchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Working with stakeholders (Classroom & Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: At the end of the training, the course would equip participants with the following learning outcomes:  •	Demonstrate understanding of the important roles played by the stakeholders and their impact on the students' development   •	Demonstrate understanding of the benefits of working with stakeholders    •	Demonstrate the competency of application of communication techniques and strategies in working with stakeholders in supporting the development of students under their care
course_learning_outcomes:
In this 16- hour short course adopting a blended learning model over 2 days,  learners will appreciate the importance working with stakeholders of students (such as Parents, Caregivers, Teachers, Relatives etc) in supporting the development of students in the student setting context. The significant roles of these stakeholders, their impact on the students and the benefits of working with stakeholders will be examined. Learners will also learn to apply communication techniques and strategies in working with the stakeholders so that they can better support the students under their care.  

This is one of the four short courses that can be taken separately by learners and stacked towards the Certificate in Student Management.
course_entry_req: Applicants should preferably have some working experiences with children and with managing a classroom for primary school going children

This is one of the four short courses that can be taken separately by learners and stacked towards the Certificate in Student Management. 


# course entry req
Applicants should preferably have some working experiences with children and with managing a classroom for primary school going children

course_title: Learning how to learn: The science behind learning and memory
course_title_cleaned: Learning how to learn  The science behind learning and memory
course_objective: Topics to be covered include: 1. Information Processing: L: location; U: use it or lose it; M: magnification; P: plasticity (L.U.M.P) 2. Information Processing: Neurotransmission 3. How do we learn: What is synaptic plasticity? 4. Memory and its mechanisms: Encoding, consolidation, storage and retrieval 5. Types of learning: active vs passive learning, massed vs spaced repetitive learning 6. Role of sleep, stress and lifestyle in in learning and memory 7. Metacognition  8. Cognitive training in humans   Upon completion of the course, participants will be able to:                                               1. Understand the basic of learning sciences 2. Identify and describe different types of memory 3. Evaluate the principles and importance of different learning styles 4. Evaluate the importance of lifestyles and health in learning and memory 5. Apply cognitive training in humans, such as memory, attention, executive function (e.g., planning, organisation and goal management)
course_learning_outcomes: This course is designed to provide students, teachers, parents the fundamental understanding on how humans learn and retain information. The course is developed by keeping in mind that the nature of learning is constantly evolving and changing. Schools are now preparing students for jobs that do not exist yet, or for taking on multiple unrelated jobs that require unlearning and re-learning in a lifetime. To achieve this, schools will focus on the long-term competencies and skills that will enable students to be ready for tertiary education and subsequently embark on their career. Optimizing learning and memory processes is one of the important keys to unlocking an individual's learning potential and preparing them for opportunities and challenges ahead. This course employs emerging research on learning and memory science, focusing on the ways in which humans process, maintain, and apply knowledge. Possessing an understanding of the pathways that underlie learning and how our memory works will help participants understand why certain learning techniques work and how to adapt their lifestyle and health towards improved learning, thinking and creativity. It also helps teachers to develop best practices for lesson plan design and assessments that enhance student learning by reinforcing the retention of information. The course will be conducted as a workshop. Participants will learn firstly about how the brain works generally,  followed by a deeper understanding of the neuronal basis of learning and memory. Current scientific evidence of how human learn and how memory is formed and maintained, as well as effective ways of learning and its mechanisms will be shared and discussed. Cognitive training in humans, such as memory, attention, executive function will also be introduced.
course_entry_req: Intermediate English proficiency
full_course_desc:

Types of learning: active vs passive learning, massed vs spaced repetitive learning 6. Role of sleep, stress and lifestyle in in learning and memory 7. Metacognition  8. Cognitive training in humans   Upon completion of the course, participants will be able to:                                               1. Understand the basic of learning sciences 2. Identify and describe different types of memory 3. Evaluate the principles and importance of different learning styles 4. Evaluate the importance of lifestyles and health in learning and memory 5. Apply cognitive training in humans, such as memory, attention, executive function (e.g., planning, organisation and goal management)

# course learning outcomes
This course is designed to provide students, teachers, parents the fundamental understanding on how humans learn and retain information. The course is developed by keeping in mind that the nature of learning is constantly evolving and changing. Schools are now preparing students for jobs that do not exist yet, or for taking on multiple unrelated jobs that require unlearning and re-learning in a lifetime. To achieve this, schools will focus on the long-term competencies and skills that will enable students to be ready for tertiary education and subsequently embark on their career. Optimizing learning and memory processes is one of the important keys to unlocking an individual's learning potential and preparing them for opportunities and challenges ahead. This course employs emerging research on learning and memory science, focusing on the ways in which humans process, maintain, and apply knowledge. Possessing an understanding of the pathways that underlie learning and how our memory works will help participants understand why certain learning techniques work and how to adapt their lifestyle and health towards improved learning, thinking and creativity. It also helps teachers to develop best practices for lesson plan design and assessments that enhance student learning by reinforcing the retention of information. The course will be conducted as a workshop. Participants will learn firstly about how the brain works generally,  followed by a deeper understanding of the neuronal basis of learning and memory. Current scientific evidence of how human learn and how memory is formed and maintained, as well as effective ways of learning and its mechanisms will be shared and discussed. Cognitive training in humans, such as memory, attention, executive function will also be introduced.

course_title: Let's work on easy-to-understand reports! Effective data visualisation and communication
course_title_cleaned: Let's work on easy-to-understand reports! Effective data visualisation and communication
course_objective: Have you ever tried to explain your data to stakeholders who does not appreciate your insights? Are you impressed with dashboards that can help users to answer their own questions and facilitate data discovery?   The answer to these lies in how you visualise your data. Data visualisation is not simply creating charts. It encompasses a series of planning and data-related activities to help you present your insights effectively.    In this hands-on course, you will learn all the basic skills and techniques to design and create effective and aesthetically pleasing data visualisations to help you become more productive at work, be it for reporting or analyses purposes. We will also cover the art of creating interactive dashboards and touch briefly on infographics to learn practical knowledge to improve your communication and presentation skills
course_learning_outcomes:
Plan and design
•	Analyse business problem and audience to establish objectives for data storytelling and visualisation
•	Select appropriate visualisation techniques and information displays to convey data and findings
•	Select and organise appropriate elements to create informative and dynamic data displays
•	Assess the style and needs of the audience and adjust the language and presentation formats
 
Develop and troubleshoot
•	Describe the differences among different data types and table structures
•	Undertake simple data preparation steps to cleanse data for analytics and visualisation
•	Organise and analyse data to present trends and correlations
•	Develop interactive graphics, visuals and other technical features into the data visualisation
•	Discuss limitations with data and highlight potential issues with interpretations of findings
•	Organise and analyse data to present trends and correlations via alternative dashboard and infographics
•	Develop interactive graphics, visuals and other technical features into the dashboard and infographics
•	Discuss limitations with data and highlight potential issues with interpretations of findings pertaining to dashboard and infographics
 
Present and communicate
•	Adopt the usage of visual cues to convey key meaning and insights effectively
•	Create concise and insightful commentary to accompany visualisation and describe the context
•	Describe data trends and patterns in the narrative format to cater to different groups of audience and scenario
 
Feedback and improve
•	Demonstrate an understanding of automation and workflow to streamline data preparation steps to design a real-time dashboard
•	Appreciate the importance of obtaining timely feedback from audience to update the objectives of data visualisation and refine the presentation elements
•	Discuss key change management concepts and develop plans to obtain buy-in from stakeholders
course_entry_req:
- Be able to read, listen and speak of English to a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 5
- Be able to have numeracy skills to a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills Sys-tem (ESS) Numeracy Level 5

course_title: Livestream like a Pro
course_title_cleaned: Livestream like a Pro
course_objective: The objective of this course is to let participants gain the skills and knowledge to produce a live streaming presentation for online platforms. In addition to physical design and setup considerations, participants will learn to use software to combine multiple sources for livestreaming. Participants will also compare and optimise livestreaming and virtual room platforms.
course_learning_outcomes:
Do you want to connect ‘live’ with audiences all over the world, or power up your online meetings with your business partners? All major social media platforms such as Facebook and YouTube as well as video-conferencing services like Zoom and MS Teams have fully functioning livestreaming services that let you engage with your audiences ‘live’.  While many have learnt to use the basics of these services, there are ways to make you and your content look and sound better. For example, working with multiple video sources to engage your audience.

Join us to unlock your livestreaming potential with some simple equipment, most of which you already have, such as your mobile phone, a computer and free software. In this one-day course, we will show you how to come up with a plan, set up your tools and streaming software and share that important story, product, commentary or message with the world like a pro.
course_entry_req: Digital literacy in using laptop with built-in camera and mobile phone.

course_title: How to Win and Keep Customers Using Social Media
course_title_cleaned: How to Win and Keep Customers Using Social Media
course_objective: This beginner-level Critical Core Skills course offers a comprehensive guide to mastering social media for customer engagement. This course equips learners with essential skills to interpret social media terms, follow cyber security policies, and adhere to digital etiquettes. By learning to respond effectively to customer queries and handle service lapses, learners will enhance their ability to provide excellent service. The course also emphasizes the importance of data security. Highly relevant to the industry, this course can significantly boost career prospects, making it ideal for anyone looking to advance in customer service roles.
course_learning_outcomes:
How to Win and Keep Customers Using Social Media is designed to equip learners with the skills to effectively engage customers through social media while managing cybersecurity and privacy risks. Learners will be able to:

1.	Interpret and Apply Social Media Terms – Understand key social media terminologies and use them to communicate effectively with customers.
2.	Follow Cyber Security Protocols – Adhere to organisational guidelines to protect information and mitigate risks when using social media for customer communication.
3.	Practice Professional Social Media Etiquette – Apply appropriate online communication norms when interacting with customers.
4.	Respond to Customer Inquiries and Feedback – Provide accurate and helpful responses to customer queries and feedback using social media.
5.	Handle Service Lapses Effectively – Engage with stakeholders to resolve service issues promptly through social media platforms.
6.	Ensure Customer Data Privacy – Follow organisational policies to safeguard customer data and manage digital content securely.

Tools and skills covered include social media platforms, cybersecurity protocols, digital communication, data privacy management, problem-solving, and customer engagement.

# course objective
This beginner-level Critical Core Skills course offers a comprehensive guide to mastering social media for customer engagement. This course equips learners with essential skills to interpret social media terms, follow cyber security policies, and adhere to digital etiquettes. By learning to respond effectively to customer queries and handle service lapses, learners will enhance their ability to provide excellent service. The course also emphasizes the importance of data security. Highly relevant to the industry, this course can significantly boost career prospects, making it ideal for anyone looking to advance in customer service roles.

# course learning outcomes
How to Win and Keep Customers Using Social Media is designed to equip learners with the skills to effectively engage customers through social media while managing cybersecurity and privacy risks. Learners will be able to:

1.	Interpret and Apply Social Media Terms – Understand key social media terminologies and use them to communicate effectively with customers.
2.	Follow Cyber Security Protocols – Adhere to organisational guidelines to protect information and mitigate risks when using social media for customer communication.
3.	Practice Professional Social Media Etiquette – Apply appropriate online communication norms when interacting with customers.
4.	Respond to Customer Inquiries and Feedback – Provide accurate and helpful responses to customer queries and feedback using social media.
5.	Handle Service Lapses Effectively – Engage with stakeholders to resolve service issues promptly through social media platforms.
6.	Ensure Customer Data Privacy – Follow organisational policies to safeguard customer data and manage digital content securely.

Tools and skills covered include social media platforms, cybersecurity protocols, digital communication, data privacy management, problem-solving, and customer engagement.

course_title: WSQ Graduate Diploma in Workplace Learning (Classroom & Synchronous)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Graduate Diploma in Workplace Learning (Classroom & Synchronous)
course_objective: 1.	Focus on the Technical, Skills & Competencies required for a Learning Specialist/Solutionist taking reference to Singapore Skills Framework (SFw).  2.	Develop learners who are able to demonstrate the learning outcomes based on the five domains of competence. 3.	Prepare learners to operate in work contexts where unanticipated changes are expected and are able to reason and engage in inquiry to analyse and evaluate the sustainability of multiple specialist and unfamiliar technical or business areas, using deep specialist technical or business knowledge in a limited field of expertise. 4.	Prepare learners to provide workplace consultancy using IAL in-house structured consultancy framework, that is Diagnose & Outline, Co-Create, Implement and Evaluate (DOCIE).  5.	Challenge learners to critically self-reflect and evaluate one’s own preparation of learning to ensure it is consistent with the technical or business knowledge required for the profession and attempt to integrate learning from other fields to manage current area of work. 6.	Enable learners to reason and engage in inquiry to analyse and evaluate the sustainability of multiple specialist and unfamiliar technical or business areas, using deep specialist technical or business knowledge in a limited field of expertise. 7.	Produce learners who are apt in displaying a high level of organisational awareness and social and leadership skills to foster a culture of openness and cohesion to embrace diversity and achieve common goals through co-creation.
course_learning_outcomes:
•	Develop competencies for roles in organisational diagnosis, customised organisational and learning strategies development, adopting skills framework, and quality assurance management.
•	Prepare professionals for workplace learning projects with enterprises.
•	Support enterprises in developing workplace capabilities through the provision of learning solutionists.

At least 5 years of TAE/L&D working experience or ​

At least 10 years of working experience with appropriate subject matter specialisation and industry experience

course_title: Administering Microsoft Azure SQL Solutions (DP-300)
course_title_cleaned: Administering Microsoft Azure SQL Solutions (DP-300)
course_objective: This course, Administering Microsoft Azure SQL Solutions (DP-300), provides comprehensive training on maintaining, securing, and optimizing SQL databases on Azure. Participants will develop efficient data processes, design secure environments, and implement robust data integration procedures tailored to business requirements.  The course covers a wide range of topics, including deploying SQL Server in Azure, migrating SQL workloads, configuring database security, monitoring performance, and automating database tasks. Additionally, it emphasizes high availability and disaster recovery strategies, ensuring participants are well-equipped to handle various database scenarios in Azure environments.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1: Develop efficient processes and data warehouse process models for Azure SQ in accordance to business requirements.
LO2: Design data validation and staging databases for Azure SQL.
LO3: Design and verify an extraction process for Azure SQL that consolidates in accordance to business rules.
LO4: Design a transformation and loading process for Azure SQL in accordance to business rules.
LO5: Develop data integration procedure and translate business requirements into Azure SQL data structure.

Topics Covered:
LU1: Introduction to Azure Database Administration
LU2: Implement a Secure Environment for a Database Service
LU3: Monitor and Optimize Operational Resources in Azure SQL
LU4: Automate Database Tasks for Azure SQL
LU5: Plan and Implement a High Availability and Disaster Recovery Environment
course_entry_req:
Knowledge and Skill
•	Able to operate using computer functions
•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience

Target age group: 21-65 years old

course_title: Apply Continuous Process Improvement Techniques
course_title_cleaned: Apply Continuous Process Improvement Techniques
course_objective: This course enables the learner to apply the continuous improvement process in the workplace to improve processes and systems by going through the different steps of continuous improvement including identifying of the goals to be achieved, creating an action plan for continuous improvement and subsequently implementing the action plan. Finally, the course aims to evaluate the implemented actions based on the set performance indicators in order to know if the actions have improved the systems and processes or more actions need to be done for further improvement.
course_learning_outcomes: This course is about enabling learners to apply continuous improvement processes to improve products, services or processes in order to create gradual improvements over time or breakthrough improvement all at once. Taking the course will help learners gain knowledge on the importance and purpose of continuous improvement and how it affects systems and processes when it is implemented in the workplace. The course presents a step-by-step process on how to apply continuous improvement so that the learners can grasp its effect and replicate the process in their respective workplaces.

course_provider: SINGAPORE INSTITUTE OF POWER AND GAS PTE....
course_title: Masterclass (2 days) Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage
course_title_cleaned: Masterclass (2 days) Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage
course_objective: The objective of the masterclass is to expose the participants to the practices outside of Singapore. The trainer will conduct the training based on their experience and overseas practices. Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:   •	Gain the overview understanding of Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) •	Apply CCUS technology across the energy system •	Understand the range of technological solutions and business drivers, including policy •	Learn new opportunities and integrated value creation possibilities through emerging carbon utilisation options
course_learning_outcomes:
•	Introduction 
o	CO2 emissions classification 
o	CO2 emissions by sector 
o	Netzero target setting 
o	Importance of CCS, CCUS 
•	Brief History of CCS/CCUS
o	How CCS emerged, when, trailblazers? 
o	Early pilot projects 
o	Ramp up 
o	Impact of fluctuating CO2 pricing 
o	Successful projects during the crisis
•	Carbon Capture (by emission sources) 
o	Fundamental approaches: pre- and post-combustion, oxyfuel, industrial processes 
o	Power plants (coal / NG combined cycle) 
o	Industrial sectors (cement, iron and steel, refineries – in particular blue hydrogen) 
•	Carbon Transportation
o	Road and Rail 
o	Sea 
o	Pipeline 
o	Emerging Technologies and Future Trend in CO2 Transportation 
•	Carbon Storage
o	CO2 / CCUS hazards. Safe CO2 operations
o	Compression
o	Subsurface sequestration (EOR, depleted reservoirs, saline aquifers, monitoring systems, risks)
o	Storage capacity
o	Other forms of sequestration
•	Carbon Utilisation
o	Current carbon dioxide utilisation
o	Captured carbon as a feedstock into ‘low carbon’ petrochemicals such as methanol and synthetic fuels
o	Carbon utilisation and the ‘circular economy’
•	CCUS Technologies
o	Overview of current technologies applied (how to remove the CO2 from process streams, solvents, amines) 
o	Evaluation of technologies: techno-commercial
o	Modelling of subsurface aspects of CO2 
o	Cost structure, learning curves: challenges and opportunities 
o	Operations and maintenance
o	Future technology outlook: opportunities and challenges
•	CCUS Business Models
o	Factors for CCS/CCUS to be commercially viable: technology applied, CO2 pricing, negative emissions 
o	CCS/CCUS clusters
o	Other supply chain requirements to make CCS/CCUS happen 
o	Strategic partnerships focusing on CCS/CCUS
o	Thermal hydrogen
•	CCUS/CCS Projects: Overview, Discussion and Case Analysis
o	Description / discussion of plants currently in operation 
o	Operations and maintenance, employment opportunities 
o	Lessons learn
course_entry_req: Pass in English at GCE ‘O’/’N’ Level or WPLN level 4 or equivalent
full_course_desc:
# course provider\nSINGAPORE INSTITUTE OF POWER AND GAS PTE....\n\n# course title\nMasterclass (2 days) Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage\n\n# course url\n/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025052197\n\n# course duration\n1-2 days\n\n# course mode of training\nFull Time\n\n# full course fee\n$2,200.00\n\n# subsidised course fee\n$660.00\n\n# course number of hours\n14.00 hours\n\n# course language\nEnglish\n\n# course objective\nThe objective of the masterclass is to expose the participants to the practices outside of Singapore. The trainer will conduct the training based on their experience and overseas practices. Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:   •	Gain the overview understanding of Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) •	Apply CCUS technology across the energy system •	Understand the range of technological solutions and business drivers, including policy •	Learn new opportunities and integrated value creation possibilities through emerging carbon utilisation options \n\n# course learning outcomes\n•	Introduction 
o	CO2 emissions classification 
o	CO2 emissions by sector 
o	Netzero target setting 
o	Importance of CCS, CCUS 
•	Brief History of CCS/CCUS
o	How CCS emerged, when, trailblazers? 
o	Early pilot projects 
o	Ramp up 
o	Impact of fluctuating CO2 pricing 
o	Successful projects during the crisis
•	Carbon Capture (by emission sources) 
o	Fundamental approaches: pre- and post-combustion, oxyfuel, industrial processes 
o	Power plants (coal / NG combined cycle) 
o	Industrial sectors (cement, iron and steel, refineries – in particular blue hydrogen) 
•	Carbon Transportation
o	Road and Rail 
o	Sea 
o	Pipeline 
o	Emerging Technologies and Future Trend in CO2 Transportation 
•	Carbon Storage
o	CO2 / CCUS hazards. Safe CO2 operations
o	Compression
o	Subsurface sequestration (EOR, depleted reservoirs, saline aquifers, monitoring systems, risks)
o	Storage capacity
o	Other forms of sequestration
•	Carbon Utilisation
o	Current carbon dioxide utilisation
o	Captured carbon as a feedstock into ‘low carbon’ petrochemicals such as methanol and synthetic fuels
o	Carbon utilisation and the ‘circular economy’
•	CCUS Technologies
o	Overview of current technologies applied (how to remove the CO2 from process streams, solvents, amines) 
o	Evaluation of technologies: techno-commercial
o	Modelling of subsurface aspects of CO2 
o	Cost structure, learning curves: challenges and opportunities 
o	Operations and maintenance
o	Future technology outlook: opportunities and challenges
•	CCUS Business Models
o	Factors for CCS/CCUS to be commercially viable: technology applied, CO2 pricing, negative emissions 
o	CCS/CCUS clusters
o	Other supply chain requirements to make CCS/CCUS happen 
o	Strategic partnerships focusing on CCS/CCUS
o	Thermal hydrogen
•	CCUS/CCS Projects: Overview, Discussion and Case Analysis
o	Description / discussion of plants currently in operation 
o	Operations and maintenance, employment opportunities 
o	Lessons learn\n\n# course entry req\nPass in English at GCE ‘O’/’N’ Level or WPLN level 4 or equivalent\n\n

course_title: Introduction to Java Programming
course_title_cleaned: Introduction to Java Programming
course_objective: Note: This course is offered as a module in the (SCTP) Junior Full-Stack Developer programme. We do not offer this module on its own. Please scroll down to proceed to the main SCTP site for more information and to register interest.   Junior Fullstack Developers (JFD) are entry-level developers that work in tech-based startups, mid to large-sized software development companies, and consultancy firms, among others. This course provides relevant training for the JFD role. JFDs spend the majority of their time analysing user requirements, designing solutions, supporting the implementation of these solutions and supporting regular updates to existing applications. Key skills which learners will acquire in this programme include testing and finalising solutions, fixing errors, supporting security provisions in software, and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.
course_learning_outcomes: This is an introduction to Java Programming. Learners will be introduced to the language of Java, and learn more about concepts like variables, data types and operators. There will also be sessions on control flow and loops, polymorphism and inheritance, as well as unit testing with JUnit.
course_entry_req: Pass screening which includes a basic technical test and interview

course_objective: This course is designed to combine both practical and theories with aims to equip learners with all essential knowledge and practical skills to: •	decide travel details of chosen attractions for delivery of tour commentary •	deliver insights of Singapore tourist attractions •	communicate with tourists with techniques their queries on places of interest •	design and write the tour commentary technically in meeting tourist specific needs and expectations •	recover service from a bad visitor experience that a professional tourist guide needs to have in maximising their tour guiding duties and in creating visitors a memorable travel experience to revisit the lion city.
course_learning_outcomes:
The course aims to equip learners with the knowledge and skills to be a competent licensed Tourist Guide in Singapore so as to manage and execute multitude ground handling duties that include:
•	collate confirmed tour itinerary travel details and organise tour activities 
•	apply story-telling approach to deliver tour commentary
•	coordinate and organise pre-arranged travel arrangement, accommodation and transport
•	transfer of groups from/to airport/railway station/pier/hotel
to accomplish a hindrance free itinerary.

-	Primary 6 pass or WSQ WPL Level 3 in English language 
•	Basic computer skills

course_title: Certified Financial Planning, Module 2: Risk Management & Insurance Planning (E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Financial Planning, Module 2  Risk Management & Insurance Planning (E-Learning)
course_objective: The objectives of the programme are: - Understand and apply knowledge of financial products to designing risk management suitable for the needs of individuals; - Apply knowledge of laws and regulations (e.g. FAA, PDPA, FATCA, Consumer Protection Fair Trading Act) to understand the need to adhere to compliance policies and procedures that govern financial planning activities; - Apply ethical principles to resolve dilemmas encountered in the course of advising clients; - Examine the principles of risk management and insurance to identify a client’s risk exposures and to select appropriate risk management techniques.  Candidates are required to sign up for the assessment with FPAS. The assessment fee is $192.60 (inclusive of GST).
course_learning_outcomes: Conferred by the Certified Financial Planners Board (CFP Board) in the United States, the CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ credential is the most desired and respected global certification for those seeking to demonstrate their commitment to competent and ethical financial planning practice. CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professionals meet initial and ongoing education, experience and professional development requirements, pass a rigorous exam that assesses competency, and adhere to a code of ethics, pledging to provide financial planning in the interests of clients and with the highest ethical and professional standards.

course_title: Steam and Compressed Air Systems (SCEM Elective)
course_title_cleaned: Steam and Compressed Air Systems (SCEM Elective)
course_objective: Understand the functions and components of compressed air and steam systems  Analyse energy performance characteristics and identify potential energy saving opportunities in compressed air and steam systems  Select heat recovery devices and analyse heat transfer performance  Operate the above systems in an energy efficient manner
course_learning_outcomes:
This is an elective module developed for SCEM (Professional
Level) participants.
The module is designed for professionals who have
responsibilities to improve the energy performance of
industrial facilities by optimising compressed air and steam
systems and maximising the recovery of waste heat.
The objective of the module is to integrate knowledge in
thermodynamics, heat transfer and fluid mechanics to analyse
the operating conditions with the objective of energy
optimization.
Major topics discussed include the function of the various
components in compressed air and steam systems, heat and
mass transfer analysis, evaluation of system performance,
potential for heat recovery, influence of different variables on
energy optimization, energy efficient design, operation and
control strategies, sustainable practices, selection and
arrangement of heat recovery devices, operations and
maintenance.
course_entry_req: Engineering/Science Degree

Major topics discussed include the function of the various
components in compressed air and steam systems, heat and
mass transfer analysis, evaluation of system performance,
potential for heat recovery, influence of different variables on
energy optimization, energy efficient design, operation and
control strategies, sustainable practices, selection and
arrangement of heat recovery devices, operations and
maintenance.

Engineering/Science Degree

course_title: TPOL - Introduction to Generative AI and Prompt Engineering(Self-Paced e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: TPOL - Introduction to Generative AI and Prompt Engineering(Self-Paced e-Learning)
course_objective: This self-paced e-learning course is about demystifying the intricacies of generative AI and the art and science of prompt engineering. It is aim to give a foundational understanding of generative AI concepts and equip you with the skills to wield the creative power of AI through effective prompt design.  With a focus on large language models like ChatGPT, you will learn how to structure prompts to achieve the output you are after. You will also learn tips for turning your prompts into output machines. You'll get practice techniques to help large language models tackle complex problems that might otherwise be beyond their ordinary capabilities. And you'll learn about the opportunity that GPT and other models provide, to automate the workflow of a person, a team, or an entire organisation.  This course is designed for individuals from all backgrounds, with no assumed knowledge or technical expertise. Whether you're a professional seeking to expand your skill set or someone intrigued by the world of generative AI, this course offers a non-technical exploration suitable for all.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course you will be able to:
1. Outline the nature and purpose of generative AI machine learning models
2. Apply prompt engineering to Large Language Models to achieve desired outputs
3. Explain how large language models can be integrated into applications to automate workflows

course_title: Solve with Gen AI
course_title_cleaned: Solve with Gen AI
course_objective: This intensive 2-day Applications Integration course is designed for intermediate-level IT professionals seeking to advance their careers in Singapore's rapidly expanding digital economy. As enterprises across finance, healthcare, and manufacturing sectors undergo digital transformation, the demand for skilled integration specialists has reached critical levels. The course directly addresses critical industry needs of helping organizations integrate new technologies with existing systems, supporting the proliferation of microservices and API-first architectures and enabling seamless integration between on-premises and cloud environments.  Learners will be able to gain the knowledge and skills to (1) Select, implement, and optimize enterprise middleware for seamless system integration, (2) Design and manage API connections between disparate enterprise applications, (3) Ensure applications work effectively across diverse technological environments, (4) Diagnose and solve technical, compatibility, and performance problems in integrated systems as well as (5) Evaluate and recommend optimal integration solutions for complex business requirements.  By the end of the course, learners will be able to distinguish themselves as career-advancing professionals from the generalist IT workers as well as being able to accelerate into the high-demand, high-value integration specialist track that leads directly to senior architect, technical lead, and CTO positions in Singapore's thriving digital economy.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:
• LO1: Examine types of middleware and their features to perform feasibility scans and assess potential middleware solutions for enterprise integration requirements
• LO2: Examine middleware types and their capabilities to apply modifications that enhance integration and connections of application programs
• LO3: Study the functions of Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) to apply effective API-level integration across enterprise systems
• LO4: Differentiate between deployment environments to systematically verify application performance and integrity
• LO5: Investigate the proper usage patterns of middleware to utilize middleware effectively for integrating data and functions across application programs within an enterprise
• LO6: Examine potential technical, compatibility, and performance issues to assess opportunities for integration between core technologies
• LO7: Assess potential glitches or performance issues in application integration to perform comprehensive tests and checks on connections between disparate application programs
• LO8: Evaluate technical, compatibility, and performance issues following integration to highlight problems with applications or platforms and recommend solutions
course_entry_req:
Entry Requirements
- 1 year of working experience in any sector; and
- Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) 4 or equivalent

*Learners without the right WPLN or equivalent qualifications can be accepted if they have at least 3 years of relevant working experience, subject to the MR’s approval.

course_learning_outcomes: The wealthy from China are fast becoming the second largest group of billionaires in the world, accounting for nearly one in eight of the world's billionaire wealth, according to the UBS/PWC Billionaires Analysis 2019. course_title: Mindful Self-Compassion
course_title_cleaned: Mindful Self-Compassion
course_objective: 1. Learn the three components of self-compassion  - self-kindness, common humanity and mindfulness 2. Learn how to motivate yourself with kindness rather than criticism, and handling difficult emotions with greater ease  3. Understand the difference between loving-kindness and compassion; empathy and compassion; compassion and self-compassion, and how they relate to relationships with others and ourselves 4. Experience a variety of practices including meditation, experiential exercises, reflective journaling, and group discussions to directly experience self-compassion in-session and learn practices
course_learning_outcomes: As human beings, it is inevitable to make mistakes or feel a sense of inadequacy. When we are going through difficult times, we may notice we tend to be more critical of ourselves versus how we would treat other people in similar situations. The MSC program is designed to cultivate the skill of self-compassion and teaches core principles and practice that enable participants to respond to difficult moments in their lives with kindness, care and understanding. The three key components of self-compassion are self-kindness, a sense of common humanity, and balanced, mindful awareness.  Self-compassion provides emotional strength and resilience, allowing us to admit our shortcomings, motivate ourselves with kindness, forgive ourselves when needed, relate wholeheartedly to others, and be more authentically ourselves. MSC is primarily a compassion training program rather than mindfulness training, although mindfulness is the foundation of self-compassion.  Rapidly expanding research demonstrates that self-compassion is strongly associated with emotional wellbeing, less anxiety, depression and stress, maintenance of healthy habits such as diet and exercise, and satisfying personal relationships.

course_title: (HCIC) 教育实习1
course_title_cleaned: (HCIC) 教育实习1
course_objective: 实习是任何一个幼教老师培训课程里基本和必须的部分。在实习过程中，通过观察幼儿我们能够增加对他们行为、发展和学习的理解。实习提供机会让理论付诸实践，去开发、创造和连接我们与孩子一起工作时的理念。         (WSQ-HCIC) 新技能资格幼儿培训证书是注重婴幼儿教师个人能力和专业能力的发展，这两方面的发展是延续性的，他们既是婴幼儿教育在工作前的准备，同时也将持续贯穿其整个职业的发展。        要成婴幼儿教育组织里面一名专业的婴幼儿教育工作者： 1.1 使个别幼儿受益 1.2 有意识去看待儿童的综合发展; 1.3 有效地与幼儿，家长，同事一起携手合作与工作 1.4 担负起对婴幼儿悉心照顾的责任和致力于促进婴幼儿的发展。
course_learning_outcomes:
为了给幼儿教育工作者提供机会：
2.1 以专业的态度观察并了解幼儿和教师的活动以及教室和幼儿教育机构的环境设施；
2.2 与幼儿一起工作，并在实习导师的督导下进行教学工作，包括对幼儿的个别指导、小组的教学；
2.3 解析幼儿教师所应扮演的角色，同时在教育实习中获得教师应具备的能力；
2.4 在实习导师的指导和幼儿培育署的指导方针下实施
course_entry_req:
At least Secondary 2 qualifications; OR Completed 8 years of formal education
 
Language Requirements:
     •      Attained A GCE ‘O’ level credit (C6) in CL OR HSK Level 4 & HSKK Advanced Level OR other Chinese Language Acceptable Alternatives

course_title: Medical Device Regulation in the US and EU (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Medical Device Regulation in the US and EU (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: "The module delves into medical device regulation in the US, with an emphasis on the product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the US. Key sub-topics include interactions with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), submission types (e.g., PMAs and 510(k)s) and postmarketing. This course provides a comprehensive review of medical device regulation in the EU, with emphasis on product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the EU. Key sub-topics include clinical assessment of medical devices, Medical-Devices Directive (MDD), conformity assessment pathways and the impact of harmonization efforts on the region. 1. To gain an understanding of US Medical Device Regulation 2. To understand the basics of Clinical Evaluations of Medical Devices 3. To gain an understanding of EU Medical Device Regulatory Structure, including details in Medical Devices Directives (MDD) In Vitro Diagnostic Devices Directive (IVDD) and Active Implantable Medical Devices Directive (AIMDD) 4. Be able to work in a team 5. Be conversant in individual and group presentation and report writing "
course_learning_outcomes: The module delves into medical device regulation in the US, with an emphasis on the product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the US. Key sub-topics include interactions with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), submission types (e.g., PMAs and 510(k)s) and postmarketing. This course provides a comprehensive review of medical device regulation in the EU, with emphasis on product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the EU. Key sub-topics include clinical assessment of medical devices, Medical-Devices Directive (MDD), conformity assessment pathways and the impact of harmonization efforts on the region.

# course title
Medical Device Regulation in the US and EU (Synchronous e-learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2020507245

# course duration
6 days - 1 month

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$5,400.00

# subsidised course fee
$1,620.00

# course number of hours
39.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
"The module delves into medical device regulation in the US, with an emphasis on the product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the US. Key sub-topics include interactions with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), submission types (e.g., PMAs and 510(k)s) and postmarketing. This course provides a comprehensive review of medical device regulation in the EU, with emphasis on product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the EU. Key sub-topics include clinical assessment of medical devices, Medical-Devices Directive (MDD), conformity assessment pathways and the impact of harmonization efforts on the region. 1. To gain an understanding of US Medical Device Regulation 2. To understand the basics of Clinical Evaluations of Medical Devices 3. To gain an understanding of EU Medical Device Regulatory Structure, including details in Medical Devices Directives (MDD) In Vitro Diagnostic Devices Directive (IVDD) and Active Implantable Medical Devices Directive (AIMDD) 4. Be able to work in a team 5. Be conversant in individual and group presentation and report writing "

# course learning outcomes
The module delves into medical device regulation in the US, with an emphasis on the product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the US. Key sub-topics include interactions with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), submission types (e.g., PMAs and 510(k)s) and postmarketing. This course provides a comprehensive review of medical device regulation in the EU, with emphasis on product lifecycle and an extended examination of the submissions process in the EU. Key sub-topics include clinical assessment of medical devices, Medical-Devices Directive (MDD), conformity assessment pathways and the impact of harmonization efforts on the region.

course_title: The Art of Leadership: Lessons from the Ancient Chinese
course_title_cleaned: The Art of Leadership  Lessons from the Ancient Chinese
course_objective: This course explores leadership through classical Chinese philosophy, focusing on Confucius, Mencius, and Laozi. Participants will study ancient leadership models—humanistic, bureaucratic, and naturalistic—and their modern applications. The course blends traditional wisdom with contemporary practices, offering valuable insights and enhanced skills for effective leadership in today’s context.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
• Gain a comprehensive understanding of China’s cultural evolution and historical context.
• Explore and differentiate between various Chinese classical leadership approaches, including Humanistic, Bureaucratic, and Naturalistic methods.
• Apply ancient Chinese philosophies to contemporary leadership roles and challenges.
• Identify and implement key success factors for nurturing effective and influential leaders.
course_entry_req:
Minimum C6 in GCE 'O' Level English (or its equivalent) or;
More than 2 years of working experience.

course_title_cleaned: Automation using Visual Basic for Applications
course_objective: This course aims to enhance the productivity of users of MS Excel by reducing the time spent on repetitive and manual data processing tasks and minimising human errors through spreadsheet automation using MS Excel VBA. Participants will learn how to write Excel VBA codes from the ground up and this serves to build a basic understanding to develop simple software automation using Excel VBA programming.
course_learning_outcomes:
MS Excel is a ubiquitous application which is indispensable in many companies.  Users can harness the full potential of MS Excel by automating repetitive and manual tasks using Excel VBA. Through automation, users can also improve their productivity and reduce human errors in data processing. 
In this course, the learners will learn how to automate complex tasks and get more meaningful insights from data in Excel using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) code.

course_title: Mastering Electromagnetic Compatibility Principles and Measurements
course_title_cleaned: Mastering Electromagnetic Compatibility Principles and Measurements
course_objective: The rapid advancement of electronic devices and systems has led to an increased emphasis on electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) to ensure seamless operation and compliance with regulatory standards. With the proliferation of wireless communication, Internet of things (IoT) devices, and high-speed digital circuits, the need to address EMC issues has become more critical than ever. These trends highlight the importance of understanding EMC principles and staying updated with industry-standard testing and measurement techniques to design robust systems with and EMC compliance.  This unique course provides a thorough understanding of EMC principles including sources of electromagnetic interference, coupling mechanisms, and mitigation techniques as well as hands-on experience with industry-standard testing and measurement techniques to develop the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve EMC issues efficiently.
course_learning_outcomes: This course is offered as a partnership between SIT and Rohde & Schwarz, to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical skills in electromagnetic compatibility (EMC). It is designed for engineers, technicians, and professionals involved in the design, testing, and certification of electronic devices and systems. Whether you are working in Research and Development (R&D), product development, compliance, or quality assurance, this course will equip learner with the necessary skills to address EMC challenges effectively. It is also suitable for learners with non-electrical /non-electronics background who wish to deepen their understanding of EMC principles and applications.
course_entry_req: Basic knowledge of electrical and electronic circuits is required to attend this course
