# course objective
The rapid advancement of electronic devices and systems has led to an increased emphasis on electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) to ensure seamless operation and compliance with regulatory standards. With the proliferation of wireless communication, Internet of things (IoT) devices, and high-speed digital circuits, the need to address EMC issues has become more critical than ever. These trends highlight the importance of understanding EMC principles and staying updated with industry-standard testing and measurement techniques to design robust systems with and EMC compliance.  This unique course provides a thorough understanding of EMC principles including sources of electromagnetic interference, coupling mechanisms, and mitigation techniques as well as hands-on experience with industry-standard testing and measurement techniques to develop the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve EMC issues efficiently.

# course learning outcomes
This course is offered as a partnership between SIT and Rohde & Schwarz, to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical skills in electromagnetic compatibility (EMC). It is designed for engineers, technicians, and professionals involved in the design, testing, and certification of electronic devices and systems. Whether you are working in Research and Development (R&D), product development, compliance, or quality assurance, this course will equip learner with the necessary skills to address EMC challenges effectively. It is also suitable for learners with non-electrical /non-electronics background who wish to deepen their understanding of EMC principles and applications.

course_title: Platform Strategy
course_title_cleaned: Platform Strategy
course_objective: 1. Analyse how platform businesses manage to disrupt and dominate vast traditional industries. 2. Formulate how platform businesses outcompete traditional companies. 3. Appraise how the rise of the platform transforms the principles governing economic growth and business competition. 4. Compare the similarity and difference between platform businesses and pipe businesses. 5. Appraise the life stages of platform businesses and their managerial challenges. 6. Assess the strategic options for traditional firms being disrupted. 7.  Formulate business plans on innovative platforms to effectively engage the target audience. 8. Develop critical thinking skills to examine a platform business and its management problems. 9. Demonstrate proficiency in communication. 10. Demonstrate proficiency in group work.
course_learning_outcomes:
A platform business connects members of communities and enables them to transact. This business model is distinctive from that of traditional organizations, as it does not involve the use of linear value chains, to buy and transform raw materials into products or services in order to sell them at a profit. The course examines the characteristic of the platform business model and review successful (and not-so-successful) cases to derive useful management principles. In addition, the course examines the challenges that traditional companies face with platform competition and discuss their strategic options. Topics will also include how old and new business models can be combined to create entire self-reinforcing platform-powered ecosystems. A range of platform examples, such as eBay, Alibaba, Amazon, Google, Apple, Facebook, Uber and Airbnb, will be used as case studies to illustrate key business insights.

Topics:
1. The rise of the platform business model
2. Economic characteristics of platforms - Network effects
3. Comparison of the platform business and traditional industries
4. Life stages of a platform business
5. Managerial challenges of a platform business
6. Principles for successful platforms
7. Challenges faced by traditional firms being disrupted by platforms
8. Strategic options for traditional firms being disrupted
9. Policies to increase value and enhance growth
10. Platform regulations
11. Business plans on innovative platforms
12. Case studies on successful platforms
course_entry_req: Bachelor Degree
full_course_desc:

course_title: Ethical Hacking Essentials (EHE) (SF)
course_title_cleaned: Ethical Hacking Essentials (EHE) (SF)
course_objective: •	Define the Elements of Information Security. •	Define Vulnerability, and Vulnerability Assessment. •	Understand Vulnerability Scoring Systems and Databases •	Understand Fundamentals of Penetration Testing and its Benefits •	Learn to use common vulnerability scanning tools.
course_learning_outcomes:
This is a 2-day course which introduces learners to the fundamentals of information security and ethical hacking. Learners will gain knowledge on Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability, Authenticity, and non-Repudiation - (the key concepts of Information Security). Learners will also gain knowledge and skills on topics like Lockheed Martin Cyber Kill Chain Framework, Ethical Hacking Methodology, Vulnerability Assessment, types of malwares, password cracking, social engineering, Linux operating systems and common penetration testing tools.

In today’s digital world, where data breaches can incur hefty costs for companies, having a robust understanding of information security fundamentals is the key to enhance the security posture of an organization. Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing (VAPT) is one of the ways that an organization can review the effectiveness of their security measures and take the appropriate actions to enhance any short comings.
course_entry_req: Candidates with basic knowledge in information technology

course_title: WSQ Enterprise Application Design (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Enterprise Application Design (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the course, learners attaining the following Learning Outcomes is the objective of this course Knowledge: •	Understand the business requirements for enterprise applications using various tools and techniques. •	Gain understanding of the aspects in enterprise application designs that meet the needs of stakeholders, considering requirements, business processes, architecture, and security. •	Explain trade-offs between different design patterns, architectures, and technologies in the context of enterprise applications. •	Understand the principles of data modelling, user-centric design, and security to design application components for enterprise applications. •	Learn security and access controls to protect enterprise applications from threats and ensure data privacy.  Skills: •	Analyse business requirements and translate them into design specifications •	Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyse requirements and design enterprise applications that meet their needs. •	Develop project plans, including timelines, milestones, and deliverables, for enterprise application design projects. •	Use design tools and techniques, such as entity-relationship modelling, process mapping, and wireframing, to create effective application designs. •	Implement security and access controls, optimize application performance, and design for scalability and resilience •	Test and validate enterprise application designs using techniques such as load testing, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery.
course_learning_outcomes:
The Enterprise Application Design module covers the fundamentals of enterprise application design, including its importance and impact on business operations. Students will learn how to gather and analyze requirements from stakeholders, and how to use this information to design enterprise applications that meet business needs.

The module introduces students to different types of enterprise application architectures, such as monolithic, microservices, and serverless architectures. Students will learn how to choose the appropriate architecture based on business requirements. Additionally, students will learn how to design application components, including modules, layers, and tiers. They will also learn how to design interfaces between components and ensure component reusability.

Designing data models for enterprise applications is also a key aspect of this module. Students will learn entity-relationship modelling, data normalization, and data storage options. Furthermore, the module covers user interface design basics for enterprise applications, with emphasis on designing user interfaces that are user-friendly, intuitive, and accessible.

The module also includes designing security and access controls for enterprise applications. Students will learn how to design authentication and authorization mechanisms, implement data encryption and decryption, and protect against common security threats.

Finally, the module covers designing enterprise applications for optimal performance, scalability, and resilience. Students will learn how to design for high availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery, and how to optimize application performance through caching, load balancing, and other techniques. Upon completion of this module, learners will have the necessary skills to design enterprise-level applications that meet business needs, using modern architecture styles and technologies
course_entry_req:
Academic Qualification - Minimum one credit in Nitech in STEM
English Proficiency- Minimum  IELTS 5.5 or its equivalent 
Experience: Complete Advanced Certificate in Software Development course or Minimum 1 year experience in software field

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$1,200.00

# subsidised course fee
$360.00

# course number of hours
40.50 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
At the end of the course, learners attaining the following Learning Outcomes is the objective of this course Knowledge: •	Understand the business requirements for enterprise applications using various tools and techniques. •	Gain understanding of the aspects in enterprise application designs that meet the needs of stakeholders, considering requirements, business processes, architecture, and security. •	Explain trade-offs between different design patterns, architectures, and technologies in the context of enterprise applications. •	Understand the principles of data modelling, user-centric design, and security to design application components for enterprise applications. •	Learn security and access controls to protect enterprise applications from threats and ensure data privacy.  Skills: •	Analyse business requirements and translate them into design specifications •	Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyse requirements and design enterprise applications that meet their needs. •	Develop project plans, including timelines, milestones, and deliverables, for enterprise application design projects. •	Use design tools and techniques, such as entity-relationship modelling, process mapping, and wireframing, to create effective application designs. •	Implement security and access controls, optimize application performance, and design for scalability and resilience •	Test and validate enterprise application designs using techniques such as load testing, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery. 

# course learning outcomes
The Enterprise Application Design module covers the fundamentals of enterprise application design, including its importance and impact on business operations. Students will learn how to gather and analyze requirements from stakeholders, and how to use this information to design enterprise applications that meet business needs.

The module introduces students to different types of enterprise application architectures, such as monolithic, microservices, and serverless architectures. Students will learn how to choose the appropriate architecture based on business requirements. Additionally, students will learn how to design application components, including modules, layers, and tiers. They will also learn how to design interfaces between components and ensure component reusability.

Designing data models for enterprise applications is also a key aspect of this module. Students will learn entity-relationship modelling, data normalization, and data storage options. Furthermore, the module covers user interface design basics for enterprise applications, with emphasis on designing user interfaces that are user-friendly, intuitive, and accessible.

The module also includes designing security and access controls for enterprise applications. Students will learn how to design authentication and authorization mechanisms, implement data encryption and decryption, and protect against common security threats.

Finally, the module covers designing enterprise applications for optimal performance, scalability, and resilience. Students will learn how to design for high availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery, and how to optimize application performance through caching, load balancing, and other techniques. Upon completion of this module, learners will have the necessary skills to design enterprise-level applications that meet business needs, using modern architecture styles and technologies


# course entry req
Academic Qualification - Minimum one credit in Nitech in STEM
English Proficiency- Minimum  IELTS 5.5 or its equivalent 
Experience: Complete Advanced Certificate in Software Development course or Minimum 1 year experience in software field

course_title: Sustainability Expert - Leading Change Towards Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Sustainability
course_title_cleaned: Sustainability Expert - Leading Change Towards Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Sustainability
course_objective: This course covers key aspects of ESG and change management, equipping professionals with the knowledge and tools to drive sustainability within organizations. It begins with understanding an organization’s sustainability needs, goal-setting using SMART principles, and applying Locke and Latham’s goal-setting theory. The ESG business environment is explored through global sustainability trends, the UN SDGs, and consumer behavior. Policies and frameworks, such as Singapore Green Plan 2030, Germany’s Climate Action Programme, and the European Green Deal, provide regulatory context. The curriculum includes analytical tools like the Modified BCG Matrix for sustainability and change management models such as ADKAR and McGuire’s persuasion model. It delves into ESG standards, including GRI, ISSB, and ISO 26000, alongside policies like Singapore’s Carbon Pricing Act and Europe’s carbon tax. Risk and opportunity management is addressed using scenario analysis, risk matrices, and mitigation strategies. Sustainability strategies are covered across environmental (ISO 14064-1, ISO 50001), social (ISO 26000, CSR plans), and governance (ISO 22301, ISO 37001) domains. Stakeholder engagement is emphasized through impact assessment models. The curriculum also includes ESG scoring methodologies, rating agencies, and sustainability marketing strategies, covering external communication and preventing greenwashing. Change resistance is examined using Maurer’s model, with strategies for overcoming resistance. Organizational resilience is fostered through the ADKAR and Kotter models, while conflict resolution is supported by the Thomas-Kilmann model. ESG reporting fundamentals, including materiality assessments and legal requirements, ensure compliance with global frameworks such as CSRD and SGX reporting standards.
course_learning_outcomes:
Change Management for ESG Sustainability Adoption
ESG Change Pre-Planning
ESG Change Risk and Opportunity Assessment
ESG Strategisation
ESG Action Planning
ESG External Communication
ESG Internal Communication
ESG Change Monitoring
ESG Change Management Conflict Resolution
ESG Reporting
course_entry_req: Diploma

course_title: Dental Care for People with Special Needs
course_title_cleaned: Dental Care for People with Special Needs
course_objective: This SkillsFuture funded course is a hands-on short course which will be of great benefit to anyone involved in the oral care of people with special needs such as the elderly and individuals with disabilities.  You will understand the challenges faced by this special group of people and learn how to provide holistic oral care for them.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, you will be able to:
• Understand the type of oral health problems commonly faced by people with special needs: dental decay, gum disease, dry mouth, tooth wear and mucosal diseases
• Appreciate the consequences of poor oral health on quality of life
• Identify barriers to dental care faced by the special needs population
• Demonstrate competency in delivery of basic oral hygiene
• Understand oral hygiene strategies and learn oral delivery techniques specific to patients who are wheelchair users, bedbound, PEG (Percutaneous Endoscopic Gastrostomy) and NG (Nasogastric) fed and those who demonstrate care-resistant behaviours
• Identify avenues to seek advanced oral health care for people with special needs
course_entry_req: English language proficiency at the professional working level.

course_title: HNWC1 - PRIVATE WEALTH AND FAMILY OFFICE - ENVIRONMENT, TRENDS AND CLIENT FOCUS  (FACE-TO-FACE)
course_title_cleaned: HNWC1 - PRIVATE WEALTH AND FAMILY OFFICE - ENVIRONMENT, TRENDS AND CLIENT FOCUS  (FACE-TO-FACE)
course_objective: IFPAS has developed the High Net Worth (HNW) Certification Course to help support our Members, and the broader financial advisory profession, respond to the rapidly changing environment and the increasing demand for quality financial advice.  We see an opportunity to establish a defined career path for financial practitioners and bancassurance specialists within the Institute of Banking and Finance (IBF) skills framework at level 2/3 within the Sales, After Sales, Distribution and Relationship Management career track, for a senior financial planner role.
course_learning_outcomes:
Across the region, there is a growing need for financial advisers to solve increasingly complex problems for their clients and family offices.

The HNW Certification combines international best-practice and local market case studies in family wealth management to equip advisers with the knowledge and expertise to implement a step-by-step process for providing quality financial advice to HNW individuals. 

Through scenario-based assessments, you will emerge with the knowledge and skills to design appropriate asset protection and wealth management strategies, in addition to a marketing and communication plan to attract, advise and retain these clients.

The HNW Certification combines the academic rigour of higher education theory with practical and relevant outcomes centred on financial planning best-practice. This professional certification represents the pinnacle of achievement, providing formal recognition of the highest standard of competence and skill within the financial advice discipline.

course_title: Customer Experience (CX) & Survey Design: Quantifying CX and User Sentiment
course_title_cleaned: Customer Experience (CX) & Survey Design  Quantifying CX and User Sentiment
course_objective: Ready to unlock the power of customer insights?   Learn how to define, track, and analyse key customer experience metrics with expertly crafted surveys and measurement strategies.   Explore the various types of questionnaires, sampling methods, and research instruments, equipping participants with the skills needed to gather actionable insights.   Participants will also explore metrics like Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) and Customer Effort Score (CES), understanding how to align them with broader business objectives and use feedback to drive actionable results.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this 2-day course, participants will be able to:

• Select appropriate Customer Experience (CX) metrics (Net Promoter Score, Customer Satisfaction Score, Customer Effort Score) aligned with strategic goals
• Design bias-free questionnaires using proven psychometric techniques
• Analyse survey data to identify customer sentiment and prioritise improvements
Implement continuous measurement frameworks to monitor experience over time

course_title: Food Safety Course Level 1 – Synchronous e-learning (Chinese)
course_title_cleaned: Food Safety Course Level 1 – Synchronous e-learning (Chinese)
course_objective: The Food Safety Course Level 1 is designed to equip Food Handlers with essential knowledge and skills to ensure food safety at every stage of food preparation and handling.  As of 1 July 2023, all Food Handlers, whether working in retail or non-retail food establishments licensed by SFA, must attain WSQ FSC Level 1. A Food Handler is defined as any person who handles and prepares food and beverages within food establishments licensed by SFA.  This course is suitable for individuals working in the food and beverage industry, including food handlers, kitchen staff, and anyone responsible for food safety compliance. Upon successful completion, participants will be able to apply best practices in food safety to enhance overall food quality and protect public health.
course_learning_outcomes:
On completion of the course, learners will have the knowledge and skills to apply:
1.Practice good personal hygiene
2.Use safe ingredients
3.Handle food safely
4.Store food safely
5.Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises

course_title: Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge (CCAK) (SF)
course_title_cleaned: Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge (CCAK) (SF)
course_objective: •	cloud security assessment methods and techniques and how to use them to evaluate a cloud service prior to and during the provision of the service and •	how to ensure that a cloud service is compliant with the company requirements and is aligned with the governance approach of the organization •	In addition, the CCAK will give those individuals with an auditing role and background the necessary knowledge to be able to update their expertise from on-prem IT security auditing to cloud and hybrid security auditing.
course_learning_outcomes:
CCAK™ is the first-ever, technical, vendor-neutral credential for cloud auditing. This certificate fills a gap in the industry for competent technical professionals who can help organizations mitigate risks and optimize ROI (Return on Investment) in the cloud.

The CCAK instructor-led training course curriculum consists of 5 major areas of coverage:
1.	Cloud Governance
2.	Cloud Compliance
3.	Cloud Auditing
4.	Cloud Assurance
5.	CSA (Cloud Security Alliance) Tools: CCM (Cloud Controls Matrix), CAIQ (Consensus Assessments Initiative Questionnaire) and STAR (Security, Trust, Assurance and Risk) Program

16.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
•	cloud security assessment methods and techniques and how to use them to evaluate a cloud service prior to and during the provision of the service and •	how to ensure that a cloud service is compliant with the company requirements and is aligned with the governance approach of the organization •	In addition, the CCAK will give those individuals with an auditing role and background the necessary knowledge to be able to update their expertise from on-prem IT security auditing to cloud and hybrid security auditing. 

# course learning outcomes
CCAK™ is the first-ever, technical, vendor-neutral credential for cloud auditing. This certificate fills a gap in the industry for competent technical professionals who can help organizations mitigate risks and optimize ROI (Return on Investment) in the cloud.

The CCAK instructor-led training course curriculum consists of 5 major areas of coverage:
1.	Cloud Governance
2.	Cloud Compliance
3.	Cloud Auditing
4.	Cloud Assurance
5.	CSA (Cloud Security Alliance) Tools: CCM (Cloud Controls Matrix), CAIQ (Consensus Assessments Initiative Questionnaire) and STAR (Security, Trust, Assurance and Risk) Program

course_title: Counselling on Ageing Family Issues (Classroom & Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Counselling on Ageing Family Issues (Classroom & Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: At the end of the course, participants will be able to build stronger relationships and communicate more effectively through self-awareness and counselling, understand common issues of the elderly, such as loneliness, isolation, poor health, intergenerational, and learn interventions to deal with these issues, understand challenges faced by caregivers and manage the dynamics of parties involved in the caregiving process, help families to face family issues with strength using Caregiver Family Therapy, understand and apply Bowen Family Systemic Theory to promote understanding and calm reflections within the family context and recommend ways to manage anxiety and stress in caregiving.
course_learning_outcomes: In this course, participants will learn to apply Gerontological Counselling in building trust and rapport with the elderly and their family members. This will further help participants to explore and understand their thoughts and feelings, and be able to identify and deal with the diverse issues experienced in a family. Bowen Family Systemic Theory will be taught to help one’s family work together better and keep anxieties low. Caregiver Family Therapy (CFT) will be introduced to participants as CFT is a treatment model that offers a framework for addressing the complex needs and issues of families. One of its components is Self-Care. Hence, the Biopsychosocial Model will be used to help participants to manage stress and prevent burnout while attending to the needs of the elderly and family caregiving issues.
course_entry_req:
• Undergraduate degree in any field from a recognised institution
• Working/volunteering with a non-profit organisation (NPO) of the social sector at the point of application

course_title: Operator Maintainer (OMer)
course_title_cleaned: Operator Maintainer (OMer)
course_objective: It is a continuous improvement course for existing bus captains to equip them with the appropriate skills to ensure that the bus is road worthy, manage onboard systems and route adherence, and analyse and mitigate onboard equipment failures during a service trip. This will help ensure the smooth running of Singapore’s public transport system.
course_learning_outcomes:
This module is specifically targeted at the public transport sector – bus captains.

Bus captains will have the opportunity to be trained under a centralised programme that aims to standardise maintenance skills, through a common course curriculum, course duration and controlled learning environment. 
After the training, Bus captains will be equipped with common basic maintenance skills and trouble-shooting knowledge for the bus types issued by LTA. Eventually, our objective is to upskill bus captains with additional technical knowledge and skills. This is part of our continued effort in improving bus safety and reliability. It also provides bus captains with future-ready skills and interest to pursue careers beyond driving.
course_entry_req:
This course is targeted at existing Bus Captains (BCs) with bus operators. They do possess sufficient knowledge of their job and the content, however, may not be practicing the required actions on a daily basis. This module is to reinforce the positive behaviours that they must incorporate into their everyday behaviour.

Therefore the entry requirements are:
●	Experienced Bus captain from PTOs
●	21 years old and above
●	Be able to listen, speak, read and write English (possess Level 3 and above in Workplace Literacy (WPL) skills as stated in the Employability Skills WSQ framework or equivalent) for those with no formal education

course_title: Understanding Law and Technology
course_title_cleaned: Understanding Law and Technology
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:  • Define what law is • Define the three ways in which law interacts with technology • Understand the difference between the three themes, i.e., legal technology (LegalTech), technology law, and impact of technology on law • Understand the basic features of Singapore’s legal system, including: constitutional structure and the process of making law; the common law system and the relationship between case law and statute; the hierarchy of courts and the doctrine of binding precedent; and the role of Organs of State in making, administering, and enforcing law • Understand how the legal system and fundamental legal principles constrain or enable legal innovation and the adoption of technology
course_learning_outcomes:
Technology is transforming all aspects of our lives, and law is no exception. Technology is changing the way we do law – LegalTech is transforming what our work processes and offices look like. At the same time, it is also producing new frontiers that need to be regulated by new laws. Comprising 9 modules built into 3 different pathways for business and legal professionals serving different job roles, this certificate programme is designed to allow participants to gain an understanding of the difference between LegalTech, technology law, and the impact of technology on existing laws. Participants will understand the current state of LegalTech and how to implement LegalTech in practice.

This module seeks to equip participants with the knowledge of current areas of existing law that are being heavily impacted by technological developments and the ability to navigate such changes.
course_entry_req:
Participant should have at least:
• a Bachelor's Degree or
• Diploma with at least 3 years working experience

course_title: Business Mandarin for Insurance Professionals (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Business Mandarin for Insurance Professionals (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This course aims to raise participants' confidence in communicating with their Chinese clients in Mandarin. Participants get to learn the vocabulary, nuances, and expressions that prevail in one’s profession particularly in Insurance.
course_learning_outcomes: This course is designed for insurance professionals seeking to excel in Mandarin-speaking markets. It provides a deep immersion in Mandarin language and culture, enabling effective communication with Chinese clients and stakeholders. In addition to mastering industry-specific Mandarin terminologies, participants also explore regulatory norms and market dynamics. The course incorporates advanced technologies, such as AI, for creating social media strategies and engaging Mandarin-speaking clients. Furthermore, it provides practical experiences, including the creation of a Mandarin Pitch Deck for real-world scenarios like consultations, market analysis, and legal discussions. By comprehending the Mandarin language, cultural nuances, and industry context, participants enhance their professional capabilities, fostering stronger client relationships. This course thus provides the necessary skills for professionals to capitalize on business opportunities in Mandarin-speaking markets and navigate the complexities of the Chinese insurance industry with confidence.

This course requires a basic understanding of Python. Participants who do not have the basic knowledge are encouraged to take up Fundamentals of Python Programming prior to this course.

course_title: (ACEY) Engage in Continuous Learning and Reflective Practice (Infant/Toddler Educarer, Beginning Educarer)
course_title_cleaned: (ACEY) Engage in Continuous Learning and Reflective Practice (Infant Toddler Educarer, Beginning Educarer)
course_objective: Early childhood educators have a major influence in the lives of young children, and the use of many talents and skills are required in teaching. They are also expected to be models of communication and interpersonal skills in their interactions with children, parents and colleagues. Educarers need a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities, continuity in evaluating own performance and identifying needs for professional growth. This module focuses upon the professional knowledge and skills of early childhood educarers, identification of various modes of personal and professional development through continuous development and sharing their skills with others. They will learn to identify the importance of reflective practices in their personal and professional growth.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the module, participants should have:

1. The ability to understand:
a. The importance of continuous learning and reflective practice
b. Modes of continuing professional development
c. Methods of reflective practice

2. The ability to:
a. Identify learning needs to improve care and teaching practice
b. Demonstrate commitment to acquiring and maintaining professional
knowledge and to continuing professional development
c. Participate in various modes of continuing professional development to hone competence for engaging young children and families
d. Engage in reflective practice to improve care-giving and teaching
practice

3. The ability to:
a. Share information and knowledge obtained from participation in formal
professional development activities with colleagues
course_entry_req:

a. Minimum Secondary 4 education* or completed 10 years of formal education* and

b. At least an average SOA in the WPL series, including an SOA 5 for WPL-Writing

*Official documents are required to show completion of 10 years of education. Medium of instruction is to be in English.

course_title: Video Editing With AI Tools
course_title_cleaned: Video Editing With AI Tools
course_objective: In this practical, hands-on 3 day course at Intellisoft, we show you how to harness the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools to streamline and enhance your entire video editing workflow — from concept to completion.  Whether you're a beginner or have some video editing experience, this course will equip you with the skills to create professional-quality video content using smart, time-saving AI tools. You’ll work with a range of cutting-edge platforms to create, edit, enhance, and finalize video content with greater speed and creative control.  This practical course guides you to  Create AI-generated scripts that reflect your creative vision while adhering to content and copyright standards.  Edit and fine-tune scripts for tone, clarity, pacing, and audience engagement using AI-driven writing assistants.  Use AI to plan postproduction workflows, break down tasks into clear phases, set realistic timelines, and manage editing efficiently.  Refine your video footage using AI tools to enhance video quality, correct lighting, add transitions, and apply visual effects effortlessly.  Improve storytelling impact by adding captions, music, sound effects, and adjusting audio for maximum clarity.  Conduct final quality checks, ensuring your video meets technical standards such as resolution, color balance, and export settings for various platforms.  Fix common editing issues using AI features like background noise removal, object elimination, stabilization, and color correction.  Explore emerging AI tools, including automated voiceovers, avatar presenters, script-to-video generators, and AI-driven content repurposing tools for social media.  By the end of this course, you will be able to produce professional-looking videos in a fraction of the time it normally takes—ideal for marketing, training, social media, or corporate communication. This is a future-ready course designed to make video editing faster, smarter, and more accessible for everyone.
course_learning_outcomes:
You will learn to use Artificial Intelligence Tools (AI Tools) to perform Video Editing quickly and easily at Intellisoft. 

LU1: AI-generated scripts with creative alignment
-LO1 – Review and develop AI-generated scripts to identify necessary edits that align with creative and regulatory standards and requirements.
LU2: AI-assisted postproduction planning and timelines	
-LO2 – Develop postproduction work plans using AI tools to structure editing timelines and processes effectively.  
LU3: Footage quality and storytelling refinement	
-LO3 – Evaluate edited footage to enhance quality, storytelling, and emotional impact. 
LU4: Final output quality check	
-LO4 – Assess final video outputs to ensure AI-edited content meets technical requirements. 
LU5: Technical standards in AI edits	
-LO5 – Develop remedial actions to resolve issues according to industry quality standards.
LU6: Emerging AI tools for editing efficiency	
-LO6 – Facilitate integration of emerging AI technologies to optimize video editing quality and efficiency.  

In this engaging 3 day AI video editing course at Intellisoft, you will master AI tools to streamline the entire video editing process—from script to final cut.

Learn to:

Create AI-generated scripts that align with creative goals and meet content standards.

Plan postproduction workflows using AI to break down editing phases, set timelines, and manage tasks efficiently.

Enhance footage and storytelling with AI tools to refine visuals, improve sound, and add captions.

Conduct professional output checks—verifying resolution, audio, color grading, and quality.

Apply advanced AI edits to fix flaws, remove objects, and meet industry editing standards.

Explore the latest AI innovations like automated voiceovers, music generation, and more.

Produce polished, professional videos faster, smarter, and with greater creative control.
course_entry_req:
The learners must declare their working experience and academic qualifications that validates their basic knowledge.

Knowledge and Skills
• Able to operate computer functions with minimum Computer Literacy Level 2 based on ICAS Digital Technologies assessments.
• Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
• Positive Learning Attitude
• Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
• Minimum of 1 year of working experience.
• Minimum 18 years old
All applications will be reviewed and vetted by the course administrator to ensure suitability and authenticity of the documents. If any learner is deemed not suitable, he/she will not be admitted to the course.

course_title: Certified Scrum Product Owner (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Scrum Product Owner (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Every high-functioning Agile team that you see has a well-trained Product Owner making critical product decisions. The industry today is ripe with endless opportunities for Product Owners. With 90% of modern teams using Scrum, the demand for Certified Scrum Product Owners (CSPO) has seen a steep rise. This course aims to equip you with the essential tools and skills necessary to excel as a Product Owner in the Scrum framework. It offers a practical and immersive learning experience that accelerates your knowledge and expertise. Techniques are explored to improve communication skills, particularly with non-Scrum Team stakeholders, and methods are explored to build deeper understanding and empathy.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:
•	LO1. Examine the impact of emerging market trends and digital disruptors to identify new opportunities and leverage market conditions and needs
•	LO2. Collaborate with experts and innovators to conceptualise, define and set clear product requirements for new products or features to address market needs
•	LO3. Develop and evaluate business model prototypes and incubation plan for the new product
•	LO4. Develop an actionable product roadmap to manage and bring a range or portfolio of products to market
•	LO5. Combine data on competitor, consumer and technology trends to determine their impact on the product
•	LO6. Predict future product performance and requirements 
•	LO7. Propose strategies to maintain or improve product performance
course_entry_req:
The learner should:
- Be able to speak, listen, read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6
- Be well-versed in Microsoft Office applications, especially Word, and 
- Be proficient with the use of a Windows laptop or MacBook. 

*Learners who do not meet the education requirements but have at least 3 years of relevant work experience can be accepted on a case-by-case basis subject to approval by the Management Representative.

course_title: Analytics for Better Health
course_title_cleaned: Analytics for Better Health
course_objective: This  course aims to introduce the data analytics techniques that are commonly needed for healthcare data and healthcare problems. We will investigate the unique challenges and considerations of implementing data analysis for healthcare problems. This will be followed by a focus on developing predictive models for various healthcare applications. We will cover the commonly used predictive machine learning models, their learning mechanisms and  methods to picking the most suitable model. In the second half of the course, we will  focus on the conduct of causal inference studies with retrospective healthcare data. Various causal inference techniques will be introduced.  Students will  gain hands-on experience of all the introduced concepts throughout the course.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the course, participants will be able to:

1.  Evaluate analytics results to determine their impact on business value in the healthcare sector 

2. Elaborate the key elements to build a successful healthcare analytics solution. 

3. Summarise the common data source in healthcare 

4. Outline the commonly used data collection, data cleansing in healthcare analytics techniques. 

5. Analyse the key problems and challenges in the healthcare clinical analytics area. 

6. Apply the concepts and techniques to conduct causal inference studies with retrospective healthcare data
course_entry_req:
• Bachelor’s degree
• Relevant public health related work experience
• Prior knowledge of statistics/ biostatsitcs is required
• Candidates with other qualifications and experience may be considered on a case by case basis, subject to approval

# course objective
This  course aims to introduce the data analytics techniques that are commonly needed for healthcare data and healthcare problems. We will investigate the unique challenges and considerations of implementing data analysis for healthcare problems. This will be followed by a focus on developing predictive models for various healthcare applications. We will cover the commonly used predictive machine learning models, their learning mechanisms and  methods to picking the most suitable model. In the second half of the course, we will  focus on the conduct of causal inference studies with retrospective healthcare data. Various causal inference techniques will be introduced.  Students will  gain hands-on experience of all the introduced concepts throughout the course.

# course learning outcomes
Upon completion of the course, participants will be able to:

1.  Evaluate analytics results to determine their impact on business value in the healthcare sector 

2. Elaborate the key elements to build a successful healthcare analytics solution. 

3. Summarise the common data source in healthcare 

4. Outline the commonly used data collection, data cleansing in healthcare analytics techniques. 

5. Analyse the key problems and challenges in the healthcare clinical analytics area. 

6. Apply the concepts and techniques to conduct causal inference studies with retrospective healthcare data

course_title: Developing Advanced Machine Learning Applications with  Python and Tensorflow
course_title_cleaned: Developing Advanced Machine Learning Applications with  Python and Tensorflow
course_objective: Embark on a transformative journey with our WSQ-endorsed Pattern Recognition with Deep Learning course. You will delve into core concepts such as neural networks, feature extraction, and machine learning algorithms. Through hands-on projects and case studies, you'll gain practical experience in recognizing patterns and applying deep learning techniques to various types of data.  By the end of this course, you'll have a robust skill set in pattern recognition using deep learning methods. Whether you're a data scientist looking to specialize, or a professional in fields requiring complex data analysis, this course will empower you with the expertise to make insightful, data-driven decisions.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcome:
- Understand and code CNN models for image recognition
- Diagnose overfitting issues in image recognition and propose methods to overcome the issues.
- Perform functional API coding based on a selected model.
- Implement transfer learning to fine tune the image recognition models.
- Understand code RNN models and word embedding for text recognition

Course Outline:
Topic 1 Image Recognition with CNN

Introduction to Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
Convolution & Pooling
Build a CNN Model for Image Recognition

Topic 2 Overfitting for Small Datasets

Overfitting and Underfitting
Methods to Solve Overfitting
Small Dataset Overfitting Issue
Data Augmentation & Dropout

Topic 3 Functional Keras API

What is Functional API
Create Sequential Model with Functional API
Create Non-Sequential Models with Functional API

Topic 4 Transfer Learning for Small Datasets

Introduction to Transfer Learning
Pre-trained Models
Transfer Learning on Small Dataset

Topic 5 Text Classification with RNN

Introduction to Recurrent Neural Network (RNN)
Types of RNN Architectures
LSTM and GRU
Word Embedding
Build a RNN Model for Text Classification
course_entry_req:

•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience. 
•	Minimum 18 years old

course_title: Assessment of Employee Well-being and Implementation of Behavioural Intervention Programmes
course_title_cleaned: Assessment of Employee Well-being and Implementation of Behavioural Intervention Programmes
course_objective: At the end of the course, participants will be able to: 1. Describe the use of health screening and other related tools in the assessment of employee well-being. 2. Employ Total Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) principles to implement behavioural intervention programmes.
course_learning_outcomes:
Total Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) is the Singapore framework to promote worker safety, occupational health, and wellness. It is an evolution of the traditional view that worker health is only about safety at the workplace. The framework encourages companies to view worker health holistically and provides guidance on the assessment of worker’s Total WSH needs as well as the implementation of intervention or preventive programmes.

Building on top of the Introduction to Total WSH as the foundation, this course allows participants to acquire the understanding and principles of health and related tools for employee wellbeing in an organisation. With this understanding, participants will then be able to implement behavioural intervention programmes by employing the tools of the Singapore Assessment-Intervention-Monitoring & Evaluation (A-I-ME) methodology as part of the Total WSH framework.
course_entry_req:
- Completed Introduction to Total Workplace Safety and Health (WSH)
- Bachelor’s degree
- Interest in public health related work
- Candidates with other qualifications and experience may be considered on a case by case basis, subject to approval

# course entry req
1. Minimum of 3 GCE ‘O’ Level credits, including English, Mathematics and at least 1 year of relevant working experience;
2. NITEC with GPA ≥ 3.5 OR 
                        GPA ≥ 3.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience; 
3. Higher NITEC with GPA ≥ 2.0 OR 
                                    GPA ≥ 1.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience;
4. NITEC in Services / Technology with GPA ≥ 3.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience;
5. Higher NITEC in Services / Technology with GPA ≥ 2.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience;
6. Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher), and at least 1 year of relevant working experience and Workplace Literary & Numeracy (WPLN) at Level ≥ 6.
7. Others - At least 2 years relevant work experience (subject to interview/assessment).
Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL)
Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered  base on supporting evidence of competency readiness.

course_title: WSQ: Perform Thermal Imaging with Drones
course_title_cleaned: WSQ  Perform Thermal Imaging with Drones
course_objective: Thermal imaging is a cutting-edge technology capable of capturing unique data sets that were previously difficult or impossible to acquire. Drones provide a platform for deploying these technologies in a safe, accessible, and cost-effective manner. For example - Security - Perimeter monitoring, detecting intruders, identifying suspicious activities. The demand for skilled professionals equipped with knowledge and expertise in drone-based thermal imaging is rapidly increasing. This presents a significant career opportunity for individuals seeking to specialize in this area.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will have practical experience with drone operations and thermal imaging to ensure that they can apply theoretical knowledge       in real-world scenarios as well as be trained on the latest software used for data analysis and interpretation in thermal imaging.

Learners will be taught the legal and safety regulations related to drone operations to ensure compliance and safe practices. They will also learn risk assessment and management techniques to handle potential hazards during drone operations.

Learners will be able to analyse and interpret data collected from thermal imaging to make informed decisions as well as develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address challenges encountered in the field.
course_entry_req: UAPL or WSQ Operate Drones up to 7kg conducted by Academy of Design Arts and Media Pte Ltd.

course_title: Little Learners, Big Feelings: Practical Classroom Strategies
course_title_cleaned: Little Learners, Big Feelings  Practical Classroom Strategies
course_objective: This interactive course is designed to help early childhood educators create calm, engaging, and responsive classroom environments. Grounded in child development and evidence-based strategies, this training transcends traditional disciplines, focusing on proactive management, emotional connection, and positive guidance. Participants will explore the root of child behaviour, learn to design effective routines and environments, and practise strategies for redirecting challenging behaviours, employing empathy and consistency. This course will feature real-world examples, collaborative discussions, and hands-on practical activities to help participants build a personalised classroom management toolkit. Participants will also reflect on their practices and learn how to strengthen relationships with children and families to support children’s growth. Whether participants are new to the field or looking to refresh their teaching and learning strategies, this course is designed to offer practical, immediately usable strategies for thriving in a preschool setting. This course is targeted for pre-service or in-service preschool educators teaching children from birth to 3 years.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, participants will
1. Describe key developmental milestones and typical behavioural characteristics of preschool-aged children.
2. Explain how environmental factors, routines, and transitions influence behaviours of preschool children
3. Identify common behaviour challenges and appropriate management strategies.
4. Analyse the effectiveness of different classroom management approaches using case studies and real-world examples. 
5. Develop an individualised classroom management toolkit that incorporates visual supports, clear expectations, and conflict resolution techniques.
6. Reflect on personal practices and formulate strategies for consistent, empathetic responses to challenging behaviours.
course_entry_req: Basic English Proficiency

course_title: Leading SAFe with Certified SAFe Agilist
course_title_cleaned: Leading SAFe with Certified SAFe Agilist
course_objective: Upon completing the Leading SAFe course, financial services learners will be expected to apply the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) to scale Lean and Agile development in the enterprise. They will also be able to apply a Lean-Agile mindset and principles, and Human Centric Design Thinking to maximize the Business Value.  Learners will be able to plan and successfully execute Program Increments and release Value through Agile Release Trains. They will be able to build an Agile portfolio with Lean-Agile Budgeting and thrive in the digital age. They will describe SAFe as an operating system for Business Agility and explain the Seven Core Competencies of Business Agility.  Furthermore, learners will embrace the Lean-Agile Mindset and apply Lean and Agile at scale with the SAFe Principles. They will form cross-functional Agile Teams and organize Agile Release Trains (ARTs) around the flow of value. They will apply Customer Centricity with Design Thinking and prioritize the Program Backlog.  Additionally, learners will be able to participate in PI Planning and develop on Cadence while releasing on Demand. They will build a Continuous Delivery Pipeline with DevOps and define a SAFe portfolio. They will connect the portfolio to Enterprise strategy, maintain the Portfolio Vision, establish portfolio flow, fund Value Streams, lead by example, and lead the change.
course_learning_outcomes:
As financial services are facing increasing disruption in the marketplace, many executives are turning to the Scaled Agile paradigm to become lean-agile businesses and remain competitive. Leading SAFe training is a valuable tool for any financial services company looking to adopt this framework.
Through this two-day course, attendees will gain an understanding of the principles underlying SAFe, including Lean, systems thinking, Agile development, product development flow, and DevOps. They will learn how to establish team and technical agility and reorganize their work around the flow of value. Additionally, participants will gain insight into implementing a Lean Portfolio Management function within their enterprise to effectively link strategy and execution.
The course emphasizes the importance of adopting a customer-centric mentality and a Design-Thinking approach to Agile Product Delivery. Attendees will also learn how to facilitate and carry out PI Planning events and manage Agile Release Trains (ARTs).

course_title: Certified Usability Analyst (CUA) (SF) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Usability Analyst (CUA) (SF) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Module 1 - User Experience (UX) Foundations: How good user experience design is dependent on a scientific understanding of how people function. How the key research-based models, insights, and principles in the UX field impact design. This includes aspects of human: •	Vision •	Intellect •	Memory •	Motor control  Various methods that directly apply these models, insights, and principles to design of interactive applications. Variation in users that impact design. Understand the challenges of survey design •	Individual differences •	Disability •	Cultural differences Sources of research and insights for UX professional. How to tell if you can believe the research. Pathways to excellence in the UX profession Module 2 -User-Centered Analysis and Conceptual Design:  •	Develop a design strategy •	Create user profiles, personas and scenarios •	Develop meaningful interview questions •	Carry out effective interviews •	Understand the challenges of survey design •	Analyze task flow •	Understand and identify primary nouns •	Develop user-driven information architecture •	Engage in user-centered task/tool redesign  Module 3 – The Science and Art of Effective Web and Application Design: •	Identify, select, and implement appropriate navigation models used to build intuitive navigation structures •	Make better decisions and recommendations to improve visual design, including: layout, color, graphics and icons, and text. •	Implement effective usability-based content organization and treatment methods •	Ensure intuitive interaction through appropriate UI control selection and error and feedback design •	Increase design efficiency using Web and application standards •	Extend their UCD sphere of influence into the domains of user experience, accessibility, and cross-cultural design  Module 4 - Practical Usability Testing: •	Survey the scope of usability issues •	Know the four factors that drive your testing •	Know the appropriate test and when to use it
course_learning_outcomes:
These 4 modules, 7-day accelerated program teaches research-based principles of designing interfaces from the perspective of the end user. Learn how to perform data gathering, task analysis, and usability testing. Pinpoint the usability problems and offer design solutions. The usability analyst brings the critical success factor to bear throughout the development life cycle.
HFI-Certified Usability Analysts pass an examination demonstrating their mastery of the fundamental principles of user-centered design. The following HFI courses provide a solid foundation in this knowledge. This course is applicable to all sectors and contextually  relevant to other sectors deploying digital channels to reach and serve their customers.
course_entry_req: There are no prerequisites to take this course.

course_title: Unlocking the Power of Google Analytics (GA4) for Advanced Web Analytics
course_title_cleaned: Unlocking the Power of Google Analytics (GA4) for Advanced Web Analytics
course_objective: Embark on a journey to become proficient in using Google Analytics 4 (GA4) for market research with this comprehensive WSQ-endorsed course. The curriculum focuses on navigating the GA4 interface, tracking user behavior, and analyzing audience segments for data-driven insights. In addition, you’ll get to engage in real-world scenarios and hands-on exercises, ensuring that the knowledge you acquire is both theoretical and practical.  By the conclusion of this course, you'll be adept at using Google Analytics 4 for a variety of market research applications. You'll be capable of setting up custom tracking configurations, interpreting complex data sets, and making informed business decisions based on analytics. Whether you're a marketing professional or an entrepreneur, this course will give you the analytical tools needed to succeed in the ever-evolving digital landscape.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
- determine data types and identify data sources using Google Analytics analytical tool
- analyze market trends using Google Analytics reports to gather data and determine variables
- analyze customer behavior and dynamics using explorations and forecasting techniques
- evaluate the effectiveness of marketing efforts using modeling techniques, indicators, events and conversions.

Course Outline:
Topic 1: Get Started on Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
- Overview of Google Analytics 4
- Types of  data
- Identify data sources

Topic 2: Market Research
- Acquisition, engagement, retention reports - develop questions to gather data
- Monetization, demographics and tech reports – analyse market trends and industry development

Topic 3: Explorations and Analysis
- Using Explorations to analyse customer behaviour and business outcomes
- Using Funnel Visualization Analysis to analyse customer and competitor - dynamics

Topic 4: Evaluation
- Statistical model comparison
- Setup Events and Conversions to interpret future demands
- Evaluate marketing effectiveness

•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience. 
•	Minimum 18 years old

course_title: TikTok Affiliate Marketing: Driving Engagement and Traffic
course_title_cleaned: TikTok Affiliate Marketing  Driving Engagement and Traffic
course_objective: "Unlock the strategic potential of digital marketing in the era of short-form content with our course that has been designed for forward-thinking marketing professionals, innovative content creators, and ambitious entrepreneurs. Dive deep into the art and science of monetising digital landscapes by mastering platform-specific strategies that transform creative content into powerful revenue streams.  Acquire hands-on experience in developing targeted communication frameworks, constructing optimal affiliate portfolios, and deploying marketing campaigns that maximize visibility and impact. Through structured learning activities, you will cultivate expertise in identifying emerging trends, understanding platform-specific policies, and creating integrated marketing communication strategies that drive meaningful results across digital affiliate channels.  This course enables you to implement affiliate marketing strategies that align seamlessly with your organization’s overall marketing objectives whilst incorporating proven techniques to analyze campaign performance and optimize ROI. You will become proficient in navigating complex digital landscapes, developing strategic partnerships with creators, and applying sophisticated performance metrics to refine and elevate your affiliate marketing approach."
course_learning_outcomes:
"Learners will apply principles and techniques of affiliate marketing to develop effective digital marketing strategies, focusing on platform-specific guidelines, communication frameworks, and creating structured campaigns with measurable outcomes. They will design affiliate marketing approaches based on understanding TikTok’s unique ecosystem, including content creation, creator partnerships, and strategic positioning of products and services within the platform’s dynamic environment.

Learners will develop targeted communication strategies to maximise visibility and engagement, incorporating advanced techniques for constructing affiliate portfolios and identifying optimal creator partnerships. They will explore integrated marketing communication approaches, understanding how to position products and services effectively across TikTok’s affiliate channels whilst maintaining alignment with organisational marketing objectives.

Learners will analyse marketing performance metrics to optimise campaign effectiveness through interpreting engagement data, creator performance, and return on investment indicators. They will evaluate outcomes using established assessment criteria for affiliate marketing success, identify high-performing strategies, and determine optimal interventions across different marketing contexts. Participants will apply methodologies for tracking and interpreting marketing performance, continuously improving affiliate marketing approaches and providing strategic insights for campaign optimisation."
course_entry_req:
• Possess minimally a ‘N’ Level and/or listen, speak, read, and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 4.
• Use numeracy skills equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 3.
• For learners without the prerequisite, they will be allowed to be accepted in the course, should they possess a minimum of 1 year of relevant working experience.

course_title: Intermediate Cybersecurity Risk Management (Synchronous and Asynchronous Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Intermediate Cybersecurity Risk Management (Synchronous and Asynchronous Learning)
course_objective: This course aims to equip learners to understand and describe different techniques for risk assessment and analysis, and how these exercises help optimize an organization’s security posture subject to budgetary constraints. Furthermore, learners will learn about the role of security audits and business continuity plans to achieve proper cybersecurity risk management.   At the end of the course, learners will be able to:   1. Explain the usage of typical conceptual tools used for risk analysis. 2. Explain security management from a risk management perspective.   3. Describe practical mechanisms for managing risk.   4. Analyse real world case studies from the perspective of cybersecurity risk management.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course introduces the concept of viewing cybersecurity through the lens of risk management. Specifically, learners will gain an understanding of how an organisation should determine its allocation of resources for security based on risk assessment. This approach enables an organisation to optimise its security measures within the constraints of its budget and other available resources, all while effectively aligning with its business objectives and compliance requirements. Accordingly, the course provides a comprehensive overview of the key conceptual tools necessary for conducting risk analysis. 
Furthermore, the course delves deeper into advanced subjects, providing detailed insights into the role of cyber threat intelligence and audits in the context of cybersecurity risk management. Additionally, it covers the process of business continuity planning, essential for managing security events of high intensity that could potentially disrupt normal business operations.
course_entry_req:
This course is suitable for participants working/ intending to work in the
cybersecurity industry. Prior knowledge in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) modules will be an advantage.

course_title: My Microbes and me, in Sickness and in Health
course_title_cleaned: My Microbes and me, in Sickness and in Health
course_objective: The workshop aims to educate/equip participants with knowledge and basic skills in the following healthcare topics: 1. Introduction to what microbiomes are 2. Bacterial DNA (metagenomic) sequencing 3. Microbiomes effect on health (development) and disease 4. Probiotics and prebiotics in food 5. Technics to prepare home-made probiotic drinks 6. Influence of skin microbiomes on beauty and home hygiene 7. Appreciation of microbiome research in science/medicine  Training will be conducted in the form of seminars (small group lectures with Question and Answer), laboratory demonstrations and hands-on preparation of probiotic drinks.  At the end of the course, the participants should be able to effectively communicate the following: 1. What comprises a microbiome and where these microbial communities can be found 2. The principles of microbiome sequencing 3. The importance of microbiomes in human development and disease 4. The difference between prebiotics and probiotics and their benefits in diet 5. Recipes for probiotics cultures/drinks and main principles 6. Recognize the role of microbes in beauty and in hygiene 7. Application of microbiome research in the local science and healthcare scene
course_learning_outcomes: Our microbiomes, the communities of microscopic organisms that live in and on us, shape our development from birth and play a pivotal role in both health and disease. Our microbiomes can be nurtured through everyday choices, including consumption of probiotics, prebiotics and antibiotics, and have a bearing on how gracefully we mature and age.
course_entry_req:
Proficient in English
Basic biology (secondary level) or relevant experience in microbiome-related industry/work/hobbies

Influence of skin microbiomes on beauty and home hygiene 7. Appreciation of microbiome research in science/medicine  Training will be conducted in the form of seminars (small group lectures with Question and Answer), laboratory demonstrations and hands-on preparation of probiotic drinks.  At the end of the course, the participants should be able to effectively communicate the following: 1. What comprises a microbiome and where these microbial communities can be found 2. course_title: Enhancing Banking & Finance with AI: Tools & Risk Management for Executives
course_title_cleaned: Enhancing Banking & Finance with AI  Tools & Risk Management for Executives
course_objective: Data are a key and critical competitive component of all businesses. Data-driven technologies such as Data Science (DL), Machine Learning (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI) help translate data into competitive advantages for many businesses and enterprises, including those in banking and finance. A good understanding of these technologies and their real-world business applications are now critical skills and knowledge of all business executives. This course spans 3 days, with the first 2 days dedicated to building foundational knowledge of AI technology in financial services and the third day emphasizing practical skills. Day 1: Understanding of Technology • Overview of the AI industry, including trends and future directions. • Exploration of AI use cases in financial services. • Introduction to data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence concepts. • Detailed discussion on AI algorithms and specific use cases. • Introduction to Supervised and Unsupervised Learning techniques. • Overview of Reinforcement Learning and its applications. Day 2: Understanding of Technology • Overview of Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing. • Introduction to Large Language Models, such as those used in chatbots and virtual assistants. • Machine learning demo/practical session. • Guest speaker session for industry insights. • Additional segment on the application of AI in banking and finance. • Quiz and assessment to evaluate participants' understanding. Day 3: AI Risk Management • Emerging AI-related cyber crime risks, including adversarial AI, deep fake fraud, phishing, synthetic identities, etc. • AI Ethical Issues, including transparency and black box issues, AI biases, data privacy, societal implications of AI deployment, etc. • Case Discussions involving ethical dilemmas and best practices. • Overview of current and upcoming regulations related to AI. • Understanding of and strategies, frameworks, and tools in managing AI Risks.
course_learning_outcomes:
The objective of this course is to equip business, finance, and banking executives with:

1)	A foundation understanding of the data science, machine learning, and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies.

2)	Knowledge about the way these technologies work and solve real world issues.

3)	A broad understanding of their applications in banking, finance, and other commercial settings.

4)	Identification of AI risks and ethical issues.

5)	Strategies, frameworks, and tools to assess and mitigate risks in AI projects.



The course is specially designed for business executives and working adults without STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) background or coding/programming language skills.



A large variety of use cases involving financial institutions, fintechs, and other businesses will be used to inspire the participants in adopting the technologies to drive innovation, productivity, and efficiency in their workplace.

course_provider: BELLS INSTITUTE OF HIGHER LEARNING PTE. LTD.
course_title: (SCTP) Agentic AI Specialist
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) Agentic AI Specialist
course_objective: Upon completion of this course, learners will be able to: Explain the fundamentals of Generative AI, covering practical uses and ethical considerations across industries. Define Agentic AI, differentiate it from general automation and traditional machine learning models. Evaluate Agentic AI’s application in SMEs through real-world case studies and examples. Compare and contrast AI agents and traditional automation tools in terms of autonomy, adaptability, and decision-making capabilities. Set up a complete AI development environment with the necessary tools, libraries, and API integrations. Construct and execute SQL queries to retrieve, manipulate, and manage data in relational databases, and integrate SQL with Python. Describe the architecture and training processes of large language models and identify their practical use cases. Design effective prompts using zero-shot, few-shot, and chain-of-thought prompting techniques. Build simple LangChain applications by integrating Chains, Agents, Memory, and Tools for real-world AI interactions. Connect and interact with external data sources via APIs and integrate RelevanceAI to process and retrieve vector-based data. Embed AI agents into web applications and connect RelevanceAI-powered outputs with frontend interfaces. Automate business tasks and workflows using AI agents and RelevanceAI’s automation tools. Identify inefficiencies in traditional industries and propose relevant AI agent solutions using RelevanceAI and n8n tools. Formulate and document strategic AI adoption plans that improve SME operations. Design and implement end-to-end AI workflows using the n8n platform for specific business use cases. Build and test AI agents tailored to specific job roles within SMEs using n8n. Develop and present digital transformation strategies using AI agents to drive SME growth and innovation. Design AI project plans with ROI projections and explain financial viability. Plan and communicate AI implementation
course_learning_outcomes: This comprehensive course equips learners with the knowledge and practical skills to leverage Generative AI and Agentic AI technologies within small and medium-sized enterprises. Beginning with foundational concepts of AI, the course progresses through advanced topics including large language models, prompt engineering, and LangChain applications for real-world business interactions. Participants will gain hands-on experience setting up AI development environments, constructing SQL queries integrated with Python, and building context-aware applications using RelevanceAI's platform. The curriculum emphasizes practical business applications, teaching learners to identify inefficiencies in traditional industries and implement tailored AI solutions that drive growth and innovation. By the end of the course, participants will be able to develop complete digital transformation strategies with ROI projections and implementation plans, positioning them to confidently lead AI adoption initiatives within their organizations.

Obtained at least Grade C6 in GCE 'O' Level English Language, or
Be able to listen, speak, read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to WSQ Workplace Literacy (WPLN) Level 5.

Minimum Age Required:
21

course_title: (SCTP) ADVANCED DIPLOMA IN FASHION TECHNOLOGY (Full-time) (TA-eligible)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) ADVANCED DIPLOMA IN FASHION TECHNOLOGY (Full-time) (TA-eligible)
course_objective: Advanced Diploma in Fashion Technology caters to the individual who wants the full suite of skills and knowledge needed to break into the Fashion Retail Industry.  A holistic learning experience, one part of the programme guides students through each step in the business of fashion - from creating your brand, to utilising digital marketing to sell your products. This programme will also provide the fundamentals of quality assurance, merchandise planning, sourcing, tracking and costing of materials for your collection, allowing you to gain an insight into the key financials of your business.   The other part of the programme will deep-dive into technical skills like drafting, sewing, draping, pattern-making, quality control, AI applications and apparel development techniques. Your new-found skills will also be coupled with the latest in digital and virtual prototyping technologies, preparing you for the future of Fashion Retail.   AI-driven tools are embedded throughout: from generative design in collections to predictive analytics for costing and consumer insights in branding and business planning.  With the Advanced Diploma programme, you'll gain the tools needed to create and sustain your label while confidently navigating the demands of this dynamic industry.
course_learning_outcomes:
1. Learn to build your influencer brand and connect authentically on social media.
2. Understand garment construction techniques, seams, and production communication.
3. Create virtual samples and patterns using 3D prototyping software.
4. Evaluate design viability and negotiate costs effectively.
5. Learn to evaluate garment fit and make precise pattern alterations.
6. Build your own fashion brand with branding, marketing, and positioning strategies.
7. Learn hands-on draping techniques to create 3D patterns from fabric.
8. Draft and sew skirts and pants using professional methods.
9. Learn to draft and sew a variety of basic top patterns.
10. Create a full design collection aligned with trends and consumer demands.
11. Digitally illustrate fashion designs using Adobe Illustrator.
12. Master production tracking and risk management in fashion supply chains.
13. Learn fabric types, weaving, dyeing, and textile troubleshooting.
14. Attract and convert customers with inbound digital content marketing.
15. Accurately sketch garments for manufacturers to ensure smooth production.
16. Draft, sew, and construct casual knits like tees and shorts.
17. Understand quality control, product testing, and garment evaluation.
18. Build a sustainable brand by adopting eco-friendly fashion practices.
19. Run paid SEM ads to increase visibility and conversions on search engines.
20. Learn trend-based merchandise buying, planning, and budgeting.
21. Boost organic search ranking with keyword optimization and SEO tools.
22. Create impactful content and manage campaigns on Facebook and Instagram.
23. Learn global sourcing strategies, supplier selection, and trade compliance.
24. Master fast-track product development from design to buyer-ready samples.
25. Develop a solid fashion business plan with financials and market strategy.
course_entry_req:

SINGAPOREAN / SINGAPORE PR:•	GCE ‘A’ LEVEL WITH MINIMUM GRADE D FOR 3 SUBJECTS, INCLUDING ENGLISH AND MATHEMATICS; OR•	DIPLOMA IN APPAREL DESIGN AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT; OR•	DIPLOMA IN FASHION BUSINESS; OR•	DIPLOMA IN A RELEVANT FIELD•	POLYTECHNIC DIPLOMA IN A RELEVANT FIELDINTERNATIONAL STUDENTS:•	FORMAL INTERNATIONAL YEAR 12 EDUCATION•	QUALIFICATIONS FROM PROFESSIONAL INSTITUTES MAY BE CONSIDERED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS; AND•	PASS TEMBUSU ENTRANCE TESTALL STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO HAVE BASIC KNOWLEDGE OF COMPUTER AND MICROSOFT OFFICE.

21
