course_title: JLP - Translating Corporate Governance Principles into Legal Frameworks
course_title_cleaned: JLP - Translating Corporate Governance Principles into Legal Frameworks
course_objective: This training module is designed to equip young lawyers with the skills to advise clients on corporate governance issues, and how to balance ethical considerations with the rights of relevant stakeholders, and to comply with the prevailing regulations.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this module, participants will be able to:

- Understand the importance and need for corporate governance in both private and public organizations.
- Identify the challenges faced by directors and boards, including balancing stakeholder expectations and ensuring compliance with legal and ethical standards.
- Understand the ethical considerations involved in corporate governance, with a focus on legal professionals' roles.
- Recognize the importance of compliance, policies, and procedures in ensuring good corporate governance and how these apply to business, legal, and corporate secretarial functions.
- Analyze the roles and responsibilities of various types of directors and understand key duties under common law and statutory regulations.
- Understand when and why directors need external advice, especially in legal matters, and the risks of not seeking expert guidance.
- Examine the difference in governance for publicly listed companies, including an understanding of the Corporate Governance Code.
- Explore the personal liabilities of directors, including their responsibilities during insolvency and issues related to piercing the corporate veil.
course_entry_req:
Language and literacy proficiency level; At least 'O' Level English
Target age group: above 21 years old
Prerequisite skills and knowledge: Legal professionals
Required years of experience in relevant domain: Less than 5 years of experience

course_title_cleaned: Personal Branding and Professional Growth in Marketing
course_objective: This module is designed to empower aspiring and established marketers to navigate their professional journeys with confidence, leveraging personal branding as a key tool for success in today's digital-first marketing industry. It offers a deep dive into personal branding and professional growth within the marketing function. It emphasises the importance of crafting a unique personal brand, enabling participants to distinguish themselves in a crowded field.   During the course, participants will acquire the skills needed to thrive in the fast-changing marketing function. Additionally, the module provides actionable strategies, tools for creating standout resumes, LinkedIn profiles, content calendars, and effective outreach messages to build a network.   Upon completion of the course, learners will be equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to build their online presence, develop engaging thought leadership content, and grow their professional networks.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
1. Acquire the skills to develop and enhance personal branding tailored to the digital marketing industry.
2. Create positioning in the digital marketing field to stand out and showcase unique value to potential employers or clients.
3. Explore interview techniques and strategies to confidently navigate job interviews. 
4. Gain insights into long-term career development planning, including strategies for advancement and success in the ever-evolving digital marketing landscape.
5. Learn effective networking skills to build valuable professional connections.
6. Develop a roadmap for continuous growth and success in digital marketing industry.
course_entry_req: Participants should have at least 2 years of working experience.

course_title: Mastercard Cybersecurity Tools (Synchronous and Asynchronous Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Mastercard Cybersecurity Tools (Synchronous and Asynchronous Learning)
course_objective: In this module you will have the opportunity to become a Certified Cryptocurrency Examiner and learn how to monitor the Crypto Blockchain, learn about the technology behind Singpass and biometric identification and see what a hacker sees when they evaluate the cyber hygiene or profile vulnerabilities of a potential victim to compromise.  At the end of the course, learners will be able to:  1. Identify the tools and products for threat analysis.   2. Describe the process of sourcing intelligence.  3. Investigate and evaluate potential indicators of security compromise.
course_learning_outcomes:
The proficiency in utilising tools and third-party external products is pivotal for Threat Analysts in their pursuit of intelligence gathering, investigating, and assessing potential indicators of compromise. These resources empower analysts to effectively combat emerging threats and enhance the security posture of their organizations. 
This course is specifically tailored to meet the needs of current Information Technology (IT) professionals who seek to elevate their skills and knowledge within the domains of cyber and data governance. It is particularly well-suited for those with aspirations to become experts within the banking and finance sector. Additionally, it caters to professionals in industries that engage in e-business interactions with the banking and financial sector. 
By enrolling in this course, learners gain access to a comprehensive toolkit that equips them with the competencies required to excel in the role of a Threat Analyst. They will learn how to harness these tools and third-party solutions to efficiently gather, analyze, and act upon cyber threat intelligence, contributing significantly to the robustness of their organization's cybersecurity defenses and ensuring the safety and integrity of digital interactions within their sector.
course_entry_req: This course is suitable for cybersecurity analysts, information system auditors, law enforcement, security architects, system designers, and system administrator. Learners are expected to have basic knowledge in cybersecurity, cybersecurity risk management and cryptography before taking this module.

course_title: VTCT (ITEC) Level 1 Award in Mental Health Awareness
course_title_cleaned: VTCT (ITEC) Level 1 Award in Mental Health Awareness
course_objective: This purpose of the qualification is to provide learners with an understanding of mental health and wellbeing. Learners will develop an awareness of a range of mental health conditions, the factors affecting mental health and the impact of mental health from a global, individual and workplace perspective. Learners will develop an understanding of what constitutes good mental health and mental ill-health and how to recognise the signs and symptoms of a number of mental health conditions. Learners will also develop an awareness of the types of support available for mental health conditions and how to access them.
course_learning_outcomes: On completion of this unit, learners will understand what is meant by mental health, develop an awareness of the effects of mental health conditions, develop an awareness of the types of support for people with mental health conditions.

course_title: Sound Mixing for Digital Content
course_title_cleaned: Sound Mixing for Digital Content
course_objective: This beginner-friendly course provides a comprehensive introduction to audio production, covering key skills in sound design, immersive mixing, and digital audio workstations.   You'll gain hands-on experience in recording, editing, mixing, and mastering, using industry-standard tools to create polished audio content.   Whether you're interested in music, film, or game audio, these skills are highly sought after in today's media landscape, opening doors to roles in content creation, audio engineering, and sound design.   By mastering these techniques, you'll enhance your employability and position yourself for job advancement in the creative industries.            Ideal for those looking to kickstart or pivot their careers in audio production for Digital Content
course_learning_outcomes:
Gain a solid understanding and application,  of the core principles behind                     
1.Sound Design                                                                                   
2. Immersive Mixing &
3. Digital Audio Workstations.  
                                  
This course will equip you with the skills to create impactful audio experiences, from - 

1.Ideation 
2.Recording, 
3.Editing, 
4.Mixing, and 
5.Mastering.   
                                                                                                    
You’ll learn to use both software and hardware tools to manipulate sounds, add effects, and craft cohesive compositions tailored for music, films, video games, podcasts, and more.  
                                                      
By the end of this program, you'll be able to evoke emotions, tell compelling stories, and enhance the quality of any audio project.
course_entry_req:
Learners are expected to:
• Have at least a minimum of 2 GCE N Level subject passes or its equivalent or in the absence of this - 
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WSQ Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5
• Have a medium level of computer literacy (be able to navigate the internet for information and resources  , operate and work with the basics of the Windows operating system without supervision ) 
Learners who do not qualify in terms of education, literacy and/or numeracy but have at least 1 year of working experience in any industry will be admitted on a case-by-case basis, subject to approval by Bells Management Representative (MR).

course_title: Basic Orthopaedic Biomechanics - Part II
course_title_cleaned: Basic Orthopaedic Biomechanics - Part II
course_objective: This annual Basic Orthopaedic Biomechanics course started in year 2004 in conjunction with the Orthopaedic Advance Surgical Training Syllabus in Singapore. Starting in year 2009, this course is conducted in two parts. Orthopaedic trainees should take Part 1 and Part 2 on different years. Part 1 consists of bone mechanics, upper and lower limb mechanics and practical sessions. Part 2 consists of revision, spine mechanics, soft tissues and practical sessions. The objective of this course is to allow participants to understand the biomechanics of spine and soft tissues. With the appreciation of the engineering aspects of biomechanics, participants will be equipped to initiate research projects that interest them.
course_learning_outcomes:
Course Outline:
1. Precourse Assessment
2. Revision of Part I
3. Soft Tissue Mechanics
4. Gait Analysis
5. Biomechanics of Spine
course_entry_req: There are no formal entry requirements or prior qualifications needed.

course_title: Clean Energy Economics
course_title_cleaned: Clean Energy Economics
course_objective: This course will explore the core economic principles driving the clean energy transition, including cost dynamics, market structures, policy incentives, and investment considerations. Through a mix of facilitated learning, hands-on exercises, and peer discussions, the course will demystify the economics behind renewable energy technologies such as solar, wind, battery storage, and green hydrogen.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the session, participants will be able to :
•	Gain a Strategic Understanding of the Clean Energy Economy
•	Develop the ability to evaluate clean energy projects using key financial and economic tools, including Levelised Cost of Energy (LCOE), payback periods, and cost-benefit analysis.
•	Explore how subsidies, carbon pricing, and regulatory frameworks influence clean energy deployment and investment.
•	Learn from industry leaders and interact with peers across energy, finance, and policy sectors through facilitated discussions and group exercises
course_entry_req: There are no formal prerequisites for enrolment in this programme. As this programme is conducted in English, participants should be proficient in reading, writing, and communicating in English.

course_title: Content Marketing and Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)
course_title_cleaned: Content Marketing and Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)
course_objective: This module offers a comprehensive understanding of modern digital marketing, with a focus on integrating machine learning tools. Participants will gain proficiency in content ideation and development enhancing their ability to create content that resonates with target audiences.    During the course, the learners will learn effective content distribution strategies across various digital channels and platforms, and instructs on forming and nurturing online partnerships for collaborative efforts. Additionally, it delves into crafting compelling content aligned with marketing objectives. An emphasis is placed on mastering advanced Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) strategies, equipping participants with skills in using related tools and techniques.   By the end of the course, learners will be empowered with strategic expertise in content marketing, partnership building, and Search Engine Optimisation (SEO), culminating in measurable results and brand success.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
1. Understand content marketing's role in digital marketing with the integration of machine learning tools for content development.
2. Gain proficiency in content ideation and development, focusing on generating content that resonates with target audiences.
3. Acquire advanced skills in Search Engine Optimisation (SEO), content optimisation, understanding search engine algorithms, and enhancing online visibility.
4. Develop content distribution strategies across various digital channels and platforms to engage diverse audiences.
5. Build strategic content marketing partnership, focusing on measurable results and brand success, with the aid of analytics.

course_title: New Ventures in China (Enterprise Leadership for Transformation)
course_title_cleaned: New Ventures in China (Enterprise Leadership for Transformation)
course_objective: At the end of the 5-day programme, participants would be able to: 1.	Gain understanding in recognising opportunities 2.	Gain knowledge and perspective on best business practices 3.	Explore potentials for cross-collaboration with fellow and overseas small and medium enterprise (SME) owners
course_learning_outcomes:
As the world's second-largest economy, China is a tempting market for many businesses. In the first quarter of 2022, the Chinese economy grew by 4.8% (compared to the previous year), exceeding the market estimate of 4.4% and beating the previous period's 4.0% growth. China's economy is still rebounding, despite additional COVID-19 infections and geopolitical concerns.

With over 1.4 billion inhabitants, China is the world's most populous country, and it provides a massive market for businesses to tap into. Furthermore, China's economy has expanded rapidly in recent years and is likely to expand further. 
Favorable business climate because the Chinese government has sought to improve the country's business environment by reducing bureaucracy, improving infrastructure, and increasing financial access.
The Chinese economy is varied, with significant expansion across the board. This presents enterprises with a wide range of options as it positions itself as a leading commercial hub, bolstered by the Belt and Road Initiative, which has a favorable impact on its logistics industry.
course_entry_req: Must be an existing or former participant from the SMU-ELT Programme

With over 1.4 billion inhabitants, China is the world's most populous country, and it provides a massive market for businesses to tap into. Furthermore, China's economy has expanded rapidly in recent years and is likely to expand further. 
Favorable business climate because the Chinese government has sought to improve the country's business environment by reducing bureaucracy, improving infrastructure, and increasing financial access.
The Chinese economy is varied, with significant expansion across the board. This presents enterprises with a wide range of options as it positions itself as a leading commercial hub, bolstered by the Belt and Road Initiative, which has a favorable impact on its logistics industry.


# course entry req
 Must be an existing or former participant from the SMU-ELT Programme

course_title: Condition Monitoring Techniques for Distribution Switchgear & Transformer
course_title_cleaned: Condition Monitoring Techniques for Distribution Switchgear & Transformer
course_objective: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:  •	Understand fundamentals of partial discharge •	Perform partial discharge detection using condition monitoring diagnostic tools and instrument •	Apply condition monitoring techniques for distribution electrical assets
course_learning_outcomes:
•	History and development of condition monitoring
•	Overview of partial discharge (PD) theory
•	Common causes of PD and its effects
•	PD phenomenon before breakdown
•	Breakdown mechanism of insulation
•	Benefits of condition monitoring
•	Basic condition monitoring diagnostic tools and instruments 
•	Use acoustic and transient earth voltage (TEV) methods to detect PD
•	Review distribution switchgear cases on busbar, circuit breaker and cable termination compartments
•	Review distribution transformer cases on cable termination and dissolved gas analysis (DGA)
•	Case studies on diagnostic experience and root cause analysis
•	Practical hands-on using acoustic and TEV instruments

course_title: CompTIA Security+ (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: CompTIA Security+ (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The Cyber Security Essentials course provides an overview of the various domains of cyber security and covers the essential principles of Network Security; Compliance and Operational Security; Threats and Vulnerabilities; Application, Data and Host Security; Access Control and Integrity Management; and Cryptography. This course is an important stepping stone into understanding and applying the best cyber security practices. The course would equip the participants to take the Computing Technology Industry Association (CompTIA) Security+ certification exam. CompTIA Security+ is the certification globally trusted to validate foundational, vendor-neutral Information Technology (IT) security knowledge and skills.
course_learning_outcomes:
THREATS, ATTACKS & VULNERABILITIES (8 hours) 
- Detect various types of compromise and have an understanding of penetration testing and vulnerability scanning concepts. 
 
TECHNOLOGIES & TOOLS (8 hours) 
- Install, configure, and deploy network components while assessing and troubleshooting issues to support organizational security. 
 
ARCHITECTURE & DESIGN (6 hours) 
- Implement secure network architecture concepts and systems design. 
 
IDENTITY & ACCESS MANAGEMENT (6 hours) 
- Install and configure identity and access services, as well as management controls. 
 
RISK MANAGEMENT (6 hours) 
- Implement and summarize risk management best practices and the business impact. 
 
CRYPTOGRAPHY & public key infrastructure (PKI) (6 hours) 
- Install and configure wireless security settings and implement public key infrastructure
course_entry_req: A Polytechnic Diploma (or equivalent) in a technology or Information Technology (IT) related course.

course_title: Certified Climate Resilient Officer (CRO)
course_title_cleaned: Certified Climate Resilient Officer (CRO)
course_objective: With climate change accelerating, climate resilience has become a strategic necessity for corporations and urban cities alike. The Certified Climate Resilient Officer (CRO) course is a globally relevant programme designed to equip professionals with the critical competencies necessary for assessing climate risk, analysing the financial implications of climate-related threats, and integrating these insights into organisational planning and reporting.   Aligned with the latest international standards and frameworks, such as ISO 14091, the World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD), the Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Protocol, and the Science Based Targets Initiative (SBTi), this course combines foundational knowledge, real-world case studies, and a clear understanding of the CRO's vital role within a resilient organisation or city.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day programme, participants will be able to: 
 1. Explain key concepts in climate change science and climate resilience, identifying and assessing various climate risks and their implications across corporations and cities.  
 2. Analyse the financial impacts of climate change using structured risk assessment methodologies and evaluate the importance and requirements of climate risk disclosure within sustainability and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) reporting.
3. Apply major climate resilience frameworks and standards, including ISO 14091, Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Protocol, Climate Disclosure Standards Board (CDSB), Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB), and Science Based Targets Initiative (SBTi).
4. Develop strategies for adaptation and mitigation, integrating climate risk into long-term planning and operational practices to enhance resilience.
5. Leverage data analytics and emerging technologies to enhance climate risk assessments and resilience planning and examine case studies to understand best practices at organisational and municipal levels.
6. Communicate climate risks and resilience strategies to stakeholders, contributing to ethical and sustainable decision-making, and understand the Climate Resilient Officer (CRO) role and competencies.
course_entry_req: There are no formal prerequisites for enrolment in this programme. As this programme is conducted in English, participants should be proficient in reading, writing, and communicating in English.

course_title: Apply Autonomous Mobile Robots for Flexible Automation
course_title_cleaned: Apply Autonomous Mobile Robots for Flexible Automation
course_objective: This course targets to the robotics engineers who are working or plan to work in electronics sector.  In recent decades, mobile robots have been popularly implemented in many commercial and industrial settings, such as logistics, healthcare services, marine, manufacturing etc.  Many companies are planning to implement autonomous mobile robots to improve their industrial efficiency. With the development of computer science and sensory technology, various mobile robots have been designed and developed, such as Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) and Autonomous Forklift. While different robots are designed to target at different tasks, how to configure an appropriate robotic system to serve your application in your environmental setting would be an important and challenging skill.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course aims to teach the fundamental knowledge about autonomous mobile robots for professionals working in robotic and logistical industry. The course will cover skills from the following aspects:
•	Robotics Programming: Proficiency in programming languages and frameworks specifically tailored for mobile robots, such as ROS (Robot Operating System), is essential. Skills in developing algorithms, sensor integration, navigation, and control systems are in high demand.
•	Mobile Robot Navigation: Skills in mobile robot navigation, including path planning, obstacle avoidance, localization, and mapping, are critical for effective robot operation in dynamic and changing environments.
•	Machine Learning for Robotics: Mobile robots can benefit from machine learning techniques to improve their perception, decision-making, and interaction capabilities. Skills in machine learning algorithms, deep learning, computer vision, and sensor fusion are highly valued.
•	Sensor Integration and Fusion: Mobile robots rely on various sensors, such as LiDAR, cameras, and inertial measurement units (IMUs), to perceive their environment. Skills in integrating and fusing sensor data to generate accurate and comprehensive representations of the surroundings are essential.
•	Mobile Robot Hardware: Proficiency in mobile robot hardware, including knowledge of motors, actuators, sensors, microcontrollers, and embedded systems, is valuable for designing, building, and maintaining mobile robot platforms.
•	Cloud Robotics: Cloud robotics leverages cloud computing resources to augment the capabilities of individual robots. Skills in cloud robotics involve integrating robots with cloud services to offload heavy computation, access large datasets, and facilitate coordination and collaboration between robots and remote operators.
course_entry_req:
-	Have basic knowledge in C++/Python with object-oriented programming concept. 
Candidates with industry working experience on the topic but do not meet the above entry requirement may apply, subject to approval as exceptional cases.

At the end of this 2-day course, participants will be able to:

• Develop and test hypotheses using growth hacking principles and lean experiments
• Design viral loops and referral strategies that amplify user adoption
• Employ analytics to monitor conversion funnels and pinpoint opportunities for improvement
• Create cross-channel growth campaigns aligned with brand and product goals

MLOps is about orchestrating the steps in the ML pipeline, then automating the execution of the pipeline for continuous training (CT) of the models. Practical hands-on interactions with the tools forms a part of the learning process.

course_title: Microsoft Certified Endpoint Administrator Associate (MD-102)
course_title_cleaned: Microsoft Certified Endpoint Administrator Associate (MD-102)
course_objective: The Microsoft Certified Endpoint Administrator Associate course offers an in-depth exploration into the administration and security of Microsoft Endpoint environments. Participants will start by exploring the fundamentals of endpoint management, including device enrollment and configuration profiles for users and devices. The course covers a wide range of essential topics, such as managing Microsoft Entra identities, device authentication, and the deployment and update of applications through Intune and Configuration Manager.  Advanced modules focus on enhancing endpoint security through the management of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, implementing device compliance policies, and protecting organizational access with modern authentication methods like Windows Hello and multi-factor authentication. Learners will gain practical experience in troubleshooting security issues, coordinating access control rights, and investigating unauthorized access incidents. The course also delves into deploying devices using both on-premises and cloud-based tools, including Windows Autopilot and Azure Virtual Desktop, preparing participants to administer complex security programs and effectively analyze system updates' impacts on Microsoft Endpoint administration. By the end of this course, attendees will be equipped with the knowledge and skills to perform comprehensive Microsoft Endpoint system administration and secure enterprise environments against emerging security threats.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes
LO1: Administer complex security programs and analyze system updates impacts on Microsoft Endpoint administration.
LO2: Perform Microsoft Endpoint system administration and configure authentication to protect against security threats
LO3: Troubleshoot Microsoft Endpoint security issues and assist users in defining access rights.
LO4: Coordinate advanced access control rights and investigate unauthorized access incidents on Microsoft Endpoint system.

Topics Covered:
LU1: Explore endpoint management, Execute device enrolment and Configure profiles for user and devices
LU2: Configure profiles for user and devices and Examine application management  
LU3: Manage authentication and compliance and Manage endpoint security
LU4: Deploy using on-premises based tools and Deploy using cloud-based tools
course_entry_req:
Knowledge and Skills
•	Able to operate using computer functions
•	Able to operate using computer functions
•	Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude
•	Positive Learning Attitude
•	Enthusiastic Learner

Experience
•	Minimum of 1 year of working experience

Target age group: 21-65 years old

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Business Innovation for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) Module 6: Leadership in SMEs
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Business Innovation for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) Module 6  Leadership in SMEs
course_objective: Leadership skills are fundamental in helping small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) scale up, expand internationally, and innovate. Effective leadership can help SMEs to develop a clear vision, establish a strong company culture, and build a high-performing team. SME leaders should be equipped with new skills to ensure their businesses remain relevant and competitive in the rapidly changing market.   Participants explore how SMEs can anticipate and adapt to agile methodology, future trends advancements, and evolving consumer behaviours. It emphasises the importance of foresight in business planning, innovation in product and service offerings, and the agility to pivot strategies as needed. This module is designed to help SMEs stay ahead of the curve, minimise risks, and seize opportunities in a dynamic business environment.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the importance of leadership skills in helping small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to scale up, expand internationally, and innovate
• Develop effective leadership skills to help SMEs develop a clear vision, establish a strong company culture, and build a high-performing team
• Identify emerging trends and potential disruptors in your industry and develop strategies to innovate and adapt products and services
• Create business models and practices that are resilient to market changes
• Anticipate and adapt to agile methodology, future trends advancements, and evolving consumer behaviors
• Emphasise the importance of foresight in business planning, innovation in product and service offerings, and the agility to pivot strategies as needed

course_title: SDE5405 Sustainability Roadmapping
course_title_cleaned: SDE5405 Sustainability Roadmapping
course_objective: This module delves into the principles, strategies, and tools necessary for fostering sustainability within organisations. It explores the integration of sustainability into various facets of organisational operations and decision-making processes. Through a combination of theoretical insights, case studies, and practical exercises, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of sustainable practices and learn how to create effective roadmaps for implementing sustainable initiatives within organisations.
course_learning_outcomes:
1. To understand the concept of sustainability and its relevance to contemporary organisations.
2. To explore the various dimensions of sustainability, including environmental, social, and economic aspects.
3. To examine the challenges and opportunities associated with integrating sustainability into organizational strategies.
4. To analyse different approaches to sustainable development and their implications for organizational performance.
5. To develop skills in creating sustainable roadmaps tailored to organizational needs and contexts.
6. To critically evaluate the role of stakeholders in promoting sustainability within organisations.
course_entry_req:
Applicants should possess a recognised undergraduate degree or be in decision-making roles within Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) or their organisations. 

They should have a keen interest in sustainability, and be ready to apply sustainable practices in their business. 

They should have an understanding of business transformation and a commitment to learning about and implementing sustainability frameworks are essential.

course_title: Creative Storytelling (Director) (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Creative Storytelling (Director) (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: This course provides an overview of directing the creative storytelling process to create compelling audience experiences. Participants will explore techniques for engaging audiences, including experiential storytelling and the use of visual and aural media to advance narratives. Emphasis is placed on understanding trends, themes, and audience insights across various platforms. Technologies enabling cross-media and nonlinear storytelling will also be covered.  Participants will learn to define overarching visions guiding storyline development, refine characters to enhance audience appeal, and adapt narratives to address creative and technical challenges. The module fosters collaboration with creative teams to ensure the delivery of impactful outcomes tailored to audience preferences. Additionally, participants will evaluate proposed story changes to optimise audience engagement through suitable mediums.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
- Define the overarching vision for storyline development
- Develop compelling stories that suit audience tastes and convey complex themes using new techniques and technologies
- Refine characters to enhance audience appeal
- Modify storylines to resolve creative and technical issues during production
- Evaluate the impact of story changes on the intended audience for greater appeal
- Collaborate with creative teams to facilitate processes and deliver desired outcomes
- Recommend suitable mediums to increase audience engagement
course_entry_req:
- Minimum Age: 18
- Academic Requirement: Obtain Pass Grade in GCE O-Level subjects including at least B4 for English (or IELTS overall band score 6.5 and above or equivalent) and 2 other subjects or equivalent
- Applicants who do not meet the minimum requirements may still apply and will be considered based on: Mature candidates (≥30 years old with 8 years of work experience); and/or At least 1 year working experience in any industry; and/or Oral interview or evaluation test by Singapore Media Academy to determine suitability for the course
full_course_desc:
# course provider
SINGAPORE MEDIA ACADEMY PRIVATE LIMITED

# course title
Creative Storytelling (Director) (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025052528

# course run
20 Apr 26

# course duration
6 days - 1 month

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$3,600.00

# subsidised course fee
$1,080.00

# course number of hours
41.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
This course provides an overview of directing the creative storytelling process to create compelling audience experiences. Participants will explore techniques for engaging audiences, including experiential storytelling and the use of visual and aural media to advance narratives. Emphasis is placed on understanding trends, themes, and audience insights across various platforms. Technologies enabling cross-media and nonlinear storytelling will also be covered.  Participants will learn to define overarching visions guiding storyline development, refine characters to enhance audience appeal, and adapt narratives to address creative and technical challenges. The module fosters collaboration with creative teams to ensure the delivery of impactful outcomes tailored to audience preferences. Additionally, participants will evaluate proposed story changes to optimise audience engagement through suitable mediums.

# course learning outcomes
Learning Outcomes:
- Define the overarching vision for storyline development
- Develop compelling stories that suit audience tastes and convey complex themes using new techniques and technologies
- Refine characters to enhance audience appeal
- Modify storylines to resolve creative and technical issues during production
- Evaluate the impact of story changes on the intended audience for greater appeal
- Collaborate with creative teams to facilitate processes and deliver desired outcomes
- Recommend suitable mediums to increase audience engagement

# course entry req
- Minimum Age: 18
- Academic Requirement: Obtain Pass Grade in GCE O-Level subjects including at least B4 for English (or IELTS overall band score 6.5 and above or equivalent) and 2 other subjects or equivalent
- Applicants who do not meet the minimum requirements may still apply and will be considered based on: Mature candidates (≥30 years old with 8 years of work experience); and/or At least 1 year working experience in any industry; and/or Oral interview or evaluation test by Singapore Media Academy to determine suitability for the course

course_title: Post-Diploma Certificate in Applied Analytics & Digitalisation in HR (part of Specialist Diploma in HR Analytics & Digitalisation)
course_title_cleaned: Post-Diploma Certificate in Applied Analytics & Digitalisation in HR (part of Specialist Diploma in HR Analytics & Digitalisation)
course_objective: Post-Diploma Certificate in Applied Analytics & Digitalisation (PDC2 of Specialist Diploma in HR Analytics & Digitalisation) covers the following modules with a total of 150 training hours:  •	Strategic Perspectives in HR (CmU) •	HR Analytics (CmU) •	HR Digitalisation & Technology (CmU) •	HR Technology Project (WIU)  This PDC has THREE (3) Competency Units (CmUs) and ONE (1) Work-Integration Unit (WIU).
course_learning_outcomes:
With technological advancement towards a more data driven economy, it is imperative for HR professionals to use analytical techniques to make sense of people data. Digitalisation in HR will enable transformation of HR practices by bringing greater efficiency and productivity.

This PDC2 focuses on equipping learners with skills sets needed to align HR strategies and plans to organisation's current and future business strategy in consultation with business leaders through HR analytics and technology. It addresses the sector skills set needed in the areas of human resource management and organisational excellence. 

PDC2 will be offered by School of Business Management (SBM).
course_entry_req:
The admission requirement(s) are:

- A diploma from a local polytechnic or degree with a minimum of 1 year of work experience, preferably in a related field. 

- Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on: 
i.	Evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience; OR
ii.	Supporting evidence of competency readiness. 

Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or proficiency test.

course_title: Talent Casting (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Talent Casting (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: This course focuses on the process of conducting auditions to select talent for various production needs, emphasising creative considerations and talent requirements. Participants will learn to identify specific acting needs for main characters, narrators, voice-over artists, and supporting roles. The module covers various acting techniques, styles, and improvisation methods based on scripts. Participants will explore different audition and selection processes, understand commercial and aesthetic criteria for selecting talent, and methods for identifying emerging talents and marketability.  Through practical exercises, participants will review and implement appropriate audition processes, create and evaluate talent briefs, and conduct interviews and auditions. The module also emphasises assessing the strengths and weaknesses of performers and their overall impact on production quality.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
- Review and select appropriate audition or selection processes for the production
- Provide input on talent briefs and suggest alternatives
- Conduct interviews and auditions with talent, narrators, and voice-over artists
- Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of talent
- Assess the performer's impact on the production
course_entry_req:
- Minimum Age: 18
- Academic Requirement: Obtain Pass Grade in GCE O-Level subjects including at least B4 for English (or IELTS overall band score 6.5 and above or equivalent) and 2 other subjects or equivalent
- Applicants who do not meet the minimum requirements may still apply and will be considered based on: At least 1 year working experience in any industry; and/or English language proficiency assessment (written and/or oral) by Singapore Media Academy to determine suitability for the course

course_title: Implement FlexiWork Arrangement
course_title_cleaned: Implement FlexiWork Arrangement
course_objective: At the end of this module, learners will be able to: •	Apply suitable Legal Framework(s) for Flexi-Work Arrangement (FWA). •	Construct objectives for the Flexi-Work Arrangement (FWA) that are aligned with organizational HR policies. •	Utilize research to incorporate Flexi-Work Arrangement (FWA) into HR policies. •	Develop Flexi-Work Arrangement (FWA) policy. •	Implement methods to communicate the Flexi-Work Arrangement Policy throughout the organization.   This course is targeted at HR professionals and business owners, from various sectors to enhance their technical skills competencies in human resource policies and legislation framework management. More specifically, in the area of implementing flexi-work arrangement. This course is suitable for learners at beginner and intermediate levels.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is is crafted to promote an understanding of new human resource (HR) legislation framework and its implications of HR workplace implementation.
The learners will be able to develop and review human resource (HR) policies and procedures against organisational needs, and in compliance to legislative, ethical and regulatory standards.
The labour market is undergoing structural changes in this current volatile landscape. Locally, the rapidly aging population, increased caregiving demands as well as slowing workforce growth are challenges that organisations and businesses face to attract and retain human talent. For sustainable business continuity, it is critical to harness human resources effectively.
To handle changes in legislations or mandatory guidelines impacting workplace people management, it is essential to ensure the upskilling for HR professionals and business owners with skills and knowledge to stay relevant and to develop appropriate human resource (HR) policies to facilitate their implementation.

Learning Unit 1: Introduction to Flexi-Work Arrangements (FWAs)
•	Identify the legal framework(s) for FlexiWork Arrangement
•	Definition and types of FWAs in Singapore
•	Objectives of FWAs for organizations and employees

Learning Unit 2: Developing a FWA Policy
•	Identify and Prepare Supporting Information to Develop HR Policies
•	Draft and Review HR policies

Learning Unit 3: Implementing and Managing Good Practice of FWAs
•	Considerations for different employee groups
•	Communication and continuous improvement of FWA policies
course_entry_req:
Learners are expected to have a minimum of:
•	Learners have at least 1 years of human resource or people management experience
•	Upper secondary level education
•	Able to read, write, speak and listen to English at WSQ WPL level 5
•	Able to manipulate numbers at WSQ WPN level 5
•	Able to operate a computer

Learners will apply their skills in practical sessions of arranging and producing music in a collaborative setting.

course_title: Influencing Without Authority
course_title_cleaned: Influencing Without Authority
course_objective: Influencing Without Authority equips participants with the skills needed to build credibility and effectively influence stakeholders, even if they lack the formal authority to make demands on resources. This course helps attendees understand the attitudes and behaviors of leaders who know how to get work done through influence and persuasion whether managing up, down, across, or diagonally within organizations. Influencing Without Authority begins by placing the concept of influence within the larger context of environmental, organizational, network, relational, and interpersonal factors. It breaks influence down into a series of learnable skills, moving beyond the notion that influence is simply the product of personal charisma or charm, and instead, gives participants tools needed to negotiate the political landscape of organizations.  Participants also learn how to build the personal credibility that serves as the foundation of effective influence and how to apply a powerful methodology for resolving performance challenges in an environment where power cannot be exerted by one individual over another. They also learn how to build networks by overcoming internal barriers to creating new contacts. Finally, Influencing Without Authority provides the tools necessary to be more influential on both a personal and more strategic level.
course_learning_outcomes: Influencing Without Authority equips participants with the skills needed to build credibility and effectively influence stakeholders, even if they lack the formal authority to make demands on resources. This course helps attendees understand the attitudes and behaviors of leaders who know how to get work done through influence and persuasion whether managing up, down, across, or diagonally within organizations.

course_title_cleaned: Modular Certificate in Additive Manufacturing (part of Diploma in Engineering (Advanced & Digital Manufacturing))
course_objective: This is part of Diploma in Engineering (Advanced & Digital Manufacturing) and consists of 180 hours of training.  This Modular Certificate consists of the following modules: M1: Additive Manufacturing Application (30 hours) M2: Design for Additive Manufacturing (30 hours) M3: Product Topology Optimization (30 hours) M4: Polymeric-based Additive Manufacturing (30 hours) M5: Metal-based Additive Manufacturing (30 hours) M6: Additive Manufacturing Project (30 hours)
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the Modular Certificate, learners will be able to:
1) Create 3D Solid Models for additive manufactured components by considering design guidelines and product topology optimisation of the additive manufacturing process.
2) Determine an appropriate additive manufacturing process for a product by applying knowledge of additive manufacturing technologies and process selection guidelines for both polymers and metals.
3) Build prototypes using additive manufacturing machines, adhering to standard machine parameters.
4) Demonstrate teamwork and adaptability by using effective communication and problem-solving techniques to achieve project goal.
course_entry_req:
GCE 'O' level with minimum of 3 relevant passes and at least 1 year of relevant working experience; Nitec GPA ≥ 3.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience; Higher Nitec GPA ≥ 1.5 and at least with 1 year of relevant work experience; Nitec in Technology/Services* with GPA ≥ 3.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience; Higher Nitec in Technology/Services* with GPA ≥ 2.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience; Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher), and at least 1 year of relevant working experience and Workplace Literary & Numeracy (WPLN) at Level ≥ 6; At least 2 years relevant working experience (subject to interview / assessment).
Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or entrance test(s). The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicant

course_title: Equipment Maintenance and Utilities
course_title_cleaned: Equipment Maintenance and Utilities
course_objective: On completion of the module, students should be able to carry out reverse osmosis water plant operation, carry out boiler unit operation, carry out steam header and condenser unit operation and carry out compressed air unit operation. They also learn to perform maintenance on pipe system and equipment, check pump and compressor performance, troubleshoot abnormal conditions in pumps and compressors, and prepare process equipment for shutdown maintenance .
course_learning_outcomes:
On completion of the module, students should be able to carry out reverse osmosis water plant operation, carry out boiler unit operation, carry out steam header and condenser unit operation and carry out compressed air unit operation. They also learn to perform maintenance on pipe system and equipment, check pump and compressor performance, troubleshoot abnormal conditions in pumps and compressors, and prepare process equipment for shutdown maintenance.

Equipment Maintenance and Utilities (CE3204FP) is one the modules leading to NITEC IN TECHNOLOGY - CHEMICAL PROCESS TECHNOLOGY.

course_title: Integrated Command Centre Training (Level 3 -Supervisor)
course_title_cleaned: Integrated Command Centre Training (Level 3 -Supervisor)
course_objective: This course is designed to enhance supervising abilities in performing duties at Integrated Command Centre. Upon completion if the course, learners will be competent oh following work tasks:  •	Real-time Monitoring: Surveillance of security feeds, alarms, and other indicators to detect incidents as they happen. •	Incident Response: Coordinating responses to security breaches, emergencies, or any suspicious activities. •	Data Analysis: Analyzing security data to identify trends, vulnerabilities, and potential threats. •	Communication Hub: Acting as a communication point between security personnel, law enforcement, and emergency services. •	Policy Enforcement: Ensuring that security protocols and policies are adhered to across the organization. •	Reporting and Documentation: Keeping detailed records of incidents, responses, and security audits for future analysis and compliance.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will equip with knowledge and abilities on how to Supervise CCTV Surveillance Monitoring, Data Analysis and Reporting” of CCTV Security Surveillance. 
They also will learn principles of supervising an alarm monitoring system which involves overseeing its operation to ensure optimal performance and rapid response to incidents. 
 Learners will enhance learning through active participation in case studies of actual premises and presentation of solutions. Competent with roles and responsibilities in supervising Integrated Command Centre daily security operations.
course_entry_req:
Entry Requirements. Learners must;
•	Be able to read, write and speak English at WPL Level 4 
•	Be able to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 4 
•	Be able to act in a professional manner 
•	Be able to observe confidently 
•	Be vigilant at all times

Age
The minimum entry age shall be 21 years old at the time of application, and the maximum age shall be 65 years old.

Physical and Medical Requirement. Learners must certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work. Not be colour-blind or hearing impaired

Education Qualifications
The minimum entry educational qualification for learners shall be GCE ‘O’ Level, Polytechnic Diploma or their equivalent.

course_title: LOG-IPP - Bachelor of Science in Logistics and Supply Chain Management (Integrated Pathway)
course_title_cleaned: LOG-IPP - Bachelor of Science in Logistics and Supply Chain Management (Integrated Pathway)
course_objective: This programme would accelerate the academic and career growth with the requisite knowledge and skills becoming of a leader in the aviation industry. The programme enables students to obtain a degree and acquire a CPL concurrently. By completing the programme two years ahead of the traditional pathway, students can enter the industry earlier, gaining a competitive edge in the job market and positioning themselves for leadership roles sooner.
course_learning_outcomes:
Beyond the aviation sector, graduates of this programme can assume various roles in diverse industries, aligning with the professional skills acquired through their chosen SUSS major programme.

In the aviation industry, students from the Integrated Pathway Programme, supported by SFC, will have the opportunity to apply for, and undergo, the pilot selection process with the SIA group during the course of their training. A conditional letter of employment from the SIA group may be offered to successful applicants.

course_title: Fundamentals of Accounting & Finance
course_title_cleaned: Fundamentals of Accounting & Finance
course_objective: The Diploma in Business Practice (Accounting) (DBACC) focuses on developing key financial and accounting skills required in the business sector. It equips working professionals and career switchers with foundational and advanced knowledge on financial accounting, taxation, auditing and management accounting, preparing them for roles such as Accounting Executive and Audit Associate / Audit Assistant Associate in various industries.   As part of the revamp, key updates include: - Enhanced curriculum structure, incorporating industry feedback for relevancy - Practical and competency-based assessments for real world application - Flexible learning modes including blended learning and compressed schedules - Stronger industry partnerships, ensuring alignment with evolving job market needs
course_learning_outcomes:
Graduates of the programme will:
- Develop strong financial literacy and technical accounting skills
- Gain practical knowledge in business taxation and corporate financial management
- Understand audit processes, financial compliance, and sustainability reporting
- Apply date analytics and digital tools in accounting and finance
- Apply learned skills and knowledge into an integrated capstone project
course_entry_req:
GCE ‘O’ Levels: 
(3 relevant passes and at least 1-year relevant working experience)
English: 6
Mathematics: 6
Any relevant subject (excluding CCA): 6

FT Nitec:
GPA > 3.5 OR
GPA > 3.0 and 1 year of relevant working experience

PT Nitec in Technology/Services:
GPA > 3.5 and 1 year of relevant working experience   

FT Higher Nitec:
GPA > 2.0 OR
GPA > 1.5 and 1 year of relevant working experience

PT Higher Nitec in Technology/Services:
GPA > 2.0 and 1 year of relevant working experience

WSQ Diploma:Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) with 1 year of relevant working experience and Level 6 for both WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA & Workplace Numeracy SOA.

Without any of the relevant academic qualifications:
At least 2 years of relevant working experience.

Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL):
Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on supporting evidence of competency readiness.

course_title: Technology for Sustainability
course_title_cleaned: Technology for Sustainability
course_objective: The Specialist Diploma in Business Sustainability & Reporting is a one-year programme comprising two Post-Diploma Certificates (PDCs), totalling 240 curriculum hours over two semesters.   The course focuses on corporate purpose and sustainability applied in the areas of Accountancy, Carbon Services, Human Resource, Wholesale Trade, and Financial Services. It equips current professionals such as Enterprise Risk Management Associate/Enterprise Risk Management Executive, Talent Attraction and Employee Experience and Relations Executive, Procurement Executive/Sourcing Executive, and Portfolio Analyst/Investment Analyst/Fund Management Assistant with the knowledge and skills to transition into emerging roles such as ESG Executive/Analyst, Sustainability & HSE Executive, Carbon Accountant, Decarbonisation Consultant or to take on sustainability-related functions within their existing roles.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will learn to integrate sustainability into business functions, apply sustainability reporting frameworks, evaluate sustainability risks, and drive purpose-led change in their organisations. Through this course, they will gain skills in corporate purpose, sustainability reporting, carbon management, sustainable finance, sustainable HR management practices, sustainable supply chain management, branding and communications, systems thinking, design thinking, and technological skills for sustainability.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
SINGAPORE POLYTECHNIC

# course title
Technology for Sustainability

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025060044

# course mode of training

30.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
The Specialist Diploma in Business Sustainability & Reporting is a one-year programme comprising two Post-Diploma Certificates (PDCs), totalling 240 curriculum hours over two semesters.   The course focuses on corporate purpose and sustainability applied in the areas of Accountancy, Carbon Services, Human Resource, Wholesale Trade, and Financial Services. It equips current professionals such as Enterprise Risk Management Associate/Enterprise Risk Management Executive, Talent Attraction and Employee Experience and Relations Executive, Procurement Executive/Sourcing Executive, and Portfolio Analyst/Investment Analyst/Fund Management Assistant with the knowledge and skills to transition into emerging roles such as ESG Executive/Analyst, Sustainability & HSE Executive, Carbon Accountant, Decarbonisation Consultant or to take on sustainability-related functions within their existing roles.

# course learning outcomes
Students will learn to integrate sustainability into business functions, apply sustainability reporting frameworks, evaluate sustainability risks, and drive purpose-led change in their organisations. Through this course, they will gain skills in corporate purpose, sustainability reporting, carbon management, sustainable finance, sustainable HR management practices, sustainable supply chain management, branding and communications, systems thinking, design thinking, and technological skills for sustainability.

# course entry req
The proposed course is open-enrolment. Applicants must be at least a diploma/degree graduate in business or other related areas.  
 
Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may apply for admission to this Specialist Diploma by producing evidence of at least three years of relevant working experience or supporting information to ascertain their competency readiness. Eligible applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist eligible applicants and admit applicants who perform well in the interview and/or entrance test.

course_title: HR Technology & Analytics
course_title_cleaned: HR Technology & Analytics
course_objective: The Diploma in Business Practice (Human Capital) (DBHC) is tailored for working adults seeking a broad-based business education with a focus on human capital. The program covers essential business functions, communication, IT, and problem-solving skills, equipping graduates with the competencies needed to advance their careers. It prepares students to contribute effectively to both SMEs and larger organisations across the private and public sectors.   The course objectives are: Broad-Based Business Education: Provide a solid foundation in core business principles and practices. Career Advancement: Build practical skills to support professional growth and development. Industry Relevance: Equip students to meet current and emerging needs in the human resource and business landscape, especially within SMEs and larger enterprises.   The curriculum has been enhanced to emphasise digitalisation across all Modular Certificates (MCs). By integrating data analytics, automation, and emerging technologies into core business areas, the program equips students with the digital competencies required to navigate and lead in a rapidly evolving business environment. This digital focus enables students to manage transformation initiatives, improve operational efficiency, and drive innovation. Graduates will be well-positioned to contribute meaningfully to both SMEs and larger organisations in the public and private sectors, supporting their career progression and readiness for further education in the digital economy.   Targeted Job Roles & Knowledge Application   This course is ideal for individuals who wish to join or progress within the Human Resource sector spanning across all industries:   - Associate / Executive / Manager, Performance and Rewards - Associate / Executive, Talent Attraction and Employee Experience and Relations - Manager, Talent Management - Associate / Executive, Talent Management and Learning and Organisational Development
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills to excel in diverse business roles, with a particular emphasis on human capital. They will:

- Apply business and HR principles to analyse trends, use AI and data tools, enhance communication, and develop strategic marketing, HR, and planning solutions.

- Apply business and HR skills, analyse data for decisions, demonstrate emotional intelligence, and adapt strategies to manage resources in dynamic environments.

- Analyse HR laws and technologies, evaluate engagement strategies, and implement solutions to improve workforce effectiveness.

- Evaluate and apply sustainable HR strategies to improve talent management and organisational performance.

- Apply knowledge to analyse HR challenges, evaluate organisational issues, and develop strategic HR solutions that drive innovation.

• Communicate sensitively with patients and families.
• Support families during bereavement.
• Develop leadership and self-care skills.
• Navigate cultural and ethical complexities in palliative care.

course_title: Energy Management and Economics
course_title_cleaned: Energy Management and Economics
course_objective: This course equips learners with the essential skills to perform detailed energy audits, develop effective demand management strategies, and conduct comprehensive economic analyses for energy efficiency investments. Participants will gain practical knowledge in setting up Energy Management Systems (EMS) aligned with international standards like ISO 50001, establishing Energy Accounting Centers, and applying Energy Performance Indicators (EnPIs) for continuous improvement. The course further deepens understanding of Singapore's energy policies and market dynamics, preparing learners to analyze electricity supply structures and pricing mechanisms. Through hands-on exercises and case studies, learners will also master financial evaluation techniques such as net present value and internal rate of return, enabling them to calculate customer savings and optimize project investments.  Energy management and sustainability have become vital across sectors like manufacturing, facilities management, utilities, and commercial real estate, where optimizing energy use can significantly reduce costs and enhance environmental performance. This course is highly relevant as it addresses the growing need for professionals who can integrate energy efficiency with economic analysis. Completing this training can enhance career prospects by opening up opportunities in energy management, consultancy, and project evaluation roles. It also supports career advancement for existing professionals seeking to specialize in energy economics, energy performance contracting, or sustainability leadership roles.  This course is designed for intermediate learners who have a basic understanding of energy systems and seek to deepen their expertise in energy management and economic analysis.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learning Outcomes:
LO1: Perform energy audits by assessing equipment consumption, applying audit procedures, and using appropriate measuring tools.
LO2: Develop demand management plans using electricity profiles and market pricing strategies to optimize energy use.
LO3: Calculate customer savings through analysis of load curtailment data and current market price trends.

Course Outline:
Topic 1: Energy Management System
Topic 2: Energy Market Overview
Topic 3: Economic Analysis in Energy Efficiency Investments
course_entry_req:
1. Minimum education at Bachelor Degree
2. Working experience of at least 1 year in energy industry
3. Age group: 21 and above

course_title: Introduction to Sports Photography
course_title_cleaned: Introduction to Sports Photography
course_objective: Discover the exciting world of sports photography with our engaging course. Learn valuable strategies to enhance your action photography skills and create a standout portfolio. Leave with a personalised plan to inspire and guide you towards a fulfilling career as a sports event photographer. Note: This is an introductory course to sports photography. Participants are required to have their own Bridge Cameras, or Interchangeable Lens Camera Systems, eg. SLRs, DSLRs, Mirrorless Cameras; with prime (fixed focal) lenses of 50mm to 800mm, and/or telefocal (Zoom) lenses.
course_learning_outcomes: Dive into the dynamic world of sports photography and learn to capture the intensity and emotion of the game. This course will guide you through essential camera settings and advanced shooting techniques to freeze fast-paced action, while also exploring the art of dynamic composition and building rapport with athletes to create powerful, brand-defining imagery. You'll discover effective workflow strategies to ensure you never miss the perfect shot and learn how to authentically engage with the sports community to enrich your photographic experience.

course_title: Unmasking the Deepfake Threat: A Practical Guide to Detection & Defence
course_title_cleaned: Unmasking the Deepfake Threat  A Practical Guide to Detection & Defence
course_objective: In an era where Artificial Intelligence (AI) can generate hyper-realistic fake video and audio, deepfakes pose an escalating threat to individuals and organisations globally. This intensive one-day course will equip participants with a comprehensive understanding of deepfake risks, drawing on real-world incidents such as the £200 million fraud against Arup and the politically disruptive deepfake audio targeting Sadiq Khan. Participants will learn how deepfakes exploit human trust and discover how AI is both the problem and the solution in combating this evolving threat. A significant portion of the course will be dedicated to exploring a Deepfake Detector, a cutting-edge, AI-powered tool for real-time, on-device detection of deepfakes. Through practical demonstrations and discussions, attendees will gain insights into implementing robust internal policies, updating incident response plans, and fostering a zero-trust mindset to safeguard against deepfake-driven attacks and mitigate potential liability.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:
1. Identify and articulate the growing threat posed by deepfakes, including their exponential rise and impact on financial fraud and misinformation.
2. Understand the mechanisms by which deepfakes are created and the role of AI in both generating and detecting synthetic media.
3. Explain the core capabilities and unique advantages of the Deepfake Detector, including its real-time, on-device, application-agnostic, and Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)-integrated features.
4. Apply a zero-trust mindset to digital communications and recognise common red flags indicative of a deepfake attack.
5. Develop and update organisational incident response plans and internal policies to effectively address deepfake scenarios, emphasising verification and escalation procedures.
6. Recognise the importance of deepfake awareness training for employees and understand the potential liability and compliance exposures associated with deepfake incidents.
7. Strategise for integrating deepfake detection tools into a broader, multi-layered cybersecurity posture, including endpoint and hardware protection.
course_entry_req: Proficiency in English

course_title: Influencing Skills for Leading Without Authority
course_title_cleaned: Influencing Skills for Leading Without Authority
course_objective: In this day and age of flatter organizations, leaders have to unlearn their dependence on authority that stems from their position or designation. To be able to enroll others towards a common purpose, they need to be able to earn the buy-in of their stakeholders instead of demanding it.  This simulation-powered course helps you become a confident leader who is proactive and self-reliant in driving change that the organization needs to stay ahead of the competition. Through activities, videos, frameworks and other tools, you'll learn how to read, understand and win over stakeholders towards your initiatives.  Note: Influence is one of the essential transferable Critical Core Skills and competency highlighted by SkillsFuture Singapore for employability and career mobility.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, you will be able to: 
1. Understand the importance and complexity of leading without authority 
2. Employ influencing as an effective way of leading without authority 
3. Leverage various tools and dynamics for influencing others 
4. Apply learning in a simulated environment and analyze participants� actions 

Simulation Scenarios: ChangeQuest
Within the simulation, you play the role of a change agent in a virtual  organization with the goal of convincing internal stakeholders to bring about a transformational change within the organization, without exercising authority over the stakeholders.

Simulation reports can be generated at the end of the simulation to help you assess your influencing skills, innovation marketing, leading with authority and change management skills.

course_title: Leading Technical Teams Effectively
course_title_cleaned: Leading Technical Teams Effectively
course_objective: Members of technical teams may work towards common deliverables but their individual productivity depends on their individual skill and morale levels. To motivate such teams effectively, their managers need personalized approaches with each member instead of a single leadership style for all.   This simulation-powered course will equip managers like yourself with the knowledge and the skillset to evolve into better leaders for your teams, enabling performance and drive results.  Note: Developing people is one of the essential transferable Critical Core Skills and competency highlighted by SkillsFuture Singapore for employability and career mobility.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, you will be able to: 
1. Define the responsibilities of the leader of a technical team
2. Identify the challenges that come with the responsibility of leading a technical team 
3. Demonstrate the skills needed to be a successful leader 
4. Learn to flex leadership styles 

Simulation Scenarios: iLead
The simulation is designed to help you build leadership capabilities. It puts you in the role of a team manager, who is required to achieve business objectives by energizing and inspiring the team while responding to their needs. To succeed, you are expected to use a variety of leadership styles in response to  tough situations that emerge within the simulation.

At the end of the simulation, you will receive a personalised report of actionable insights to implement in the real world.

To motivate such teams effectively, their managers need personalized approaches with each member instead of a single leadership style for all.   This simulation-powered course will equip managers like yourself with the knowledge and the skillset to evolve into better leaders for your teams, enabling performance and drive results.  Note: Developing people is one of the essential transferable Critical Core Skills and competency highlighted by SkillsFuture Singapore for employability and career mobility.  

# course learning outcomes
At the end of this course, you will be able to: 
1. Define the responsibilities of the leader of a technical team
2. Identify the challenges that come with the responsibility of leading a technical team 
3. Demonstrate the skills needed to be a successful leader 
4. Learn to flex leadership styles 

Simulation Scenarios: iLead
The simulation is designed to help you build leadership capabilities. It puts you in the role of a team manager, who is required to achieve business objectives by energizing and inspiring the team while responding to their needs. To succeed, you are expected to use a variety of leadership styles in response to  tough situations that emerge within the simulation.

At the end of the simulation, you will receive a personalised report of actionable insights to implement in the real world.

course_title: Energy and Carbon Management for Non-Energy Managers
course_title_cleaned: Energy and Carbon Management for Non-Energy Managers
course_objective: This course is designed to equip non-energy professionals—such as facility managers, corporate decision-makers, and operations staff—with foundational knowledge in energy and carbon management. It provides a clear, contextual understanding of climate change, sustainability principles, energy systems, and practical strategies for emissions reduction.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course prepares non-energy professionals to engage effectively in sustainability and decarbonisation efforts within their organisations. Participants will be guided to analyse energy and carbon data, evaluate sustainability interventions, and contribute to decision-making aligned with national targets such as the Singapore Green Plan 2030, Energy Efficiency Fund (E2F), and Green Mark Certification. Through case studies, hands-on sessions, and interactive discussions, participants develop cross-functional literacy in energy management, carbon accounting, and sustainable operations.

By the end of the course, participants will be able to: 
1.	Describe key climate science principles and environmental risks affecting the built environment.
2.	Identify major sources of energy use and carbon emissions within building operations and facilities.
3.	Differentiate between various sustainability and energy efficiency initiatives, such as Green Mark and carbon credits.
4.	Apply lifecycle thinking to assess the environmental impact of decisions in project development and operations.
5.	Interpret carbon accounting data and reporting requirements relevant to Singapore’s sustainability frameworks.
6.	Develop action plans or recommendations to improve energy performance and reduce emissions in their workplace context.
course_entry_req:
Applicants with diploma in relevant disciplines with minimum GPA of 2 and one year of relevant working experience
OR, applicants with GCE A levels with minimum Grade E in any three GCE 'A' Level subjects, including English and two science subjects or equivalent and one year of relevant working experience
OR, applicants with other relevant qualifications and five years of relevant work experience

course_title: Applied AI Compliance and Governance
course_title_cleaned: Applied AI Compliance and Governance
course_objective: This intermediate course is designed for professionals who need to develop, enhance, and audit AI compliance processes. Building on foundational ethics, this program provides a deep dive into the practical application of external standards (such as NIST and ISO) to an organization's specific context. Participants will learn how to conduct a formal gap analysis of business and IT operations, develop new compliance processes based on internal and external guidelines, and recommend enhancements to strengthen an organization's internal controls for AI.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:
- Evaluate organizational AI governance and compliance gaps in relation to evolving regulatory standards and industry frameworks.
- Develop robust AI compliance processes based on key design elements and external guidelines.
- Recommend enhancements to internal controls via a systematic process gap analysis.
course_entry_req:
At least 2 years of professional experience in roles related to compliance, governance, or risk management.

A foundational understanding of AI concepts and digital technologies, with prior exposure to business use cases or governance considerations.

A tertiary qualification (e.g., degree or diploma) as the minimum education requirement.

# course objective
This 2-day course is designed to help learners tasked with AI adoption and to balance AI powered growth with responsible use of AI. Participants will learn how to use AI for exponential business growth. This course also covers AI governance frameworks and AI regulations. By the end of this course, participants will be equipped with knowledge and skills required to use AI for business expansion and also for implementation of robust AI governance principles. 

# course learning outcomes
Participants will be able to evaluate the risks and impacts associated with aligning organizational AI ethics and governance principles to industry requirements, and develop an organization framework based on AI ethics and governance standards and industry best practices.


# course entry req
At least 2 years of professional experience in roles involving decision-making, strategy, or digital transformation initiatives.
Foundational understanding of AI concepts and digital technologies, with prior exposure to business use cases or governance considerations.
The minimum education requirement is Lower Secondary.

The course also covers methods for designing and applying decorative patterns to create visually appealing Swiss rolls suitable for both casual and premium presentation.

• Create and apply decorative designs for Swiss rolls using piping and pattern transfer methods
• Assemble Swiss rolls with clean, even layers and professional finishing
