course_title: WSQ Diploma in Precision Engineering (Master Craftsman Skills)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Diploma in Precision Engineering (Master Craftsman Skills)
course_objective: The PeMC programme (a combination of WSP, Diploma and Specialist Diploma) is part of the Precision Engineering Vocational Continuing Education and Training initiative. The aim of the PEVC initiative is to develop deeply-skilled Master Craftsmen capable of supporting high-end manufacturing activities within their companies and to build internal capabilities for their companies to retain and enhance their competitiveness.   Through the creation of a class of Master Craftsmen, the PEVC initiative will result in a career progression pathway for the highly skilled professionals in the precision engineering industry, thereby enhancing the attraction and retention of skilled craftsmen the industry needs.   The PeMC programme is also part of the PE Productivity Roadmap endorsed by the National Productivity and Continuing Education Council (NPCEC) and strongly supported by EDB, ESG and WSG. The PeMC programme has a strong emphasis on technical skills training as well as critical core skills needed for master craftsmen in the industry. Additionally, participants will learn important productivity and pedagogical concepts to enable them to be technical experts, shop floor leaders and trainers for the next generation of PE workforce.  Finally, the PeMC programme has been accredited by AHK Singapore and IHK Munich to be of the same standard and rigour as that of the equivalent programmes for producing and upskilling master craftsmen in Germany. The programme has created and sustained a brand that NYP would like to continue nurturing by continuing with the current names of the individual courses under the PeMC programme.   The PeMC programme (WSQ Diploma) has been offered for public run since 2012 to train PMETs for the manufacturing & precision engineering sectors. There are no similar PeMC programme (WSQ Diploma) available by other training providers.
course_learning_outcomes:
There is no change to the existing full qualification. The WSQ Diploma in Precision Engineering (Master Craftsman Skills) which formed part of the PeMC programme is currently offered to the public since 2012 as a full qualifications programme. The modules offered are:

Common Core:
1) Manage Manufacturing Productivity Improvement
2) Apply Productivity Improvement Tools
3) Apply Mechanics in Design Solutions
4) Apply Computer-Aided Design (CAD) Techniques
5) Apply Mechanical Fixture Design
6) Apply Mathematical Concepts in Engineering Solutions

Specialisation elective - Advanced CAM & CNC Machining:
1) Apply Computer-Aided Manufacturing (CAM) Techniques
2) Apply Advanced CNC Machining
3) Apply Advanced Toolroom Machining
4) Apply Process Optimisation & Cutting Techniques
5) Manage Engineering Project [CAM & CNC Machining]
course_entry_req:
The programme is offered to Candidates with ITE Nitec / Higher Nitec / NTC-2 / WSQ Advanced Certificate or equivalent qualifications with at least four years of relevant experience in the PE industry.

Graduates who are awarded the WSQ Diploma in Precision Engineering (Master Craftsman Skills) and the WSQ Specialist Diploma in Precision in Precision Engineering (Master Craftsman Skills) will be considered to have completed the Precision Engineering Master Craftsman (PeMC) Programme.

course_title: SE100: Responsive Web Development (Classroom)
course_title_cleaned: SE100  Responsive Web Development (Classroom)
course_objective: SE100 Responsive Web Development equips learners with essential and advanced skills to build dynamic, responsive websites and applications. Whether you are a beginner, upskilling for your career, or seeking to strengthen your business’s online presence, this course covers the key foundations of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript before progressing to modern frameworks like React and Playwright. You will also gain practical experience with APIs, Git, and GitHub, and develop robust web applications using Node.js and Express.js.  The curriculum is designed by leading academics and industry experts, ensuring all content is aligned with real-world demands. Emphasis is placed on hands-on learning, enabling you to work on real projects and develop a portfolio that showcases your technical capabilities and creative solutions.  SE100 is ideal for individuals and teams seeking practical, project-based training to thrive in Singapore’s fast-changing digital landscape. Join Heicoders Academy and gain the expertise to turn your ideas into effective digital solutions and unlock new opportunities in web development.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:
- Apply HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with modern frameworks to develop responsive and visually engaging web applications
- Integrate APIs and manage data flows to support dynamic user experiences
- Apply version control practices and document updates for both business and technical stakeholders
- Select appropriate technologies for deployment
- Assess and debug written code
- Test and improve web applications
course_entry_req:
- English Language C6 grade and above for GCE 'O' Level or equivalent
- Basic computer literacy: While no prior coding or technical experience is required, participants should possess foundational skills in using computers and internet applications, as these are essential for engaging with the course content and software.

course_title: Unified Power Format (UPF)
course_title_cleaned: Unified Power Format (UPF)
course_objective: This course is designed to provide learners and professionals with an in-depth understanding of Unified Power Format (UPF) for low-power design, essential for creating energy-efficient integrated circuits and electronic systems. It begins with an overview of power consumption challenges in modern electronics, followed by a comprehensive study of UPF, its syntax, and its methodologies. Learners will learn how to use UPF to specify power intent in designs, facilitating the creation of power-aware models that are crucial for reducing power consumption at all levels of electronic design.  By the end of this course, participants will master the skills necessary to implement UPF for optimizing the power efficiency of both simple and complex electronic systems, making them proficient in the principles and practices of low-power design using UPF.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will acquire an advanced knowledge in writing Unified Power Format (UPF) to describe the power intent for a Register Transfer Level (RTL) design, synthesizing the design and performing Logic Equivalence Check (LEC) in the context of RTL and UPF. Throughout the course, students will gain practical experience with various UPF commands and techniques such as creating power domains, adding power states, and defining power switches and isolation rules. The curriculum also covers advanced topics like retention strategies and multi-voltage designs, with a focus on integrating UPF with existing Electronic Design Automation tools and design flows.
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
- Define Power Domains
- Explain Isolation Strategies
- Explain Level shifter Strategies
- Explain Retention Cell Strategies
- Define the Power State Table
- Synthesize design with UPF
course_entry_req: There are no formal entry requirements or prior qualifications needed.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Allied Legal Professional Skills Module 5: Legal Communications and Business Development
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Allied Legal Professional Skills Module 5  Legal Communications and Business Development
course_objective: Effective communication is a vital tool for any working professionals. Your success at getting your point across can be the difference between sealing a deal and missing out on a potential opportunity. Communication is also important within the organisation. Effective communication can help to foster a good working relationship between you and your staff, which can in turn improve morale and efficiency. course_title: Chartered Fintech Professional (CFtP) Level 1A Training Module 1: Economics (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Chartered Fintech Professional (CFtP) Level 1A Training Module 1  Economics (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Module 1 of the Level 1A training sets the direction for and encapsulates the concept of learning Economics for Fintech professionals. Studying Economics equips Fintech professionals with a comprehensive understanding of the economic forces that shape their industry. This knowledge will also help them to understand market dynamics, make sense of economic policy implications, leading to better understanding of the regulatory landscape in which they operate. It enhances their ability to adapt to changing market conditions, develop innovative products, manage risks, and make sound financial decisions, ultimately leading to the success and growth of their fintech businesses.  There are 3 sections in this module: Microeconomics, Macroeconomics and Macro-Finance. The module will start with Section 1 on Microeconomic which covers concepts of Supply and Demand, Price Elasticity, Decision Making of firms and elements of Game Theory. Section 2 introduces Macroeconomics and the various aggregate economic output measures, including Real and Nominal Gross Domestic Product (GDP), National Income, Personal Income, and Personal Disposable Income. Essential concepts covered include Aggregate Demand and short-run and long-run Aggregate Supply. The course will also discuss the causes of a shift in aggregate demand and aggregate supply and long-run economic growth sources.  Finally in Section 3 on Macro-Finance, participants will learn key concepts in Financial Intermediation, Repression and Liberalisation, Central Banking and Monetary Policy. This module will conclude with a short discussion on the Basel Accord, a key element of Financial Supervision.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Describe the demand/ supply curve and the Law of Demand/ Supply and price elasticity
• Calculate, interpret and compare cost, profit, and output
• Understand the role that blockchain can play in firm decision-making
• Understand the debate on the impact of Fintech on market structure
• Understand the impact of Fintech on the ability to analyse and assess anticompetitive behaviour within the financial services market
• Understand the application of Game Theory in Fintech
• Understand the implications of aggregate demand and aggregate supply equilibrium and describe how fluctuations in aggregate demand and supply cause short run changes in the economy and the business cycle
• Understand the drivers of economic growth
• Understand the need for financial markets and financial institutions (or intermediaries) and the services they provide
• Understand the financial system and its key functions
• Understand financial repression, how it is manifested, and its symptoms
• Understand the motivations for financial innovation and what financial innovation includes
• Understand the transformation driven by Fintech and the emerging new forms of financing and investments such as "inclusive finance", "socially responsible investment", and "impact investing", etc. driven by greater awareness of sustainable development goals
• Understand the functions of money, the international currency and monetary systems, money supply and money creation
• Explain the objectives of monetary policy and its use in practice and its implementation tools
• Understand the role of the central bank and the importance and vulnerabilities of the financial sector
• Understand the concept and design of central bank digital currency and its associated benefits and risks
course_entry_req:
No prerequisites, but participants are strongly encouraged to go through the assigned pre-reading materials and videos, especially if one does not have any prior learning or working knowledge in the subject matter of this Module.

If the participant intends to register for the Chartered Fintech Professional examination following the completion of this training course, do note that an undergraduate degree from a recognised university or equivalent professional qualification is a compulsory enrolment requirement.

course_title: Professional Certificate in Tech Sales Module 4: Perfecting Your Sales Demo
course_title_cleaned: Professional Certificate in Tech Sales Module 4  Perfecting Your Sales Demo
course_objective: If you’re having trouble consistently converting prospects from the demo stage into paying customers, you might need to redesign your demo. Successful demos are no longer about explaining what your product is and what it does as this approach will cause most prospects to disengage in the first few minutes. To make buyers pay attention and ultimately decide to buy your product, there are crucial elements of the demo you need to get right. This module provides a structure on how participants can redesign their demos and consistently close deals.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 1-day module, participants will be able to:
- Understand the difference between prospecting and closing
- Learn the skills and work involved in running a successful demo
- Learn about how to handle objections and follow-up with the prospect after the demo

course_title: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Power Automate for Accounting and Finance Professionals  (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Power Automate for Accounting and Finance Professionals  (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Power Automate for Accounting and Finance Professionals is designed for professionals in the accounting and finance industry who are looking to enhance their skills by learning how to automate repetitive tasks and streamline their workflow using RPA and Power Automate. RPA allows organisations to automate repetitive and time-consuming tasks, improving efficiency and free up valuable resources. Power Automate is a popular RPA tool that integrates with Microsoft products and enables users to automate workflows and business processes.  This course covers the fundamentals of RPA and provides hands-on experience in using Power Automate to automate various business processes. Participants will learn how to set up Power Automate and how to use it to automate tasks such as email processing and handling, data processing and web browser automation. Throughout the course, participants will work on real-world scenarios and complete practical assignments to apply the concepts learned. The course also introduces participants to topics such as integrating Power Automate with other Microsoft products and error handling.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Set up Power Automate
• Automate handling and processing of emails
• Automate data processing
• Automate web browser interactions
• Integrate Power Automate with other Microsoft products like Excel, Outlook etc
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably have basic knowledge of Windows operating systems and Microsoft Office applications.

course_title: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Python for Accounting and Finance Professionals (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Python for Accounting and Finance Professionals (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with Python for Accounting and Finance Professionals is a course designed for finance and accounting professionals who are looking to enhance their skills by learning how to automate repetitive tasks and streamline their workflow using RPA and Python.  RPA enables businesses to automate repetitive, rule-based tasks. Python is one of the most popular programming languages used for developing RPA solutions. Participants will learn the basics of RPA, including how to identify tasks that can be automated, how to design an automation process, and how to implement and maintain it using Python. The basics of Python will be refreshed for the benefit of participants who might not be current with Python.  Throughout the course, participants will work on real-world scenarios and complete practical assignments to apply the concepts learned. They will also learn about common tools and libraries used in RPA, such as UiPath, Blue Prism, and Automation Anywhere.  By the end of the course, participants will have a deeper understanding of RPA and acquire the skills to apply RPA to improve their organisation's processes and efficiency.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Understand explore the Robotic Process Automation (RPA) framework using Python
• Know the different RPA tools using Python and pick the most appropriate tool
• Implement a RPA solution in Python
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably have basic knowledge of programming concepts and Python.

course_title: Zero-Knowledge Proofs: How it Works
course_title_cleaned: Zero-Knowledge Proofs  How it Works
course_objective: Building privacy-enhancing and secure technology require diving into the beauty of understanding current cryptographic building blocks. One of the existing heavily researched cryptographic tools is the zero-knowledge proof. Zero-knowledge proofs are currently in excessive development, both in terms of theoretical machinery but also practical implementations, and have the potential to scale blockchain-based solutions securely. Additionally, a standardisation effort for zero-knowledge proofs is currently in progress.  Zero-knowledge proofs refer to a cryptographic protocol where a party can prove possession of certain information without revealing the information itself. Most learning materials struggle to explain why they are important and how they work internally, so zero-knowledge proofs remain somewhat “magical” and elusive, deterring developers from effectively exploring or utilising them in a big span of projects. In this course, we will focus on the mathematical and cryptographic foundations of zk-SNARKs, a type of commonly used zero-knowledge proof. The acronym zk-SNARK stands for “Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Argument of Knowledge”, and the course will focus on every development step of the Groth16 zk-SNARK.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
▪ Explain the capabilities, limitations, and applications of zero-knowledge proofs
▪ Analyse arithmetic and algebra for cryptographic building blocks
▪ Assess elliptic curves and review elliptic curve pairings
▪ Dissect Groth16 zk-SNARK setup, prover, and verifier stage
▪ Design statements to be proven in Groth16 zk-SNARK and build them in different representations (algebraic circuits, Rank 1 Constraint System (R1CS), Quadratic Arithmetic Programme (QAP))
▪ Construct Groth 16 zk-SNARK setup, prover, and verifier
▪ Use SageMath for mathematical calculations and Circom for zk-SNARK calculations
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Google Cloud Professional Cloud Developer (Exam)
course_title_cleaned: Google Cloud Professional Cloud Developer (Exam)
course_objective: The Google Cloud Professional Cloud Developer certification validates the advanced skills required to design, build, deploy, and maintain scalable, secure, and highly available applications on Google Cloud. The certification targets developers who want to demonstrate proficiency with Google-recommended tools, practices, and managed services for cloud-native application development and operations. It is ideal for professionals seeking to solidify their credibility, enhance their career prospects, and support organizations’ digital transformation through robust and modern cloud solutions
course_learning_outcomes:
The certification exam aims to evaluate and confirm that candidates can:
•	Design scalable, reliable, and highly available cloud-native applications suited for both enterprise and startup environments.
•	Build and test applications leveraging cloud-native patterns, containers, serverless, and continuous integration practices.
•	Deploy, monitor, and maintain applications on Google Cloud using best practices and appropriate hosting platforms (e.g., Compute Engine, GKE, Cloud Run).
•	Integrate with a wide range of Google Cloud services for data, APIs, messaging, authentication, monitoring, and security.
•	Instrument applications for observability (metrics, logs, and traces) and optimize for cost, performance, and reliability.
•	Make informed technical decisions that balance cost, performance, and operational complexity in a real-world cloud context

course_title_cleaned: S.M.A.R.T Entrepreneurship X Global - Beijing   Harnessing Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) to Build Sustainable Business Competitiveness
course_objective: This programme focuses on Beijing, the capital city of China and an Artificial Intelligence (AI) powerhouse with top Chinese universities such as Tsinghua University, is designed to provide participants with an experiential learning journey. Beijing is at the forefront of AI innovation, with significant contributions from renowned institutions like Tsinghua University and organizations such as the Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI). The curriculum integrates case studies, panel discussions, site visits, and class presentations, equipping participants with actionable insights and fostering collaboration in AI. By the end of the course, participants will be able to:  * Understand and analyze the latest development in AI technologies in Beijing and their strategic applications in creating new competitive advantage and customer satisfaction. * Gain knowledge of cutting-edge AI technologies and real life case studies from industry leaders in China, including Tsinghua University, Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI), Baidu, Sensetime, Tencent, and Alibaba. (Notably, Singapore Deputy Prime Minister visited Tsinghua University & BAAI in April 2024.) * Gain insights from networking sessions with Tsinghua University alumni, including business owners and senior management, to explore AI business collaborations. * Evaluate the latest AI technologies and business models developed in Beijing to strengthen business competitiveness. * Develop an AI business strategy for implementation, leveraging the latest AI technology trends and best practices in Beijing and globally This program equips participants with the tools, networks, and strategies needed to drive growth and innovation in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.
course_learning_outcomes:
* Analyze and apply relevant Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies: Understand and evaluate the latest advancements in AI technologies in Beijing and their strategic applications in building new competitive advantages and driving customer satisfaction.
* Gain AI industry insights: Acquire in-depth knowledge of cutting-edge AI technologies and real-life case studies from leading Chinese companies and institutions, including Tsinghua University, Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI), Baidu, Sensetime, Tencent, and Alibaba in Beijing. Understand how these leaders are shaping the future of AI and its integration into existing business to create new smart business models.
* Leverage networking opportunities: Gain practical insights through networking sessions with Tsinghua University alumni, including business owners and senior management, to explore potential AI-driven business collaborations and partnerships.
* Evaluate AI technologies and AI business models: Assess and analyze the latest AI technologies and business models developed in Beijing to identify opportunities to enhance business competitiveness in the global marketplace.
* Create actionable AI strategies: Create a comprehensive AI business strategy for your organization, incorporating the latest AI technology trends, industry best practices in Beijing and globally, and the specific needs of your business.
course_entry_req: Basic knowledge in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and smart businesses

course_provider: SINGAPORE UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY AND DESIGN
course_title: S.M.A.R.T Entrepreneurship X Global - Chengdu : Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Food
course_title_cleaned: S.M.A.R.T Entrepreneurship X Global - Chengdu   Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Food
course_objective: - Contribute to Singapore’s Broader Engagement with the strategic Chengdu-Chongqing Economic Circle (CCEC) initiative in China:  -Understand the CCEC’s strategic importance and explore opportunities in agricultural products, culinary innovations, smart Food and Beverage (F&B) transformation, advanced food manufacturing, and smart logistics.  -Visit leading Chinese F&B enterprises such as KFC China, Meizhou Dongpo, and Chen Mapo, to explore their culinary innovations, business model innovations and identify potential partnership opportunities. - Visit Chengdu’s major logistics hubs to examine their capabilities in food distribution, supply chain management, and international trade, and uncover collaboration opportunities with logistics players to enhance connectivity and business expansion within the CCEC and Southeast Asia. -Learn & Explore Artificial Intelligence (AI)-Driven Collaboration Opportunities: - Learn from leading Chengdu-based companies such as KFC China on the successful integration of AI and digital technologies in Chengdu’s F&B ecosystem to create smart F&B businesses to drive productivity growth and business growth. - Gain exposure to AI and digital innovation practices in Chengdu, identifying potential collaboration opportunities, and explore how these technologies can foster business growth. -Expand Business Networks and Resources: -Build valuable connections with members of the Sichuan Industry Association of Hotels, Restaurants & Catering, and alumni from Tsinghua University and Sichuan University, including business owners and senior management, through curated networking sessions designed to facilitate knowledge exchange and collaborative ventures.Create a company-specific Business Strategy to pursue opportunities in Chengdu: -Create and present a comprehensive business strategy tailored to capitalize on the unique opportunities and strengths of Chengdu, leveraging insights gained from site visits, panel discussions, and networking
course_learning_outcomes:
* Support Singapore’s Strategic Engagement with the Chengdu-Chongqing Economic Circle (CCEC):
   Gain a comprehensive understanding of the CCEC’s significance, with a focus on opportunities in agricultural products, culinary innovation, smart F&B transformation, advanced food manufacturing, and smart logistics.
   Learn about culinary innovations and business model innovations directly at leading Chinese F&B companies such as KFC China, Meizhou Dongpo, and Chen Mapo, & identify potential partnership opportunities.
   Visit key logistics hubs in Chengdu to examine their capabilities in food distribution, supply chain management, and international trade, uncovering opportunities to strengthen connectivity and expand business operations within the CCEC and across Southeast Asia.
* Learn AI-Powered Smart Businesses in Chengdu:
   Learn from top Chengdu-based companies, such as KFC China, about the successful integration of AI and digital technologies in the local F&B ecosystem to foster smarter, more efficient business operations.
   Discover AI and digital innovation practices in Chengdu, identifying how these technologies can drive productivity improvements and unlock new business opportunities for growth.
* Expand Networks and Foster Collaborative Ventures:
   Establish valuable connections with members of the Sichuan Industry Association of Hotels, Restaurants & Catering, and alumni from prestigious institutions such as Tsinghua University and Sichuan University, including business owners and senior executives. Participate in curated networking sessions aimed at facilitating knowledge sharing and collaborative ventures.
* Create a Tailored Business Strategy for Chengdu Opportunities:
   Create and present a business strategy to leverage the unique opportunities within Chengdu, incorporating insights gained from site visits, panel discussions, and networking opportunities to craft actionable strategies for growth.
course_entry_req: Basic knowledge in Food and Beverage (F&B) manufacturing, trade & logistics

course_provider: SINGAPORE UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY AND DESIGN
course_title: The Art of Influencing with Social Media and Content Marketing
course_title_cleaned: The Art of Influencing with Social Media and Content Marketing
course_objective: Understand the fundamentals of Social Media landscape Learn how to build a Social Media Marketing Strategy/Plan Learn about Social Media Measurement Metrics Understand the different Social Media platforms Develop Customer Personas for Content Strategy Develop framework for Content Strategy across different platforms Create meaningful and relevant content for your brand Understand Influencer Marketing and its Tools & Techniques
course_learning_outcomes:
Businesses know how important Social Media can be for their business but how would they decide on a social media platform and for what purpose? Is their planned budget sufficient? How do they measure success and plan for further optimisation?

This 5-day programme addresses these gaps and provides learners with the confidence to know how to be effective in dealing with their own teams and/or an agency/vendor in the analysis, planning, implementation and measurement of an effective social media strategy. This programme is designed by industry practitioners and aims to equip marketers with the latest knowledge and best practices in social media including Influencer Marketing, Content Creation and Paid Social Media advertising.

This is an extremely practical course as individuals/teams will have to deliver a plan that will be graded and this plan can be used as a blueprint for their own organisation’s social media marketing plan.

course_title: Digital Technologies Adoption 101 (for Financial Sector) (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Digital Technologies Adoption 101 (for Financial Sector) (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Businesses cannot ignore the fact that going digital is no longer a discretionary but a mandatory change. It is thus important for companies to understand the fundamentals for digital transformation, the key technologies that make it possible, the ways to integrate them into all areas of a business, as well as the ways to operate and deliver value to customers.
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably have tertiary qualifications and/ or at least 3 years of working experience.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
SINGAPORE MANAGEMENT UNIVERSITY

# course title
Digital Technologies Adoption 101 (for Financial Sector) (Synchronous E-Learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025058346

# course duration
3-5 days

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$1,600.00

# subsidised course fee
$800.00

# course number of hours
16.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
Businesses cannot ignore the fact that going digital is no longer a discretionary but a mandatory change. It is thus important for companies to understand the fundamentals for digital transformation, the key technologies that make it possible, the ways to integrate them into all areas of a business, as well as the ways to operate and deliver value to customers.

# course learning outcomes
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Gain an overview of key disruptive trends that are impacting various industries;
• Identify key challenges faced by financial institutions in trying to stay competitive in the digital world;
• Understand how emerging technologies and processes such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Workflow Management, Distributed Ledger Technology, and Cloud can be adopted to drive business and operating model reinventions for the financial services sector;
• Understand the benefits of digital transformation and how a company can use it as a lever to create competitive advantage that sets it apart from its competitors.

# course entry req
Participants should preferably have tertiary qualifications and/ or at least 3 years of working experience.

course_title: Software Testing and Scripting (for Financial Sector)
course_title_cleaned: Software Testing and Scripting (for Financial Sector)
course_objective: A working software satisfies the functional, the non-functional requirements such as security and performance and the requirements on user-experience (UX) and user-interfaces (UI) built with the end-users in mind. Such outcomes are the result of a comprehensive testing strategy executed in a disciplined and methodological approach throughout the software testing lifecycle. Regardless if the software is built internally, purchased commercially, or integrated via the Application programming Interface (API),  the expectation should not differ.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Be familiar with the various types of testing, its goals, objectives and deliverables
• Learn how to create a test plan, test cases and to define the Key Performance Indicators for an Application Programming Interface (API) testing
• Understand how testing automation tools is adopted so as to enhance the software testing quality
• Identify scope for API testing and build simple API testing scripts 
• Acquire the knowledge of appropriate approaches and methodologies for in-house, commercial and API-based applications testing
• Be familiar with the commonly used scripting applied to enhance the productivity of software testing
• Gain the knowledge on best practices for software testing
course_entry_req: Participants should preferably have basic knowledge in software development lifecycle and Information Technology.

course_title: Foundations of WealthTech: Digital Wealth Management Essentials
course_title_cleaned: Foundations of WealthTech  Digital Wealth Management Essentials
course_objective: Dive into the future of wealth management and gain a broad overview of the core technologies reshaping the landscape of financial services, from automated advising to personalised investment strategies. Participants will be equipped with the tools to innovate and lead in the evolving landscape of financial services.   This intensive 2-day course is designed to equip participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to thrive in the rapidly evolving landscape of digital wealth management and WealthTech. Participants will explore the disruptive forces reshaping traditional wealth management practices, delve into the innovative technologies driving change, and gain valuable insights from industry experts.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
 • Acquire a solid foundation in digital wealth management and wealth management practices being disrupted
 • Gain insights into WealthTech and its transformative role in reshaping the landscape of financial services
 • Explore the diverse WealthTech ecosystem, understanding its segments and regional trends
 • Deepen understanding through real-world case studies, examining startups and tech innovations
 • Gain valuable perspectives and insights from industry experts
 • Navigate the intricate regulatory landscape and legal frameworks, with a focus on understanding the role of RegTech for established WealthTech players
course_entry_req:
• Business or technology degree or equivalent education and professional experience
• Participants should have a basic understanding of financial and economic concepts.
• A basic understanding of technology, including familiarity with computer systems and software applications, is beneficial.
• Some professional experiences, particularly in roles related to finance, technology, entrepreneurship, or regulation, can enrich the participant's understanding of course contents.

course_title_cleaned: Innovations Shaping FinTech  Emerging Technologies and Trends (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Step into the future of finance with this cutting-edge course, where participants will explore the transformative technologies and trends reshaping the FinTech landscape. Delve into quantum computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), and other groundbreaking advancements to discover their transformative impact on financial services. Beyond theoretical knowledge, participants will learn practical applications for these emerging technologies, tackling real-world financial challenges. This course is designed to equip participants with the insights and skills needed to navigate and lead in the fast-paced world of FinTech, ensuring they stay at the forefront of industry evolution.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to:
• Gain a comprehensive understanding of how emerging technologies like quantum computing and the Internet of Things (IoT) are influencing the FinTech sector
• Analyse future trends and their impact on FinTech
• Learn strategies to stay abreast of and adapt to rapid technological changes in FinTech
• Demonstrate the ability to apply theoretical concepts to real-world FinTech challenges
course_entry_req: Participants must ideally have at least 3 years of work experience in financial services or foundational finance/payments industry knowledge.

course_title: Leveraging Generative AI in Quality Assessment Design for Educators (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Leveraging Generative AI in Quality Assessment Design for Educators (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: This course is tailored for educators seeking to harness the potential of generative artificial intelligence (AI), specifically focusing on designing high-quality assessments. Participants will delve into the fundamentals of generative AI and explore innovative strategies for assessing student work, even in cases where tools like Chat Generative Pre-Trained Transformer (ChatGPT) are employed. The course blends theoretical understanding with hands-on practical applications to empower educators in leveraging AI for effective and ethical assessment practices.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Understand the basics of generative artificial intelligence (AI) and its applications in education
• Explore different generative AI tools and their features
• Examine various models for integrating generative AI into assessment design
• Delve into the ethical implications of using generative AI in student assessment
• Establish guidelines for fair and unbiased AI-assisted evaluations
• Define clear and objective criteria for evaluating student work generated with AI
• Identify and mitigate potential challenges in using generative AI for assessment
• Formulate strategies for handling issues related to plagiarism and authenticity
• Implement practices to maintain fairness and equity in assessments using AI
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Agile Mastery Unleashed: A Transformative 3-day Journey in Business Agility
course_title_cleaned: Agile Mastery Unleashed  A Transformative 3-day Journey in Business Agility
course_objective: Elevate Your Agile Game – Explore, Build, Transform is a three-day workshop designed for intermediate learners to deepen their business agility skills. Engage in hands-on projects like building a toy motor car and innovative methods like Lego Serious Play. You’ll master agile principles, Lean Systems Thinking, and Design Thinking, enhancing your ability to lead teams and drive organizational success. This course equips you with the tools to navigate fast-paced industries, making you a valuable asset in technology, finance, and more. Elevate your career prospects with skills in rapid prototyping, strategic problem-solving, and innovation, positioning yourself for higher responsibility roles and job upgrades
course_learning_outcomes:
1. Understand and Apply Business Agility: Articulate the core values and principles of business agility, and effectively apply them in VUCA (Volatility, Uncertainty, Complexity and Ambiguity) environments.
2. Implement Agile Methodologies: Execute agile practices like Scrum and Kanban in real-world projects, demonstrating leadership in managing agile teams.
3. Solve Problems Innovatively: Utilize Lean Systems Thinking, Lean Startup, and Design Thinking to approach problems with creative and adaptive solutions.
4. Collaborate Effectively in Teams: Enhance teamwork and communication, focusing on collaborative problem-solving and effective questioning strategies.
5. Manage Complexity and Change: Identify and mitigate cognitive biases, manage complexity, and optimize outcomes in dynamic environments.
6. Develop Strategic Action Plans: Create and implement actionable plans that align team efforts with organizational goals, ensuring continuous improvement.
course_entry_req: There are no formal entry requirements or prior qualifications needed.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Communications and Public Relations Module 1: Strategic Communication Planning
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Communications and Public Relations Module 1  Strategic Communication Planning
course_objective: Keen to learn the art of strategic communication?  In today’s fast-paced, interconnected world, where public perception shapes success, mastering effective communication has become a crucial skill for any organisation seeking to stay relevant, build trust and foster strong relationships with their audiences. Whether it’s launching a new product, crafting impactful marketing campaigns, managing a brand’s reputation, or navigating through a crisis, strategic communication and public relations (PR) are key drivers of organisational achievement. The Advanced Certificate in Communications and Public Relations seeks to enhance participants' expertise in these critical areas and be equipped with the tools, insights, and practical skills needed to navigate the fast-evolving communications landscape and lead with confidence.   This module is designed to equip participants with the essential skills to develop, implement, and evaluate effective communication strategies. Covering key concepts such as audience analysis, message development, channel selection, and evaluation metrics, this module emphasises aligning communication efforts with organisational goals while factoring in market trends and stakeholder expectations.   Participants will engage in hands-on activities to create tailored communication plans for specific objectives and audiences. Through case studies and real-world examples, participants will explore best practices in crisis communication, brand management, and digital engagement. By the end of the module, participants will be able to craft strategic communication plans that enhance reputation and build strong stakeholder relationships.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Develop strategic communication plans that align with organisational goals, by analysing key components and understanding their role in shaping successful communication strategies
• Assess audience needs and preferences using communication models and theories, enabling participants to craft tailored messages that resonate with diverse stakeholder groups
• Create a comprehensive communication strategy that integrates research, messaging frameworks, and evaluation metrics, ensuring all communications efforts support broader business objectives
• Apply crisis communication strategies within a strategic framework, equipping participants with the tools to navigate risks and safeguard the organisation’s reputation during challenging circumstances
• Evaluate the role of digital media in modern communication practices, gaining insights into how emerging technologies can enhance engagement and drive successful public relations campaigns
course_entry_req: Participants should have foundational understanding of communication principles and practices

course_title: (eCornell) Framing Front-End Web Development
course_title_cleaned: (eCornell) Framing Front-End Web Development
course_objective: In this course, students go beyond the code to understand what is really important in web development. Through creating a mental model of how web development works, student are exposed to the big picture of how users interact with websites. By building empathy and an understanding of target audience needs, students recognize the benefits of approaching design from the perspective of the user and the importance of accessibility, biases, and cultural sensitivity. Finally, students dive into the inner workings of the web to remove the mystery and build a clear picture of how websites work. Ultimately, the goal of this course is to prepare students to design and build beautiful, functional websites that meet the needs of their target audience. The course is provided by eCornell in partnership with Genashtim.
course_learning_outcomes:
Recognize the impact of mental models on developing and interacting with websites.
Recognize the complexity and needs of your target audience.
Identify the importance of designing to communicate effectively.
Construct a mental model of how the web works.
Identify the common tools used in web development.

course_title: (eCornell) Knowledge-Based AI Technologies
course_title_cleaned: (eCornell) Knowledge-Based AI Technologies
course_objective: In this course, you will carefully examine knowledge-based AI technologies and discover how to apply them to common tasks in your personal life as well as your own organization's systems and processes. You will compare and contrast human and artificial intelligence and consider shifts in the field of AI related to human intelligence and rationality. You will also determine how intelligence can be modeled by using intelligent search algorithms and investigate why search alone cannot work for AI agents. You will then explore the importance and application of knowledge-based systems in conversational applications such as Siri and Alexa, customer service and advisory tools in university settings, and chatbots in consumer purchasing. In addition, you will highlight the remarkable progress of conversational AI systems in recent years and how it helps improve the effectiveness of businesses and organizations across many sectors. By the end of this course, you will understand the vital importance of knowledge-based AI technologies to society and business in the modern era. The course is provided by eCornell in partnership with Genashtim.
course_learning_outcomes:
Define heuristics for an AI search strategy
Describe elements of knowledge for an AI search strategy
Specify ways to use conversational AI to improve the customer experiences

course_title: (eCornell) Managing Organizations
course_title_cleaned: (eCornell) Managing Organizations
course_objective: In this course, you will examine the various organizational methods that help support a chain of command. You will also analyze, describe, and specify a job position to help ensure that everyone knows how their role supports overall company goals. You will design an HR management process to recruit the right potential employees, identify the best candidates, welcome them to the organization, and support them as they work. You will describe the organizational culture of a company and determine its role in helping employees do their best work. Finally, you will describe the uses of power in organizations, as employees influence one another in pursuit of common goals. In the five-part project, you will develop an organizational brief that considers each step of organizing a firm so that you can better structure the inner workings of a company to support its goals. The course is provided by eCornell in partnership with Genashtim.
course_learning_outcomes:
Apply principles of organizing to your job to sensibly divide roles and responsibilities
Analyze, describe, and specify a job position to ensure you attract the best candidates for the job
Describe the HR management process, from recruiting candidates to motivating employees
Describe the components of organizational culture and how they influence employee satisfaction and productivity
Identify the various uses of power within organizations to discover how you are affected by it and how you may affect others

course_title: (eCornell) Natural Language Processing Fundamentals
course_title_cleaned: (eCornell) Natural Language Processing Fundamentals
course_objective: In this course, you will explore the foundational vocabulary of natural language processing (NLP) � and start writing code right away � by finding patterns in strings using both simple functions and regular expressions. This will prepare you for an important component of NLP work, which is preprocessing text to reduce the size of the vocabulary being analyzed: The fewer total words that need to be analyzed, the more computationally efficient your work will be. You will then tag sentences so that you will be able to relate keywords to one another. You will also gain extensive hands-on experience writing Python, first by practicing on individual sentences then working up to a larger body of text. Overall, your understanding of and skill in NLP with Python will support you as you continue through your career and meet your goals in this area and beyond. The course is provided by eCornell in partnership with Genashtim.
course_learning_outcomes:
Divide a document into words and use regular expressions to find simple patterns
Preprocess text in order to reduce a document's vocabulary and make your analysis more computationally efficient
Tag and parse sentences in a document to relate words and phrases to one another

You will then tag sentences so that you will be able to relate keywords to one another. You will also gain extensive hands-on experience writing Python, first by practicing on individual sentences then working up to a larger body of text. Overall, your understanding of and skill in NLP with Python will support you as you continue through your career and meet your goals in this area and beyond. The course is provided by eCornell in partnership with Genashtim.

# course learning outcomes
Divide a document into words and use regular expressions to find simple patterns
Preprocess text in order to reduce a document's vocabulary and make your analysis more computationally efficient
Tag and parse sentences in a document to relate words and phrases to one another

course_title: Lighting Design

course_objective: This module is part of the Modular Certificate in Staging and Lighting Design, Diploma in Design and Media (Digital Entertainment and Events). This diploma is a comprehensive and industry-relevant programme designed for individuals seeking to build a career in the dynamic fields of live entertainment, events, and creative media production. Delivered through five Modular Certificates, the programme offers a practice-oriented learning pathway that equips students with interdisciplinary skills across production management, technical execution, design and technology.
course_learning_outcomes: This module covers the fundamental knowledge and skills required to design and rig lighting for theatre and “live” entertainment. Students will also develop competencies in general lighting language necessary to collaborate with creative and production team members. Most lessons involve mini collaborative team projects, which simulate designing in a theatre or site-specific environment. course_title: Adult Ballet for Beginners
course_title_cleaned: Adult Ballet for Beginners
course_objective: Ever dreamed of learning ballet but never had the chance to start? This beginner-friendly ballet course introduces adults to the fundamentals of ballet in a supportive and enjoyable environment. Designed for those exploring ballet as a new skill or fitness activity, the course covers posture, turnout, and basic positions of the feet and arms. Participants will progress from simple barre and center exercises to coordinated movements like port de bras, strengthening drills, and spatial awareness techniques.
course_learning_outcomes:
- Foundations: Ballet basics, posture, turnout, and fundamental positions of feet/arms.	
- Technique: Simple barre and center movements, introductory combinations, and arm coordination (port de bras).					
- Strength & Coordination: Drills to build stability and weight-transfer exercises.		
- Spatial Awareness: Body facings and directional movements in the center.		
- Artistry: Musicality, performance quality, and longer step combinations with increasing complexity.

course_title: Electronic Devices and Circuits
course_title_cleaned: Electronic Devices and Circuits
course_objective: The Diploma in Engineering (Electrical and Electronics) provides participants with a strong foundation in Electrical and Electronic (EE) Engineering and emerging skillsets in the areas of Industrial Internet of Things, Artificial Intelligence, Data Visualisation and Analytics that will equip them for the diverse and dynamic EE industry.  This unique programme offers two specialisation tracks in specific fields of Electronic Communications and Microelectronics. These are high value-adding sectors in the EE industry with strong demand for skilled and trained professionals.
course_learning_outcomes: This module equips participants with theory and practical knowledge of electronic devices such as diodes, Bipolar Junction Transistors (BJT), various types of Field Effect Transistors (FET), and their applications in electrical and electronic circuits. It also focuses on the fundamentals of operational amplifiers and their applications. Students will develop essential hands-on skills in circuit prototyping, troubleshooting and testing in practical laboratory sessions. The curriculum is designed to include extensive use of circuit simulation software tools which will help reinforce the knowledge of circuit theories learnt in lessons.

course_title_cleaned: Graduate Certificate in Creative Practices in Performance
course_objective: Courses in this area focus on techniques, methods, and approaches to creative performance practices to highlight the relationships between making, contextualising, and analysing performance. course_title: Transforming Images with Creativity
course_title_cleaned: Transforming Images with Creativity
course_objective: This course aims to equip learners with the technical and conceptual skills essential to enhance and modify photographic images for artistic and professional purposes.  It introduces learners with essential design ideas, image processing methodologies, and industry standards for assessing, enhancing, and generating optimised image outputs.  The course also incorporates legal and sustainability considerations, enabling learners to work responsibly in diverse image production settings. The course is designed for individuals with basic knowledge or experience in photography or digital content creation, offering practical practice with image editing software and workflow tools that meet professional standards.  Upon completion, learners will be equipped to utilise these abilities in diverse professions across photography, media, marketing, and content development industries.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will develop the ability to:
1) Apply design elements and principles to improve the composition and visual impact of images.
2) Comply with intellectual property, privacy, and legal requirements during image manipulation processes.
3) Assess work prints and image files for quality, sustainability, and suitability for enhancement.
4) Execute a range of image editing, processing, enhancement and manipulation techniques to produce optimal outputs using industry-relevant software.
5) Make informed decisions on tools, materials, and export settings in alignment with sustainability best practices.
course_entry_req:
Assumed / Preferred to have:
•	Basic digital literacy (computer or mobile device use)
•	Able to perform tasks such as browsing, saving files, and using editing apps or software
•	Some prior experience in image-related tasks (e.g. taking photos, basic editing, creating visuals for work, study or business)
•	Able to understand and follow instructions in English
•	Positive learning attitude and willingness to explore creative techniques
•	Suitable for adult learners aged 21 and above from all backgrounds

course_title: Youth Outreach and Development
course_title_cleaned: Youth Outreach and Development
course_objective: This module is part of the Modular Certificate in Sports and Youth Development in Outdoor Education, Diploma in Outdoor Education. This Diploma is designed to develop people-centred professionals for the outdoor education, special needs, and youth sectors. You will develop interdisciplinary skills and knowledge relating to teaching, outdoor technical skills, environment, and people through a flexible, hands-on, and applied curriculum.
course_learning_outcomes: This module introduces concepts and theories related to youth development in Singapore. Topics include positive youth development, lifespan and development stages, motivational factors, local policies, support systems, and community-based resources. The emphasis is for students to shape their attitudes towards youth development and discern the means to develop and support youth in Singapore.
course_entry_req:
‘O’ Levels 
•	At least three (3) ‘O’ Level passes in the following subjects: 
English Language (EL1 or EL2) Grade 1 – 7
Mathematics Grade 1 – 6
One (1) relevant subject Grade 1 – 6 
•	and at least one (1) year relevant work experience 

Higher Nitec
•	GPA ≥ 2.0 OR
•	GPA ≥ 1.5 AND at least one (1) year relevant work experience

Nitec 
•	GPA ≥ 3.5 OR
•	GPA ≥ 3.0 AND at least one (1) year relevant work experience  

Workforce Skills Qualifications (WSQ)       
•	Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) AND at least one (1) year relevant work experience AND Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA

•	Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least two (2) years of relevant working experience. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted will have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. RP reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

course_title: IATA DANGEROUS GOODS REGULATIONS 7.1 - Infectious Substances
course_title_cleaned: IATA DANGEROUS GOODS REGULATIONS 7.1 - Infectious Substances
course_objective: On completion of this course participants will be able to:  Shipping infectious substances can be an intimidating task when looking at the multitude of classification, packaging, marking, labelling, documentation and handling requirements. In accordance with Division 6.2 – Category A and B requirements, this course will keep you compliant with regulations for shipping infectious substances, such as those used in medical research and diagnostic fields. This course will teach you the skills to handle potentially dangerous pathogens, process all of the correct documentation, and reduce risks to yourself and those around you.   This course is recommended for:  Those involved in the transport of dangerous goods by air must complete training and assessment based on the function(s) they perform every 2 years.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is recommended for personnel responsible for preparing Dangerous Goods consignments (Infectious Substances)

Students are certified to the IATA CBTA standard 7.1 upon completion of this course
course_entry_req: Recommended level is entry-level staff in pharmaceutical transport

course_title: PDPA Compliance for Executives
course_title_cleaned: PDPA Compliance for Executives
course_objective: This course will equip the participants with  • the knowledge of the Data Protection and Do-Not-Call provisions of the Singapore Personal Data Protection Act and its impact to businesses  • the understanding that the "Tone at the top" could uplift an organisation from compliance to accountability, and that Data Protection as an organisational culture requires participation by all staffs, and continuous effort over a period of time.  • the ability to lead or supervise the Data Protection Management Programme (DPMP) implementation as a management champion (DPO), by utilising tools and resources provided by PDPC and IMDA to  a) develop and jumpstart the DPMP  b) perform data protection impact assessment (DPIA) and finalizing an action plan agreed by stakeholders  c) conduct periodical revision for DPMP improvements
course_learning_outcomes:
With more businesses pushing for digital transformation, there is a greater need for stronger Data Protection (DP) capability in businesses. Professionals and executives who are appointed as Data Protection Officers (DPO) need to be equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to carry out their functions in order to comply with the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA).

Organisations will have to adopt an accountability-based approach to safeguard personal data and use them responsibly. DPOs need to be very familiar with the obligations under the PDPA so that they are able to identify the compliance risks faced by their organisations. Based on the risks identified, the DPO will need to implement the data protection management programme at the organisation level and data protection impact assessment at the project level to ensure compliance and accountability.
course_entry_req: Diploma

course_title: Professional Certificate in Legal Practice of the Future Module 1: Fundamentals in Legal Technology
course_title_cleaned: Professional Certificate in Legal Practice of the Future Module 1  Fundamentals in Legal Technology
course_objective: At the end of the 1-day module, participants will be able to: • Develop a sound and broad understanding of the various legal technologies such as AI, Blockchain, Cloud and 5G in the legal industry • Learn how to practically evaluate and implement these technologies in their firm
course_learning_outcomes:
In an ever changing world, the context and skill sets of what it means to lead, manage and run a law firm have changed significantly. For the leaders of tomorrow’s legal practices, more than ever a more diverse skill set and structured approach to management and development of a law firm’s various processes and strategy is important.

This executive certificate programme aims to arm participants with the knowledge and systems they can use to transform their firm/ department business model from top to bottom. Focusing on such diverse areas as Technology, Business Development, HR, Operations and Legal Design, it is designed to be an introductory course giving insight and structure to processes in order to meet the challenges of tomorrow.

Module 1 aims to equip lawyers with the basic understanding of the different types of legal tech solutions out there, the underlying technology that they are based on and what the limitations of these technologies are.
course_entry_req: Participants should have at least 1-2 years PQE in a legal services firm.

Graphic Design specialisation equips students with essential skills in visual communication and design principles to create visually appealing and effective designs for various mediums, including print and digital platforms.   2. # course objective
The WSQ PDECCE-T course is designed to prepare teachers of young children for the early childhood field.

# course learning outcomes
The objectives of the course are to:

a. Enable students to transfer education philosophies and child development theories into practices which provide wide-ranging, multimedia and developmentally appropriate experiences for young children;

b. Enable students to be skillful in their role of observation and application of knowledge of child development, in order to design a learning environment that meets the needs of each individual child;

c. Present students with a variety of approaches and strategies which facilitate a creative and developmentally appropriate curriculum for young children;

d. Enable students to develop interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate with fellow colleagues, parents and other professionals in the community;

e. Help students design, implement and evaluate learning environments and classroom activities based on the Pre-school education curriculum framework/goals and desired outcomes set out by the Early Childhood Development Agency (ECDA).

# course entry req
Applicants should have:
▪ 5 GCE ‘O’ level credits including a grade C6 in GCE ‘O’ level English Language OR Any English Language Acceptable Alternatives
OR
▪ 10 years of formal education in English as a medium of instruction and passed state exam with credits in 5 different subjects OR required to pass English Language
OR
▪ Degree with English as medium of instruction from state recognised university OR required to pass English Language Acceptable Alternatives

course_title: Maximise Digital Advertising Dollars with Search Engine Marketing (SEM) [Classroom Facilitated, Asynchronous E-Learning]
course_title_cleaned: Maximise Digital Advertising Dollars with Search Engine Marketing (SEM) [Classroom Facilitated, Asynchronous E-Learning]
course_objective: The course equips participants with the essential skills to effectively leverage Google Ads for Search and Display Network advertising. By the end of the course, participants will understand key SEM concepts, best practices, and how to plan, execute, and refine Google Search and Google Display Network (GDN) campaigns. Learners will explore techniques for targeting, conversion tracking, re-marketing, and optimizing campaigns to drive higher returns on advertising spend. Additionally, participants will learn to use Pay-Per-Click (PPC) models to enhance awareness, engagement, and lead conversions, while conducting market and keyword research to identify revenue opportunities. This course also emphasizes the importance of data analysis to optimize campaigns and achieve business goals, making it ideal for professionals looking to maximize their digital advertising impact and improve their organization's ROI.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
1. understand the key differences and concepts between Google Search and Display Network campaigns.
2. create targeted paid campaigns using platform ads manager & keywords research to drive business objectives.
3. evaluate the performance of digital marketing campaigns by using collected advertising data to identify growth opportunities and insights.

course_title: Mathematics A (Classroom & Asynchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Mathematics A (Classroom & Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This course aims to provide a mathematical foundation for learners, covering key concepts such as vectors, limits, derivatives, integrals, differential equations, sequences, and series. These topics are fundamental in calculus and analysis, equipping learners with essential skills to enhance their problem-solving and analytical capabilities.  Learners will develop proficiency in solving geometrical problems using vectors, as well as in differentiating and integrating functions to tackle real-world challenges related to rates of change, optimization, and calculating areas and volumes. These mathematical skills are highly relevant across engineering and data analytics disciplines, and the course equips learners with versatile tools that lay the groundwork for their academic and professional advancement.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:

1.	Use vectors to solve geometrical problems in two- and three-dimensional space.
2.	Evaluate limits of functions using different methods.
3.	Evaluate derivatives and apply Chain Rule and Implicit differentiation and L'Hopital's Rule.
4.	Apply differentiation to solve problems related to rate of change and optimization.
5.	Evaluate integrals using different techniques and apply integration to find areas and volumes.
6.	Classify and solve Ordinary Differential Equations.
7.	Give examples of convergent and divergent sequences and series, and perform various convergence tests for series.
8.	Describe how a function can be expressed as a power series, determine the radius of convergence of a power series.
9.	Represent certain functions by manipulating geometric series or by differentiating or integrating known series.
10.	Find Taylor/Maclaurin series of a given function using definition.
11.	Evaluate partial derivatives and apply Chain Rule and Implicit Differentiation for functions of more than one variable.
12.	Apply the properties of directional derivatives and gradient vectors to solve problems related to rate of change of functions of more than one variable.
13.	Interpret the meaning of double integrals, and evaluate double integrals via iterated integrals and change of order.
14.	Evaluate double integrals in polar coordinates.
course_entry_req: Learners are required to have a relevant part-time diploma issued from local polytechnics.

course_title: (SCTP) Certificate in Food Safety and Analysis (Classroom and Async e-learning) (Full-time) (TA-eligible)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) Certificate in Food Safety and Analysis (Classroom and Async e-learning) (Full-time) (TA-eligible)
course_objective: The Skillsfuture Career Transition Programme Certificate in Food Safety and Analysis is a structured 3-month programme aimed at equipping participants with essential knowledge and hands-on skills in food safety, microbiology, and quality management systems. The course prepares participants to meet the increasing demands for food safety professionals such QA&QC Supervisors, QA&QC Specialist / Food Safety Specialist, Laboratory Technician / QC Technician  in the food industry by focusing on practical and theoretical aspects of food science, safety regulations and analytical methods.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to provide an in-depth understanding of food safety principles and equip learners with the practical skills required for the food industry.

Upon successful completion of this course, the participants will be able to: 

•	Analyse foodborne microorganisms and conduct laboratory tests for food safety.
•	Implement quality management and food safety systems (HACCP, ISO 22000) to ensure food safety compliance.
•	Develop compliant food labels under Singapore Food Regulations.
•	Apply chemistry concepts to analyse food components such as fats, proteins, and moisture.

( SCTP) Certificate in Food Safety and Analysis will be conducted in nine modules delivered via Classroom and Async e-learning:
1. Fundamentals of Food Microbiology
2. Techniques in Food Microbiology
3. Quality Management System
4. Food Safety Management Systems
5. Food Regulations & Labelling
6. Analytical Methods in Food Science
7. Instrumental Analysis in Food Science
8. Applied Food Chemistry
9. HACCP Project
course_entry_req:
Target learners (MER)

1. GCE ‘O’ Level(with Minimum of 3 relevant GCE ‘O’ Levels passes and 1 year relevant working experience)

2.    NITEC or Higher NITEC learners from the NITEC in Applied Food Science, NITEC in Chemical Process Technology, Higher NITEC in Chemical Technology, Higher NITEC in Biotechnlogy and Higher NITEC in Applied Food Science.

3. Diploma graduates (any disciplines)

4. Any relevant formal certificate 

Recognition for Prior learning (RPL) for Food Science
-At least 2 years of relevant working experience (subject to interview/assessment)

Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to be course based on evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or proficiency test.

course_title: Designing Innovations for Sustainability
course_title_cleaned: Designing Innovations for Sustainability
course_objective: At the end of this course, participants should be able to:  1. Evaluate the validity of sustainability claims.  2. Identify areas to improve the sustainability performance of their products and services.  3. Effectively communicate the sustainability performance of their products and services and differentiate them from competitors.
course_learning_outcomes:
Businesses must continuously innovate to thrive in today’s fast-paced world. Additionally, with increasing societal pressure to act more responsibly and adopt sustainable practices, they must simultaneously strive to reduce the negative environmental impact of their innovative products and services. Business leaders can achieve both objectives by designing their innovations for sustainability, but many lack the know-how to get started.

This one-day interactive course empowers business leaders and innovators to start designing their innovations for sustainability by first equipping them with the latest knowledge, insights, and developments in core sustainability concepts and trends. Participants will also learn to critically evaluate and improve their proposed innovations' sustainability performance. They will learn various frameworks, techniques, and tools to minimize the carbon footprint of their proposed innovations and enable them to participate in the Circular Economy.

By the end of this course, participants will gain the necessary know-how to lead their teams to design their future innovations for sustainability, communicate their design decisions and outcomes effectively, and achieve their sustainability goals.
course_entry_req: Proficient in English

course_title: Singapore’s Regulatory Frameworks for Fund Managers
course_title_cleaned: Singapore’s Regulatory Frameworks for Fund Managers
course_objective: Singapore’s Regulatory Frameworks for Fund Managers" provides an in-depth exploration of the regulatory landscape governing fund managers in Singapore.   This programme focuses on critical compliance areas, including anti-financial crime measures, market abuse and conducts, fund management regulations, advertising compliance, and business continuity management for fund managers.  Participants will gain the knowledge and tools needed to navigate MAS guidelines and regulatory requirements effectively, uphold ethical practices, and build resilient and compliant fund management organisations. This programme qualifies for 6 Core Securities and Futures Act (SFA)/Financial Advisers Act (FAA) Continuing Professional Development training (CPD) hours, helping professionals meet regulatory requirements while advancing their expertise.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course bundle, learners will be able to:

1) Apply Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism in Singapore (AML/CFT) principles and sanctions compliance to effectively mitigate financial crime risks and address emerging threats in asset management.

2) Understand and navigate market abuse regulations to identify, prevent, and address instances of unethical conduct within the regulatory framework.

3) Interpret and comply with Singapore’s fund management regulations, ensuring alignment with Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) standards and expectations.

4) Enhance organizational resilience through robust business continuity management practices tailored to fund management companies.

5) Implement Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) fair dealing guidelines to ensure accountability and foster trust through effective leadership and customer-focused practices.

6) Develop advertising and marketing strategies for retail fund management that align with regulatory compliance and fair dealing outcomes.

course_title: Gestalt Play Therapy - The Oaklander Approach
course_title_cleaned: Gestalt Play Therapy - The Oaklander Approach
course_objective: Objectives:  At the end of the workshop, participants are expected to achieve the following objectives:  • Overview of the therapeutic process developed by Violet Oaklander.  • Understand Gestalt relational perspective on child development and the nature of the self  • Learn Gestalt play therapy process of working with projections through creative arts  • Learn how to build therapeutic relationship with children and adolescents and facilitate emotional expression and deeper self awareness.  Application:  At the end of the workshop, participants are expected to be able to do the following:  • Apply Oaklander's process for assessment and intervention with clients  • Developing intervention programs wth different creative arts modalities such as art, clay, puppets  • Use the Gestalt play therapy approach to help clients develop deeper self awareness.
course_learning_outcomes:
This workshop (basic, part 2) continues to build on theoretical understanding and clinical skills of Gestalt Play Therapy with special focus on the Oaklander Approach. The Approach is represented in the works of Violet Oaklander, Ph.D., author of Windows to Our Children: A Gestalt Approach to Child and Adolescent Psychotherapy (1989) and Hidden Treasure: A Map to the Child’s Inner Self (2007). The workshop will examine closely factors that bring about change and growth for a child or adolescent through the therapeutic process of Gestalt Therapy.

Participants will learn a range of play modalities and media such as puppets, art and sand to provide them with a wide repertoire to meet the wide and complex needs of children and adolescents. Working in pairs or small groups, participants will have opportunities for group consultation and practice.
course_entry_req: At least a Degree in any discipline
