course_title: Manage and Create Unforgettable F&B Service Moments
course_title_cleaned: Manage and Create Unforgettable F&B Service Moments
course_objective: This course is designed to equip learners with the essential knowledge, skills, and competencies required for delivering exceptional Food & Beverage (F&B) service. Through interactive lessons, real-world scenarios, and practical assessments, participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of menu knowledge, quality control processes, customer request management, and adherence to standard operating procedures. The course prepares learners to confidently handle service operations, ensuring guest satisfaction and operational excellence in any F&B setting.
course_learning_outcomes:
1.Menu Knowledge for F&B Service Staff
Explain menu items, including ingredients, preparation methods, and timing.
Address guest inquiries and concerns with confidence and promptness.
Review and manage order intakes effectively.

2. F&B Service Quality Check and Control for Food Products
Conduct final quality checks before packing food products.
Ensure accuracy in packaging, labeling, and adherence to special order requirements.
Communicate effectively within the team to handle ad hoc and special orders.

3.Managing Customer Requests and Feedback
Apply different service styles to address and resolve customer feedback and ad hoc requests.
Maintain quality assurance throughout service operations.
Adapt to various scenarios using problem-solving and decision-making skills.

4.Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for Service Preparation Areas
Follow SOPs for opening and closing service areas.
Take corrective actions to address customer dissatisfaction.
Demonstrate leadership by conducting pre-service briefings and ensuring team alignment.

This course integrates theoretical understanding with practical applications, enabling learners to enhance their professional competency in the F&B service industry.
course_entry_req: Participants are required to have the ability to converse, read and write in English. Minimum Lower Secondary Education or WPLN Level 3 and above.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NTUC LEARNINGHUB PTE. LTD.

# course title

# course objective
This course is designed to equip learners with the essential knowledge, skills, and competencies required for delivering exceptional Food & Beverage (F&B) service. Through interactive lessons, real-world scenarios, and practical assessments, participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of menu knowledge, quality control processes, customer request management, and adherence to standard operating procedures. The course prepares learners to confidently handle service operations, ensuring guest satisfaction and operational excellence in any F&B setting.

# course learning outcomes
1.Menu Knowledge for F&B Service Staff
Explain menu items, including ingredients, preparation methods, and timing.
Address guest inquiries and concerns with confidence and promptness.
Review and manage order intakes effectively.

2. F&B Service Quality Check and Control for Food Products
Conduct final quality checks before packing food products.
Ensure accuracy in packaging, labeling, and adherence to special order requirements.
Communicate effectively within the team to handle ad hoc and special orders.

3.Managing Customer Requests and Feedback
Apply different service styles to address and resolve customer feedback and ad hoc requests.
Maintain quality assurance throughout service operations.
Adapt to various scenarios using problem-solving and decision-making skills.

4.Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for Service Preparation Areas
Follow SOPs for opening and closing service areas.
Take corrective actions to address customer dissatisfaction.
Demonstrate leadership by conducting pre-service briefings and ensuring team alignment.

This course integrates theoretical understanding with practical applications, enabling learners to enhance their professional competency in the F&B service industry.

course_title: Sustainability Landscape and the Built Environment
course_title_cleaned: Sustainability Landscape and the Built Environment
course_objective: At the end of the course, participants will:  a. Gain a broad overview of climate science, global warming, the value of mangroves, and forests as carbon sinks  b. Appreciate the impact of climate change on Singapore & the risks we face  c. Appreciate the concepts behind carbon estimation in Singapore’s forests and other ecosystems.  d. Appreciate the concepts of biophilic/nature-based solutions to mitigate climate change in the urban design and urban planning context  e. Be aware of the urbanisation effects on environmental variables such as solar radiation, storage of heat, and wider implications for environmental change.  f. Gain an appreciation of the concepts and solutions to adapt to climate change in relation to the built environment sector
course_learning_outcomes: This course introduces participants to Nature-based Climate Solutions and Adaptation measures that can be incorporated in planning and design, to adapt to the effects of climate change.
course_entry_req:
Bachelor's Degree/ Diploma holders in Engineering, Science, Technology, and Bachelor's degree in Architecture preferred.

For Diploma holders, relevant work experience will be required.

course_title: Applications of Quantum Technology and AI in Finance
course_title_cleaned: Applications of Quantum Technology and AI in Finance
course_objective: This course offers participants an exploration of quantum technology and its transformative potential in financial applications. Participants will gain practical insights into executing quantum algorithms, implementing quantum-safe cybersecurity measures, and solving complex financial optimization problems. The course will also delve into the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) with quantum technology to enhance predictive analytics, decision-making processes, and optimize processes in the financial sector. By the end of this course, participants will demonstrate competency in both quantum and AI technologies in real-world financial contexts.
course_learning_outcomes: By the end of this module, participants will:•Be equipped with a deep understanding of quantum technology and artificial intelligence principles and their specific applications in finance.•Examine the critical role of quantum cybersecurity in safeguarding financial data in compliance with regulatory standards.•Analyze the rapid advancements in the integration of quantum technology and artificial intelligence, with a focus on their implications for the finance industry.•Demonstrate proficiency in leveraging quantum and AI technologies, gaining a competitive edge in the financial sector.

course_title: Sustainability and Climate Risk Certification Training Program (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Sustainability and Climate Risk Certification Training Program (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The course will equip students to take the SCR exam certified by GARP. A certified student is expected to have a broad knowledge of sustainability and climate risk.  This knowledge will allow the student to gain entry employment into areas such as green finance, Environmental-Social-Governance (ESG) indexing, sustainability consulting, governmental /non-governmental advocacy, financial institution's climate risk management, sustainability reporting & governance, carbon credit markets, etc.  The subject will be extremely relevant and timely as the financial industry, listed companies & regulators are embracing climate change and the green agenda rapidly, driven by regulatory requirements. We expect a sharp increase in green workforce and a competency gap and increased need for these emerging skill sets. This knowledge base is multi-disciplinary-- combining science, finance and advocacy-- will certainly be in high demand.
course_learning_outcomes:
Climate risk and Sustainability are fast gaining importance in today’s financial world because of the global agenda on climate change and efforts to reduce Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions internationally. These follows the Paris agreement on climate change in 2015 and COP26 @Glasgow more recently. Indeed, climate risk is an emerging ‘new’ risk class in financial institutions because of indirect dire impact from transition risk and physical risks. Importantly regulators (such as the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)) are drafting the standards and reporting requirements for this new emerging risk class to be measured, controlled and disclosed.

The Risk Management Institute (RMI)’s Sustainability and Climate Risk (SCR) exam preparation course’ is designed to align with Global Association of Risk Professionals' (GARP) SCR (Climate risk and Sustainability) certification objectives and examination structure.

The latest (2023) SCR comprises an 8 chapters course covering aspect of sustainability and climate risk management. The RMI course is composed of 7 sessions of 3 hours each—which should be sufficient to all 8 chapters. There will be a quiz at the end of the course which mirrors the format, coverage and standards of the actual SCR exam syllabus.

Chapter 1: Foundations of Climate Change: What Is Climate Change

Chapter 2: Sustainability

Chapter 3: Climate Change Risk

Chapter 4: Sustainability and Climate Policy, Culture, and Governance

Chapter 5: Green and Sustainable Finance: Markets and Instruments

Chapter 6: Climate Risk Measurement and Management

Chapter 7: Climate Models and Scenario Analysis

Chapter 8: Net Zero
course_entry_req: There are no work experience or prior qualifications required to sit for the SCR exam. Hence, this will be the same to take this preparation course. However, course participants are generally expected to have general proficiency in the English language, and a basic degree/diploma (in any subject) at the university/college/polytechnic level.
full_course_desc:

course_title: CaseTrust Accreditation Scheme for eCommerce Business & Individual Training 1 [Classroom Facilitated, Practical Training, Asynchronous E-Learning]
course_title_cleaned: CaseTrust Accreditation Scheme for eCommerce Business & Individual Training 1 [Classroom Facilitated, Practical Training, Asynchronous E-Learning]
course_objective: Since its inception in 1971, 50 years ago, much has been achieved by CASE in fulfilling its purpose of protecting and promoting consumers’ interests. Today, the CaseTrust Quality Mark is recognized and accepted by both retailers and consumers as a symbol of a business that has attained a level of customer-centricity in its business and operations, evoking consumer confidence and providing an edge over non-accredited competitors.  This Individual Training Programme is structured to help businesses close the Accreditation criteria gaps by identifying and guiding them to apply the appropriate solutions. Participants will also learn to apply cybersecurity frameworks and implement practices to ensure safe and reliable networks and systems, enhancing trustworthiness across their eCommerce channels.  The aim is for businesses to ensure that their eCommerce channels provide an optimal end-to-end customer experience, which will, in turn, elevate business credibility and returns. Participants will also be trained on completing their Accreditation Desktop Assessment, submitting their Accreditation application, and preparing for their Practical Assessment, maximizing their chances of obtaining accreditation.  Accredited businesses will benefit significantly not only from displaying the CaseTrust Quality Mark, which sets them apart from non-accredited competitors, but also from the advantages of optimally enhanced e-Commerce channels that drive greater sales conversion.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, learner will be able to:
1. identify the solutions that optimise the user experience based on relevance to the business and fulfilment of the Accreditation requirements. 
2. apply the required solutions that fulfil all the Accreditation criteria based on the gaps identified.
3. administer the Accreditation application for submission to CASE through understanding the requirements and process.
course_entry_req: Basic English Proficiency and Digital Literacy. Must own an eCommerce Business.

course_title_cleaned: Advanced Social Media Advertising (Part-Time)

It begins by providing hands-on experience in executing Meta (Facebook and Instagram) advertising campaigns with AI support, covering advanced features such as custom audience creation and lookalike audience targeting. Learners will gain proficiency in leveraging Advantage+ for enhanced ad performance. The course also explores the implementation of TikTok and LinkedIn advertising, with a strong emphasis on aligning these efforts with an overarching social media strategy. By the end of the course, learners will have the skills and knowledge necessary to execute advanced social media advertising campaigns across multiple platforms.

●	Gain a comprehensive understanding of the key features and current trends in major social media networks, including Meta (Facebook and Instagram), TikTok, YouTube, and LinkedIn, enabling them to navigate these platforms effectively

●	Acquire the skills needed to leverage AI execution support tools, optimizing their social media strategies, and enhancing their efficiency in content creation and distribution

●	Develop strategic social media marketing plans, with an emphasis on community engagement and management strategies to foster active and loyal online communities

●	Understand the knowledge and tools required to identify suitable influencers, collaborate with them, and measure the impact of influencer partnerships on their social media campaigns

●	Create content that resonates with their target audience across various social media platforms, aligning their content strategies with their overall marketing objectives

course_title: PTY6203 Musculoskeletal Diagnostic Imaging (Classroom & Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: PTY6203 Musculoskeletal Diagnostic Imaging (Classroom & Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: The module is designed to develop knowledge, skills and competencies in integrating diagnostic imaging of musculoskeletal conditions as part of safe and effective physiotherapy clinical practice. The module aims to upskill physiotherapists with the ability to confidently determine indicators and contraindications for the order of plain film radiography for musculoskeletal assessment, including the ethical considerations in use of diagnostic imaging. Concepts and skills needed for analysis and interpretation of imaging findings, and understanding of investigation reports will be covered, with the focus placed on plain film radiography. This module will also strengthen the physiotherapist’s ability to incorporate imaging findings into problem identification, management strategies, intervention goals and patient education in accordance with clinical practice guidelines. A key emphasis of this module is patient safety and the enablement of physiotherapists to communicate effectively with other healthcare practitioners on appropriate action plan following diagnostic imaging.
course_learning_outcomes:
After successfully completing this module you should be able to:  

1.	Outline Radiation Protection (Ionising Radiation) Regulations and Radiation Protection Act. 

2.	Differentiate the capabilities, benefits and limitations of plain film radiography compared to other diagnostic imaging modalities for musculoskeletal assessments. 

3.	Explain the different plain film radiography views for various body regions, including the reasoning for the specific views. 

4.	Evaluate the indications and contraindications for plain film radiography based on ethical considerations, assessment findings and clinical decision-making rules. 

5.	Differentiate between normal and common pathological or degenerative changes in plain film radiography for the musculoskeletal system. 

6.	Perform basic interpretation of plain film radiography for the musculoskeletal system. 

7.	Integrate diagnostic imaging findings and reports into clinical practice by correlating the findings with clinical examination and findings. 

8.	Enhance professional communication to patients, caregivers and other healthcare practitioners regarding diagnostic imaging findings and the appropriate action plans.
course_entry_req:
Allied Health Professions Council (AHPC) registered physiotherapist with relevant primary bachelor's degree in the relevant discipline (for example Physiotherapy).  

Candidates are recommended to have 2 years of working experience in a musculoskeletal setting.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
SINGAPORE INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY

# course title
PTY6203 Musculoskeletal Diagnostic Imaging (Classroom & Asynchronous e-Learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025055931

# course duration
6 days - 1 month

# full course fee
$4,100.00

# subsidised course fee
$1,230.00

# course number of hours
94.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
The module is designed to develop knowledge, skills and competencies in integrating diagnostic imaging of musculoskeletal conditions as part of safe and effective physiotherapy clinical practice. The module aims to upskill physiotherapists with the ability to confidently determine indicators and contraindications for the order of plain film radiography for musculoskeletal assessment, including the ethical considerations in use of diagnostic imaging. Concepts and skills needed for analysis and interpretation of imaging findings, and understanding of investigation reports will be covered, with the focus placed on plain film radiography. This module will also strengthen the physiotherapist’s ability to incorporate imaging findings into problem identification, management strategies, intervention goals and patient education in accordance with clinical practice guidelines. A key emphasis of this module is patient safety and the enablement of physiotherapists to communicate effectively with other healthcare practitioners on appropriate action plan following diagnostic imaging.

# course learning outcomes
After successfully completing this module you should be able to:  

1.	Outline Radiation Protection (Ionising Radiation) Regulations and Radiation Protection Act. 

2.	Differentiate the capabilities, benefits and limitations of plain film radiography compared to other diagnostic imaging modalities for musculoskeletal assessments. 

3.	Explain the different plain film radiography views for various body regions, including the reasoning for the specific views. 

4.	Evaluate the indications and contraindications for plain film radiography based on ethical considerations, assessment findings and clinical decision-making rules. 

5.	Differentiate between normal and common pathological or degenerative changes in plain film radiography for the musculoskeletal system. 

6.	Perform basic interpretation of plain film radiography for the musculoskeletal system. 

7.	Integrate diagnostic imaging findings and reports into clinical practice by correlating the findings with clinical examination and findings. 

8.	Enhance professional communication to patients, caregivers and other healthcare practitioners regarding diagnostic imaging findings and the appropriate action plans. 


# course entry req
Allied Health Professions Council (AHPC) registered physiotherapist with relevant primary bachelor's degree in the relevant discipline (for example Physiotherapy).  

Candidates are recommended to have 2 years of working experience in a musculoskeletal setting.

course_provider: BELLS INSTITUTE OF HIGHER LEARNING PTE. LTD.
course_title: Programmatic and Digital Advertising(Part-Time)
course_title_cleaned: Programmatic and Digital Advertising(Part-Time)
course_objective: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of programmatic and digital advertising, starting with an exploration of the programmatic advertising landscape. It covers the fundamentals of digital advertising planning, including audience targeting, budget allocation, and ad format selection. Learners will delve into performance marketing analytics, learning how to measure and optimize campaign effectiveness. Additionally, the course offers hands-on experience in executing Google Ads campaigns, covering paid search, display, and YouTube advertising. A key focus will be on leveraging AI-powered tools, such as Performance Max, to enhance campaign performance and achieve optimal results in the dynamic digital advertising ecosystem.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learners will be able to: 
●	Gain a deep understanding of the programmatic advertising landscape, including its concepts, technologies, and significance in modern advertising

●	Acquire skills in digital advertising planning, encompassing audience targeting, budget allocation, and ad format selection to create effective campaigns

●	Measure and assess the effectiveness of digital advertising campaigns, utilizing key performance indicators (KPIs) and analytics tools to optimize outcomes

●	Gain practical expertise in executing Google Ads campaigns, spanning paid search, display, and YouTube advertising, enabling them to navigate these platforms effectively

●	Understand the integration of AI-powered tools, such as Performance Max, to enhance campaign performance, automate tasks, and achieve optimal results in the ever-evolving digital advertising ecosystem

●	Have hands-on experience in planning, executing, and optimizing digital advertising campaigns, equipping them with practical skills to excel in the field of digital advertising
course_entry_req:
Minimum Age: 21

Academic Level: At least 3 GCE ‘O’ Level Passes including English Language with C6 pass or Higher Nitec or Equivalent

Language Proficiency: 

Be able to listen, speak, read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to WSQ Workplace Literacy (WPLN) Level 4.

course_title: Financial Ethics and Regulatory Considerations in AI Adoption (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Financial Ethics and Regulatory Considerations in AI Adoption (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: This course examines the ethical and regulatory challenges of artificial intelligence(AI) in the financial industry, focusing on issues like fairness, transparency, and privacy when analysing credit scoring, loan approvals and investment analysis. The course will help students gain a comprehensive understanding of global standards and frameworks for responsibly governing AI applications in financial services. Learners will explore regulatory frameworks, compliance requirements, and key laws, as so as to incorporate environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors into their financial investment strategies and practices. The course provides practical insights into the ethical dilemmas posed by AI-driven financial systems.    This course forms part of the SCTP NUS Digital Finance Project Management with AI  which consists of 8 modules.
course_learning_outcomes:
The learners will:
1.	Discuss the ethical issues related to artificial intelligence(AI) adoption in the financial industry, considering the effects of fairness, transparency, and privacy in terms of measurement of credit risk, portfolio selection and handling of financial data for clients.
2.	Interpret regulatory frameworks and compliance requirements for AI applications in financial institutions and regulatory bodies to ensure ethical and sustainable generation of financial returns.
3.	Describe the ethical implications of using AI-driven algorithms in credit scoring, loan approvals, and algorithmic trading, referring to case studies for insights.
4.	Explain the core risks and potential harms posed by AI systems when making financial decisions e.g. evaluation of creditworthiness of clients, credit risk rating for firms, along with the characteristics of trustworthy AI and the principles necessary for responsible and ethical AI to help improve financial decision accuracy.
5.	Identify global AI-specific laws and the main frameworks and standards that demonstrate how AI systems can be governed responsibly such as governance related to the handling of financial data of clients.
course_entry_req: General Diploma

course_title: NUR6105 Organ Transplant Nursing (Classroom & Synchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: NUR6105 Organ Transplant Nursing (Classroom & Synchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: This module introduces the main concepts in the provision of nursing care and services to transplant recipients and donors. It also explores the professionalism aspects of transplantation, the nurses’ role and responsibilities in providing care to both the transplant recipients and donors as well as incorporating the legal and ethical considerations and a wide range of transplant-related complications and chronic allograft dysfunction.
course_learning_outcomes: Solid organ transplant nursing is a specialised nursing care that focused on protection, promotion and optimisation of the health and abilities of both the transplant recipients and the living donors across the life span. This care includes prevention, detection and treatment of illness and injury related to diseases treated by solid organ transplantation, and disease that may result from living donor donation in individuals, families, communities and population of all ages.
course_entry_req: Singapore Nursing Board (SNB) registered nurses with minimum diploma in nursing and must have at least 2 years of work experience in nursing, of which at least 1 year must be in the relevant specialty field of any adult organ transplant.

course_title: Fair Hiring Practices
course_title_cleaned: Fair Hiring Practices
course_objective: LU1: Fair Employment Guidelines in Selection Management LU2: Evaluate Applications Based on Fair and Transparent Criteria LU3: Adapt to Market Trends and Evolving Hiring Needs  LU4: Legal and Ethical Hiring Considerations LU5: Conduct Structured and Unbiased Interviews LU6: Make Equitable and Data-Driven Hiring Decisions LU7: Effective Candidate Communication using Fair Hiring Practices LU8: Stakeholder Collaboration and Engagement
course_learning_outcomes:
LO1: Apply fair employment principles to proposed selection processes in compliance with national guidelines
LO2: Analyse candidate applications using established shortlisting methods for accurate assessment of suitability
LO3: Differentiate hiring approaches based on current market selection trends using real-world examples and industry case studies
LO4: Apply ethical and legal hiring principles to candidate evaluations based on workplace contexts
LO5: Conduct structured interview questions aligned to the job requirements and role-based competencies
LO6: Assess candidate data to inform selection decisions using scoring rubrics and candidate profiles
LO7: Identify clear communication techniques for informing candidates of outcomes based on fair hiring practices
LO8: Determine action plan to gain hiring managers’ commitment to fair and inclusive selection practices in team settings
course_entry_req: Learners are assumed to able to speak, listen, read and write English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5.

course_title: Diploma in Engineering (Microelectronics & Semiconductor Technology)
course_title_cleaned: Diploma in Engineering (Microelectronics & Semiconductor Technology)
course_objective: The Part-Time Diploma in Engineering (Microelectronics & Semiconductor Technology) (DEMST) focuses on the principles and applications of microelectronics and semiconductor technology that is applied in the areas of Integrated Circuit (IC) design, wafer fabrication and testing. It equips current electronics technicians, assistant engineers, or participants with equivalent roles with the knowledge and skills required to undertake new roles that include microelectronics process engineer, semiconductor device engineer, test and validation engineer, and quality engineer in the semiconductor and consumer electronics industries.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course equips participants with a deep understanding of microelectronics and semiconductor technology through a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical skills. Participants will analyze, design, and troubleshoot circuits, gaining proficiency in the use of various instruments and tools. They will also create and simulate integrated circuits, applying principles of analog and digital electronics to real-world scenarios. Advanced modules cover IC design and wafer fabrication processes, where participants will describe, identify, and explain the steps involved, and apply industry-standard design tools.

Further, the course includes specialized training in packaging and IC testing. Participants will evaluate and implement testing procedures, using automated test equipment to perform functional and parametric tests. Emphasis is also placed on quality, reliability, yield improvement, defect and failure analysis, and manufacturing excellence. Participants will analyze manufacturing processes, conduct defect analysis, and implement lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methodologies to enhance productivity and reduce waste. Awareness of the positive and negative impact of semiconductor to the environment is also discussed.
course_entry_req:
The following GCE 'O' Level grades and with at least 1 year of relevant working experience:
•	English Language Grade 1 – 7
•	Mathematics (Elementary or Additional) Grade 1 – 6
•	Science Grade 1 – 6

Science can be one of the following subjects:
•	Biology
•	Chemistry
•	Combined Science
•	Design & Technology
•	Electricity & Electronics
•	Fundamentals of Electronics
•	Integrated Science/Additional Combined Science
•	Physical Science
•	Physics/Engineering Science
•	Science (Chemistry, Biology)
•	Science (Physics, Biology)
•	Science (Physics, Chemistry)
•	Science (Physics, Chemistry, Biology) 

Nitec in an engineering or information technology discipline
GPA > 3.5 OR
GPA > 3.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience


Nitec in Technology in an engineering or information technology discipline
GPA > 3.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience

course_title: Building Attention and Self Awareness for Individuals with Autism Using Mindfulness
course_title_cleaned: Building Attention and Self Awareness for Individuals with Autism Using Mindfulness
course_objective: This skills training has 3 major components.1)  Part 1 covers challenges of individuals with ASD in attention and self-awareness2)  In Part 2, participants will be taught the basics of mindfulness and how mindfulness can be helpful for individuals with ASD. Participants will get to practice and experience varied mindfulness practices.3)  Lastly in Part 3, participants will be taught progressive steps in using mindfulness to help individuals with ASD to build attention.
course_learning_outcomes: This workshop teaches strategies using mindfulness to help individuals with ASD to direct attention and build self-awareness. All the participants will be guided through the practices progressively, from easy-to-do practices to the more difficult practices that will be helpful to build attention span. The easy practices can be taught and understood by individuals with ASD of all ages and across the whole spectrum.

course_title: Supporting Individuals with Autism in Special Needs School and Day Care Activity Centre
course_title_cleaned: Supporting Individuals with Autism in Special Needs School and Day Care Activity Centre
course_objective: This skills training has 4 major components: 1)  Part A provides an overview of the difficulties and needs of individuals with ASD 2)  In Part B, participants will be taught strategies on how to help an individual with ASD to have better understanding of their environment, eg. What to expect in the environment. 3)  In Part C, participants get to learn ways to identify and prevent lash out as well as strategies to manage a lash out.4)  Part D covers information and strategies to help such individuals to build emotional understanding and awareness
course_learning_outcomes: Individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) who present with verbal and language difficulties may consistently face challenges in understanding the environment around them and regulating their emotions. These challenges may be stressful for caregivers and families to deal with. In this 1-day course, we will be sharing strategies that will be helpful for individuals with ASD to build understanding of their environment and coping skills to regulate their emotions. The participants will be given practice to plan schedules and routines that will promote the overall well-being of individuals with ASD.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
OREGO PTE. LTD.

# course title
Supporting Individuals with Autism in Special Needs School and Day Care Activity Centre

This skills training has 4 major components: 1)  Part A provides an overview of the difficulties and needs of individuals with ASD 2)  In Part B, participants will be taught strategies on how to help an individual with ASD to have better understanding of their environment, eg. What to expect in the environment. 3)  In Part C, participants get to learn ways to identify and prevent lash out as well as strategies to manage a lash out.4)  Part D covers information and strategies to help such individuals to build emotional understanding and awareness

# course learning outcomes
Individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) who present with verbal and language difficulties may consistently face challenges in understanding the environment around them and regulating their emotions. These challenges may be stressful for caregivers and families to deal with. In this 1-day course, we will be sharing strategies that will be helpful for individuals with ASD to build understanding of their environment and coping skills to regulate their emotions. The participants will be given practice to plan schedules and routines that will promote the overall well-being of individuals with ASD.

course_title: Threat-Oriented Person Screening Integrated System (TOPSIS) [Synchronous e-learning]
course_title_cleaned: Threat-Oriented Person Screening Integrated System (TOPSIS) [Synchronous e-learning]
course_objective: The Introduction to Threat-Oriented Person Screening Integrated System (TOPSIS) will focus on participants in the skillsets needed to conduct TOPSIS enhanced screening. In addition, it will also reinforce participants’ understanding of the Threat-Oriented Person Screening Integrated System (TOPSIS) concept and the passive observation skillset used to establish an operational baseline and detect Tell-Tale Indicators (TTIs).  This programme is supported by the Singapore Police Force.
course_learning_outcomes:
• Understand the concept, components, and implementation phases of
  Threat-Oriented Person Screening Integrated System (TOPSIS).
• Identify and analyze Tell-Tale Indicators (TTIs) to detect suspicious
  persons, objects, and activities.
• Make effective use of technology to enhance threat detection.
• Build and sustain a culture of Recognising, Reporting, and Resolution (3Rs)
  for effective threat management within organisation.
• Apply behavioral analysis and security questioning techniques in screening
  processes for enhanced security outcomes.
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Bread Making 1
course_title_cleaned: Bread Making 1
course_objective: This course will equip learners with the knowledge and techniques involved in the baking process of basic bread products. Learners will gain hands-on skills on to gather ingredients, handling of dough, manage the proofing and baking process.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, learners will attain knowledge and skills in the following area: 
• Identify the types and uses of baking tools and equipment
• Apply the use baker's percentage and formulas in calculation of ingredient requirement
• Apply methods and techniques of handling knives for bread products
• Determine the readiness of dough at various stages of bread making 
• Manage bread making baking time and temperature
• Determine appropriate methods of cooling and storing finished bread products and raw materials

course_title: Adapting Programmes for Persons with Disabilities
course_title_cleaned: Adapting Programmes for Persons with Disabilities
course_objective: By the end of the course, learners will be able to:  1.	Apply principles of Universal Design for Learning in the adapting of programmes to meet needs of persons with disabilities  2.	Propose solutions to address potential challenges in implementing programmes with persons with disabilities
course_learning_outcomes: In moving towards building an inclusive society to integrate persons with disabilities, there is a need to re-look at designing and adapting programmes that cater to persons of all abilities. This module will introduce participants to the elements of Universal Design for Learning and how they can be applied in adapting programmes to suit the needs of children and adolescents with special needs, while placing the needs of persons of all abilities in the heart of the adaptation process. Participants will be guided on how they can adapt the existing programmes from their workplace to meet the needs of persons with disabilities. Participants will walk away from the course with prototypes of programmes that can be implemented in their engagement with persons of all abilities.
course_entry_req:
The skills and knowledge for this course, which the learner is assumed to possess, are as follows:
* A minimum of GCE ‘N’ Level with credits including English Language as a first language; or
* Be able to listen, speak, read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualifications (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5

course_title: SIMATIC PCS 7 System Course (Part 2)
course_title_cleaned: SIMATIC PCS 7 System Course (Part 2)
course_objective: In this Process Control System (PCS) course, trainee will learn how to implement the diversity of engineering possibilities with SIMATIC PCS 7 process control system in a structured and efficient way. Trainee will configure the entire control system from the field level through the automation system to the operating and monitoring system.  The course is structured into two parts. Trainees are required to attend both Part 1 and Part 2 consecutively as a bundle to achieve completion. Attendance in both Part 1 and Part 2 is mandatory without exceptions.
course_learning_outcomes:
Some of the Skills and Compentencies 
- Communication
- Decision Making
- Technology Roadmap
- Design Specificaiton

This course will address the gap on the Industrial Automation field. This helps the learners understand and practice system design, programming, graphics design, and troubleshooting. 

This will help learners find development not just for employment but also for personal technical growth.

This course is very relevant to this industry, since this is the cutting edge technology that is present right now.
course_entry_req:
Learners must have a background on basics of Industrial Automation:

Work Experience: Work experience that is related to Industrial Automation, Instrumentation, Electrical, Electronics, and Mechanical for the Industrial Industry.

Learners must have at least a basic knowledge of the following prior to attending the course
- Basic Ladder Programming
- Basic Graphics Design
- Analog and Digital Signals

course_title: Diploma in Engineering (Mechanical Technology)
course_title_cleaned: Diploma in Engineering (Mechanical Technology)
course_objective: Graduates of the course will be better equipped with knowledge and skills required of a Mechanical Engineering Technologist to enable him/her to:  (i) Support Mechanical Engineers in the performance of their technical duties, such as design, operation, fabrication, commissioning and maintenance work. (ii) Operate and maintain a wide range of mechanical and manufacturing   equipment. (iii) Carry out design, fabrication, modification and commissioning of mechanical components and systems.
course_learning_outcomes: The Diploma in Engineering (Mechanical Technology) aims to better prepare students with necessary skills and knowledge for career advancement to meet the demands for the operation and maintenance of equipment and facilities for all key industry sectors such as Precision Engineering (PE).
course_entry_req:
The following GCE 'O' Level grades and with at least 1 year of relevant working experience:
• English Language Grade 1 – 7
• Mathematics (Elementary or Additional) Grade 1 – 6
• Science Grade 1 - 6
• Any one other subject excluding CCA Grade 1 – 6
• GPA > 3.5 OR
• GPA > 3.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience
• GPA > 3.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience
• GPA > 2.0 OR
• GPA > 1.5 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience
• GPA > 2.0 and at least 1 year of relevant working experience
• Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) with at least 1 year of
relevant working experience and Level 6 for both WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA & Workplace Numeracy SOA
• At least 2 years of relevant working experience.

course_title: Air Traffic Safety Electronics Personnel Qualification (Communications - Data)
course_title_cleaned: Air Traffic Safety Electronics Personnel Qualification (Communications - Data)
course_objective: This course builds on the Air Traffic Safety Electronics Personnel (ATSEP) Basic course to strengthen your knowledge and skills relating to the design, installation, operation and maintenance of data communications systems. Designed in collaboration with Temasek Polytechnic, it leverages the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore and Temasek Polytechnic’s expertise in Communication, Navigation, Surveillance (Communications, Navigation, and Surveillance/Air Traffic Management) and regulatory requirements. The course is developed in accordance with International Civil Aviation Organization Document 10057.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:
• Appreciate data networking concepts and protocols
• Explain the purpose and role of aeronautical data networks
• Understand Local Area Network (LAN) and Wide Area Network (WAN)
• Understand network addressing and routing strategies
• Appreciate how to design and troubleshoot a network through practical network exercises

What is covered:
• Data network concepts and protocols
• Aeronautical networks
• LAN and WAN technologies and equipment
• Network addressing and routing

Designed in collaboration with Temasek Polytechnic, it leverages the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore and Temasek Polytechnic’s expertise in Communication, Navigation, Surveillance (Communications, Navigation, and Surveillance/Air Traffic Management) and regulatory requirements. The course is developed in accordance with International Civil Aviation Organization Document 10057.

# course learning outcomes
Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:
• Appreciate data networking concepts and protocols
• Explain the purpose and role of aeronautical data networks
• Understand Local Area Network (LAN) and Wide Area Network (WAN)
• Understand network addressing and routing strategies
• Appreciate how to design and troubleshoot a network through practical network exercises

What is covered:
• Data network concepts and protocols
• Aeronautical networks
• LAN and WAN technologies and equipment
• Network addressing and routing

# course entry req
Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel (ATSEP) Basic course

course_title: Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) v13
course_title_cleaned: Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) v13
course_objective: In a report published by HRM Asia which can be found on https://hrmasia.com/is-ethical-hacking-the-next-big-thing-in-the-talent-market/  Ethical hackers – commonly known as white hat hackers – help to identify threats and vulnerabilities in IT systems to prevent any potential breaches or attacks by their malicious counterparts. Simply put, they utilise their hacking skills for a good cause by using them to bypass IT systems of organisations to test out their security defences.  As cyberattacks become more prevalent, sophisticated, and large-scale, there has never been a greater demand for ethical hackers to help prevent them and build a safer cyber world for everyone.  Organisations are starting to place more emphasis and investment on cyber security by hiring more ethical hackers and even organising bounty challenges to identify and develop potential young ethical hackers.  In another publication from CNA News Asia, https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/ethical-hackers-frontline-keeping-your-home-safe-cyber-attacks-1023216  In today's digital landscape, organizations face an escalating threat from cyberattacks, underscoring the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures. Ethical hackers, or "white hat" hackers, play a pivotal role in this defense by proactively identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities within IT systems.  Conclusion  Integrating ethical hacking training into workforce development is imperative for enhancing organizational resilience against cyber threats. By cultivating a pool of skilled professionals adept at identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities, organizations can better protect their digital assets and maintain trust in an increasingly interconnected world.
course_learning_outcomes:
LO1: Apply threat modelling techniques and network reconnaissance methods using appropriate tools to identify system vulnerabilities, interpret scan results, and recommend pre-emptive security measures.

LO2: Conduct penetration testing and execute exploitation techniques such as malware deployment, web application attacks, sniffing, and privilege escalation to assess security loopholes, and propose countermeasures aligned with industry practices.

LO3: Evaluate vulnerabilities in wireless, mobile, IoT, cloud, and cryptographic systems, and develop a vulnerability assessment report with actionable remediation strategies to safeguard emerging technology platforms against advanced threats.
course_entry_req:
Knowledge and Skills

a. Able to operate using computer functions with minimum Computer Literacy Level 2 based on ICAS Computer Skills Assessment Framework
b. Minimum 3 GCE ‘O’ Levels Passes including English or WPL Level 5 (Average of Reading, Listening, Speaking & Writing Scores)

Attitude

a. Positive Learning Attitude
b. Enthusiastic Learner

Experience

a. Minimum of 1 year of working experience.

Target Year Group : 18-65 years old

Simply put, they utilise their hacking skills for a good cause by using them to bypass IT systems of organisations to test out their security defences.  As cyberattacks become more prevalent, sophisticated, and large-scale, there has never been a greater demand for ethical hackers to help prevent them and build a safer cyber world for everyone.  Organisations are starting to place more emphasis and investment on cyber security by hiring more ethical hackers and even organising bounty challenges to identify and develop potential young ethical hackers.  In another publication from CNA News Asia, https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/ethical-hackers-frontline-keeping-your-home-safe-cyber-attacks-1023216  In today's digital landscape, organizations face an escalating threat from cyberattacks, underscoring the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures. Ethical hackers, or "white hat" hackers, play a pivotal role in this defense by proactively identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities within IT systems. course_title: WSQ Administer Server (SF) (Classroom and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Administer Server (SF) (Classroom and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The " Administer Server " module equips learners with essential knowledge and skills in administering servers using Windows Server technologies. The module comprises various learning units (IUs) that cover a range of topics, Identity Services and Azure AD Integration for Seamless Directory Services, Windows Server Management with Windows Admin Center in Hybrid Environments, Virtualization and Azure VM Deployment in Windows Server, Network, Infrastructure and Hybrid Networking in Windows Server, Storage Solutions and Hybrid File Server Infrastructure in Windows Server Upon completion of the module, learners will gain the following learning outcomes and abilities, as demonstrated through the listed projects: The ability to lead large-scale installation projects involving the deployment, decommissioning, and coordination of multiple hardware and software deployment plans.  With a focus on Windows Server technologies, learners will develop proficiency in identity services and Azure AD integration, enabling them to ensure seamless directory services. They will also gain expertise in managing Windows Server using the Windows Admin Center, particularly in hybrid environments. Additionally, learners will acquire skills in virtualization and deploying Azure virtual machines within Windows Server. They will become adept in setting up network infrastructure and hybrid networking, as well as implementing storage solutions and hybrid file server infrastructure. By combining theoretical knowledge with practical project experience, this module prepares learners to excel in administering servers and overseeing complex installation projects in diverse IT environments.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to target the audience who would like to gain Administer server skills.
 Instructional Units 
1.	Identity Services and Azure AD Integration for Seamless Directory Services
2.	Windows Server Management with Windows Admin Center in Hybrid Environments
3.	Virtualization and Azure VM Deployment in Windows Server
4.	Network Infrastructure and Hybrid Networking in Windows Server
5.	Storage Solutions and Hybrid File Server Infrastructure in Windows Server
Knowledge Outcomes 
1.	Understand the integration of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to provide unified and seamless directory services across on-premises and cloud environment
2.	Comprehend the functionalities of Windows Admin Center for managing Windows Server instances in hybrid environments, facilitating streamlined administration and monitoring.
3.	Gain insight into virtualization technologies within Windows Server and the deployment of virtual machines (VMs) in Azure, enhancing scalability and resource management.
4.	Understand the implementation and management of network infrastructures, including hybrid networking solutions that connect on-premises networks with Azure services.
5.	Comprehend storage solutions and the configuration of hybrid file server infrastructures to ensure efficient data management and accessibility across environments.

Skills Outcomes 
1.	Demonstrate the ability to configure and manage identity services, including the implementation of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to enforce security settings and configurations across the network.
2.	Effectively design and deploy hybrid networking solutions that integrate on-premises networks with Azure, ensuring secure and reliable connectivity. 
3.	Skillfully set up and manage virtualization environments using Hyper-V, including the creation and configuration of virtual machines and virtual networks
course_entry_req:
Academic Qualification - Minimum one credit in N level 
English Proficiency - Minimum  IELTS 5.5 or its equivalent 
Experience - Complete Advanced Certificate in IT System Support course or Minimum 1 year experience in IT system or cloud systems support

course_title: Assessment and Development of 21st Century Competencies (Classroom and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Assessment and Development of 21st Century Competencies (Classroom and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: This course aims to equip aspiring and existing educators with a better understanding of the theories, principles, and applications of the assessment approaches in helping their students acquire the 21st century competencies. Learners will be exposed to the knowledge, skills and attitudes that make up the 21st century competencies, the traditional and alternative principles and theories of assessment,  theories, the theories and principles of authentic task design and rubric development as well as the principles and approaches of providing student feedback. Through these, learners will be able to develop a deeper understanding of how assessment approaches could be more effectively aligned with the teaching and learning process to achieve intended student outcomes.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
NANYANG TECHNOLOGICAL UNIVERSITY

# course title
Assessment and Development of 21st Century Competencies (Classroom and Asynchronous E-Learning)

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025054338

# course duration
6 days - 1 month

# full course fee
$5,177.00

# subsidised course fee
$1,553.10

# course number of hours
52.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
This course aims to equip aspiring and existing educators with a better understanding of the theories, principles, and applications of the assessment approaches in helping their students acquire the 21st century competencies. Learners will be exposed to the knowledge, skills and attitudes that make up the 21st century competencies, the traditional and alternative principles and theories of assessment,  theories, the theories and principles of authentic task design and rubric development as well as the principles and approaches of providing student feedback. Through these, learners will be able to develop a deeper understanding of how assessment approaches could be more effectively aligned with the teaching and learning process to achieve intended student outcomes.

# course learning outcomes
At the end of the course, learners will be able to: 
 
•	apply the understanding of the 21st century competencies and assessment theories in teaching and learning;
•	compare and contrast traditional assessment approaches and alternative assessment approaches;
•	identify the different types of assessment (i.e. diagnostic, formative and summative/evaluative) and explain their purposes;
•	describe the different modes of assessment (i.e. pen-and paper tests, performance-based assessments, student self-assessment);
•	design authentic learning tasks and scoring rubrics.
•	apply the principles of assessment (i.e. validity, reliability, fairness and flexibility) in the design of assessment tasks and rubrics;
•	apply the rules of evidence (i.e. valid, sufficient, current, authentic) in collection of assessment data or evidences;
•	conduct and review of the assessment design and process; and including giving student feedback.

course_title: Calculus
course_title_cleaned: Calculus
course_objective: MTH109 Calculus introduces students to the study of limits, continuity, differential calculus and integral calculus in one variable. Students will be exposed to computational techniques in evaluating limits, derivatives, integrals. Applications of this course include optimisation, calculating areas between curves and volumes of cylindrical shells.
course_learning_outcomes:
1. 	Determine limits of functions of one variable
2. 	Apply derivative tests to find relative extremum of differentiable function(s) of one variable
3. 	Solve for the derivative of a given integral
4. 	Use a Taylor polynomial of a given function to estimate the value of the function at a given point up to fixed degree of accuracy.
5. 	Employ various techniques of integration to evaluate integrals.
6. 	Calculate the area between given curves and/or volume of given solids of revolution.

Students will learn about the knowledge and skills required to design and implement research studies to evaluate the effectiveness of programmes, including qualitative, quantitative and mixed methods.

course_title: Learning and People development
course_title_cleaned: Learning and People development
course_objective: This module is part of the Part-Time Diploma in Business Practice (Hospitality Management), Modular Certificate (Elective 3) in Human Resource Management.  This diploma program offers a comprehensive curriculum designed to equip students with essential skills and knowledge in the hospitality and tourism industry. It covers areas such Hospitality and Food and Beverage management, as well as equipping learners with skillsets in sustainability and digital transformation. Learners will also acquire skills in project management, customer journey mapping and analytics. Learners will be exposed to how technology works in the hospitality sector and will be able to choose options between hospitality business management or Human Resource Management. These will expose learners to areas in Revenue Management and understanding consumers, as well as managing the Human Resources component of the industry. The program is rounded off with a Capstone project to tie the learnings together.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will examine the broad suite of activities within staff training and developing organisational capabilities. Students will learn to conduct needs analysis, translate these into learning goals, develop a total company learning plan, choose suitable learning interventions, and evaluate the results of these interventions. In addition, they will gain basic knowledge of designing and conducting classroom and on-the-job training. They will acquire skills in managing training administration such as sourcing for vendors, developing feedback forms, and servicing internal customers.

course_title: Public Relations and Communications Management
course_title_cleaned: Public Relations and Communications Management
course_objective: This module aims to equip students with the knowledge and concepts of PR and the PR process so that they are able to plan and implement communications strategies and PR programmes. It also aims to equip students with basic understanding of how media works and how to write for various media to convey messages effectively. It provides students with the BIG picture of the PR and media landscape and its progress towards digital media.
course_learning_outcomes: Public relations (PR) is a strategic communication process that builds lasting relationships between an organisation and its publics, to strengthen the organisation’s identity and reputation. It involves developing and implementing effective communication strategies and programmes, to help achieve its organizational goals. PR also identifies and harnesses key media across various practices to convey messages to the publics, so as to help them understand and accept the organisation and its businesses.

course_title: Post-Diploma Certificate in Customer Focused Innovation (Part of Specialist Diploma in Service Experience Design and Innovation)
course_title_cleaned: Post-Diploma Certificate in Customer Focused Innovation (Part of Specialist Diploma in Service Experience Design and Innovation)
course_objective: Post-Diploma Certificate in Customer Focused Innovation (PDC1 of Specialist Diploma in Service Experience Design and Innovation) (1) Business Organisation & Service Design - 30 Hours (2)  Experience Mapping Techniques - 45 Hours (3)  Design Thinking & Innovation - 30 Hours (4)  User-Centric Design - 45 Hours  Service Experience Design, an increasingly prominent field, emphasizes thoughtful experiences through a comprehensive and systematic approach. This interdisciplinary practice seeks to train individuals, whether from design or non-design backgrounds, to become Design Enablers for the future workforce.
course_learning_outcomes:
Post-Diploma Certificate in Customer Focused Innovation (Part of Specialist Diploma in Service Experience Design and Innovation) will provide learners:

1.  an overview of translating Business Organisation goals and objectives for the marketplace.
2.  the ability to perform naturalistic and participatory observation study methods to gain deep understanding of the customer behaviour and to develop deep understanding towards customers.
3.  the knowledge and application of Design Thinking techniques and tactics in solving problems and providing solutions used by service designers today.
4.  an overview of the User-Centric Design principles as part of the studio practice.
course_entry_req:
A diploma from a local polytechnic in any relevant disciplines.

Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on:

   (i) Evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience; or
  (ii) Supporting evidence of competency readiness. 

Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or entrance test(s). The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

course_title: Tripartite Maritime Training Award (Deck) Distance Learning Programme (Shipboard Training)
course_title_cleaned: Tripartite Maritime Training Award (Deck) Distance Learning Programme (Shipboard Training)
course_objective: The Tripartite Maritime Training Award (TMTA) is a career development programme that prepares Singaporeans and Permanent Residents to join the maritime industry and pursue their aspirations as Nautical Officers onboard ocean-going ships.  The Distance Learning Programme (DLP), aka Phase 2, requires students to sail onboard ocean-going ships for a minimum of 12 months accumulatively. They will be given DLP Assignments consisting of the series of modules below. The DLP Assignments are to be completed onboard together with the Training and Assessment Record Book. It is an offline self-directed learning.  12 months are spent onboard ship completing the following modules: 1) General Ship Knowledge 2) Seamanship 3) Navigation 4) Cargo Work 5) Ship Operations 6) Naval Architecture 7) Physical Science 8) Mathematics
course_learning_outcomes:
1)General Ship Knowledge-To enable the cadet have adequate knowledge of Ship Construction, Stability and Cargo work in order to do a safe and efficient job at sea.         
2)Seamanship- Knowledge and proficiency to enable students serving as deck cadets to demonstrate and appreciate the principles and practicalities of seamanship when serving their sea service.
3)Navigation- Thorough knowledge of and ability to use nautical charts and publications, such as sailing directions, tide tables, notices to mariners, radio navigational warnings and ship's routing information, including knowledge of Collision Regulations.
4)Cargo Work- The aim of the module is to enable students serving as deck officer on a ship to be able to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of: - Knowledge of the effect of cargo including heavy lifts, on the seaworthiness and stability on the ship.
- Knowledge of safe handling, stowage and securing of cargoes, including dangerous, hazardous and harmful cargoes, and their effect on the safety of life and of the ship.
-Ability to establish and maintain effective communications during loading and unloading.
-Inspect and report defects and damage to cargo spaces, hatch covers and ballast tanks.
-Knowledge and ability to explain where to look for damage and defects most commonly encountered due to:
1.            loading and unloading operations
2.            corrosion
3.            severe weather conditions
5)Ship Operations -The aim is to enable students serving as deck officer to have a knowledge of ship operations of ships to enable safe and efficient running of the ship.
6)Naval Architecture-The aim of the module is to enable students serving as deck officers to have:
-Working knowledge and application of stability, trim and stress tables, diagrams and stress-calculating equipment.
-Understanding of fundamental actions to be taken in the event of partial loss of intact buoyancy
-Understanding of the fundamentals of watertight integrity
course_entry_req:
Academic Level Required:
Certificate of Completion in Tripartite Maritime Training Award (Deck) Pre-Sea Preparation Training Course

Language Proficiency:
N level pass in English or equivalent

Work Experience Required:
-

Minimum Age Required:
18

The Distance Learning Programme (DLP), aka Phase 2, requires students to sail onboard ocean-going ships for a minimum of 12 months accumulatively. They will be given DLP Assignments consisting of the series of modules below. The DLP Assignments are to be completed onboard together with the Training and Assessment Record Book. It is an offline self-directed learning.  12 months are spent onboard ship completing the following modules: 1) General Ship Knowledge 2) Seamanship 3) Navigation 4) Cargo Work 5) Ship Operations 6) Naval Architecture 7) Physical Science 8) Mathematics  

# course learning outcomes
1)General Ship Knowledge-To enable the cadet have adequate knowledge of Ship Construction, Stability and Cargo work in order to do a safe and efficient job at sea.         
2)Seamanship- Knowledge and proficiency to enable students serving as deck cadets to demonstrate and appreciate the principles and practicalities of seamanship when serving their sea service.
3)Navigation- Thorough knowledge of and ability to use nautical charts and publications, such as sailing directions, tide tables, notices to mariners, radio navigational warnings and ship's routing information, including knowledge of Collision Regulations.
4)Cargo Work- The aim of the module is to enable students serving as deck officer on a ship to be able to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of: - Knowledge of the effect of cargo including heavy lifts, on the seaworthiness and stability on the ship.
- Knowledge of safe handling, stowage and securing of cargoes, including dangerous, hazardous and harmful cargoes, and their effect on the safety of life and of the ship.
-Ability to establish and maintain effective communications during loading and unloading.
-Inspect and report defects and damage to cargo spaces, hatch covers and ballast tanks.
-Knowledge and ability to explain where to look for damage and defects most commonly encountered due to:
1.            loading and unloading operations
2.            corrosion
3.            severe weather conditions
5)Ship Operations -The aim is to enable students serving as deck officer to have a knowledge of ship operations of ships to enable safe and efficient running of the ship.
6)Naval Architecture-The aim of the module is to enable students serving as deck officers to have:
-Working knowledge and application of stability, trim and stress tables, diagrams and stress-calculating equipment.
-Understanding of fundamental actions to be taken in the event of partial loss of intact buoyancy
-Understanding of the fundamentals of watertight integrity

course_title: NSA- Learn A New Language Using Apps
course_title_cleaned: NSA- Learn A New Language Using Apps
course_objective: The primary objective of this course is to empower seniors with the skills and confidence needed to learn a new language using apps like Duolingo and Google Translate. Participants will begin by understanding the significance and benefits of language learning, which will motivate them throughout the course. They will learn to effectively navigate the Duolingo app, creating an account, selecting a target language, and engaging in interactive lessons to build a foundational vocabulary and basic sentence structure. Additionally, participants will become adept at using Google Translate for practical applications, such as translating everyday phrases and enhancing communication in real-life situations. Through collaborative activities and exercises, seniors will practice their language skills in a supportive environment, fostering both social interaction and a sense of accomplishment as they progress in their language-learning journey.
course_learning_outcomes: Seniors will embark on an exciting journey to explore the world of language learning using the popular apps like Duolingo and Google Translate. The course begins with an introduction to the importance and benefits of learning a new language, followed by hands-on sessions where participants will set up and navigate Duolingo to develop basic language skills. They will learn how to use Google Translate to assist with everyday conversations and practical situations, enhancing their communication abilities. Through practical exercises and group activities, participants will have the opportunity to practice their new skills in a supportive environment, fostering both confidence and enjoyment in the language learning process.

• Examine and address the ethical considerations and challenges associated with the deployment of AI and automation within sales processes

course_title: NSA - Digital Wellbeing: Using Digital Technology Well
course_title_cleaned: NSA - Digital Wellbeing  Using Digital Technology Well
course_objective: With the pervasiveness of digital technology in our everyday life, technology has at times become the “Best Friend” that has taken control over our lives. Often, we hear of problems with addiction to the Internet, the inability to “switch off” and relax, a growing susceptibility to scams, rumours and fear-mongering – all of which may have a negative impact on the mental wellbeing of seniors. This course will help participants learn to use digital technology safely. This includes managing its use so that it does not impact seniors' mental health and wellbeing negatively. Participants will also learn to tap its power of communication to maintain close ties with family and friends and keep self- isolation at bay. This will enable seniors to have better quality of life and improve social interactions.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
- Know the right Digital Technology tools to use
- Know the benefits and risk of digital technologies 
- Identify the issues around how information is shared through digital technologies.
- Know the types of cyber-crimes that target them.
- Practise diligence to keep personal information safe and secure.
- Discuss the impact of digital technologies on self-confidence and sense of achievement.
- Know the impact of digital technologies on the way people interact with each other.
- Reflect on their use of digital technologies.
- Identify strategies and devise a plan to manage digital technologies in such a way as to improve their wellbeing.
course_entry_req: Minimum Entry Requirements
full_course_desc:

Often, we hear of problems with addiction to the Internet, the inability to “switch off” and relax, a growing susceptibility to scams, rumours and fear-mongering – all of which may have a negative impact on the mental wellbeing of seniors. This course will help participants learn to use digital technology safely. This includes managing its use so that it does not impact seniors' mental health and wellbeing negatively. Participants will also learn to tap its power of communication to maintain close ties with family and friends and keep self- isolation at bay. This will enable seniors to have better quality of life and improve social interactions.

# course learning outcomes
By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
- Know the right Digital Technology tools to use
- Know the benefits and risk of digital technologies 
- Identify the issues around how information is shared through digital technologies.
- Know the types of cyber-crimes that target them.

course_title_cleaned: [ELEVATE] Effective Coaching for Talent Development (Classroom & Asynchronous)
course_objective: The Korn Ferry Academy’s ELEVATE Programme offers four essential course modules designed to empower middle managers with the knowledge and skills to perform, transform and shape how your team adapts and thrives.  Additionally, the programme enables you to leverage insights from the proprietary Korn Ferry Talent Assessment and receive personalised coaching to sharpen your leadership skills as middle managers.
course_learning_outcomes:
As the workforce evolves, so must leadership. Today’s employees, especially Millennials and Gen Z, seek leaders who act as mentors and champions of their growth. The final Module of your programme journey, a two-day course on Effective Coaching for Talent Development, empowers you to step into this role by mastering the art of coaching.

You’ll explore key techniques in active listening, strategic questioning, and fostering open, supportive dialogue. These essential coaching skills will empower you to elevate your team’s performance and nurture a growth-driven team culture.

This course will equip you with the skills to:

- Enhance Employee Engagement through Coaching.
- Differentiate Coaching from Other Development Methods.
- Employ Essential Coaching Skills in Leadership Conversations.
- Balance Empathy with Accountability.
- Utilise Structured Coaching Models Effectively.
- Promote Employee Ownership of Development.
- Develop Personalised Coaching Plans for Teams.
course_entry_req:
- Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents
- Able to commit to the full duration of the programme

course_title: Literature and Humanistic Knowledge
course_title_cleaned: Literature and Humanistic Knowledge
course_objective: 1. Provide exposure to the Malay-Indonesian literary, cultural, language and heritage vistas, as part of promoting cultural understanding and knowledge. 2. Enhancing reading skills on various subjects of literature, language, culture and heritage, linking it to critical knowledge and harnessing historical and social awareness for citizens and residents of Singapore. 3. Expanding interpretative approaches for teachers, officers, social volunteers and cultural enthusiasts for better appreciation and insights into the cultural, literary and heritage dynamics of the people in the region.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course introduces the scope of Malay literature studies that could encompasses the critical appreciation of ideas, intellectualism and aestheticism. The topics of humanism and realism will be discussed alongside the social and cultural meanings of aesthetic expressions. A Literature course like this could also enhance language learning apart from providing exposure to literary discourse.

In secondary schools and junior colleges, Malay literature is offered as a subject. Teacher- training at NIE include the pedagogy of literature. The in-service for teachers primarily focuses on language pedagogy, curriculum and assessment, but it is not offered regularly as the emphasis is on language studies.

Most importantly the skills of reading literary via the approach of critical literacy alongside the understanding of sociological dynamics of poetics and politics in creative works will be provided.

By highlighting of skills of reading literature, the focus will be on:

The primacy of the author’s intent, values and ideological affiliation
The key words as encapsulated in the text and unravelling its meanings
Drawing the humanistic tropes in the text and linking to its significance to society and the ideational realms
These could be achieved if the course appreciates aspects of critical literacy, sociological analysis and cultural studies as part of its teaching and learning approach.
