course_title: (SCTP) PROFESSIONAL DIPLOMA IN FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPMENT (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) PROFESSIONAL DIPLOMA IN FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPMENT (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The "Professional Diploma in Full Stack Web Development" prepares learners for dynamic careers in web development, offering abundant job prospects and opportunities. Graduates can pursue roles like Full Stack Web Developer, Front-End Developer, Back-End Developer, and Application Developer. The course covers essential modules, including User Interface Design, Programming Fundamentals, Database Design Principles, Web Development Design, Enterprise Software Development, and Gen AI Design & Development. In the User Interface Design module, learners acquire skills in web design and front-end development tools. Programming Fundamentals covers programming basics and object-oriented programming. The Database Design principles module focuses on database design and normalization techniques. Web Development Design equips learners with skills in SDLC, back-end development, MVC pattern implementation, and comprehensive testing. Enterprise Software Development covers software architecture, business logic, integration, user interface development, testing, deployment, and maintenance. The Gen AI Design & Development module explores the use of generative AI algorithms in web development, with a focus on Generative AI principles, Prompt Engineering, and GitHub CoPilot. Real-world case studies illustrate the transformative potential of Generative AI. The Capstone Project-Application Implementation module allows learners to apply agile project management methodologies to real-world software implementation challenges. Overall, the diploma offers a comprehensive curriculum that prepares learners for success in full-stack web development, enabling them to contribute to innovative web applications and enterprise software solutions.
course_learning_outcomes:
The Professional Diploma in Full Stack Web Development course is designed for candidates looking to transition their careers into the role of a full stack web developer.

The learning outcomes of this course are.
Knowledge
• Explain the agile project management concepts and principles in application design, development, and testing methodologies.
• List the advantages and disadvantages of various program paradigms, software development life cycles, and testing methods.
• Recognize UI/UX principles and to develop customer-centric, and data-driven applications.
• Articulate the use of design patterns, frameworks, and testing methods to ensure that the developed applications meet high standards of quality and reliability.
• Demonstrate strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills to analyze complex situations, identify innovative solutions, and make informed decisions through Generative AI.
Skills
• Develop interactive web applications using generative AI techniques, following agile project management principles to adapt to changing requirements and deliver value iteratively.
• Incorporate generative AI algorithms seamlessly into data-driven enterprise software development projects.
• Automate the design process and streamline web development workflows using generative AI, facilitating agile project management practices.
• Choose suitable tools, techniques, design patterns, frameworks, and software methodologies to develop robust and efficient applications.
• Execute appropriate testing methods, procedures, and tools to ensure the software's quality and reliability.

Ability
Proficient in incorporating generative AI algorithms to automate design processes, improve user experiences, and develop innovative web applications featuring tailored content and efficient workflows in the development of data-driven enterprise applications.
course_entry_req:
Academic Level Required:
A' Level or equivalent OR ADVANCED CERTIFICATE IN WEB DEVELOPMENT OR Polytechnic Diploma or equivalent

Language Proficiency:
Minimum IELTS 5.5 or its Equivalent

Work Experience Required:
2 years of programming experience

Minimum Age Required:
20

course_title: Sustainability & Renewable Energy Integration
course_title_cleaned: Sustainability & Renewable Energy Integration
course_objective: A green and sustainable data center not only reduces its environmental impact but also enhances its long-term operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness. In this course, learners will develop competencies in analyzing various renewable energy technologies and assess the feasibility and economic viability of incorporating these sources into data center operations. Learners will acquire skills in evaluating grid integration techniques, energy storage solutions, and sustainability practices to optimize renewable energy utilization. Additionally, learners will develop competencies in applying regulatory frameworks for managing green data centers align with industry standards and environmental goals.
course_learning_outcomes:

2. Foster skills in analysing and designing potential renewable energy sources with the grid and optimizing energy storage solutions.
3. Equip learners with skills in applying regulatory frameworks and sustainability practices for managing green data centers in line with industry standards.

course_title: Workplace Communication (SF - Associate) [Synchronous E-Learning]
course_title_cleaned: Workplace Communication (SF - Associate) [Synchronous E-Learning]
course_objective: Good workplace communication is essential for any organisation’s success because it allows companies to be productive and operate effectively. Employees can experience an increase in morale, productivity and commitment if they are able to communicate up and down the communication chain in an organisation.   This module will help participants understand the fundamental importance of communication in a workplace setting, as well as the skills to perform the techniques of handling the flow of information at work.
course_learning_outcomes:
This program covers the following content:

- Understand Communication Styles

- Different Ways to Communicate Effectively

- Types of Information Channels and Communications

- Interpretation and Analysis of Information

- Translating Communication Into Action
course_entry_req:
- GCE 'N' Level Credit (at least C5) in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) score: Level 4 for Reading, Listening and Numeracy; and

For E-Learning classes at SIRS, participants MUST have the following:
•Laptop / desktop computer
•Stable WIFI
•Webcam (external or built-in)
•Earpiece / headphone with microphone

course_title: Transformative Leadership Development in Healthcare (Classroom, Synchronous, and Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Transformative Leadership Development in Healthcare (Classroom, Synchronous, and Asynchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: 1. Demonstrate understanding of various leadership theories and styles applicable to healthcare. 2. Apply the principles of transformational leadership to drive changes in healthcare settings.  3. Apply strategic planning to encourage and implement innovative practices to enhance patient safety, quality of care, continuous improvement and efficiency that align with organizational goals. 4. Develop personalized professional development plans and strategies for career advancement relevant to healthcare settings.  5. Explore effective strategies to support continuous learning in healthcare.  6. Demonstrate understanding of the importance of mentorship and networking skills in professional development and relationship respectively, within and beyond the healthcare organization
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to equip healthcare professionals with the knowledge and skills necessary to leverage on transformative leadership and professional development to promote collaboration, teamwork, resiliency and organisation commitment in healthcare settings. 

Participants will explore the application of 
i) various leadership theories and models, with a focus on transformative leadership and 
ii) strategies for lifelong learning, career advancement, and personal growth in the contexts of healthcare. 

The course will examine the unique challenges and opportunities in healthcare leadership, equipping students with the skills to implement positive change, encourage innovation, cultivate a culture of patient safety and quality care, and promote continuous professional development.
course_entry_req: Bachelor's degree in a healthcare-related field OR equivalent.

course_title: Foundational Photography / Basic Photography
course_title_cleaned: Foundational Photography   Basic Photography
course_objective: Artists, marketers, media professionals, non-profits and individual or small business owners alike will find this course useful in building not only their technical competence but also their confidence in shooting better photographs under different conditions, and for a range of purposes from creative self- expression, to shooting simple portraits, to documenting work and events, to social media content for corporate and small business marketing purposes.  This course imparts photography fundamentals and equips camera users with the skills to shoot beyond automatic mode, through a rigorous combination of lectures, in-class exercises, guided shoots (day and night), homework and group critiques of images shot.  It also builds visual literacy and enables informed decision-making, a valuable skill in today’s image-saturated world.
course_learning_outcomes:
Introduction
- What makes a good image?
- Types of photography
- Camera handling
- Aperture, shutter speed, ISO and exposure

Putting photographic concepts into practice
- Revisiting manual functions
- Measuring exposure – metering
- Guided field shoot

Getting the right exposure and composition
- Rules of composition
- White balance

Evening Guided Shoot
- Working with low light and artificial light
- Ways to reduce camera shake
- Using on-camera flash

Guided Field Shoot (Day Shoot)
- Capturing the moment, and doing so well
- Approaching subjects
- Applying techniques learnt to different scenarios
- Finding stories in your environment

Managing your images
- Basic digital workflow
- Managing and archiving your digital files
- Basic image editing

course_title: Skills & Technology Adoption Readiness (STAR) for Formulating Protein Rich Baked Products
course_title_cleaned: Skills & Technology Adoption Readiness (STAR) for Formulating Protein Rich Baked Products
course_objective: This course equips participants with the necessary knowledge and skills in product development of healthier protein-enriched baked goods to meet Healthier Choice Symbol requirements through project-based training.
course_learning_outcomes: Protein dietary requirement increases with age and adequate protein intake is associated with many positive functional outcomes. As such, there is a noticeable growing interest in protein fortification of food and beverages. However, protein fortification has implications on the quality of the food product, especially bakery products, due to its impact on dough handling, mixing times and other attributes. Hence, it cannot be added without care and consideration. Incorporation of additional protein in baked goods requires careful selection of ingredients, reformulation with proper application of additives or process adjustment to meet the recommended protein content without compromising the eating quality. This is in addition to the understanding of the requirements of Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) to develop a more nutritionally wholesome baked product.
course_entry_req:
1. ITE/Polytechnic Diploma in relevant food science discipline or equivalent qualifications. 
2. Literate in Microsoft Excel
3. Working in a Singapore Food Agency (SFA)-licensed food establishment with bakery equipment.

# course objective
This course equips participants with the necessary knowledge and skills in product development of healthier protein-enriched baked goods to meet Healthier Choice Symbol requirements through project-based training.

# course learning outcomes
Protein dietary requirement increases with age and adequate protein intake is associated with many positive functional outcomes. As such, there is a noticeable growing interest in protein fortification of food and beverages. However, protein fortification has implications on the quality of the food product, especially bakery products, due to its impact on dough handling, mixing times and other attributes. Hence, it cannot be added without care and consideration. Incorporation of additional protein in baked goods requires careful selection of ingredients, reformulation with proper application of additives or process adjustment to meet the recommended protein content without compromising the eating quality. This is in addition to the understanding of the requirements of Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) to develop a more nutritionally wholesome baked product.

# course entry req
1. ITE/Polytechnic Diploma in relevant food science discipline or equivalent qualifications. 
2. Literate in Microsoft Excel
3. Working in a Singapore Food Agency (SFA)-licensed food establishment with bakery equipment.

course_title: Organization Plans & Capability Building
course_title_cleaned: Organization Plans & Capability Building
course_objective: This course equips the participant with the necessary skills and knowledge in the following areas: - Resilience planning approach, architecture and programs - Developing resilience plans such as crisis management plan (CMP), business continuity plans (BCP) and emergency response plans (ERP) - Undertsand the importance of readiness testing and exercises - Understand the chararcteristics of crisis and emergency leadership
course_learning_outcomes:
Procedures and plans are important deliverables from the planning process. Complementing the planning process is the capacity building to align to the strategies and requirements of the plan. It is important to have a clear program to enhance the maturity level of the organization in resilience management. This session aims to provide the participants with essential knowledge in the areas of resilience planning, plan development, and validation exercise so that the participants can assist an organization to plan and build their business resilience capability. In addition, this module also covers the importance of leadership during a crisis and emergency. 
This module allows participants to understand, develop, and test plans that address the hazards that the organization faces.
course_entry_req: At least a polytechnic diploma (or equivalent)

course_title: Heat Exchangers in a Process Plant
course_title_cleaned: Heat Exchangers in a Process Plant
course_objective: This course aims to equip participants with basic knowledge and skills required in the chemical manufacturing industry to function as a process technician. It covers different types of heat exchangers and their uses, functions of components in heat exchangers and their operating principles.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:
- Identify and describe the functions of components of heat
exchangers
- Identify different types of heat exchangers
- Explain the operating principles of heat exchangers
course_entry_req:
Learner may be a process technician in a chemical manufacturing plant with several years of experience but does not possess formal qualification in chemical engineering related training.  

Learner may also be working in a chemical manufacturing plant as laboratory analyst, maintenance technician or safety personnel who would like to seek a career switch to process technician job role.

Learner may also be a fresh engineer working in the chemical industry or working in a company supporting the chemical industry who would like to familiarize himself in chemical process operations and control.

Learner may possess GCE ‘N’ or ‘O’ level or ITE certification, with knowledge of basic sciences equivalent to lower secondary level.  

Learner must possess basic level of literacy in English and numeracy.

course_title: Western Music Within a Singaporean Context
course_title_cleaned: Western Music Within a Singaporean Context
course_objective: Learners will examine the relationship and develop perspectives on Singaporean identity with Singaporean music in terms of genres, venues, educational institutions, and geographical location. Through research and information synthesis, learners will be able to connect factual evidence to their personal experiences, and have a pragmatic understanding of the musical landscape in Singapore. Through this process, effective communication skills and critical thinking will be honed.
course_learning_outcomes: This course critically analyses Singapore’s historical and present-day relationship with Western music, examining its influences on and integration into our culture and society, and its role in our self-identification. Learners will develop their socio-historical and contemporary perspectives through investigating various case studies. Through honing research and information synthesis skills, learners will critically consider how Singapore and Singaporeans have shaped and been shaped by music from the West, and be equipped with research thinking to make decisions in negotiating this cultural correspondence moving forward. Such skills will be applied through looking at historical overview of the arrival of Western music in Singapore and the various functions that music plays and has played in society.
course_entry_req:
At least 5 years of performing/teaching experience

and/or

successful outcome of the selection interview

# course provider
NATIONAL UNIVERSITY OF SINGAPORE

# course title
Western Music Within a Singaporean Context

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2025052220

3-5 days

# full course fee
$4,200.00

# subsidised course fee
$1,260.00

# course number of hours
24.75 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
Learners will examine the relationship and develop perspectives on Singaporean identity with Singaporean music in terms of genres, venues, educational institutions, and geographical location. Through research and information synthesis, learners will be able to connect factual evidence to their personal experiences, and have a pragmatic understanding of the musical landscape in Singapore. Through this process, effective communication skills and critical thinking will be honed.

# course learning outcomes
This course critically analyses Singapore’s historical and present-day relationship with Western music, examining its influences on and integration into our culture and society, and its role in our self-identification. Learners will develop their socio-historical and contemporary perspectives through investigating various case studies. Through honing research and information synthesis skills, learners will critically consider how Singapore and Singaporeans have shaped and been shaped by music from the West, and be equipped with research thinking to make decisions in negotiating this cultural correspondence moving forward. Such skills will be applied through looking at historical overview of the arrival of Western music in Singapore and the various functions that music plays and has played in society.

and/or

successful outcome of the selection interview

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Data Analytics in Digital Economy Module 2: Data Collection and Preprocessing Techniques
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Data Analytics in Digital Economy Module 2  Data Collection and Preprocessing Techniques
course_objective: Module 2 provides an in-depth understanding of the fundamental concepts and techniques for collecting and preprocessing data in the context of data analytics within the digital economy. The module covers various methods for acquiring, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a format suitable for analysis. Participants will learn about different types of data sources, such as structured and unstructured data, as well as strategies for handling missing or inconsistent data. participants will explore advanced preprocessing techniques including normalisation, feature scaling, dimensionality reduction, and outlier detection. Through hands-on exercises and case studies, participants will gain practical experience in applying these techniques to real-world datasets.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the importance of data collection and preprocessing in the context of data analytics within the digital economy
• Demonstrate proficiency in selecting appropriate data collection methods and tools for types of data sources, including structured and unstructured data
• Apply various techniques for cleaning, transforming, and integrating raw datasets to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness for analysis
• Evaluate the impact of different preprocessing techniques on downstream analytical processes such as machine learning models or statistical analysis
• Develop practical skills in using popular software tools and programming languages to implement effective data collection and preprocessing workflows for real-world business scenarios within the digital economy context
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Real Estate Finance & Securitisation
course_title_cleaned: Real Estate Finance & Securitisation
course_objective: The evolution of the real estate investment industry has created a demand for a special group of professionals who not only have deep knowledge and understanding of the real estate market, but are also familiar with the dynamics of the capital markets.  To meet this demand, the Executive Certificate in Real Estate Finance (ECREF) was introduced to integrate the best of real estate and finance knowledge. Participants will acquire critical concepts and skills relevant throughout the life cycle of a public/private real estate fund, from fund raising, acquisition, and asset management to exit. This pool of trained specialists will enhance Singapore’s attractiveness as the real estate investment and fund management hub in Asia.  The ECREF will be offered in three modules.  Real Estate Investment & Asset Management Real Estate Finance & Securitisation Real Estate Portfolio & Risk Management
course_learning_outcomes: This module covers issues related to fund raising through the traditional and alternative routes, including securitisation.

course_title: Teaching Music Online (Classroom & Synchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Teaching Music Online (Classroom & Synchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: Music educators will find the current methods and pedagogical approaches to teaching music over the internet discussed in this module useful as they plan to better utilize the internet in their own music programmes through technology-enabled learning delivery. Learners will practise and apply their knowledge by teaching music students around the world in a variety of settings. Through this course, learners will be equipped with the skills necessary to thrive in the digital world of music teaching, and reach students across distances and timezones.
course_learning_outcomes: The course explores teaching music through online means. The online component of teaching is no longer an alternative in the 21st century, but a necessity. Music educators will learn the current methods and pedagogical approaches to teaching music over the Internet through technology-enabled learning delivery. Learners will practise and apply their knowledge by teaching music students around the world in a variety of settings. By the end of the module, learners are expected to be able to design online music lesson plans, formulate effective online teaching methods, use various technological platforms to deliver lessons online, record video-tutorials as instruction material, evaluate own teaching, as well as critique peers on teaching techniques and suggest ways to improve music performance.
course_entry_req:
At least 5 years of performing/teaching experience

and/or

successful outcome of the selection interview

Through this course, learners will be equipped with the skills necessary to thrive in the digital world of music teaching, and reach students across distances and timezones.

The course explores teaching music through online means. The online component of teaching is no longer an alternative in the 21st century, but a necessity. Music educators will learn the current methods and pedagogical approaches to teaching music over the Internet through technology-enabled learning delivery. Learners will practise and apply their knowledge by teaching music students around the world in a variety of settings. By the end of the module, learners are expected to be able to design online music lesson plans, formulate effective online teaching methods, use various technological platforms to deliver lessons online, record video-tutorials as instruction material, evaluate own teaching, as well as critique peers on teaching techniques and suggest ways to improve music performance.

# course entry req
At least 5 years of performing/teaching experience

and/or

successful outcome of the selection interview

course_title: Programming Methodology(Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Programming Methodology(Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This module aims to introduce students to the discipline of computing and the problem solving process. It stresses on good programme design and programming styles, and structured programme development using a higher-level programming language. The topics covered in this module are: Algorithm design process, Programme development/coding/debugging. Programming concepts in a high-level language including programme structure, simple data types and structured types and various control structures (sequencing, loops, conditionals, etc.). Linear data structures such as arrays and linked-lists. The utility of recursion using a variety of sorting algorithms.

course_title: Digital Disruption and Technology Strategy (Synchronous E-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Digital Disruption and Technology Strategy (Synchronous E-learning)
course_objective: Through the utilisation of tools, case studies, break-out groups and specific assignments, participants will learn to: - Take a case study based on industry 4.0 technology in a company, identify its value proposition and potential to disrupt business. - Identify the potential opportunities the technology presents. - Think of potential applications to one's businesses. - Think about how the opportunities could be used for entrepreneurship and corporate membership.
course_learning_outcomes:
In our hyperconnected, rapidly evolving world, businesses are being disrupted faster than before. This course starts with an overview of these digital disruptions -- Platforms and two-sided markets, big data, cloud computing, machine learning and artificial intelligence, blockchain, and the internet of things (IoT). With an understanding of these terms, participants are then challenged to think about disruption to businesses and future digital challenges arising from industry 4.0.

This course will utilise business cases to provide relevant and practical ways to appreciate the impact of industry 4.0 technologies and how they may be implemented in businesses.

It will teach participants to systematically approach various aspects of the threat of digital disruption and apply the concepts to their businesses. This will be done through a combination of case studies, interactive discussion, and practical application.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Digital Procurement Module 3: Leveraging the Internet of Things in Procurement (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Digital Procurement Module 3  Leveraging the Internet of Things in Procurement (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The integration of Internet of Things (IoT) technology into procurement processes has emerged as a transformative force, offering unprecedented opportunities to revolutionise traditional practices.  From understanding IoT sensors and predictive analytics to exploring real-time monitoring, smart contracts, and data security considerations, Module 3 equips procurement professionals with the latest insights and strategies in IoT adoption to optimise supply chains, enhance efficiency, and drive innovation.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Gain an overview of the Internet of Things (IoT) and its relevance to procurement
• Utilise IoT sensors and devices in procurement systems and workflows
• Utilise real-time monitoring to track shipment and inventory levels
• Improve procurement decision-making through predictive analytics models
• Learn how smart contracts and IoT-enabled payment systems streamline transactional processes to ensure transparency, efficiency, and trust 
• Monitor supplier performance and improve collaboration with suppliers 
• Implement best practices to address data security and privacy challenges associated with IoT in procurement

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Artificial Intelligence in the Digital Economy Module 3: Natural Language Processing and Sentiment Analysis (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Artificial Intelligence in the Digital Economy Module 3  Natural Language Processing and Sentiment Analysis (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: This module provides a comprehensive understanding of how artificial intelligence (AI) techniques can be applied to analyse and understand human language. It covers the fundamental concepts of natural language processing (NLP) including tokenisation, stemming, lemmatisation, part-of-speech tagging, and syntactic parsing. Participants will also delve into sentiment analysis which involves using NLP techniques to determine the sentiment or emotional tone behind a piece of text. They will learn about various approaches to sentiment analysis such as lexicon-based methods, machine learning based methods, and deep learning models for sentiment classification. Furthermore, this module equips participants with practical skills in implementing NLP and sentiment analysis algorithms using popular libraries such as NLTK (Natural Language Toolkit), spaCy, and TensorFlow. Through hands-on projects and case studies, participants will gain valuable experience in applying these techniques to real-world problems in areas such as social media monitoring, customer feedback analysis, market research, and more. By the end of this module, participants will have developed a strong foundation in NLP and sentiment analysis within the context of AI applications in the digital economy. They will be able to leverage these skills to extract meaningful insights from textual data that can drive informed decision-making across various industries.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the fundamental concepts and techniques of natural language processing (NLP) and how they are applied in various real-world applications
• Develop proficiency in using NLP tools and libraries to process, analyse, and extract meaningful information from unstructured text data
• Gain practical experience in sentiment analysis by learning how to classify and interpret emotions, opinions, and attitudes expressed in textual content
• Explore advanced NLP models such as recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and transformers for more complex language understanding tasks
• Apply NLP techniques to solve business challenges related to customer feedback analysis, social media monitoring, and other relevant use cases within the digital economy landscape
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: (SCTP) SOC (Security Operations Center) Analyst (Full Time) (TA-Eligible)
course_title_cleaned: (SCTP) SOC (Security Operations Center) Analyst (Full Time) (TA-Eligible)
course_objective: By the end of the program, learners will have acquired these learning outcomes, enabling them to apply their skills and knowledge in various job roles such as security analyst, incident responder, network administrator, forensic investigator, and vulnerability assessment and penetration testing analyst.  •    Understanding of Information Security •    Proficiency in Virtualization Technologies  •    Mastery of Network Fundamentals •    Competence in Operating Systems •    Scripting and Automation Skills •    Understanding of Cloud Security  •    Expertise in Security Operations Center (SOC) Services •    Proficiency in Incident Response Planning •    Ability to Analyze Logs and Perform Investigations •    Competence in Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Systems •    Understanding of Web Application Security and Data Loss Prevention •    Proficiency in Digital Forensics •    Programming Skills
course_learning_outcomes:
This is an online comprehensive training which offers practical and theoretical cyber incident analysis and response knowledge.

More and more organizations are implementing managed security services internally and using Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs). Properly trained Security Operations Center (SOC) Analysts give businesses solid cyber defense, fix damages and save costs. Security Operations Center (SOC) Analysts are a critical part of damage mitigation activities, working on the front line of responding to cyber-attacks and incidents. 
SOC Analysts know how to react efficiently and effectively to security threats and incidents.

Trainees of this program will gain the practical knowledge required for their career in cybersecurity while learning the art and science of cybersecurity operations, from the vocabulary and effectiveness of incident handling to the severity of incidents and prioritization.
course_entry_req: It is recommended that participants have a basic understanding of computer systems, networks, and operating systems. Familiarity with fundamental IT concepts and terminology will be beneficial for grasping the course material effectively. Additionally, a basic knowledge of programming concepts and scripting languages would be advantageous for certain topics covered in the program.

# course language
English

# course objective
This module is a component of the NUS Emerging Leaders Program In this module, participants will: - Enhance understanding of self and others - Learn how to connect with and lead others via thinking alignment. - Practice aligning thinking preferences - Leverage one’s preferred thinking styles for leadership effectiveness

# course learning outcomes
The transition from an individual contributor to a people manager is one of the most difﬁcult, yet critical shifts in any emerging leader’s career Most new managers are promoted for their exceptional performance as an individual However, being an effective manager demands a deeper awareness of one’s leadership impact and ability to drive team performance Rising leaders need to identify and refine their personal leadership styles, develop their emotional intelligence, and acquire the skills that will enable them to bring out the best in others.


# course entry req
Manager, Team Lead, Project Lead, Supervisor

course_title: Airline Operations and Planning
course_title_cleaned: Airline Operations and Planning
course_objective: Determine the considerations for the transport of dangerous goods for a given scenario. Examine the principles of finance, financial management, and marketing for airlines. Appraise the importance of revenue management and scheduling of resources in airlines. Compute fuel requirements for a given flight scenario. Verify the application and limitations of safety and quality management in airline operation. Indicate the elements and trade-offs involved in developing an airline network structure.
course_learning_outcomes: The rapidly expanding airline industry has an essential role in the functioning of the global economy and its continuous growth. LOG345 Airline Operations and Planning aims to develop the skills required to manage key aspects of an airline from the marketing department through to the flight operations department. The main topics include historical developments in the airline industry, airline network structure, airline pricing strategies, scheduling of resources, ground handling operations, and airline finance, marketing, and customers. The course will also cover detailed operational aspects including air law, safety and quality systems, fuel planning and contingencies, resource management, requirements, and planning, and the transport of dangerous goods. These operational components will provide an understanding of the considerations by flight operations personnel including pilots, flight dispatchers, flight controllers and safety departments in their daily undertakings.

course_title: Building Technology
course_title_cleaned: Building Technology
course_objective: 1. State the purpose, function and performance expected of buildings 2. Describe the structural behaviours of different structural elements and components of buildings 3. Explain the major classes of materials for structural and architectural materials 4. List the different criteria in the procurement and selection of materials in a project 5. Demonstrate an ability to recommend construction methods and materials selection for a built environment project 6. Discuss how the material selection and construction of different building elements influence the maintenance and operations of the buildings
course_learning_outcomes: FMT201 Building Technology provides an overview to building components, construction methods and construction material properties for the training and preparation of facilities management professionals. Topics include structural systems, architectural components and finishes, construction sequence and building erection. Students will also be exposed to evaluating each material that may make up a component, and sub-systems that may make up a system to serve a function within a building. Students will learn to appreciate how a building is put together or erected, and how material selection and installation are considered and their impacts to future maintenance and operations.

course_title: Category Management and Supplier Evaluation
course_title_cleaned: Category Management and Supplier Evaluation
course_objective: Analyse procurement requirements of common goods and services to assess feasibility of demand aggregation. Develop category management strategy to identify demand aggregation opportunities to achieve economies of scale. Formulate data analysis plan to anticipate impacts of market trends and changes on organisations. Indicate methods to identify potential suppliers and develop evaluation criteria for selecting suppliers. Draft evaluation criteria for evaluating the performance of existing suppliers. Examine the best practices in procurement to improve organisations’ category management and sourcing practices. Illustrate how to communicate demand aggregate contracts through the whole organisation. Modify category management and supplier evaluation approach to maximise benefits within the organisation according to agreed KPIs. Appraise the competitiveness of the potential supply base.
course_learning_outcomes: LOG315 Category Management and Supplier Evaluation covers two important areas in procurement. Category Management is a part of strategic cost management techniques to analyse organisations’ spending by discrete groups of products and services. Products and services purchased by the organisation are segmented into groups according to their functions. Effective application of category management enables an organisation to aggregate their procurement efforts on products and services of similar functions to gain substantial cost savings. This course will also cover Spend Analysis, one of the key tools for Category Management. There are two aspects in Supplier Evaluation. The first aspect is to evaluate potential suppliers. The techniques for selecting suppliers include; supplier surveys, financial condition analysis, facility visit, evaluation conference and capability analysis on quality, capacity, management, service, flexibility and information technology. The second aspect of supplier evaluation is supplier performance evaluation. The techniques to monitor and control suppliers’ performance include: categorical plan, weighted point plan and cost ratio plan.

course_title: Fundamentals of Sustainable Business Practices
course_title_cleaned: Fundamentals of Sustainable Business Practices
course_objective: Analyse the connection between business and sustainability, and the role of innovation and technology in implementing sustainable business practices Examine leadership initiatives, organisational culture and the corporate governance structure integrating stakeholders' needs that can support business sustainability Appraise investment opportunities by applying the principles of responsible investment Evaluate the impact of sustainability of business processes, performance measurement and reward, reporting and formulate a sustainable business strategy Discuss the concept of circular economy and contemporary issues in business sustainability Demonstrate proficiency in written and oral communication skills and develop interpersonal skills to work effectively and efficiently in a team
course_learning_outcomes: This course is designed to cultivate students’ mindset of business sustainability. It demonstrates the importance of integrating social and environmental concerns into business operations. It further introduces how business sustainability shapes strategy formulation, leadership, organisational culture, corporate governance, financing, performance measurement, reward, and reporting. Cases and real examples will be adopted to enhance students’ understanding in this area.

course_title: Interdisciplinary Global Learning
course_title_cleaned: Interdisciplinary Global Learning
course_objective: Observe how cultures vary and intersect. Discuss the challenges and opportunities in one or more identified global issue(s) Deconstruct the complexity of issues though interdisciplinary lenses Demonstrate knowledge synthesis from varied disciplinary bases applied to contemporary global contexts Practice perspective taking strategies and effective intercultural communication skills to facilitate the integration of diverse perspectives in understanding complex subjects Examine personal and collective global citizenship responsibilities, such as the consequences of individual and collective action or inaction in addressing ethical, social, and environmental challenges in global systems
course_learning_outcomes:
To thrive in an interconnected and interdependent world, it is imperative to broaden one’s experience to a wider context, hone the intercultural competencies to explore, critically analyse and engage with complex global systems and their implications, to connect local and global perspectives. Applying and synthesizing concepts and skills from NCO101 and NIE201 in contemporary global contexts, this course further contextualises theory with practice. Through curated engagement with global communities and stakeholders in the university’s network of international partners, students will practice tools and skills for intercultural engagement and learning for respectful collaboration with diverse others, gaining a nuanced understanding of the complex dynamics of perspectives, opportunities, and issues, and diversity of social, economic, political, and environmental concerns. Utilising perspective taking, empathy, balanced perspectives, students will gain confidence and competence to engage constructively with complex global challenges, applying interdisciplinary processes to appreciate and harness the strengths and diversity of the human experience. At the end of the course, students will gain the experience, skills and values to: (a) be informed, open-minded, and responsible people who are attentive to diversity across the spectrum of differences; (b) seek to understand how their actions affect both local and global communities, and (c) address the world’s most pressing and enduring issues collaboratively and equitably, to continue to learn through practice and critical reflection on what it means to live, work and play intentionally, responsibly and meaningfully as natural collaborators and effective global citizens in an inclusive and sustainable world. Please note that the course requires compulsory overseas travelling during the Semester Break and the course span over 2 semesters (grades will be released at the end of the following Semester).

The course spans 2 regular semesters. There is a compulsory travel component during the semester break.

course_title: Maritime Business and Management
course_title_cleaned: Maritime Business and Management
course_objective: Describe the significance of the maritime industry and key maritime regions. Demonstrate the workings of the sale and purchase, newbuilding and demolition markets and bulk trades. Distinguish the financial aspects of running a shipping business. Discuss developments in sea transport and the effects on shipping freight. Illustrate important attributes of liner shipping and general cargo trades. Examine roles of the flag state, port state control and maritime clusters in fostering greater competitiveness for the maritime industry.
course_learning_outcomes: LOG231 Maritime Business and Management introduces the maritime industry to students by highlighting key aspects of the maritime business. The course provides an overview of concepts and theories pertaining to the maritime industry and covers a broad range of sectors including the container, liquid bulk, dry bulk, general cargo and cruise businesses. Students will be exposed to principles that drive interactions and relationships between the four major markets that affect the maritime industry, as well as role of flag state and port state in regulatory matters. The concept of maritime clusters will also be introduced in relation to policy making and development of the maritime industry in Singapore. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with a broad- based understanding of the maritime industry from the commercial, regulatory and managerial perspectives.

course_title: Reflective Practice and Cultural Competencies
course_title_cleaned: Reflective Practice and Cultural Competencies
course_objective: Identify and locate personal values within broader socio-economic contexts. Explain key concepts related to reflective practice and cultural competencies. Discuss the importance and challenges of reflective practice in social work. Discuss the relationship between personal values and the role of social workers under various contexts. Identify personal experiences and attributes that shape one’s own values. Demonstrate different ways of practicing reflexivity as a social worker. Develop skills and strategies to engage with “difficult” clients. Illustrate how social workers balance between personal, professional, organisational and social values.
course_learning_outcomes:
The understanding of “self” and its relationship with others is critical in social work practice. The understanding of one’s personal beliefs, values and biases is a first step in appreciating the importance of multi-cultural identities in the lives of clients and how it will influence one’s attitude and beliefs about clients. There are two main components to the course. The first component consists of a journey of self-awareness through experiential learning and the second component consists of using the insights gained to understand how the “self” interacts and relates to people who have different ages, genders, ethnicity, religions, physical abilities, cultural practices and socio-economic backgrounds. Through a constant practice of self-reflection towards inter-cultural value differences, the course aims to introduce respectful, cultural competent social work practices among diverse social groups.
Pre-requisite is SWK100

Identify and locate personal values within broader socio-economic contexts. Explain key concepts related to reflective practice and cultural competencies. Discuss the importance and challenges of reflective practice in social work. Discuss the relationship between personal values and the role of social workers under various contexts. Identify personal experiences and attributes that shape one’s own values. Demonstrate different ways of practicing reflexivity as a social worker. Develop skills and strategies to engage with “difficult” clients. Illustrate how social workers balance between personal, professional, organisational and social values.

# course learning outcomes
The understanding of “self” and its relationship with others is critical in social work practice. The understanding of one’s personal beliefs, values and biases is a first step in appreciating the importance of multi-cultural identities in the lives of clients and how it will influence one’s attitude and beliefs about clients. There are two main components to the course. The first component consists of a journey of self-awareness through experiential learning and the second component consists of using the insights gained to understand how the “self” interacts and relates to people who have different ages, genders, ethnicity, religions, physical abilities, cultural practices and socio-economic backgrounds. Through a constant practice of self-reflection towards inter-cultural value differences, the course aims to introduce respectful, cultural competent social work practices among diverse social groups.
Pre-requisite is SWK100

course_title: Leadership in Service Innovation
course_title_cleaned: Leadership in Service Innovation
course_objective: Design a customer journey map and understand the role of technology in transforming the customer experience Appraise the key elements of value co-creation and understand the importance of the service ecosystem Prioritise the importance of service design thinking principles, processes, methods and tools used in the design and delivery of service innovative in sustainable service experiences Recommend various blended approaches as well as emerging and advanced technologies including artificial intelligence, robotics, augmented and virtual realities and digital media to enhance service interaction across sectors Propose ideas from multiple perspectives to identify reasoning in a variety of fields with differing assumptions, contents and methods Create the organisation�s projected brand and reputation with the customer Examine emerging technology trends for new technological products, services and techniques
course_learning_outcomes: In an increasingly volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous business environment, organisations need to focus on leadership, innovation, customer experience and service excellence to gain a competitive advantage. This course examines best practices in business leadership, innovation, service management and customer experience design. It helps students develop the transformational mind-set and leadership skills needed to succeed in the changing market landscape. Students will learn about the environmental changes that led to an experience-based value model which demands that leaders have a strong background in customer experience, value co-creation, and change management to ensure that they are well prepared for the future and ready to maximise organisational resilience and continuous innovation.

course_objective: Compare different SLA theories Discuss the role of language environment (input/interaction/feedback) in SLA Examine second language learner data to better understand how language learning happens in interaction Critique cognitive accounts of SLA Assess the implications of SLA research on language pedagogy Appraise social dimensions of L2 learning
course_learning_outcomes: TSL 507 Second Language Acquisition examines critically theories that seek to explain the acquisition of a second language (SLA). These theories focus on different aspects of second language learning: learner’s language, difference and strategies; social factors; language transfer; cognitive factors; and classroom interaction. The implications of some of these theoretical insights on language teaching and syllabus design are then considered critically.

course_title: Youth Suicide and Prevention
course_title_cleaned: Youth Suicide and Prevention
course_objective: Demonstrate an understanding of the underlying causes, signs, symptoms, assessment and intervention techniques related to youth mental health and suicide. Review and apply the standard of care and professional code of conduct, ethics and values to safeguard and promote the best interests of youths. Evaluate the principles underpinning systems and resources of safety policies, procedures and programmes, and risk assessment theories and frameworks relating to youth mental health and suicide. Facilitate discussions and learnings on emerging youth mental health and suicide issues and develop intervention programmes and policies to reduce risk and recurrence. Review standard of care, procedures and programmes of health and safety and compliance relating to youth mental health and suicide. Adapt the appropriate risk assessment frameworks to suit the unique requirements of youth mental health and suicide cases.
course_learning_outcomes: Suicide rates continue to increase globally. In Singapore, SOS reported in the August 3, 2020, The Straits Times that suicide remains the leading cause of death for people aged 10 to 29, adding that the number of suicides among the 20 to 29 age cohort remains highest compared with other age groups. YWK501 Youth Suicide and Prevention aims to present and share the work of leading researchers and clinicians locally and overseas, by providing a concise review of recent literature, discuss solutions achieved and provide practical guidance for youth care to aid understanding and help prevent suicide. Each lesson provides pertinent information covering aspects of the field, from epidemiology and theories of causation through to treatment and prevention. This course will educate practitioners working with youths and other health care workers, as well as providing a pathway for graduate students interested in furthering their understanding of the complexities surrounding suicide.

course_title: Critical Thinking Series : Mastering Logic for Problem-Solving (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Critical Thinking Series   Mastering Logic for Problem-Solving (Classroom and Asynchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This programme will focus on logical reasoning in critical thinking where students will apply hypothetical thinking in searching for solutions. The course will also engage students in experiential learning to identify structural similarities in seemingly unconnected elements while numerical sequences will be used to train the mind to discern meaningful patterns The Feuerstein Instrumental Enrichment (FIE) will be used. FIE is a cognitive coaching approach that has been established for more than 60 years. It is based on the theory of Structural Cognitive Modifiability and Mediated Learning Experience, which can modify cognition over time and make thinking more flexible. This programme invites you to start a lifelong journey of transformation as you experience first-hand how you can learn to exercise awareness and control over your cognitive functions and establish new habits of the mind. A pre- and post-dynamic assessment test is included so you can see progress in your own critical thinking ability. Mastering logic for problem-solving contributes to work skills as it is the foundation for applying logic to assess situations, identify solutions and make sound decisions. This is key part of creating clear arguments in workplace communication and assessing multiple relevant sources of information to resolve workplace issues, as well as planning, risk assessment, resource management and troubleshooting for project management. Mastery in this case involves developing flexibility of mind to adapt logical thinking to different contexts.
course_learning_outcomes:
Examine cognitive functions and logical reasoning skills that are relevant to workplace learning and performance
Determine how awareness and control of the input, elaboration and output elements of the thinking process can help plug cognitive gaps 
Apply specific cognitive functions to formulate hypothesis and search for credible and convincing evidence for problem-solving
course_entry_req: Proficiency in English

course_title: Adaptability In the Face of Disruptive Change: Practice Beyond the Theory (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Adaptability In the Face of Disruptive Change  Practice Beyond the Theory (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to: • Gain an understanding of the change processes, the resistance to change and how to overcome it • Learn about the different change management models and how to select the best ideas from each • Manage change positively via the 5 Stages of the Transtheoretical Change Framework • Be introduced to an entire set of skills enabling us to become more adaptable
course_learning_outcomes: Brace yourself for a world of lightning-fast change! Unfortunately, most of us struggle to keep up. But the good news is we can learn to adapt and thrive. Join us for a transformative 1-day course where you’ll discover the secrets to adaptability and change management. Based on cutting-edge research, this class will introduce participants to overcoming resistance and enhancing theirs and their organisation’s adaptability capabilities. Discover why adaptability is the secret to thriving in a world of unstoppable change. Participants will gain a powerful overview of adaptability and change models, practices and methods,  and be enabled to positively manage change in their organization by becoming more adaptable and supporting of others.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Agile Business Practices and Management Module 5: Coaching Agile Transformations  (ICP-CAT) (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Agile Business Practices and Management Module 5  Coaching Agile Transformations  (ICP-CAT) (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Co-create an organisational change strategy; • Bring the Agile mindset to change that incorporates inspect-and-adapt, creation through collaboration and the belief that change is a continuous process rather than an event; • Understand, identify and address organisational impediments to agile practices; • Communicate, educate and facilitate organisation change; • Attain the ICAgile Certified Professional in Coaching Agile Transformations (ICP-CAT) certification upon passing the required assessment(s).
course_learning_outcomes: Coaching Agile Transformations (CAT) is an advanced form of Agile Coaching that works at an enterprise scale. It builds upon the discipline of team coaching and facilitation (Module 4) and draws upon the disciplines of management consulting and Organizational Development (OD). Given its very diverse scope, CAT is not a role per se, but rather a set of skills and competencies that an individual can obtain and leverage in guiding organizations to become more Agile. This 2-day module aims to equip learners with broad awareness of business, technical and transformational agility that includes working with organizational structures and culture, developing leaders, building a strong team culture, growing technical practices, and increasing business agility.
course_entry_req: Participants should have at least 2 years of working experience with interest in agile business practices and management.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Crisis Management for Business Module 6: Crisis Recovery (Synchronous E-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Crisis Management for Business Module 6  Crisis Recovery (Synchronous E-learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Conduct a review framework for post-crisis recovery with internal and external collaborators  • Structure and organise diagnostic actions required  • Establish a tracking system for post-crisis follow-ups and maintenance
course_learning_outcomes:
In the aftermath of a crisis, you’ll want to ensure your organiastion is able to recover and resume operations as quickly as possible. While adequate preparation will reduce the impact of a crisis and potentially allow you to avert one completely, integrating a recovery process into your crisis management plan is critical.

This module focuses on how organisations recover and reassess their reputation, procedures and strategies post-crisis. The tapering down of a crisis and eventual passing of the immediate situation does not mark the end or close the incident for the organisation affected. In fact, it requires a review and analysis to determine the organisations new starting position upon recovery, the plan ahead and ensuring lessons learnt are applied.  Regardless of the size of the organisation, manpower and resources available, learning how to move forward requires key strategic considerations that go beyond adopting a business-as-usual attitude.
course_entry_req: Participants should be fluent in speaking and written English.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Fintech and the Future of Finance Module 5: Shaping the Future of Fintech – Entrepreneurship and Innovation
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Fintech and the Future of Finance Module 5  Shaping the Future of Fintech – Entrepreneurship and Innovation
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Understand the intricacies of developing, launching, and scaling a Fintech startup • Develop a comprehensive knowledge of the Fintech ecosystem, including the funding landscape and venture capital • Analyse case studies of successful Fintech startups to glean insights and identify emerging trends and opportunities in the Fintech space • Develop a holistic perspective of the Fintech landscape, with the ability to critically examine and evaluate its evolution in light of entrepreneurship, innovation, and behavioural finance
course_learning_outcomes:
In an ever-changing financial landscape, entrepreneurship and innovation are key drivers of growth and transformation. This module delves into the role of these elements within the realm of Fintech.

The module guides participants through the journey of launching and scaling a Fintech startup, highlighting key considerations such as the Fintech ecosystem, venture capital, and funding options. Using case studies of successful Fintech startups, participants are encouraged to identify opportunities for innovation within this sector, paving the way for potential entrepreneurial ventures. Structured with lectures, case studies, interactive discussions, and hands-on exercises, this module aims to provide participants with the tools and insights needed to carve their niche in the Fintech landscape as innovative entrepreneurs.
course_entry_req: Participants should have a basic understanding of financial and economic concepts. A basic understanding of technology, including familiarity with computer systems and software applications, is beneficial. Knowledge of data analysis, programming, or software development, while not mandatory, could enhance the learning experience. Some professional experience, particularly in roles related to finance, technology, entrepreneurship, or regulation, can enrich the participant's understanding of course content. However, motivated fresh graduates or students with a keen interest in Fintech are also welcome.

course_title: Advanced Certificate in Strategic Sourcing Module 4: Finance and Data Analytics for Procurement (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in Strategic Sourcing Module 4  Finance and Data Analytics for Procurement (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Gain an appreciation of finance and its impact on procurement • Learn about financial ratios and interpret financial documents • Link financial information to procurement tasks • Use data analytics to forecast demand planning • Analyse data impact to warehouse management and other functions
course_learning_outcomes: Traditional procurement planning practices display a strong short- to medium-term orientation. To be prepared for the future, procurement professionals have to think “out-of-the-box” and select forecasting tools with the most extensive field of vision. It is the only way to provide comprehensive procurement transformation with the best possible support across its entire breadth and depth. To this end, the roles of finance and analytics are key. Finance has an incredibly important role in procurement and it is important to understand the value it offers. Analytics, on the other hand, helps tie together both internal and external data sources, thus providing information anytime and anywhere about supplier markets. This module discusses how finance and analytics can help drive decisive insights for procurement and enable organisations to unlock its real value.
course_entry_req:
Participants should preferrably be
• conversant in English, both spoken and written
• proficient in MS Office

# course objective
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Gain an appreciation of finance and its impact on procurement • Learn about financial ratios and interpret financial documents • Link financial information to procurement tasks • Use data analytics to forecast demand planning • Analyse data impact to warehouse management and other functions

# course learning outcomes
Traditional procurement planning practices display a strong short- to medium-term orientation. To be prepared for the future, procurement professionals have to think “out-of-the-box” and select forecasting tools with the most extensive field of vision. It is the only way to provide comprehensive procurement transformation with the best possible support across its entire breadth and depth. To this end, the roles of finance and analytics are key. Finance has an incredibly important role in procurement and it is important to understand the value it offers. Analytics, on the other hand, helps tie together both internal and external data sources, thus providing information anytime and anywhere about supplier markets. This module discusses how finance and analytics can help drive decisive insights for procurement and enable organisations to unlock its real value.

# course entry req
Participants should preferrably be
• conversant in English, both spoken and written
• proficient in MS Office

course_title: Advanced Certificate in UI/UX Essentials for UI/UX Designer Module 1: Introduction to UI/UX Fundamentals (Asynchronous and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Advanced Certificate in UI UX Essentials for UI UX Designer Module 1  Introduction to UI UX Fundamentals (Asynchronous and Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: In this programme, participants will embark on a transformative journey into the world of User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX) design. From user research and wireframing to visual design and accessibility, participants will master the art of crafting intuitive digital experiences. By the end of the programme, participants will gain hands-on skills and build a portfolio that allows them to step confidently into the role of an associate UI/UX designer.  This module provides an overview of UI/UX design and the responsibilities associated with being a UI/UX designer. Participants will acquire a strong foundation in UI/UX design principles, mastering the essentials of creating user-centered digital experiences, such as through conducting user research and creating personas. It will also cover basic concepts in information architecture and wireframing.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the module, participants will be able to:
- Understand the role of a User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX) designer
- Differentiate between UI and UX design
- List and explain the design process: research, design, prototype, test, iterate
- Explain the importance of user-centered design
- Conduct user interviews and surveys
- Create user personas and scenarios based on users' needs and goals
- Organise content and create site maps
- Explain hierarchical structure and navigation design
- List common wireframing tools such as Figma and InVision and techniques

- Design according to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) for users with disabilities
- Test and ensure accessibility compliance

course_title: CS103 A: Network Security in Practice: Fundamentals of Network Security (synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: CS103 A  Network Security in Practice  Fundamentals of Network Security (synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Networking fabric is the backbone of any cybersecurity framework. This course provides you with the technical understanding of cryptographic protocols and network design principles to prevent attacks on different layers of communication networks.
course_learning_outcomes: After taking the course, you will be able to explain the security issues in a cyber environment, explain the design decisions behind a secure network architecture plan, and design a secure network strategy based on a combination of cryptographic protocols and network control mechanisms. In addition to the traditional networks, you will also be introduced to the security requirements and design of modern cyber-physical networks, IoT environments, cloud architecture, and blockchain.

course_title: Circular Organisational Design (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Circular Organisational Design (Synchronous e-Learning)
course_objective: Circular Organizational Design combines Circularity principles and Organizational development. This 1-day course focuses on designing organizations based on Circularity. The course begins with an overview of Circular organizational principles and processes. A large part of the workshop will be focused on the use of business modeling tools, analytical frameworks, and governance strategies to design new business opportunities and/or transform existing organizational practices in a Circular manner. The concepts will be further deepened through case studies and simulated workshops, where participants will apply what they have learned. The pedagogical approach will be a mixture of content lectures, hands-on activities, and case study examinations.

course_title: Empowering Women in Artificial Intelligence: Strategies Navigating New Tech and Innovation (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Empowering Women in Artificial Intelligence  Strategies Navigating New Tech and Innovation (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: In the world of technology and finance, an increasing number of women are encountering both dynamic opportunities and challenges at the workplace. As executives in these fields, women navigate negotiations, manage teams, and continuously strive for personal and professional growth.  This course seeks to equip women with practical strategies for navigating difficult conversations, mastering negotiation techniques, and effectively managing teams. Through engaging discussions and actionable workshop, participants will unlock their leadership potential and build a professional network of fellow female executives for ongoing support and collaboration in the tech and finance sector.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to:

course_title: Energy Storage for Green Technologies (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Energy Storage for Green Technologies (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: At the end of the course, the participants will be able to: 1. Introduce various energy storage technologies for electric vehicles and stationary storage applications. 2. Present their characteristics such as storage capacity and power capabilities. 3. Understand various components and working principles of electrochemical and electrical storage technologies including redox flow, Na-S, Li-ion batteries and supercapacitors. 4. Address the factors affecting the performances of Li-ion battery deployed in various sectors including electric vehicles, stationary energy storage systems, aerospace and marine and finally illustrate a few failure modes causing safety issues
course_learning_outcomes: Energy storage technologies are vital for success of electric mobility and micro-grids to address climate change mitigation. This course introduces various types of storage technologies including pumped hydro, flywheel, compressed air and thermal storage along with their characteristics such as storage capacity and power for various applications. Second part of this course covers various components and working principles of electrochemical and electrical storage technologies including redox flow, Na-S, Li-ion batteries and supercapacitors. This course will also address the factors affecting the performances of Li-ion battery deployed in various sectors including electric vehicles, stationary energy storage systems, aerospace and marine and finally illustrate a few failure modes causing safety issues.

course_title: Entrepreneurial Marketing and Business Development (Asynchronous and Synchronous e-learning) (Chinese)
course_title_cleaned: Entrepreneurial Marketing and Business Development (Asynchronous and Synchronous e-learning) (Chinese)
course_objective: 1.	Gain an understanding of the functional role of marketing in the wider context of a business and entrepreneurship setting. 2.	Answer the crucial “What am I selling, to whom and why, and how can I be a market leader” question. 3.	Appreciate marketing from both a conceptual and entrepreneurial real-world application basis. 4.	Apply marketing techniques in real-life situation.
course_learning_outcomes:
Frequently the success of a new venture is not just a good product – but combined with good marketing. Yet many ventures are started without a market orientation – which can be a costly and fatal mistake. This course combines marketing approaches with insights on how marketing principles are applied in new ventures and entrepreneurial business situations. While fundamental marketing principles are still relevant, these will be applied with an entrepreneurial angle that is characterized by innovativeness, opportunity gap focus, resource leveraging, customer intimacy; differential competitive advantages and value creation that is aligned with changes in the business landscape.

Scope / Syllabus 
1.	Overview of Marketing and Marketing Strategy 
2.	Marketing Research (Concepts, Tools and Methods) 
3.	Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning I
4.	Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning II
5.	Product and product development
6.	Pricing
7.	Promotion
8.	Distribution Channel
9.	Consumer Behaviour
10.	Branding
11.	Digital Marketing
12.	Business development strategies
course_entry_req: No pre-requisites are needed. However, participants without qualifications or working experience in finance or technical field may find the course contents challenging.

course_title: Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) and Materiality Reporting (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) and Materiality Reporting (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the of the 1-day course, participants will be able to:  • Understand the importance of sustainable practices • Understand the reporting standards including GRI Standards, UNSDGs, and Singapore Exchange requirements • Learn how to identify risk – based material issues for companies • Practice application of concepts and standards by critiquing and recommending improvement for actual ESG reports
course_learning_outcomes:
There has been a growing focus on sustainable business practices and transparent ESG (Environment, Social & Governance) reporting.  While sustainability reporting is not mandatory in all jurisdictions, a growing number of successful organisations appreciate that adopting best practice can be a significant business differentiator. Additionally, a growing number of lenders and investors have incorporated Sustainability related pre-requisites on corporations who require funding.
 
As ESG reporting is not mandatory in Singapore except for companies listed on the Singapore Exchange, companies across different industries disclose disparate metrics relating to their sustainability performance. This has led to a persistent and key challenge surrounding sustainable investing: a perceived lack of trust in the reliability of this data. There is thus a need to improve both the quality and reliability of ESG disclosure.
course_entry_req: Professionals and business owners who are keen on deepening their skills and knowledge in corporate and business sustainability.
