course_title: Executive Certificate in Successful Data Transformation for the Logistics Sector
course_title_cleaned: Executive Certificate in Successful Data Transformation for the Logistics Sector
course_objective: At the end of the 5-day course, participants will be able to: • Appreciate basic critical data elements, data governance concepts and the data roles and responsibilities across data life cycle • Gain insights into challenges, trends and business benefits that drive the need for good data quality • Know the importance of data privacy and common privacy regulations • Understand basic data classification and processing concepts  • Understand the transport and logistics data universe, its different areas and terminologies and business problems  • Understand the common challenges and success to apply techniques for data requirements writing to sample business scenarios • Know the different ways an organisation can monetise and share its data, and some real-life examples  • Understand the benefits and risks associated with data monetisation and sharing • Apply problem solving skills necessary for data and analytics • Learn about the different self-service digital and data tools for transformation
course_learning_outcomes: Successful data transformations can yield enormous benefits yet many organisations are struggling to capture real value from their data programmes, with some seeing scant returns from investments. Unlike the usual short courses where participants learn skills and concepts from the course, this certificate programme seeks to offer project-solution training complemented with classroom training in data transformation for the logistics sector. Participants will be guided to establish a suitably scoped data project and will also be guided on undertaking solution steps, in the project. The training will provide participants with a step by step exposure on applying related skills and concepts to realise successful analytics of the data studied in the logistics sector to embark on a journey to elevate their organisation through the understanding of data as a critical enabler of business growth, given that digital transformation is becoming an important trend in the transport and logistics space.
course_entry_req: Participants should have basic IT application knowledge such as Microsoft Office.

Successful data transformations can yield enormous benefits yet many organisations are struggling to capture real value from their data programmes, with some seeing scant returns from investments. Unlike the usual short courses where participants learn skills and concepts from the course, this certificate programme seeks to offer project-solution training complemented with classroom training in data transformation for the logistics sector. Participants will be guided to establish a suitably scoped data project and will also be guided on undertaking solution steps, in the project. The training will provide participants with a step by step exposure on applying related skills and concepts to realise successful analytics of the data studied in the logistics sector to embark on a journey to elevate their organisation through the understanding of data as a critical enabler of business growth, given that digital transformation is becoming an important trend in the transport and logistics space.

course_title: FTI6001 Managing and Leading Enterprise Artificial Intelligence Projects
course_title_cleaned: FTI6001 Managing and Leading Enterprise Artificial Intelligence Projects
course_objective: This module trains the student on project management and the background knowhow to lead corporate AI projects, which are fundamentally different from standard IT projects, as AI systems tend to be both highly diverse and complex.   Having completed this module, the student will be able to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the following, and be able to manage and guide AI projects in a project management or enterprise innovation role:  1.	The architecture, applications and operations of popular AI Deep Learning systems and how they would benefit enterprises via enhanced productivity in corporate decision making, process automation and problem solving. Overview of software development using AI frameworks. 2.	Overview of Natural Language Processing (NLP) AI systems and key applications. 3.	Overview of AI vision processing systems for object recognition, segmentation, pose, biometrics and action recognition. 4.	Overview of AI Ethics, governance, AI cyber security vulnerabilities such as Adversarial Attacks, data security, privacy and common implementation weaknesses. Understand privacy and cyber security best practices for AIOps and the need for ethics, transparency and fairness for Trustworthy AI. 5.	Overview of AI Project Management and leadership roles. 6.	State-of-the-art in AI, future trends and developments; new pending problems that can be solved with better algorithms and the cost reduction expected as the technology advances. Additionally, students will have mastered the skills to be able to: 7.	Analyse the feasibility of user requirements, data input requirements, AI project life cycle and deployment suitability.
course_learning_outcomes:
This module trains the student on project management and the background knowhow to lead corporate AI projects, which are fundamentally different from standard IT projects, as AI systems tend to be both highly diverse and complex. 

Having completed this module, the student will be able to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the following, and be able to manage and guide AI projects in a project management or enterprise innovation role:

3.	Overview of AI vision processing systems for object recognition, segmentation, pose, biometrics and action recognition.

5.	Overview of AI Project Management and leadership roles.
6.	State-of-the-art in AI, future trends and developments; new pending problems that can be solved with better algorithms and the cost reduction expected as the technology advances.
Additionally, students will have mastered the skills to be able to:
7.	Analyse the feasibility of user requirements, data input requirements, AI project life cycle and deployment suitability.
course_entry_req: Bachelor degree in Science and Engineering, and preferably have done IT projects and have two years of project management background.

course_title: Finding Your Sweet Spot in a Digital Future (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Finding Your Sweet Spot in a Digital Future (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Understanding your personality profile and how to harness it for innovation and/or growth. - Breaking through existing mindset models to generate higher growth opportunities. - Understanding future global trends ' Asian customer demands for higher impact. - Harnessing the unique Asian perspectives to build sustainable value propositions. - Utilising the Asian tailored framework and practices for growth. - how to strategically grow the organization through culture change and mindset shift techniques.
course_learning_outcomes:
The impact of the pandemic and the onset of a global recession has shifted the business environment. It is no longer “Business as usual”. The old models of business growth no longer apply and many require a new thinking framework to survive and prosper in this new environment.
As society and markets develop new needs and new demand for economic and social impact, we require reinvention to succeed. In this course, we introduce modified Asian frameworks and practices that work well in Asia. As Asia is the growth region for the next 100 years, we step away from Western-bias thinking to understand and develop businesses that do well in our region. 
The course will turn commitments into action and we explore Asian technological and economic transformations to build a more sustainable world.
This change and innovation strategy course is for middle and top management who want to learn how to personally engage with, and develop sustainable digital value propositions. We explore 3 core topics that will provide you the tools and mindsets to:
Personal ' Team Growth
•	Identify your personal ' business strengths ' weakness
•	Implementing individual and team mindset change for powerful performance 
Critical Skills
•	Discover the skills that you need to unlearn and relearn to thrive in a digital world
•	Creating powerful performing teams for Asia and beyond
Strategies ' Approaches
•	Understanding successful Asian approaches to sustainable business growth
•	Creating impactful strategic pivots for your current or new business
•	Understand the key drivers to creating sustainable value in transformations

Method of teaching: 
•	Experiential learning
•	Asian case studies
•	Asian-centric strategies
•	Self-reflection
•	Team work ' discussions
course_entry_req: 8 years work experience and above

course_title: Freight Services and Operations
course_title_cleaned: Freight Services and Operations
course_objective: This module is part of the Post-Diploma Certificate (PDC) in Supply Chain Operations (Specialist Diploma in Supply Chain Management).
course_learning_outcomes:
This module aims to build students’ knowledge on various topics on international freight services through a structured, consultative, and interactive learning process using relevant case studies from the industry. 

By the end of the module, the participants should be able to:
•	Explain the key fundamentals of International Freight Service. 
•	Examine the key features, documentations, and service terms of Air and Ocean Freight Service.
•	Perform tender management and freight service solutioning.
course_entry_req:
Applicants should possess a local Diploma, ITE Technical Diploma / Technical Engineer Diploma / Work-Study Technical Diploma, or Degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Business, or Science from recognised institutions.
Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least five years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted will have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

course_title: Fundamentals of Mechanical Design
course_title_cleaned: Fundamentals of Mechanical Design
course_objective: This module provides the student with the fundamental knowledge to do calculations on design components like bolts, fasteners, joints, welds, springs, gears, brakes, clutches. course_title: Generative AI: Applications, Prompt Engineering and the power of ChatGPT (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Generative AI  Applications, Prompt Engineering and the power of ChatGPT (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to: • Define ChatGPT and learn the fundamentals of ChatGPT • Explore the applications of ChatGPT in businesses and examine how to train and fine-tune a ChatGPT model • Learn the Advanced ChatGPT technique s (conversational Artificial Intelligence, chatbots, customisation for specific tasks) and analyze the best practices of using ChatGPT • Understand the ethical considerations of using ChatGPT • Discover the strategies for maintaining and updating your ChatGPS model • Acquire the lessons learnt from the challenges of using a ChatGPT with real-world case studies and examples
course_learning_outcomes: With Microsoft weighing a $10 billion investment in OpenAI, ChatGPT, as its acronym indicates, is a generative language model based on the ‘transformer’ architecture. Founded by OpenAI in 2015, this language model is capable of processing large amounts of text and learning to perform natural language processing tasks effectively. This chat research tool crossed 1 million users in just 5 days after its launch. Many tech executives and venture capitalists have even compared it to Apple’s debut of the iPhone in 2007. ChatGPT surpasses language barriers and can be utilised in various industries, such as improving customer service, generating attractive posts on social media, solving errors in code and many more. In this course, participants will learn the fundamentals of ChatGPT, examine its benefits and learn to employ its technology in businesses.

course_provider: SINGAPORE UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY AND DESIGN
course_title: Introduction to Functional Textile Design and Sustainable Manufacturing
course_title_cleaned: Introduction to Functional Textile Design and Sustainable Manufacturing
course_objective: Computer Numeric Control (CNC) knitted products have become increasingly prevalent in everyday life over the past few years, manifesting in domains that are both design-oriented (sweaters and shoe uppers) and engineering-oriented (seat covers and vehicle chassis preforms etc.). Using design inputs, the machine's loop-by-loop formation enables users to create shaped geometries with different localised properties in a single manufacturing step. Thus, this broadens the design freedom to create a variety of technical textiles with functional properties that can be used for different industries. Moreover, this additive manufacturing technique presents a sustainable method of creating textiles without depending on conventional cut-and-sew processes.  This course introduces participants to digital textile design, with CNC knitting of technical textiles as the main focus. It shares how different properties (i.e. mechanical, shape-change, electrical etc.) can be imparted to the knit and the various basic Computer Numeric Control (CNC) knitting principles of how to achieve them.  It will also include sharing sessions from industry specialists to give insights of how they are incorporating sustainability in their business operations.  The latter half is a design workshop to let users have a hands-on experience of how to design a functional knitted textile with variable localised properties. It allows participants to explore using the Kniterate system to design and manufacture these textiles.
course_learning_outcomes:
•	Identify the main textile production methods and what type of textiles they can produce
•	Recognise the different functions and properties that can be imparted via Computer Numeric Control (CNC)-knitting and the relevant knitting design principles
•	Gain an understanding how sustainability in incorporated in the fashion industry
•	Able to design a simple knitted technical textile with localised properties using the Kniterate system
•	Understand the different design-to-fabrication workflows in creating a functional technical textile
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Machine Learning Solution Design  (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Machine Learning Solution Design  (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This course will enable participants to: 1. Understand and execute the processes of MLOps from ML solution design of new model pipelines. 2. Understand ML lifecycle management 3. Learn the tools and techniques in MLOps.
course_learning_outcomes: Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) is a set of practices that aims to deploy and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models in production reliably and efficiently. Machine Learning models are tested and developed in isolated experimental systems. MLOps is about orchestrating the steps in the ML pipeline, then automating the execution of the pipeline for continuous training (CT) of the models. This course provides a high-level understanding of the processes required in the creation of Machine Learning solutions and design. Practical hands-on interactions with the tools forms a part of the learning process.
course_entry_req: At least a polytechnic diploma

# course objective
This course will enable participants to: 1. Understand and execute the processes of MLOps from ML solution design of new model pipelines. 2. Understand ML lifecycle management 3. Learn the tools and techniques in MLOps.

# course learning outcomes
Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) is a set of practices that aims to deploy and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models in production reliably and efficiently. Machine Learning models are tested and developed in isolated experimental systems. MLOps is about orchestrating the steps in the ML pipeline, then automating the execution of the pipeline for continuous training (CT) of the models. This course provides a high-level understanding of the processes required in the creation of Machine Learning solutions and design. Practical hands-on interactions with the tools forms a part of the learning process.

# course entry req
At least a polytechnic diploma

course_title_cleaned: Mastering Intelligent Automation (IA) To Boost Your Business (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This programme will cover: Intelligent Automation: Why do we need IA? What is IA?  Transformation of Service Sector : Role of IA and Service Robots, implications for capturing value and competitive position Platform Business Models : Powered by IA and disruption of sectors Examples and Cases: Companies that have succeeded and benefited from IA 4 Main Capabilities: Execution, Language, Vision and thinking & learning Managing IA transformation: Organizational change management, communications and stakeholder management  The Big Picture: Competitive Advantage and Capturing Value
course_learning_outcomes:
In the age of rapidly accelerating technological innovation, Intelligent Automation (IA) is the fastest-growing technology that will lead to a significant and disruptive impact on the world of work. Organizations need to be agile and embrace the uses of IA to establish a competitive advantage and deliver business value. 

This three-day programme is designed to introduce you to IA, its main technologies and how to succeed in managing an IA transformation. It exposes you to key technologies that will be instrumental when implementing IA in your organization and sets you up for success. 

Through the sharing of corporate practitioners and experts in the field of Intelligent Automation, participants will learn how to establish a competitive edge and capture value in this World of Hyperautomation.
course_entry_req: Minimum 5 years of working experience

course_title: Nasogastric Tube (NGT) & Percutaneous Endoscopic Gastrostomy (PEG) Care Course
course_title_cleaned: Nasogastric Tube (NGT) & Percutaneous Endoscopic Gastrostomy (PEG) Care Course
course_objective: This course aims to prepare participants with basic knowledge and fundamental skills to provide home-based and personalised care to clients who requires nasogastric tube (NGT) and/or percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) tube care.  This course includes introduction to the different types of gastrostomy tube, recognition of complication of having these tubes and how to feed enteral feeds via NGT and PEG.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, the trainees will be able to:
1.	Identify the reasons for nasogastric tube.
2.	List the types of feeding tubes.
3.	Discuss the complication of nasogastric tube.
4.	Demonstrate the care for client with nasogastric tube or Percutaneous endoscopy Gastrostomy (PEG) Tube.
5.	Demonstrate feeding of client using nasogastric or Percutaneous endoscopy Gastrostomy (PEG) Tube.

course_title: No-Code Artificial Intelligence Product Development (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: No-Code Artificial Intelligence Product Development (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Imagine creating intelligent solutions, predictive models, and data-driven applications — all without the need for complex programming languages. With the emergence of No-Code artificial intelligence (AI) tools, what once seemed intimidating has now become increasingly user-friendly and accessible, changing the game for businesses and innovators. Whether you’re a business leader, a creative thinker, or a product manager, this session promises to demystify AI and empower more to build remarkable products. This course will cover the basics of Generative AI, the application of No-Code AI in product development and how to employ AI to streamline business processes. With the continuous evolution of Generative AI technologies, their influence in sculpting innovative and effective applications grows ever more crucial, offering a range of opportunities for professionals prepared to embrace this technological shift.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to:
• Grasp the foundational concepts, technologies, and principles of generative artificial intelligence (AI) and their application in No-Code AI product development
• Understand the current application of generative AI in product development, including intelligent solutions, predictive models, and data-driven applications
• Recognise potential concerns and risks associated with the use of No-Code AI product development
• Develop practical abilities through interactive exercises utilising top generative AI tools for data analytics
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title_cleaned: Professional Certificate in Fitness Training Module 2  Advanced Fitness Training for Sporting Activity
course_objective: This module aims to educate participants on the development of sports specific training programmes. This will include the thought process and key considerations for designing  programme from speed sports like rugby, to endurance sports like triathlons, as well as sports with a mix of speed and endurance like martial arts. There will also be an emphasis on the trainign needed to lower the risk of common injuries in these sports
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Design successful long term exercise programmes in improving sports performance and maintaining an active, sporting lifestyle
• Assess and analyse traditional and popular exercise programmes used presently in the area of sports performance 
• Learn to select the right methods to suit different clients 
• Coach fellow participants under the supervision of instructors

They will be able to help a wide range of people from athetes to active aging seniors

• Learn practical methods to reduce risk, and manage injuries. 
• Provide practical instructions in multi-faceted injury management techniques which include ""hard"" methods such as massage, stretching or other physical movement to achieve results
• Learn to integrate multiple methods to achieve good results for clients
• Understand and put into practice all the skills in real world settings

course_title: SMU-NAFA Advanced Certificate in Marketing with Visual Impact Module 1: Visual Communication in the Emotional Economy (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: SMU-NAFA Advanced Certificate in Marketing with Visual Impact Module 1  Visual Communication in the Emotional Economy (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: • Identify the types of fields in visual communication for marketing  • Demonstrate contextual interpretation of images in contemporary culture • Identify archetypes and motivations to communicate emotions and experiences • Use visual language confidently • Identify resources to build visual language
course_learning_outcomes:
Design literacy is the ability to understand and discuss the design process and what constitutes successful design. It is an understanding of how design is deployed across various mediums for a compelling end-user experience. To remain relevant in an increasingly image-saturated economy, design literacy is the new essential for professionals, managers, executives, and business owners to connect with their customers.

Jointly offered by SMU and Nayang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA), this certificate programme provides participants with the knowledge and confidence required to identify design principles for visual strategies and to make informed decisions when collaborating with creative expertise and procuring creative assets. They will gain meaningful insights into the process of translating customers’ needs to practical design language and provide timely response to emerging opportunities in the digital age.

Module 1 provides participants with an understanding of how semiotics is used in marketing to decipher and influence consumers’ attitudes and behaviours. They will also learn how to draw upon the latest creative assets to skilfully compete in the emotional economy.
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title_cleaned: Safety, Risk and Resilience Engineering
course_objective: System safety has progressed from its roots in accident investigation, through the creation of various prevention and mitigation strategies to a full partnership in the system design process along with quality and productivity. This 18-hour course provides students with a set of analysis and design tools to assure the ease of use, effectiveness (quality and reliability), efficiency, safety, security and satisfaction in the operation of small and large systems throughout its life cycle given various technological, human, operational and environmental “hazards.”

course_title: Sales and Marketing Leadership: A Heuristics Approach (Synchronous E-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Sales and Marketing Leadership  A Heuristics Approach (Synchronous E-learning)
course_objective: At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to: - Appreciate how heuristics affect managerial decision making in a data overloaded, digital environment  - Assess how heuristics impact sales and marketing effectiveness - Maximise the effectiveness of heuristics in digital marketing  - Design effective integrated sales and marketing campaign based on principles of heuristics  - Achieve Sales and Marketing Leadership in your chosen product/service segment through effective application of heuristics
course_learning_outcomes:
Heuristics are simple rules of thumb we use for decision making. These rules can be pre-conceived from our past experiences, emotions etc. and they help us to make decisions quickly. It has been described as a fast and frugal method managers instinctively turn to when making all sorts of business decisions, as they are often time-starved and do not have the luxury to rely on extensive reports and data for fully informed, calculated decisions all the time.

In this 2-day course, we will examine how heuristics can be successfully applied to improve your sales and marketing effectiveness and to create a leadership position for your product/services, especially in this hyper digital, data overloaded world.
course_entry_req: Participants should have at least 2 years of working experience, with interest in improving their sales and marketing function/effectiveness.

course_title: Semiconductor Fabrication
course_title_cleaned: Semiconductor Fabrication
course_objective: This Post-Diploma Certificate (PDC) consists of the following modules:  Integrated Analog and Digital Circuit Design Semiconductor Fabrication
course_learning_outcomes: This module provides students with comprehensive understanding on the Front End Of Line (FEOL) and Back End Of Line (BEOL) process integration flow of diverse silicon-based devices, including Field Effect Transistors (FETs), memories, photonics, and MEMS, alongside advanced packaging techniques employed in modern Integrated Circuits (ICs). Participants will have the opportunity to enhance their comprehension of semiconductor fabrication and nanotechnology applications by exploring the utilisation of nanomaterials and nanofabrication techniques used in modern IC development.
course_entry_req:
•	Applicants should possess a relevant (Engineering or Science) local polytechnic Diploma, ITE Technical Diploma / Technical Engineer Diploma / Work-Study Technical Diploma or Degree.   
•	Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted will have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.
•	Conditional Offer
Graduating students (in final semester) from a local polytechnic or Institute of Technical Education (ITE) may apply for the programme.

course_title: Statistical Methods
course_title_cleaned: Statistical Methods
course_objective: ANL321 Statistical Methods is an intermediate course in Statistics that will cover statistical theory in greater depth beyond those covered in BUS105 Statistics such as multiple comparisons in ANOVA and model adequacy checking in Regression models. It will cover foundational topics such as probability theory and random variables, concepts of summary statistics such as expectations, variances, covariances, large sample theory such as law of large numbers and central limit theorem, estimation methods such as least squares regression, method of moments, and maximum likelihood estimation, concepts of inference such as hypothesis testing, and other topics such as nonparametric statistics and regression such as kernel density estimation and kernel regression.  The aim of this course is to broaden students' exposure to the breadth and depth of statistical methods.  Specific software will be used intensively in the course to provide hands-on applications of the topics covered.
course_learning_outcomes:
1 Explain relevant concepts used in the various statistical methods
2 Describe the relevant data and assumptions to be used for the various statistical models
3 Determine the relevant statistical methods to use for a given business problem and data structure
4 Appraise the advantages and disadvantages of using various statistical methods
5 Implement the various statistical methods using appropriate statistical software
6 Interpret the results of using the various statistical methods
7 Evaluate the results of using the various statistical methods
course_entry_req: Diploma or an equivalent qualification from a recognised institution

course_title_cleaned: Sustainability and the Circular Economy for Engineers and Designers
course_objective: • Awareness of issues and societal challenges in sustainability • Adopt life cycle thinking perspectives for better design • Apply tools to evaluate the environmental impact of products, processes, services and systems
course_learning_outcomes: Sustainable engineering is the integration of social, environmental, and economic considerations in the design of products, processes, and engineered systems. This full-day interactive course introduces the concept of sustainability – both theory and applications – to engineers and designers. Participants will learn of tools available to perform life-cycle assessment (LCA), guided by examine real-life case studies. Takeaways include a perspective on resource circularity, sustainable design, maintenance, and operations of products and systems.

course_title: Transforming Enterprises Module 4: Present (Synchronous E-Learning) (English & Mandarin)
course_title_cleaned: Transforming Enterprises Module 4  Present (Synchronous E-Learning) (English & Mandarin)
course_objective: The contents of a presentation, regardless of its depth or relevance, is only as good as the ability of the presenter to truly connect with his or her audiences. The PRESENT module aims to bridge the final gap for those who are ready with their presentation content to convey the intent effectively, on a one-to-one basis or to a larger pool of people.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:

• Set clear and precise presentation objectives to well segmented audiences

• Plan appropriate actions for the various stages of the presentation

• Overcome fear and present confidently to the target audience with flair

• Use techniques to deliver impactful presentation that leaves a lasting impression

• Convey the message effectively and achieve the intended outcome by driving actions
course_entry_req: Business owners, Management, Key Personnel and those who wish to gain a comprehensive coverage of the key areas driving the growth and transformation  of enterprises should attend.

course_title_cleaned: Visual Narrative Using Tableau (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: Data storytelling is one of the most important skills in a knowledge economy. This course brings together key concepts, allowing participants to work with various datasets and create compelling visual narratives.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Put into practice the framework of data storytelling by crafting compelling visual narratives using Tableau
• Interpret complex datasets and identify key insights that can be effectively communicated through visual storytelling
• Utilise critical thinking skills to evaluate the implications of data and make informed decisions in the storytelling process

course_title: Workplace Creative Problem Solving (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Workplace Creative Problem Solving (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The purpose of this course is equip participants with the ability to  • Evaluate personal and workplace barriers to creativity  • Describe key creativity theories and concepts  • Outline stages and components of the Creative Problem Solving technique • Implement the use of different creativity techniques • Recommend strategies to foster creativity • Solve workplace problems using the Creative Problem Solving technique
course_learning_outcomes:
The World Economic Forum’s 2020 Future of Jobs report lists “Creativity”, “Innovation”, and “Complex Problem-Solving” among its Top 5 skills for 2025. Yet, if you were to start typing “Singapore” and “creativity” in Google, Google will likely make the following search suggestions: “Singapore lacks creativity”, “Singapore education creativity”, and “Singapore students lack creativity”. Clearly, creativity is crucial for the future of work and we can definitely be more creative. 

This 2-day course is applied, scientifically-valid, and focused on leaving you with the ability to successfully engage in creative problem-solving independently.
course_entry_req: Need to have basic knowledge of problem solving

course_title: Essential Workplace Health and Nursing Practices HC
course_title_cleaned: Essential Workplace Health and Nursing Practices HC
course_objective: Course Objective The objective of the course is to equip learners with the skills and knowledge to understand the various issues that accompany ageing which includes Geriatric syndrome, medication and fall risk, mobility and nutrition issues; and the relevant support and skills training techniques for transfer and position, infection prevention and control, perineal and catheter care, health monitoring, escort services and suitable exercises to enable them to age well in the community.  This course is administered by Hua Mei Training Academy, an initiative of Tsao Foundation.
course_learning_outcomes:
Course Structure
There are seven (7) learning units (LUs) in this course. 
LU1: Explain Geriatric Syndromes and the different aspects of ADLs and nursing care.
LU2: Discuss common factors on fall risks, effective techniques for transfer and positioning, and the different types of mobility aids suitable for the older person.
LU3: Understand the impact of effective monitoring of health and medication for the older person.
LU4: Understand the importance of nutritional needs and exercises required to support the older person in successful ageing. 
LU5: Understand Elimination Management (constipation care) in the care of older person.
LU6: Discuss Infection Prevention/Control and safe practices especially in the provision of perineal and catheter care for older person who are unable to provide self-care.
LU7: Understand the different aspects of handling emergency crisis and escorts for older persons.
course_entry_req:
Those who are 21 years old and above with at least 3 years of working experience in any industry. The required skills and knowledge for this course are as follows: 

●	Education: 
●	be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 4
●	be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 4
●	be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System (ESS) Numeracy Level 4
●	have basic languages / dialects relevant to the target client group.
●	Have prior working experience with older adults will be an added advantage
●	Be motivated to learn and have positive attitude towards work and commitments. 
●	Have interest in community and social work.

Required years of experience in relevant Domain
-	No prior experience required.

course_title: Business Insights - Part of Post Diploma Certificate in Visualisation and Analytics (SDBD(IA))
course_title_cleaned: Business Insights - Part of Post Diploma Certificate in Visualisation and Analytics (SDBD(IA))
course_objective: This course aims to equip learners seeking to enhance their analytics skills and optimise business processes with minimal programming to help businesses automate their business processes and speed up their decision making. Learners  will learn to use design thinking methods to find bottlenecks through business process analyses and to suggest ways to optimise them through intelligent automation techniques.  Only working knowledge of Microsoft Excel is needed. No prior programming knowledge is required.  This course shares the common Post-Diploma Cert (PDC) in Visualisation and Analytics with the Specialist Diploma in Business Digitalisation (Analytics) (SDBD(A))
course_learning_outcomes: This module aims to equip students with fundamental concepts of Data Visualisation for Business to develop interactive management dashboards for decision making. This involves applying best dashboard design principles, data story-telling techniques as well as insight gathering techniques. Learners will learn how to organise data, perform data preparation, develop interactive dashboards, design data story-telling reports and automate repetitive tasks.
course_entry_req: A recognised local Polytechnic Diploma or Degree (with English as the medium of instruction) in the business, engineering, technology or any other disciplines with at least one (1) year of relevant work experience in data analysis.

course_title: BA (HONS) DESIGN FOR SOCIAL FUTURES
course_title_cleaned: BA (HONS) DESIGN FOR SOCIAL FUTURES
course_objective: Creative leadership: Become a moving and leading part of the industry as you evolve from one module to the next until you graduate.   Real-life design briefs: Participate in real-life design briefs proposed by agencies, services, healthcare and learning institutions, and social and sustainable companies and learn by making and becoming an agent of change.   Innovative learning and practice: Engage in a community of designers, students and academics who participate in multidisciplinary fields of design practice and theory.  Active network: Besides professional and learning opportunities, you get access to a community of professionals and a strong alumni network after graduation.
course_learning_outcomes:
The aim of the BA (Hons) Design for Social Futures programme is to foster a learning environment for you to gain flexibility – from leadership to co-creation and collaboration, and adapt quickly to challenges faced by today’s society. Challenges where design thinking, innovation and value creation are key to unlocking opportunities for all economic sectors of society, especially in the non-design sectors. 

The programme is rooted in areas such as service design, user interface and user-experience design, information and data, social design, transformative systems, speculative and strategic designs, as well as digital content and narrative design and environments. 

From working in big tech to social enterprises, independent ventures to co-creation endeavours, you will be able to adapt to your environment and respond to evolving societal constraints within and beyond, and imagine new potentialities for society. Designed to respond to emerging developments in design and non-design sectors, the programme brings together three major centres: design, industries and enterprise, and cultures and community.

The curriculum focuses on design practice with solutions prioritising human and non-human perspectives, realities and experiences. You will be  encouraged to ask valid, significant and complex questions, using an innovative pedagogical approach to mediate between past and future, global and local, traditions and contemporaries. 

The programme presents content to reflect the changing global and ecological climate and emerging trends through a dynamic and idea-driven learning environment, while addressing the influence of design practice on society in broad areas such as Creative Resets, Creative and Creator Communities, Health, Well-being and Care and Sustainability, Circularity and Regeneration.

For more information, please visit our website.
course_entry_req:
The qualifications listed below are common entry qualifications submitted by applicants. 
- Singapore-Cambridge GCE �A� level with minimum �Pass� in two subjects at A-Level/H2 Level and General Paper 
- Local Polytechnic Diploma 
- International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma 

For more information, please visit our website.

course_title: MA DESIGN
course_title_cleaned: MA DESIGN
course_objective: Professional development: Learn to push your own capacities through interdisciplinary and research practices.  Design studio culture: Our strong making-learning culture enables you to be part of a community of artists, designers, scholars and professionals.  Learning community: Gain access to activities planned just for our MA students.  Professional network and strong alumni: Gain the knowledge and contacts you  need to succeed in the industry.
course_learning_outcomes:
MA Design is a research-led practice programme that challenges current conventions of thinking, making and communicating. 

The design field is increasingly positioned at the forefront of innovative and new possibilities for humanity in a fast-changing world. As technologies progress, societies must evolve for communities to reimagine themselves. Design professionals are positioned to create solutions, preserving the values and thinking behind them in response to constrained resources and diverse needs. The programme encourages students to explore the impossible, question design principles and propose new solutions. 

The programme provides an independent and interdisciplinary learning environment for you to experiment and play. You will be part of a new generation of research-based creators, innovators and inventors engaged in design research and practice through critical analysis, collaborative engagement and intellectual argument. 

You will be encouraged to explore complex research themes and topics through contextual modules, design methodologies and interdisciplinary design labs. Artistic, design and industry experts will provoke your critical thinking to identify problems and formulate solutions, increasing your agility to perform across the roles of thinker, researcher, strategist and innovator. 

The programme seeks to challenge those who want to be challenged to break out of conventional sociocultural and design thinking practices to mould new ways of imagining the world that is inspirational, applicable and communicable.

For more information, please visit our website.
course_entry_req:
The qualifications listed below are academic requirements for applicants. 
- A bachelor�s degree from a recognised local or international institution. 
- A minimum of IELTS Academic 7.0, TOEFL iBT 100 or PTE Academic 65 for applicants from countries where English is not the first language or whose qualifications are obtained from institutions where English is not the medium of instruction. 

For the complete entry requirements, please visit our website.
full_course_desc:
# course provider
LASALLE COLLEGE OF THE ARTS

# course title
MA DESIGN

# course url
/content/portal/en/training-exchange/course-directory/course-detail.html?courseReferenceNumber=TGS-2017504664

# course duration
More than 1 year

# course mode of training
Full Time and Part Time

# full course fee
$31,500.00

# course number of hours
1800.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
Professional development: Learn to push your own capacities through interdisciplinary and research practices.  Design studio culture: Our strong making-learning culture enables you to be part of a community of artists, designers, scholars and professionals.  Learning community: Gain access to activities planned just for our MA students.  Professional network and strong alumni: Gain the knowledge and contacts you  need to succeed in the industry.

# course learning outcomes
MA Design is a research-led practice programme that challenges current conventions of thinking, making and communicating. 

The design field is increasingly positioned at the forefront of innovative and new possibilities for humanity in a fast-changing world. As technologies progress, societies must evolve for communities to reimagine themselves. Design professionals are positioned to create solutions, preserving the values and thinking behind them in response to constrained resources and diverse needs. The programme encourages students to explore the impossible, question design principles and propose new solutions. 

The programme provides an independent and interdisciplinary learning environment for you to experiment and play. You will be part of a new generation of research-based creators, innovators and inventors engaged in design research and practice through critical analysis, collaborative engagement and intellectual argument. 

You will be encouraged to explore complex research themes and topics through contextual modules, design methodologies and interdisciplinary design labs. Artistic, design and industry experts will provoke your critical thinking to identify problems and formulate solutions, increasing your agility to perform across the roles of thinker, researcher, strategist and innovator. 

The programme seeks to challenge those who want to be challenged to break out of conventional sociocultural and design thinking practices to mould new ways of imagining the world that is inspirational, applicable and communicable.

For more information, please visit our website.

# course entry req
The qualifications listed below are academic requirements for applicants. 
- A bachelor�s degree from a recognised local or international institution. 
- A minimum of IELTS Academic 7.0, TOEFL iBT 100 or PTE Academic 65 for applicants from countries where English is not the first language or whose qualifications are obtained from institutions where English is not the medium of instruction. 

For the complete entry requirements, please visit our website.

course_title: The Steward Leadership Advantage
course_title_cleaned: The Steward Leadership Advantage
course_objective: A highly interactive developmental experience for aspiring steward leaders who want to create a better world and thrive personally at the same time.
course_learning_outcomes:
Although technological advancements have led to life-changing innovation in recent years, the first two decades of the 21st century have already witnessed two global recessions, socio-political strife, severe resource/income inequality, and massive environmental degradation. We live in times where exciting growth opportunities coexist with existential threats to current and future generations.
Can businesses fully exploit the growth opportunities and sustain their success without addressing the challenges? Will traditional models of leadership, management and governance be adequate to ensure long-term profitability and growth in an increasingly connected and transparent world? As some companies have learned the hard way recently, the answer to both questions is a BIG NO. In today’s brave new world, we need brave new thinking that creates a WIN-WIN-WIN scenario wherein individuals, organisations, and humanity at large can thrive together. In short, we need a whole new model. One that embraces steward leadership.
course_entry_req: Nil

As some companies have learned the hard way recently, the answer to both questions is a BIG NO. In short, we need a whole new model. One that embraces steward leadership.

course_title: MLC - Living Well Matters : Embracing Work Life Harmony
course_title_cleaned: MLC - Living Well Matters   Embracing Work Life Harmony
course_objective: This micro-learning online course will help you in living well by focusing on key areas of life that matters. It provides practical knowledge and skills on how to achieve harmony in four domains of life namely self, home, work and community. Through interactive teaching using case scenarios and sharing of personal stories, you will be empowered to explore options to assess your current state of the four domains, set goals for change and manage these changes to achieve a greater harmony among the domains, leading towards a more meaningful life.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, you will be able to: 
(1) Understand the four domains of life namely self, home, work and community 
(2) Explain the elements of Harmony Model (3) Apply the Harmony model into daily life

course_title: Create Positive Stakeholder Relationships
course_title_cleaned: Create Positive Stakeholder Relationships
course_objective: This course focuses on equipping senior and junior managers and directors with strategies to engage and manage stakeholders (in general) to enhance work efficiency and collaboration opportunities so that to escalate business performance for organizations. This academic course is designed to equip learners to: •	Develop Create Positive Stakeholder Relationships Strategy •	Facilitate Discussion and Negotiations •	Becoming a Trusted Advisor This course is administered by HMTA, an initiative of Tsao Foundation.
course_learning_outcomes:
There are two (2) learning units (LUs) in this course. 
•	LU1 Create Positive Stakeholder Relationships 
•	LU2 Stakeholder Impact Analysis
course_entry_req:
Our target audience are those who are 40 years old and above with at least 3 years of working experience in any industry. The required skills and knowledge for this course are as follows: 
• Minimum GCE A’ Level / Diploma and/or able to read, write, listen and speak of English to a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5; and count to a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 5 
• Able to operate a personal desktop computer / laptop with Level 2 basic computing and applications skills 
• Be motivated to learn and have positive attitude towards work and commitments. 
• Have interest in community and social works.

course_title: Jazz Dance for Adult (Beginners)
course_title_cleaned: Jazz Dance for Adult (Beginners)
course_objective: This is a fun and energetic class that builds jazz dance techniques, starting from foundational basics before advancing into jazz dancing with freedom and confidence.  Classes progress weekly, and will provide you with approaches and techniques that build your core strength, posture, flexibility and musicality. Each session starts at the barre, focusing on alignment and strength, before movement across the floor. Every class ends with a short choreographed piece.  By the end of the course, students should be able to do grand battements, pirouettes and travelling combos.
course_learning_outcomes: For more information, please visit https://www.lasalle.edu.sg/continuing-education

•	Minimum GCE A’ Level / Diploma and/or able to read, write, listen and speak of English to a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5; and count to a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 5 
•	Able to operate a personal desktop computer / laptop with Level 2 basic computing and applications skills 
•	Be motivated to learn and have positive attitude towards work and commitments. 
•	Have interest in community and social work.

course_title: Digital Twin for Supply Chains
course_title_cleaned: Digital Twin for Supply Chains
course_objective: Demonstrate the understanding of digital twin concept and applications in supply chains. Analyse the inputs and outputs of digital models. Examine various digital model scenarios and management of digital twin projects. Construct a digital twin for warehouse operations. Set up a digital twin for manufacturing and service operations. Design a digital twin for port operations and automation.
course_learning_outcomes: A digital twin is a virtual model of a process, product or service. Imagine a digital twin as the bridge that links the physical and digital world. LOG365 Digital Twin for Supply Chains equips students with the knowledge and digital skills to develop and apply digital twins to solve supply chain problems before they occur, minimise downtime and plan for the future. The course covers concepts, inputs and outputs, and techniques to set up the digital twin to mimic real-world situations as best as possible. We look at digital twin applications in areas that include warehouse, manufacturing and services, and port terminal operations in the supply chain. Lessons learned from the virtual world can be applied to the physical world to transform the supply chain.

course_title: Financial Markets
course_title_cleaned: Financial Markets
course_objective: Appraise the significance of financial markets, institutions and instruments Show how financial instruments are transacted Distinguish between traditional and virtual entities in financial markets Examine payment systems, financial markets in global transition and systems risk Use information technology to search effectively for financial markets information Demonstrate proficiency in writing about issues concerning financial markets
course_learning_outcomes: Financial markets facilitate the transfer of resources in a complex system comprising individuals and institutions. Problems related to the transfer of resources give rise to financial instruments. Recent developments in the financial markets due to information technology and the internet have given rise to virtual markets, institutions and instruments. FIN306 Financial Markets provides a basic understanding of the significance of financial markets in a world of digital economy and shifting global concerns.

course_title: Fixed Income and Derivative Securities
course_title_cleaned: Fixed Income and Derivative Securities
course_objective: Appraise the fundamentals of derivatives and their applications Value derivatives with pricing models and their variations Formulate strategies to hedge interest rate, currency, equity and other market risks Assess and identify the risks and returns associated with fixed income securities Compute value of fixed income securities and evaluate their risk and return Calculate value of fixed income securities with embedded options Use data technologies such as Excel or FactSet to create models for pricing and risk managing fixed income and derivative securities products effectively
course_learning_outcomes: Finance graduates are required to be well-grounded in the fundamentals of modern finance. Fixed income and derivative securities constitute an aspect of this knowledge base that equips students with the market and instrument knowledge as well as analytical and modelling methods for the pricing and hedging of these securities. FIN358 Fixed Income and Derivative Securities presents these instruments in a unified setting, thereby allowing for a streamlined approach which avoids redundancies at the level of the fundamentals and which admits synergistic comparisons at the level of applications. A broad range of topics covering basic concepts behind fixed income and derivative securities, pricing and hedging methods, modelling methods, the put-call parity, the yield curves, as well as strategies in hedging and structuring financial products are included in the treatment.

course_title: Impact Investing and Green Finance
course_title_cleaned: Impact Investing and Green Finance
course_objective: Prepare an investment policy statement for clients Compute portfolio risk and return estimates Appraise and appreciate the role of asset allocation in portfolio management Compare the role of investing decisions using portfolio concepts Distinguish between different types of ESG investments Analyse and evaluate an impact portfolio’s risk, performance and trade-offs Propose suitable portfolio for an investor, integrating sustainability factors Construct an optimised portfolio using spreadsheet software
course_learning_outcomes: FIN354 Impact Investing and Green Finance introduces the process of portfolio management with an emphasis on impact investing and green finance. Increasingly, asset managers are focusing on impact investing, which refers to creating environmental, social, and governance impact through their investment decisions. In FIN354 Impact Investing and Green Finance, students will learn how to craft an investment policy statement for the socially responsible client. They will also learn how socially responsible investing can be integrated into the portfolio construction process, including investments in instruments such as green and social impact bonds. Finally, methods to measure and manage risk, especially of stranded assets, and to evaluate the performance of an impact portfolio will be discussed.

course_learning_outcomes:

• Building a validation protocol
• Performance parameters:
  o Selectivity/specificity 
  o Precision
  o Bias
  o Linearity and working range
  o Limit of detection
  o Limit of quantification
  o Robustness
  o Ruggedness
• Using validation data to evaluate measurement uncertainty
• Verification of standard methods
• Documentation and report
• Worked examples and exercises

course_title: Reminiscence Arts and Aged Care
course_title_cleaned: Reminiscence Arts and Aged Care
course_objective: Examine the use of reminiscence arts activities for senior Appraise the theory, principles and application of using reminiscence arts in aged care Examine the benefits of reminiscence methods Design activities that can be used in reminiscence for senior Experiment reminiscence activities in a life course approach Relate reminiscence products for senior
course_learning_outcomes: Reminiscence is a way to recapture the past and connect to the present's daily lives. It involves not only the discussion of memories and experiences with other people using tangible prompts such as photographs, objects, music, art, but also involves the re-enactment of past events to trigger their half-forgotten memories to bring about joy and laughter. Reminiscence is an effective way to engage with senior and their family members. It can stimulate verbal and non-verbal communication, promote confidence and self-esteem for those who participated in the activity, especially person with dementia. GER402 Reminiscence Arts and Aged Care has an experiential element to equip students with necessary skills and methods to engage senior through a series of reminiscence activities. Students will also have hand-on experiences to design and practice different principles, skills and knowledge related to Reminiscence arts.

course_title: Sociology of Education
course_title_cleaned: Sociology of Education
course_objective: Discuss the major sociological approaches to education Analyse the relationship of education to other social institutions such as the family, government, religion, and the economy Examine how students’ background characteristics shape their educational opportunities and outcomes Apply course material to the analysis of educational policies, practices, and reform Evaluate evidence bearing on the relation between facts and theoretical perspectives on education Demonstrate communication skills in written and spoken expression
course_learning_outcomes: SOC313 Sociology of Education will examine the relationships between education and society by reviewing a variety of theoretical perspectives and empirical studies. Topics include selected aspects of school organisation (tracking/streaming, class size, special education), social and cultural reproduction, the effect of social class on schooling outcomes, knowledge production, teaching as a profession, higher education, and globalisation and education.

course_title: User Centred Design for Interactive Systems
course_title_cleaned: User Centred Design for Interactive Systems
course_objective: Describe what interaction design is and how to conceptualize interaction. Explain what cognition is and why it is important for interaction design. Illustrate how different data gathering techniques are used for requirements analysis. Evaluate appropriateness of interface types and models and design concepts. Use of design principles and usability guidelines in user centred design. Apply appropriate methods of systems evaluation.
course_learning_outcomes: This course equips students with the fundamental principles of designing systems that takes into consideration the cognitive capabilities and limitations of people, as well as their physical and emotional needs. The course covers the more traditional concepts of human-computer interaction, such as requirement analysis, usability design principles guidelines and user evaluation methods, as well as contemporary issues in user centred design such as emotion and persuasive design and user experience design. Students are equipped with knowledge and skills to deal with issues, topics, and methods in designing interactive systems that supports human activity at work and play.

course_title: WSQ Capstone Project-Business Analytics (SF) (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Capstone Project-Business Analytics (SF) (Classroom, Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The "Capstone Project - Business Analytics" module serves as the culmination of the learners' knowledge and skills in the field of business analytics. Through a series of learning units, Learners will acquire the necessary expertise in various aspects of the project lifecycle. They will learn how to effectively propose and plan a business analytics project, acquire and transform relevant data, perform data modelling and analysis, prepare interactive dashboards with filtering capabilities, and ensure data sharing, collaboration, and security. Building upon the knowledge and skills gained from the learning units, learners will have the opportunity to apply their expertise in a practical setting through a comprehensive Power BI project. This project will encompass the entire data analytics process, including data acquisition, preparation, visualization, modelling, and dashboard creation. By leveraging Power BI's capabilities, learners will demonstrate their ability to analyze data, transform it into meaningful insights, develop visually appealing reports and visualizations, create efficient data models, and design interactive dashboards that allow for data filtering. Additionally, the project will emphasize the importance of data sharing, collaboration, and security, ensuring that learners develop the necessary skills to handle sensitive data and work effectively in team settings. Upon completion of the "Capstone Project - Business Analytics" module, learners will emerge with a deep understanding of the end-to-end project lifecycle in business analytics. They will possess the knowledge and skills required to successfully propose, plan, and execute a business analytics project using Power BI. Furthermore, learners will develop the ability to apply data analytics techniques, collaborate effectively, and ensure data security throughout the project. By demonstrating their proficiency in implementing a comprehensive Power BI project, learners will showcase their readiness
course_learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to  target the audience who would like to gain data analytics solution implementation  skills . Duration of this course is 60.5 hours. This is delivered in blended mode 
The learners will gain the following skills outcomes at the end of this course 
1.	Gain proficiency in developing comprehensive project plans for end-to-end data analytics projects, covering processes from data acquisition to dashboard creation.
2.	Develop advanced skills in utilizing Power BI's features to analyze diverse datasets and present insights effectively through visualizations and reports.
3.	Acquire expertise in constructing efficient data models within Power BI, organizing complex datasets for streamlined analysis.
4.	Master the art of designing interactive dashboards with advanced filtering options, creating dynamic tools for user-friendly data exploration.
5.	Learn to implement secure data sharing practices and ethical handling of sensitive information, ensuring project-wide data integrity and security.
course_entry_req:
Academic Qualification - Minimum one credit in O level 
Experience - Should have minimum 1 year experience in any field

1.  Candidates should have a recognised university degree or polytechnic diploma in engineering or science or other relevant disciplines.

The admission requirements for public intake are:
1.  Candidates should have a recognised university degree or polytechnic diploma in engineering or science or other relevant disciplines.
2.  Candidates with degrees or diplomas in other (non-relevant) disciplines, who have relevant work experience (RWE) will be considered.
3.  applicants who do not meet the above entry requirements may be considered based on Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) with evidence of at least 5 yeas of RWE; or supporting evidence of competency readiness.  Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or entrance test(s).  The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

course_title: (ACECCE-E) Numeracy Development in Children
course_title_cleaned: (ACECCE-E) Numeracy Development in Children
course_objective: Numeracy is an integral part of everyday life and it is crucial that children develop knowledge and skills to function successfully in life. Children need to be taught the necessary concepts and processes to become problem solvers. The role of a teacher is to facilitate the learning of numeracy by providing the appropriate support and guidance for individual children. In this module, important numeracy processes will be highlighted. Planning, implementing and evaluation of activities, and providing materials that supports numerate thinking will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the module, participants should have:

1. The ability to understand:
▪ How young children develop mathematical understandings, abilities and attitudes
▪ The importance and role of play, language and materials in the acquisition of mathematical learning in young children
▪ Approaches and strategies to support young children’s learning of number, concepts and problem-solving
▪ Core values of early childhood education as outlined in the NEL Framework
▪ Strategies to design and implement classroom activities and programmes that inculcate the core values of early childhood education

2. The ability to:
▪ Plan and implement child-centric math activities that inculcate the core values of early childhood education

3. The ability to:
▪ Contribute to the planning and implementation of child-centric math activities and programmes that inculcate the core values of early childhood education
course_entry_req:
Applicants should have:
a. 3 GCE ‘O’ level credits including a grade C6 in GCE ‘O’ level English Language OR Any English Language Acceptable Alternatives
OR
b. 10 years of formal education and passed state exam with credits in 3 different subjects including a credit at least C6 in EL1 or any English Language Acceptable Alternatives

course_objective: On completion of the module, students should be able to install and configure operating system (OS) and application software on end user computing devices. In addition, they should also be able to perform OS maintenance and troubleshooting.
course_learning_outcomes:
On completion of the module, students should be able to install and configure operating system (OS) and application software on end user computing devices. In addition, they should also be able to perform OS maintenance and troubleshooting.

Operating System Essentials (SN33002FP) is one of the modules leading to:

1) Higher Nitec in Technology - IT Systems & Networks (Enhanced Curricular Structure)
2) Higher Nitec in Technology - Business Information Systems (Enhanced Curricular Structure)
3) Higher Nitec in Technology - Cyber & Network Security (Enhanced Curricular Structure)

Nitec qualifications (Technical Skills); or
Workplace Literacy & Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5 in Speaking, Listening, Reading, Writing and Numeracy, and one year relevant work experience; or
Completed four Foundation modules

Workplace Literacy & Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5 in Speaking and Listening, and Level 4 in Reading and Numeracy.

course_title: CoC in Essentials of Security Assessment and Testing
course_title_cleaned: CoC in Essentials of Security Assessment and Testing
course_objective: This course aims to equip participants with the knowledge and practical skills needed to assess and strengthen their organisation's security posture. Participants will gain an understanding of the most common techniques used to test systems, and the associated remediation steps. Participants will also learn various security assessment techniques, such as vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, and security audits, to identify weaknesses and vulnerabilities. Through hands-on exercises, real-world simulations, and case studies, participants will gain valuable insights into designing and implementing robust security testing strategies to protect against cyber threats effectively.
course_learning_outcomes:
Topics covered:
•	Application and usage of basic vulnerability assessment tools and tests
•	General process and technical requirements of penetration testing
•	System security vulnerabilities and threats
•	Internal and external security standards
•	Identification of weaknesses and vulnerabilities
•	Exploitation techniques and post exploitation remediation
•	Security Audit and Compliance
•	Incident Response and Handling
course_entry_req:
It is recommended for participants to:
•	Be experienced working in Information Technology industry 
•	Be familiar with data protection and privacy policies 
•	Be familiar with data lifecycle

course_title: (ACECCE) Apply Understanding of How Children (Birth to Age 8) Learn and Develop (Beginning Pre-school Teacher)
course_title_cleaned: (ACECCE) Apply Understanding of How Children (Birth to Age 8) Learn and Develop (Beginning Pre-school Teacher)
course_objective: This module covers theories of child development and developmental sequences of children from infancy through the preschool years for early childhood educators. Emphasis is on characteristics of physical/motor, social, emotional, and cognitive/language development and appropriate experiences for children as well as the influence of the family and community.   Students will learn to apply contemporary theories and literature to support the growth, wellbeing, learning and development of each child. They will also acquire the ability to guide and adapt teaching and learning practice by applying understanding of developmental stages of children birth to 8 and acknowledging that all children have different strengths and learning abilities. This module also explores the importance of play development in young children and its relationship to learning.
course_learning_outcomes:
At the end of the module, participants should have:

1. The ability to understand:
a. Developmental theories
b. Different areas of children’s growth and development
c. Expected milestones (developmental stages) across different areas of children’s growth and development (0-8 years)
d. Factors that contribute to children’s growth, well-being, learning and development
e. Strengths-based views on the differences between typical and atypical development and learning (birth to age 8)
f. The relevant curriculum frameworks utilised in Singapore

2. The ability to:
a. Apply understanding of developmental stages of children birth to age 8 to guide practice
b. Apply understanding of contemporary theories and literature to support the growth, well-being, learning and development of each child
course_entry_req:
Applicants should have:
a. 3 GCE ‘O’ level credits including a grade C6 in GCE ‘O’ level English Language OR Any English Language Acceptable Alternatives
OR
b. 10 years of formal education and passed state exam with credits in 3 different subjects including a credit at least C6 in EL1 or any English Language Acceptable Alternatives

course_title: Foundation Knowledge for Effective Care Delivery (BGC)
course_title_cleaned: Foundation Knowledge for Effective Care Delivery (BGC)
course_objective: The Certificate in Basic Gerontological Counselling - Foundation Knowledge for Effective Care Delivery course is to enable learners who service clients in Community Care spaces like Senior Activity Centres / Active Aging Centres / Active Aging Centres (Care) and work with volunteers   This course is administered by Hua Mei Training Academy, an initiative of Tsao Foundation.
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, Learners will be able to:

1.	Explain the principles and concepts for effective care delivery to the older adult.
2.	Relate how ageing is affected by persons with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS) and delivery of effective care to older adults. 
3.	Apply the Person Centered Care (PCC) approach to help improve overall health outcomes of older adults.
4.	Understand the importance of mental health, financial and cultural issues and their implications in delivery of care to older adults.
course_entry_req:
Our target audience are those who are 21 years old and above with at least 2 years of working experience in any industry. The required skills and knowledge for this course are as follows:
 
Education: 
● be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 3 
● be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 3
● be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System (ESS) Numeracy Level 3 

● Have basic languages / dialects relevant to the target client group. 
● Have prior working experience with older adults will be an added advantage 
● Be motivated to learn and have positive attitude towards work and commitments. 
● Have interest in community and social work.
