course_title: Process Control Engineering
course_title_cleaned: Process Control Engineering
course_objective: This is a module under the Advanced Diploma in Process Control & Instrumentation.
course_learning_outcomes: Provides an integrated system approach to the understanding of behaviour of process control systems. Basic theoretical principles of automatic process control and to illustrate how these principles are used in modern industrial applications is presented.  Operation and behaviour of practical process control systems are emphasised. Topics include introduction to process control, process dynamics, dynamic behaviour of process control loops, controller characteristics, and multi-loop control. The topics in this course is generally targeted towards process industries such as petroleum, petrochemical, chemical, pulp & paper, mining, power, pharmaceutical & food processing.

course_objective: Landscape painting is regarded as the highest form of Chinese ink painting. For beginners, you may wish to join Chinese Ink Painting I and progress to levels II – XV.

For beginners, you may wish to join Chinese Ink Painting I and progress to levels II – XV.

# course learning outcomes
For more information, please visit https://www.lasalle.edu.sg/continuing-education

course_title_cleaned: Part-time Diploma in Business Practice (Logistics Management)

Apply fundamental purchasing principles in controlling inventory level and production planning. 4.	Demonstrate the use of information and automation systems to improve productivity in supply chain. 5.	Carry out basic specialised logistics tasks in cold chain and chemical logistics.

course_title: Specialist Diploma in Data Science (Vision & Language Analytics)
course_title_cleaned: Specialist Diploma in Data Science (Vision & Language Analytics)
course_objective: The Specialist Diploma in Data Science (Vision & Language Analytics), or NSDVA, aims to equip participants with the knowledge and skillset to analyse unstructured visual-textual data such as video, image, text, and language. The course aim remains the same as original proposal.  The course focuses on unstructured visual-textual data analysis for various industry applications. It equips data engineers, or participants in equivalent roles, with the knowledge and skills required to transition into new positions as Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer across a broad range of industries. The course includes the knowledge of data science fundamental in statistics and programming, as well as practical Artificial Intelligence (AI) skillsets in Computer Vision (CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
•	Understand the concepts of CV, NLP and the role of Generative AI in both.
•	Identify the tasks associated with CV and NLP.
•	Pre-process visual and textual data.
•	Develop machine learning or deep learning models for CV and NLP tasks.
•	Evaluate model performance and fine-tune parameters for performance improvement.
•	Apply their skills and knowledge in their professional environment.
course_entry_req:
Polytechnic Diploma/ University with Engineering or IT diploma/degree:
Applicants must have an Engineering/ IT diploma or degree from a recognized polytechnic*/ university** in Singapore

Polytechnic Diploma/ University with Maths requirement:
Applicants must have any other diploma or degree from a recognized polytechnic*/ university** in Singapore, and possess a Pass grade in either GCE ‘O’ level Mathematics or a Mathematics subject at diploma level.

Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL):
Applicants with relevant work experience in a data-related or analytical role will be considered on case-by-case basis, with consideration of supporting evidence of competency readiness. Suitable applicants who are shortlisted may have to go through an interview and/or entrance test. The Polytechnic reserves the right to shortlist and admit applicants.

* NYP, NP, RP, SP or TP
** NTU, NUS, SIT, SMU, SUSS or SUTD (Appl. with degrees from other universities are considered on a case-by-case)

course_title: Wilton Course 2 (Regular) - Royal Icing Essentials
course_title_cleaned: Wilton Course 2 (Regular) - Royal Icing Essentials
course_objective: Royal Icing Essentials is a course which you will learn core techniques to make a wide variety of flowers.  Throughout this course, the medium that will be taught will be royal icing.   This ideal medium allows us to create decorations in advance.  You’ll also learn how to design a professional-looking cake, from selecting the colours to arranging your flowers.  Your Wilton Method Certified Instructor will help you to learn:  1. Design the colour palette and pattern for the cake  2. Buttercream piping techniq+F13ues for the basket weave  3. Create 9 or more types of royal icing flowers and understand how to place them on your next cake project  4. Learn to pipe royal icing appliques to apply on cake design  5. Learn additional piping border designs to enhance your cake
course_learning_outcomes:
“Training Method: 
Day 1 (6 hours)
• Introduction 
• Basic Colour Principles
• Royal Icing vs Buttercream
• Making Royal Icing
• Review 3 Essentials of Wilton Method of Cake Decorating
• Tinting Icing
• Advanced Borders
• Rosebud
• Half Rose
• Check Students’ Icing 
• Royal Icing Appliques 
• How to use a Flower Nail
• Cherry Blossom
• Tulip
• Wilton Rose
• Water Lily

Day 2 (6 hours)
• Introduction 
• Check Students’ Icing 
• How to Use a Lily Nail
• Hibiscus, Lily, Poppy
• Piping Flowers in Batches
• Colour Effects on Royal Icing Flowers
• Principles of Floral Cake Design
• Brush Embroidery
• Reverse Shell 
• Rope 
• Classic Ruffle 
• Students Decorate Their Cakes 
• Wrap-up”

course_title: Politics of Environment in Southeast Asia
course_title_cleaned: Politics of Environment in Southeast Asia
course_objective: This course will examine the complexities of environmental issues in Southeast Asia. There is a need to unpack what really lies behind all sides of environmental problems. A political ecology approach will be used to examine the multiple layers of politics, money, power and neglect that lie behind these issues. We will travel across Southeast Asia, dive deep into its rich biodiversity and explore the extent of the environmental threats the region faces, as well as the plight of the people whose identity, lives and livelihoods depend wholly on the health of these highly endangered ecosystems.
course_learning_outcomes: This course will examine the complexities of environmental issues in Southeast Asia. There is a need to unpack what really lies behind all sides of environmental problems. course_title: Business Chinese Comprehensive (Beginner  Level 2) + BCT (Speaking) & (A)
course_title_cleaned: Business Chinese Comprehensive (Beginner  Level 2) + BCT (Speaking) & (A)
course_objective: The Business Chinese programme (a.k.a CWPL) is designed for anyone who is interested in communicating effectively in Chinese at business or workplace settings, and effectively understand business information written in Chinese.  This course leading to the International Business Chinese Test (BCT), is an internationally recognised certification awarded by the Centre for Language Education and Cooperation (affiliated with the Chinese Ministry of Education). An all-inclusive training to improve listening, speaking, reading and writing skills through thematic lessons surrounding daily and common workplace scenarios. Participate in activities that are specially catered to you make use of the skills learnt in class, which also help to boost your confidence in using Chinese in informal situations. Expand your network, and connect with people from different backgrounds and professions.
course_learning_outcomes:
For all-rounded learning of the above skills and content, namely in Listening & Speaking, Reading & Writing.
This course will expand on the skills learned in Level 1.2.
Master the Chinese Phonetics and learn the writing of basic Chinese characters at Beginner Levels.
Learn how to make a sound conversation.
Learn how to describe topics of daily work, life or social contact and express personal ideas and demand.
Understand and master the writing of basic Chinese characters and strokes.
Improve awareness of language use, in terms of accuracy, fluency and appropriateness.
course_entry_req: Applicants with prior knowledge of Chinese, are required to take a pre-course placement test (or using BCT results as a form of course enrolment) before enrolment.

course_title: Engineering Data Analytics
course_title_cleaned: Engineering Data Analytics
course_objective: The proposed WSP-DEERT aims to train fresh ITE graduates as well as in-service staff with NITEC or Higher NITEC qualification to become the next generation of rail engineering professionals with the necessary skills and knowledge to meet the manpower needs of Singapore’s growing rail network of 360 km by 2030. It also aims to provide Institute of Technical Education (ITE) engineering graduates another career progression pathway by acquiring a diploma qualification while continuing to be in the workforce, thereby retaining them in the sector, and mitigating manpower shortage faced by employers.
course_learning_outcomes: The SkillsFuture Work-Study Programme (WSP) offers valuable opportunities for individuals to deepen their skills in the chosen field as they enter the workforce. The School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering (EEE) is proposing WSP Part-time Diploma in Engineering (Electrical-Rapid Transit Technology), WSP-DEERT.
course_entry_req:
a)	Applicants must not suffer from serious colour appreciation deficiency.
b)	The applicant shall be an ITE Nitec with GPA ≥ 2.0 or a Higher Nitec graduate in an engineering or information technology discipline.
c)	The applicant can be an in-service employee^ from the participating WSP companies, OR
d)	The applicant can be an ITE Nitec or Higher Nitec fresh graduate within 5 years of graduation or within 5 years from his last day of National Service (ORD).
e)	Applicant (in-service employee^ from the participating WSP company) with a minimum diploma qualification in other engineering fields will be considered on a case-by-case basis, and may be subjected to interviews or tests before they can be considered for enrolment.
f)	Applicants (in-service employee from the participating WSP company) who do not meet the MER may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness.

e)	Applicant (in-service employee^ from the participating WSP company) with a minimum diploma qualification in other engineering fields will be considered on a case-by-case basis, and may be subjected to interviews or tests before they can be considered for enrolment.
f)	Applicants (in-service employee from the participating WSP company) who do not meet the MER may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 5 years of relevant working experience or supporting evidence of competency readiness.

course_learning_outcomes: The aim of the course is to equip the professionals, managers and executives (PMEs) who are currently working or those intending to make a career switch to the Retail industry, with in depth knowledge and skills to design communications channel management plans align with brand and marketing activities, identify, select and manage distribution channel structures, as well as evaluate and communicate the effectiveness of communication channels to relevant stakeholders.

course_title: Content Creation (MC3 in Diploma in Design (Digital Commerce & Experience))
course_title_cleaned: Content Creation (MC3 in Diploma in Design (Digital Commerce & Experience))
course_objective: Upon graduating from the course, graduates should be able to: - gain the knowledge of fundamental design principles, new trends and techniques of graphic design in the digital world of commerce; - propose a user-centred solution for a digital product or service; - design digital interface or presentation with appropriate styles and graphic treatment; - create an engaging digital experience for the consumers through content strategies across multiple channels and touchpoints; and - innovate new digital products, service or solutions that shape consumers’ future experiences in digital commerce.
course_learning_outcomes: The acceleration of digital transformation in businesses presents job opportunities for the future of digital commerce and online experiences. Whether it is food & beverage, telehealth, virtual government services, virtual events, remote work, or online learning, nearly all sectors are being transformed by digital commerce and experience. The aim of the course is to equip participants to gain knowledge and skills in design, with emphasis in the areas of UX/UI, innovation, social media and digital experiences to support the drive for business digitalisation and e-commerce.

GPA ≥3.5 and 1 year of relevant working experience OR                                                                     
-WSQ Qualification
Relevant WSQ Qualification with 3 year of relevant working experience and WSQ Workplace Literary Statement of Attainment (SOA) (Level 6) AND Workplace Numeracy Statement of Attainment (SOA) (Level 6)

course_title: Pharmacotherapeutics
course_title_cleaned: Pharmacotherapeutics
course_objective: The Diploma in Applied Science (Pharmaceutical Sciences) provides opportunities for participants to deepen their skills and knowledge needed for a career in the healthcare and biopharmaceutical manufacturing industries.
course_learning_outcomes: This module will cover basic pharmacotherapy of common ailments and conditions (e.g. cough and cold, nausea and vomiting, constipation and diarrhea, etc.) encountered in primary healthcare settings. Students will acquire skills and knowledge on current concepts regarding appropriate over-the-counter (OTC) drug treatment, drug information search and interpretation, and information provision on therapeutics and general health products. Students will develop patient assessment and related skills in the provision of patient care and education, and learn to apply pharmacotherapy knowledge in practical settings.
course_entry_req:
‘O’ Levels: At least 3 ‘O’ Level passes in the following subjects
- English Language (EL1 or EL2) Grade 1 – 7
- Any Science subject Grade 1 – 6
- Any 1 relevant subject subject Grade 1 – 6
- And at least 1 year relevant work experience

Higher Nitec: GPA ≥ 2.0 OR GPA ≥ 1.5 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Nitec: GPA ≥ 3.5 OR GPA ≥ 3.0 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Higher Nitec in Technology/Services: GPA ≥ 2.0 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Nitec in Technology/Services: GPA ≥ 3.5 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

WSQ: Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) AND at least 1 year relevant work experience AND Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA

Do not possess any of the above qualifications: Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 2 years of relevant working experience.

course_title: Pharmacotherapeutics II
course_title_cleaned: Pharmacotherapeutics II
course_objective: The Diploma in Applied Science (Pharmaceutical Sciences) provides opportunities for participants to deepen their skills and knowledge needed for a career in the healthcare and biopharmaceutical manufacturing industries.
course_learning_outcomes: This module focusses on pharmacotherapy of common chronic diseases (e.g. asthma, diabetes, hypertension and psychiatric disorders etc.). The module will also cover skills related to patient education so as to strengthen the chronic health management and continuity of care to improve patient outcomes.

WSQ: Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) AND at least 1 year relevant work experience AND Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA

Do not possess any of the above qualifications: Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 2 years of relevant working experience.

# course provider

# course url

# course mode of training
Part Time

# full course fee
$1,698.00

# subsidised course fee
$509.40

# course number of hours
60.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
The Diploma in Applied Science (Pharmaceutical Sciences) provides opportunities for participants to deepen their skills and knowledge needed for a career in the healthcare and biopharmaceutical manufacturing industries.   

# course learning outcomes
This module focusses on pharmacotherapy of common chronic diseases (e.g. asthma, diabetes, hypertension and psychiatric disorders etc.). The rationale use of therapeutic interventions and treatment plans to manage chronic disease progression will be explored. The module will also cover skills related to patient education so as to strengthen the chronic health management and continuity of care to improve patient outcomes.

# course entry req
‘O’ Levels: At least 3 ‘O’ Level passes in the following subjects
- English Language (EL1 or EL2) Grade 1 – 7
- Any Science subject Grade 1 – 6
- Any 1 relevant subject subject Grade 1 – 6
- And at least 1 year relevant work experience

Higher Nitec: GPA ≥ 2.0 OR GPA ≥ 1.5 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Nitec: GPA ≥ 3.5 OR GPA ≥ 3.0 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Higher Nitec in Technology/Services: GPA ≥ 2.0 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

Nitec in Technology/Services: GPA ≥ 3.5 AND at least 1 year relevant work experience

WSQ: Relevant WSQ Advanced Certificate (or higher) AND at least 1 year relevant work experience AND Level 6 WSQ Workplace Literacy SOA and Workplace Numeracy SOA

Do not possess any of the above qualifications: Applicants who do not meet the entry requirements may be considered for admission to the course based on evidence of at least 2 years of relevant working experience.

course_objective: By the end of this module, participants will be equipped with the expertise necessary to evaluate, propose and exercise best in class supply chain practices.  Participants will be able to: •	Identify and analyse the gaps and weaknesses in supply chain operations •	Develop measures to review and improve supply chain operations •	Evaluate the prevalent trends to enhance operational practices  •	Analyse logistics solutions that address customer needs  •	Propose solutions for different verticals
course_learning_outcomes:
This module covers the fundamentals of strategic design and effective management of global supply chain. The participants will learn about the best in class supply chain practices and design strategies being deployed in various industries. 
This module builds up participants’ knowledge of supply chain fundamentals by strengthening their ability to analyse the current practices and develop improvement alternatives. The participants will develop an understanding on strategies, techniques and best in class practices, which can be adopted to improve the operations in respective verticals.

course_title: Cell Biology (in MC in Biological Sciences in Part-time Diploma in Applied Science (Veterinary Technology))
course_title_cleaned: Cell Biology (in MC in Biological Sciences in Part-time Diploma in Applied Science (Veterinary Technology))
course_objective: This subject covers the biology of cells of higher organisms, including structure-function relationships of cellular membranes and internal organelles, cell cycle and nuclear division, transport mechanisms and cell communication, cell motility and the cytoskeleton and cell death. Basic laboratory skills involving the study of cell structures with the use of cell staining techniques and microscopy will also be introduced in this subject.
course_learning_outcomes: This course will provide participants with the knowledge and skills in veterinary science and technology for the improvement of animal welfare. As a diploma graduate, you will be able to perform tasks that include but are not limited to, handling and care of small animals and aquatic species, veterinary practice management, veterinary surgical nursing techniques and diagnostic laboratory procedures.

As a diploma graduate, you will be able to perform tasks that include but are not limited to, handling and care of small animals and aquatic species, veterinary practice management, veterinary surgical nursing techniques and diagnostic laboratory procedures.

course_title: Environmental Science (in MC in Sustainable Aquaculture and Environmental Sciences in Part-time Diploma in Applied Science (Aquaculture))
course_title_cleaned: Environmental Science (in MC in Sustainable Aquaculture and Environmental Sciences in Part-time Diploma in Applied Science (Aquaculture))
course_objective: In this course, you will learn the important aspects of Aquaculture, which include Feed Nutrition, Diseases Management, Hatchery Technology, and Aquaculture Systems, and many more! With the rapid expanding aquaculture production around the world, the insights gained here can improve aquaculture management so that seafood demand can be met in an environmentally and economically sustainable way.
course_learning_outcomes: This subject covers the study of patterns and processes in the natural world and their modification by human activities. Major environmental issues such as global climate system and climate change, and native issues relating to the environment in the context of aquaculture will be discussed. This subject will survey some key environmental science topics at an introductory level, and ultimately consider the sustainability of human activities.

course_title: SkillsFuture@PA Online Zero-Cost Book Publishing and Marketing
course_title_cleaned: SkillsFuture PA Online Zero-Cost Book Publishing and Marketing
course_objective: Traditionally, books can only be published through publishers. However, in today’s internet age, it is possible to self-publish books online. Further, there are online platforms which enable book publishing for free. During the first part of this course, the channels in which books can be published in today’s market will be discussed. It then introduces online platforms that can publish printed books and ebooks free of charge. There will be live demonstrations on how a printed book and an ebook are published on these platforms. It will also show the books on Amazon that have been published through these platforms.   In order to promote published books, it is necessary to carry out book marketing. During the second part of this course, the channels in which books can be marketed will be discussed. It then introduces online platforms that can promote and market published books free of charge. These platforms can be used in conjunction with the platforms that books are sold.
course_learning_outcomes:

It focuses on the major functional components in a supply chain and explains how they interact with one another in contributing to the success of a business organisation. The application of technology will also be emphasised, as technology is a key driver of business operations in the supply chain.

# course learning outcomes
The subject provides an overview of the relations between supply chain management and logistics management, and their impact on the success of organisations.

course_title: Archives and Knowledge of the Past
course_title_cleaned: Archives and Knowledge of the Past
course_objective: This course critically examines “the archive.” It explores the various ways in which the archive has been defined. It investigates why and how some knowledges about the past are collected, preserved, and recovered, and why and how some are not collected, preserved, and recovered. The class will also study the extent of the authority that the archive holds and wields over interpretations of the past.

course_title: Specialist Diploma in Building Information Modelling Management
course_title_cleaned: Specialist Diploma in Building Information Modelling Management
course_objective: The Course Objective of the two (2) courses, NSBM and NSBML, remain unchanged as per the approved Course Proposal in 2018 . The Course Objectives for students taking the two (2) courses, as extracted from the original approved 2018 Course Proposal, are: • To develop strategic skills for BIM project planning and implementation • To look forward to career advancement and Job Role opportunities as a BIM Specialist, Coordinator or Manager • To become the organisations’ BIM Strategist Planner for BIM adoption and BIM Execution Planner to BIM manage building projects during design and construction phases.  The Course Objective of both courses, NSBML & NSBM, are to boost the level of BIM competency skillsets and expertise in the BE industry of Singapore and deepen the BIM management skills and knowledge of the students to enhance their Job Role career progression in the company.  This is achieved through the institutional-based learning at SP conducted as part-time night classes for the adult learners over three nights per week.  The Course Objectives remain unchanged as they are still relevant to the current and future needs and demands of the BE industry in line with the BCA’s ITM initiatives and IDD aspirations.  The Course Objectives also align with BCA’s Integrated Planning and Design (IPD) initiative which states the following two (2) objectives:  a. Drive collaborations across value chain to enable better planning from the onset and optimise building design for downstream construction and maintenance. b. Create a conducive environment for collaboration and regulatory submissions through common data standards with a data-rich BIM model that is used across the project lifecycle.   Reference to link: https://www1.bca.gov.sg/buildsg/built-environment-industry-transformation-map
course_learning_outcomes:
NSBML and NSBM courses were conceived in 2018 in line with the aspirations of Building and Construction Authority’s (BCA) BuildSG initiative to encapsulate digital transformation of the Built Environment (BE) sector. Both courses were designed to respond to BCA’s Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM), of which Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD) is one of the key thrusts under the initiative to transform the AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction) industry sector to one that is BIM proficient and ready. IDD builds on the use of BIM and Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) to drive the needs of the BE industry from design to construction to asset management stages, covering four main areas:

a. Digital Design - To achieve design objectives through coordinated design to meet client’s, regulatory and downstream construction requirements.
b. Digital Construction - To achieve delivery, installation and monitoring of on-site construction activities to maximise productivity and minimise rework.
c. Digital Asset Delivery and Management - To achieve real-time monitoring of operations and maintenance to enhance asset values.
d. Digital Fabrication - To achieve translation of design to standardised components for automating off-site production.

The core curriculum structure and framework of both NSBM and NSBML courses are based mainly on the above IDD objectives in Digital Design and Digital Construction.

The core curriculum covers the following six (6) Modules:

• Module BE0401: BIM Fundamentals
• Module BE0402: BIM Standards & Implementation Strategies
• Module BE0403: BIM for Design Coordination & Documentation
• Module BE0404: BIM for Quality Assurance Checking, Design & Quantity Surveying Analysis
• Module BE0405: BIM for Construction Planning & Coordination
• Module BE0406: BIM Project
course_entry_req: The participant shall be a graduate of a relevant Architectural, Landscape Architectural, Civil & Structural Engineering, Electrical and Mechanical Engineering or other related diplomas, with prior BIM software knowledge, from any of the polytechnics in Singapore. Applicants with other equivalent qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

The Course Objective of both courses, NSBML & NSBM, are to boost the level of BIM competency skillsets and expertise in the BE industry of Singapore and deepen the BIM management skills and knowledge of the students to enhance their Job Role career progression in the company.  This is achieved through the institutional-based learning at SP conducted as part-time night classes for the adult learners over three nights per week. IDD builds on the use of BIM and Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) to drive the needs of the BE industry from design to construction to asset management stages, covering four main areas:

a. Digital Design - To achieve design objectives through coordinated design to meet client’s, regulatory and downstream construction requirements.
b. Digital Construction - To achieve delivery, installation and monitoring of on-site construction activities to maximise productivity and minimise rework.
c. Digital Asset Delivery and Management - To achieve real-time monitoring of operations and maintenance to enhance asset values.
d. Digital Fabrication - To achieve translation of design to standardised components for automating off-site production.

The core curriculum structure and framework of both NSBM and NSBML courses are based mainly on the above IDD objectives in Digital Design and Digital Construction.

course_title: Integrated Product Lifecycle Processes – Opportunities & Challenges (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_title_cleaned: Integrated Product Lifecycle Processes – Opportunities & Challenges (Synchronous E-Learning)
course_objective: The course aims to provide the learner with knowledge of how product lifecycle management (PLM) integrates data, processes, business systems and people in an extended enterprises.  It will also illustrate how this information is managed throughout the entire product lifecycle efficiently and cost-effectively: from ideation, design, and manufacture to service and disposal.
course_learning_outcomes: With industry undergoing digital transformation driven by smart technology and connected devices, digitalisation has been widely recognised as an important lever for performance improvements in manufacturing.  It has the potential to disrupt every part of the enterprise, including the back office and supply chain applications, R&D, factory automation, and more.  However, its implementation can typically be both broad and complex, and requires serious prioritisation to ensure that company business goals are properly supported.
course_entry_req: Have relevant experience in manufacturing and basic knowledge of how to prioritise digitalisation. Attending SP’s course on “Prioritizing Digitalization in Manufacturing for post COVID-19” is advised

course_title: Mobile Filmmaking (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Mobile Filmmaking (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Mobile Filmmaking is designed to introduce participants to the basics of creating effective short-form videos for social media and branding purposes. In today's digital landscape, videos play a crucial role in helping brands and businesses connect with their audiences. This course guides participants through the process of creating a simple 15-second brand video, providing practical techniques for in-house video production without the need for extensive equipment or prior experience. The course covers the entire video production process, from understanding the social media video landscape to hands-on exercises in pre-production, production, and post-production. Participants will learn to translate brand messages into compelling short-form content, apply basic filmmaking techniques, and edit their footage into polished branding videos. Topics Covered: •	The Social Media Video Landscape: An introduction to trends, formats, and content styles •	The 3Ps of Video Production: A step-by-step approach to Pre-production, Production, and Post-production •	Pre-production Exercise: Developing a script and storyboard for a 15-second branding video •	Production Exercise: Filming short video clips using mobile devices while applying key filmmaking techniques •	Post-production Exercise: Learning and applying basic editing techniques to create a finished video •	Screening & Review: Sharing work and receiving feedback
course_learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, participants will:
•	Gain a better understanding of the role of video in social media and branding
•	Explore ways to translate brand or campaign messages into short-form video content
•	Learn how to produce a 15-second brand video using basic filmmaking techniques
•	Plan videos effectively with pre-production techniques such as ideation, storyboarding, and scripting
•	Get hands-on experience in filming, covering camera work, lighting, and sound
•	Pick up basic editing skills to refine footage into a short branding video
course_entry_req: Nil

Through collaborative learning, real life case studies, project work, participants will be able to provide solutions to real life scenarios.
course_learning_outcomes: This course provides participants an understanding of the regulatory practices of Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing (MEP) services in Estate Management. Participants will gain an insight of the role of Estate Management’s regulatory compliance as an asset and the impact of sound Estate Management practices on the operational, safety, financial and sustainability performance of buildings. Topics include Environmental Public Health Regulations, Public Utilities Regulations, Code of Practice for Water Services/ sewerage and sanitary works, Sewerage and Drainage Regulations, Electricity (Electrical Installations) Regulations, Electricity (Electrical Workers) Regulations (Legislations for LEW) and Code of Practice for Infor- Communication Facilities (COPIF).

This course provides participants an understanding of the regulatory practices of Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing (MEP) services in Estate Management. Participants will gain an insight of the role of Estate Management’s regulatory compliance as an asset and the impact of sound Estate Management practices on the operational, safety, financial and sustainability performance of buildings. Topics include Environmental Public Health Regulations, Public Utilities Regulations, Code of Practice for Water Services/ sewerage and sanitary works, Sewerage and Drainage Regulations, Electricity (Electrical Installations) Regulations, Electricity (Electrical Workers) Regulations (Legislations for LEW) and Code of Practice for Infor- Communication Facilities (COPIF).


# course entry req
ITE or equivalent
Have 2-3 years of experience in the built environment

course_title: Fundamentals of Plant-Based Nutrition
course_title_cleaned: Fundamentals of Plant-Based Nutrition
course_objective: On completion of the workshops students will be able to: - Describe the benefits and limitations of plant vs animal protein - Explain how plant-based nutrition can help achieve better health and fitness - Help and support clients who are considering a plant-based lifestyle
course_learning_outcomes: An introduction to the fundamentals of plant-based nutrition for fitness. This course aims to address the common misconceptions about a plant-based diet, from how much protein you need, what micronutrients may be missing, to the relevance of food pairing. Whether it’s achieving lean muscle gain, improving digestion, boosting athletic performance (strength/endurance) or optimizing health, this course will provide participants with the fundamental principles of adopting and advocating a healthy plant-based diet.

course_title: Adopting Technology and Automation in the F&B Business (synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Adopting Technology and Automation in the F&B Business (synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This 1-day program is designed to help participants:   Understand the current operational constraints in the food sector   Understand how adopting technology and automation can alleviate those constraints   Learn measurement tools that can help in identifying critical areas for technology and automation adoption   Understand the different areas where technology and automation can be adopted   Understand the implications and process of adopting technology and automation
course_learning_outcomes:
With manpower constraints and a declining interest in locals applying for frontline jobs, businesses today struggle with scalability and expansion. This has prompted numerous organizations to adopt technology and embrace automation in their bid to remain productive, scalable, and sustainable. 

 

Problem is, technology and automation can be tricky to apply to an existing business and can sometimes be more disruptive than constructive. If you have ever wondered how to go about beginning your organization’s journey in adopting technology and automation, then this course will help you to discover that. After you complete the workshop, you will have greater insight into the ways to get started with technology and automation adoption.
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Using Augmented Reality (AR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Business and Training (synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Using Augmented Reality (AR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Business and Training (synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: This 1-day program is designed to help participants:   Understand the background and basics of AR and AI   Understand the business climate surrounding AR and AI today   Understand the different areas where AR and AI can be applied   Understand the scope of considerations in implementing AR and AI   Learn ways to engage their online communities through AR and AI   Gain first-hand experience on using AR and AI through an interactive learning journey
course_learning_outcomes:
AR and AI have been on the rise with more and more organizations making use of these technologies to attain new high levels of innovation, engagement, and productivity. 
 

While these technologies sound like a great way to move forward, many companies stumble when faced with the actual implementation of AR and AI. What platforms should I choose? Which parts of my business can I use it for? What are the areas of consideration? If those questions came to mind, then this course will help to bring you one step closer to implementing AR and AI to your organization. After the workshop, you would have been exposed to different applications of AR and AI, case studies from other implementations, as well as be equipped with the considerations needed to make your own implementation a success.
course_entry_req: Nil

course_title: Composite Repair Design with Practical Application
course_title_cleaned: Composite Repair Design with Practical Application
course_objective: This 2-day workshop will provide both theory and active hands-on practical workshop experience in understanding of advanced composites, rapid-prototyping, processes, layup and vacuum bagging techniques, repair considerations, additive manufacturing, adhesive bonding, tooling, and inspection methods and techniques used in Advanced Manufacturing. Advanced composites are gaining popularity as the choice material  in many industries, such as 3D printing, aerospace, marine, automotive, civil infrastructure, sporting equipment, magnetic testing, etc due to its high strength-to-weight ratio (weight saving), durability to corrosion and mechanical fatigue and design flexibility. Participants will learn the knowledge and essential hands-on skills to work with advanced composites across all engineering industries.
course_learning_outcomes: This short course will provide the general public with the essential knowledge on the construction and repair techniques and knowledge on advanced composites.

course_title: Essentials of Digital Marketing (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: Essentials of Digital Marketing (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: Essentials of Digital Marketing is a 1 ½ Day short course which will cover the absolute fundamentals of digital marketing. The course will uncover various tools within the digital marketing spectrum which aids businesses in managing their web presence, search ranking, social media, mobile and performance metrics. This will give participants a broader understanding of digital marketing and an appreciation of how proper implementation can lead to probable streamlining of business processes.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course consists of a 1-day workshop and a half-day seminar where practitioners will be invited to share their insights and experience with the participants.
 Through a blend of facilitated learning and immersive activities, you will learn about:
The Digital Marketing Landscape
Evaluating web presence
SEO/SEM
Social Media & Mobile Marketing
Performance Metrics & Analysis
The future of Digital Marketing

course_title: MICE Equipment Management and Venue Management (Mandarin) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: MICE Equipment Management and Venue Management (Mandarin) (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The aim of the course is to equip the professionals, managers and executives (PMEs) who are currently working or those intending to make a career switch to the Business Travel, Meetings, Incentives, Conventions and Exhibitions (BTMICE) industry with in-depth knowledge and skills in legal requirements and management of BTMICE equipment and venue. The course also equips learners to develop purchasing, leasing and maintaining equipment service contracts and the equipment maintenance plans.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the module, the learners will be able to : • Event concept and theme and their
effects on equipment and venue management on MICE operations. • Legal requirement relevant to
MICE equipment and venue including venue-related licences, permits and guidelines • Procedures
for purchasing and leasing equipment, develop equipment maintenance plans, and MICE related
equipment service contracts. • Venue management including distinguishing features, identify
advantages and disadvantages of venues, review venue and spatial requirements, multi-venue
management and environmental action plans
course_entry_req:
1) Above 21 years of age and have at least 2 years of work experience in supervisory or leadership position. 
2) Able to speak, listen, read and write Mandarin at a proficiency of GCE ‘N’ or Hanban BCT (A) score not lower than 241 or BCT (B) score of not lower than 121.

course_title_cleaned: Survive the Robots! Preparing Hospitality and Tourism Professionals
course_objective: This course aims to prepare participants for the "Fourth Industrial Revolution", a future where physical, digital and biological technologies come together. Participants will be exposed to real world examples in the hospitality and tourism industry where these areas have converged, and understand how technology in the form of robotics has been harnessed by the industry leading to greater operations efficiency and effectiveness.
course_learning_outcomes:
The rise of digital technology has transformed business operations as well as how consumers purchase and consume travel and lifestyle experiences.
The march of artificial intelligence and robotics is expected to gather strength over the next decade and make significant impact on the travel industry landscape.

course_title: The Adult Education (AE) Globetrotter - Using Skills Framework (SFw) for Glocalisation
course_title_cleaned: The Adult Education (AE) Globetrotter - Using Skills Framework (SFw) for Glocalisation
course_objective:
This programme is the first of its kind where learners get to equip themselves with the foundations of Singapore's SFw and how to utilize the latter for market entry into foreign country TAE markets.
By the end of this session, participants will be able to:
- Explain the purpose and intent of the Skills Framework (SFw), identifying the ways in which it can benefit learning designers
- Describe how the various components of the SFw are used in the design of learning programmes and activities
- Apply the SFw content and guidelines in designing learning programmes and activities, such as:
- Determining the skill and performance requirements for a job role
- Developing a simple curriculum outline
- Performing competency mapping tasks
- Developing learning outcomes which are aligned with performance requirements
- Identify and resolve misapplications of the purpose and usage of SFw in the process of learning design
- Describe the rationales for internationalisation
- Apply Business Acumen for TAE internationalization
- Utilise the macro business environment tool PESTLE to analyse disruptors and influencers
- Utilise the Skills Framework as a Market Entry Strategy
course_learning_outcomes: Is Singapore's domestic market for TAE too limiting for you? Thinking of expanding your TAE skillsets beyond the conventional learning design and delivery to include contextualizing Singapore's Skills Frameworks for adoption in foreign country TAE markets and open up new market opportunities for yourself in the process? Even better, how about getting paid upon successful completion of this programme, and potentially securing assignment & project opportunities right after programme completion? This programme is the first of its kind where learners get to equip themselves with the foundations of Singapore's SFw and how to utilize the latter for market entry into foreign country TAE markets, through a hybrid delivery mode comprising facilitated online learning plus a project.

course_title: WSQ Digital Marketing Strategy using Design Thinking – Level 4
course_title_cleaned: WSQ Digital Marketing Strategy using Design Thinking – Level 4
course_objective: This course “WSQ Digital Marketing Strategy using Design Thinking – Level 4” is designed for learners to evaluate customer response and sales performance to identify and determine effectiveness of different forms of marketing programs and channels to optimize business performance. This provides innovative solution to expand your business through various marketing channels with the focus of design thinking. It covers Double Diamond Design Thinking process and its application in planning digital marketing strategy for your business.
course_learning_outcomes:
What You'll Learn:

Section 1: Introduction to Design Thinking for Digital marketing and Discover Phase
	Define marketing plans and objectives for a range of channels and platforms.
	Advantages, constraints and interactivity among different traditional or digital marketing channels.

Section 2: Empathy Phase in Design Thinking
	Customer touchpoints. Range of marketing technologies and tools. Impact of different platforms and marketing activities.
	Evaluate customer response and sales performance.

Section 3: Ideation and Prototype Phase in Design Thinking
	Select marketing channel mix that best satisfies target market. 
	Types of tools used to assess weekly mix.
	Establish targets based on current needs so as to identify and come up with ideas that can be executed based on the similarities and compatibility of traditional and digital marketing.

Section 4: Testing Phase in Design Thinking
	Devise ways to align with marketing mix across platform.
	Performance indicators of various marketing channels mix. 
	Recommended steps to integrate both traditional and digital marketing efforts.
course_entry_req:
•	Speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the WPL Level 5, and manipulate numbers at a not lower than the 
WPN Level 5   	
•	Minimal education qualification is at least 1 GCE ‘A’ Level pass or 1 GCE ‘O’ Level pass or 1 GCE ‘N’ Level or National ITE certificate (Nitec) or equivalent
•	Ability to use Windows and/or Mac OS
•	Ability to use Word Processing and Presentation software
•	Owns a Google and Facebook account

course_title: MICE Equipment Management and Venue Management (Synchronous e-learning)
course_title_cleaned: MICE Equipment Management and Venue Management (Synchronous e-learning)
course_objective: The aim of the course is to equip the professionals, managers and executives (PMEs) who are currently working or those intending to make a career switch to the Business Travel, Meetings, Incentives, Conventions and Exhibitions (BTMICE) industry with in-depth knowledge and skills in legal requirements and management of BTMICE equipment and venue. The course also equips learners to develop purchasing, leasing and maintaining equipment service contracts and the equipment maintenance plans.
course_learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the module, the learners will be able to :
•	Event concept and theme and their effects on equipment and venue management on MICE operations.
•	Legal requirement relevant to MICE equipment and venue  including venue-related licences, permits and guidelines
•	Procedures for purchasing and leasing equipment, develop equipment maintenance plans, and MICE related equipment service contracts.
•	Venue management including distinguishing features, identify advantages and disadvantages of venues, review venue and spatial requirements, multi-venue management and environmental action plans

course_title: Hands On with Robotic Process Automation
course_title_cleaned: Hands On with Robotic Process Automation
course_objective: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is one of the top strategies for companies to go digital transformation and improve productivities. Singapore government recently launched a national programme, AI Singapore, to help companies with RPA adoption. Companies need to ensure that their employees have good understanding of RPA to support a successful adoption. This practical oriented course uses use cases to given learners hands-on experience on RPA. At the end of the course, learners will have a good undersand of RPA. RPA is to automate processes through software bots running in computers. Manufacturing processes, which involves manual procedures using computer, may be automated using RPA.  The file processing and database use cases may be introduced in the context of manufacturing, e.g. bill of materials, inventory etc.
course_learning_outcomes:
A. Introduction to RPA (1 hour)
B. Get Started with UiPath (2 hours)
C. In-depth Understanding on UiPath (4 hours)
D. Common Tasks Automation using RPA (7 hours)
course_entry_req: Applicants need to have a reasonable aptitude for mathematics. Applicants do not need to have any programming background.

course_title: Using Technology in Mathematics Education
course_title_cleaned: Using Technology in Mathematics Education
course_objective: At the end of the course the participant will be able to:  Consider current issues in the use of information and communications technology (ICT) in the teaching and learning of mathematics at the primary, secondary, and junior college levels;  Consider implications for curriculum planning and classroom implementation of the use of appropriate ICT resources;  Acquire familiarity with some ICT tools including handheld technology and computer software applications;  Provide a framework which allows teachers to make informed decisions about appropriate uses of ICT.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course covers various ICT tools commonly used in the mathematics classroom such as dynamic geometry software, graphing utilities, spreadsheets, calculators (including graphing calculators), computer algebra systems, and the Internet. The scope of study includes the roles these technological tools play in the teaching and learning of mathematics. The focus is on how technology can be harnessed to enhance mathematics instruction in schools.



Week 1 -7: Review of research on and use of common software (e.g., graphing utilities, dynamic geometry software, spreadsheets)

Week 8 - 13: Review of research on and use of handheld technology, computer algebra systems (CAS), and other emerging technologies

course_title: A Practical Introduction to Augmented Reality
course_title_cleaned: A Practical Introduction to Augmented Reality
course_objective: This course will give an introduction into the latest state of the art in Augmented Reality (AR) technology and will give an overview of current AR applications in industry and education.
course_learning_outcomes: This one-day course will start with lectures about the fundamentals of AR including feature recognition and tracking. In the following, an overview about hardware developments and devices will be given. The course will also contain a hands-on session where participants will have the opportunity to use the Fraunhofer in-house library visionLib to create some simple AR demos. The course will conclude with an overview and demonstration of real world applications in various industry and education sectors.

course_title: Autonomous Robots & Vehicles
course_title_cleaned: Autonomous Robots & Vehicles
course_objective: The global market for mobile robotics is forecast to grow rapidly at CAGR of 15.6%, reaching US$30Billion by 2025. This growth will have a substantial transformative effect on most industry sectors, with numerous applications already being found in manufacturing, engineering, transportation, healthcare, retail etc. It is thus imperative to equip engineers and other professionals in Singapore with the knowledge and skills to design, develop and apply mobile robotic applications.   Self-driving cars are a popular example of an autonomous vehicle, an example that most people will be familiar with. Using autonomous driving technology as a reference for market potential and demand pertaining to autonomous vehicle and robots, a research made publicly available by Intel (conducted by Strategy Analytics) predicted autonomous driving technology to enable a new “Passenger Economy” worth $7 trillion. Sharing a similar positive outlook, a research by Frost & Sullivan in 2018 predicted the global autonomous driving market to grow up to $173.15 billion by 2030.   In Singapore, it was envisaged that driverless buses could be on the roads as early as 2020.  There are also visible desires to increase utilisation of drones, autonomous vehicles and other autonomous technology across many sectors.   Aligned with the nationwide push for a Smart Nation, commercial and public organisations alike are actively commencing projects to design and trial smart systems in a control manner to assess feasibility based on a variety of use cases. A similar trend can be observed globally, with self-driving vehicles trials being conducted in various environments, other trials such as drones being using to transport organs for transplant and etc.  This course differs from other robotics courses as emphasis is placed on practical and hands-on learning,to ensure that the contents taught have relevance to real-life applications.   The main highlights of this course include: (a) having to apply state-of-the-art Hand Guiding technology on an OpenManipulator-X robotic arm, (b) having the opportunity to physically configure a ROS-enabled TurtleBot3 (that utilizes LIDAR technology and can be configured into an autonomous vehicle), and (c) having to configure an autonomous system that is a combination of the TurtleBot3 and the OpenManipulator-X robotic arm (as depicted below).
course_learning_outcomes:
Module 1: Introduction to autonomous robots and vehicles
1. Introduction to autonomous systems 
2. Applications
3. Use-cases

Module 2 : Holistic design approach for autonomous systems – Application of Systems Engineering concepts
1. Fundamentals of Systems Engineering in relevance to autonomous systems
2. Systematic, holistic design approach for autonomous systems
3. Workshop: Designing a use case for autonomous systems using a holistic design approach

Module 3 : Technical Fundamentals – Autonomous Vehicles & Robotics Technology
1. Understanding the general architecture of Autonomous Systems
2. Challenges faced while designing or developing Autonomous Systems
3. Other aspects of Autonomous Systems Design
4. Understanding the concept of technologies and system architectures that are involved in Autonomous Vehicles and Robots
5. Workshop: Assemble and program an autonomous robot arm

Module 4 : Standards/Technical Reference for autonomous vehicles
1. Sharing and elaboration on selected standards topics
-TR-68 (Singapore context)
-Other equivalent/relevant standards

Module 5 : Technical Fundamentals – In-depth Technologies and Basics of Simulation & Analysis for Autonomous Vehicles
1. Self-driving cars’ perception and decision-making
2. Basics of Simulation & Analysis
3. Workshop: Software simulation for autonomous vehicles

Module 6 : Developing Basic Autonomous Vehicle Systems
1. Automotive Basics
2. Step-by-Step guidelines on how to develop basic autonomous vehicle systems
3. Workshop: Develop basic autonomous vehicle systems

Module 7 : Developing an MVP (Minimum Viable Product) for your Organisation
1. Future of Autonomous Vehicles in Industry Transformation
2. Design Considerations
3. Development Process for Autonomous Robots and Vehicles

Final Written Assessment
course_entry_req: Please see course weblink for more information

Aligned with the nationwide push for a Smart Nation, commercial and public organisations alike are actively commencing projects to design and trial smart systems in a control manner to assess feasibility based on a variety of use cases. A similar trend can be observed globally, with self-driving vehicles trials being conducted in various environments, other trials such as drones being using to transport organs for transplant and etc.  This course differs from other robotics courses as emphasis is placed on practical and hands-on learning,to ensure that the contents taught have relevance to real-life applications.   The main highlights of this course include: (a) having to apply state-of-the-art Hand Guiding technology on an OpenManipulator-X robotic arm, (b) having the opportunity to physically configure a ROS-enabled TurtleBot3 (that utilizes LIDAR technology and can be configured into an autonomous vehicle), and (c) having to configure an autonomous system that is a combination of the TurtleBot3 and the OpenManipulator-X robotic arm (as depicted below). \n\n# course learning outcomes\nModule 1: Introduction to autonomous robots and vehicles
1. Introduction to autonomous systems 
2. Applications
3. Use-cases

Module 2 : Holistic design approach for autonomous systems – Application of Systems Engineering concepts
1. Fundamentals of Systems Engineering in relevance to autonomous systems
2. Systematic, holistic design approach for autonomous systems
3. Workshop: Designing a use case for autonomous systems using a holistic design approach

Module 3 : Technical Fundamentals – Autonomous Vehicles & Robotics Technology
1. Understanding the general architecture of Autonomous Systems
2. Challenges faced while designing or developing Autonomous Systems
3. Other aspects of Autonomous Systems Design
4. Understanding the concept of technologies and system architectures that are involved in Autonomous Vehicles and Robots
5. Workshop: Assemble and program an autonomous robot arm

Module 4 : Standards/Technical Reference for autonomous vehicles
1. Sharing and elaboration on selected standards topics
-TR-68 (Singapore context)
-Other equivalent/relevant standards

Module 5 : Technical Fundamentals – In-depth Technologies and Basics of Simulation & Analysis for Autonomous Vehicles
1. Self-driving cars’ perception and decision-making
2. Basics of Simulation & Analysis
3. Workshop: Software simulation for autonomous vehicles

Module 6 : Developing Basic Autonomous Vehicle Systems
1. Automotive Basics
2. Step-by-Step guidelines on how to develop basic autonomous vehicle systems
3. Workshop: Develop basic autonomous vehicle systems

Module 7 : Developing an MVP (Minimum Viable Product) for your Organisation
1. Future of Autonomous Vehicles in Industry Transformation
2. Design Considerations
3. Development Process for Autonomous Robots and Vehicles

Final Written Assessment \n\n# course entry req\nPlease see course weblink for more information\n\n

course_title: Cloud Computing Security and Compliance 101

course_objective: This course introduces you to the world of cloud computing security. You will learn a consistent way of developing cloud security competency and provides the confidence you need to adopt secure cloud solutions. Understand the best practices of dealing with cloud security

course_title: Computer Security (System Security)
course_title_cleaned: Computer Security (System Security)
course_objective: On successful completion of the course, the student should be able to:   a. Understand security mechanisms in modern computer systems, its role, and its importance;   b. Understand techniques for implementing security policies;   c. Use and operate access-control mechanisms;   d. Understand vulnerabilities associated with computer systems, and how they can be mitigated.
course_learning_outcomes:
This course introduces computer security mechanisms at an elementary level.  

1. Concepts and Terminology: security; confidentiality, integrity and availability; security policies; security models; mandatory and discretionary access control; access control matrix, capabilities and access control lists; information flow;  

2. Security Models: information flow policies; role-based access control  

3. Implementation of Mechanisms: security mechanisms in hardware and operating systems; memory management, memory protection and logical protection; access control lists  

4. User authentication: passwords, biometrics and user tokens; identity management  

5. Case Studies: Intel processor family; Windows; Unix  

6. Operating system vulnerabilities: how they can be exploited and how they can be prevented  

7. Software security: buffer overflows and exploits; validati

course_title: Conversational Uis
course_title_cleaned: Conversational Uis
course_objective: Conversational User Interfaces (UIs) refers to the user-machine interaction model with the interactions occurring in the user’s spoken or written natural language. It can be implemented as applications like chatbots, virtual assistants, virtual personal assistants (VPA)-enabled wireless speakers like Amazon Echo and Google Home, etc.   Conversational UIs have drawn increasing interest from enterprises and consumers, as an alternative to GUIs, promising the shift in the responsibility of learning from user to interface. Deployed Conversational UIs now start to impact sectors like customer service, connected home solutions, smart healthcare/homecare, etc.  This course provides essential knowledge and skills required to design and build systems that can interact with users using spoken or written natural language. A combination of lectures, case studies, and workshops will be used to cover the applications of conversational UI, architectures and components of such systems, the design of conversation flow and dialogue management, Natural Language Processing techniques enabling systems to understand user utterances, response generation, handling speech input and output, evaluation metrics, etc.
course_learning_outcomes:
• Introduction of Conversational UI
• Conversation Design
• Evaluating Conversational UI
• Understanding the Content of User’s Utterances
• Response Generation
• Speech Recognition
• Speech Synthesis
• Speaker Identification
• Speech Dialogue Application

course_title: Design Secure Mobile Architecture
course_title_cleaned: Design Secure Mobile Architecture
course_objective: As mobile adoption grows, so do security threats. Mobile devices are already an essential tool carried or worn by users worldwide and displacing conventional computers for everyday needs. With the number of smartphones and tablets on the increase, attacks on mobile devices are maturing. Gartner predicts that the focus of endpoint breaches will shift to smartphones and tablets in this year.  Mobile devices are affected by a range of security vulnerabilities, many of which are inherited from traditional attacks against web and desktop applications. However, several other classes of attack are specific to the mobile area and arise due to the way in which mobile applications are designed and the relatively unique entry points and attack surfaces that these applications create.  This course provides a technical review of the top security risks and controls to the iOS, Android and WebView mobile platforms, mobile apps development and integration to the enterprise that every IT professional needs to know. By combining lectures with discussion and hands-on workshops, the course prepares the mindset of participants to review the proposed mobile security architecture for businesses.
course_learning_outcomes:
•Overview of Enterprise Mobile Security
•Mobile Platforms Security
•Mobile Apps Development Security
•Mobile Application Integration and Management Security
course_entry_req: Please see course weblink for more information

course_title: Digital Transformation Planning
course_title_cleaned: Digital Transformation Planning
course_objective: The pace of digital disruption in today’s environment is such that digital transformation is needed to enable technology advancements, together with physical and digital assets, to improve customer experience and thereby create a competitive advantage for organisations. The process of Digital Technology Planning helps to identify gaps and build bridges between people, process, technology and increasingly, information. This enables organisations, if not the opportunity to be disruptors, the ability to withstand any disruptions that come their way.  This course examines an organisation and how it can embrace digital in the pursuit of value creation. It introduces tools for internal and external analysis to help identify digital opportunities. An architectural approach is then taken to create a transformation plan.  This course is part of the Digital Strategy & Leadership series as well as the Professional Diploma in Smart Health Leadership offered by NUS-ISS.
course_learning_outcomes:
• What is digital?
• The customer value proposition
• Identifying critical success factors
• Internal and external business analysis
• The transformation plan

course_title: Diploma in Engineering with Business
course_title_cleaned: Diploma in Engineering with Business
course_objective: The Diploma in Engineering with Business gives you the best of both worlds and will train you to be a business-savvy engineer. In this course, you will not just acquire knowledge and skills in electrical and mechanical engineering principles but also learn how to apply business concepts to engineering products and businesses. If you are interested in science, maths and technology, but do not want to pursue a pure engineering course, this is the right choice for you.
course_learning_outcomes:
Learn from experts from three SP schools School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, School of Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering and SP Business School. Up to 30% of the curriculum consist of business modules taught by the Business School. Strong focus on marketing as part of business modules, allowing Engineering students an edge in the industry. Experience a semester-long internship programme in world-class companies. Experience the culture and the way of doing business overseas in countries such as China, through a semester-long immersion programme in overseas universities such as Beijing Technology and Business University. You can gain direct entry into the second year of various Business Degrees offered by the University of Birmingham at SIM or complete their Bachelor of Innovation and Entrepreneurship degree in one year with the University of Adelaide
- Singapore.
course_entry_req: a) English Language 1 - 7 b) Mathematics (Elementary / Additional) 1 - 6 c) Any two other subjects 1 - 6

Master of  Business Administration (MBA) & Master of Public Administration (MPA)

More than 1 year

Full Time

# full course fee

# course number of hours
1820.00 hours

# course language
English

# course objective
Combining the strengths of both NUS Business School and the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy, this double degree programme - the first of its kind in the region - aims to attract the region's outstanding executives; particularly those who intend to pursue careers in government and its enterprises. For the latest tuition fees, please visit https://lkyspp.nus.edu.sg/graduate-admissions/fees-and-funding for updates.

# course learning outcomes
NUS Business School courses:
-Financial Accounting 4 units
-Financial Management 4 units
-Corporate Strategy 4 units
-Marketing Management 4 units
-Managerial Operations and Analytics 4 units
-Leading with Impact 4 units
-Launch Your Transformation 4 units
-MBA Survival Kit 4 units
-MBA Consulting Project 4 units 
-Electives (20 units)
+ LKY School courses                                                                                    
 A. Core courses - Economic Analysis, Policy Analysis, Public Management 12 units
B. Electives 16 units
C. Governance Study Project 4 units

course_title: Master of Science (Physics for Technology)
course_title_cleaned: Master of Science (Physics for Technology)
course_objective: The Master of Science in Physics for Technology (MPT) is a multi-disciplinary programme that offers knowledge in physics, photonics, electronics, materials science, quantum technology, big data and computing with a practical orientation to solve problems in high technology. The MPT aims to equip high-technology R&D professionals and fresh graduates with current knowledge and skills in scientific innovations and technology. The domain knowledge includes quantum physics and technology, solid-state physics, photonics, electronic/optical materials and fabrication, computational methods, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The MPT strives to equip its students with both the theoretical background necessary to approach complex problems and the practical know-how to solve these problems in quantum technology, semiconductor technology, photonic technology, technologies for advanced materials, and big data and AI technology.
course_learning_outcomes:
The MPT programme has one intake per year, with candidates joining in August every year. This programme is offered as a full-time programme and a part-time programme.

For full-time candidates, the typical candidature of the MSc programme is one year, in line with other 40 units Masters programmes within the university. The maximum period of candidature is two years.

For part-time candidates, the typical candidature of the MSc programme is two years, in line with other 40 units Masters programmes within the university. The maximum period of candidature is four years.

Each candidate has to complete 40 units: 20 units from the compulsory courses and project, plus other 5 elective courses chosen from the list of electives for five key thematics or other courses upon department approval.

# course objective
The Master of Science in Physics for Technology (MPT) is a multi-disciplinary programme that offers knowledge in physics, photonics, electronics, materials science, quantum technology, big data and computing with a practical orientation to solve problems in high technology. The MPT aims to equip high-technology R&D professionals and fresh graduates with current knowledge and skills in scientific innovations and technology. The domain knowledge includes quantum physics and technology, solid-state physics, photonics, electronic/optical materials and fabrication, computational methods, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The MPT strives to equip its students with both the theoretical background necessary to approach complex problems and the practical know-how to solve these problems in quantum technology, semiconductor technology, photonic technology, technologies for advanced materials, and big data and AI technology.

# course learning outcomes
The MPT programme has one intake per year, with candidates joining in August every year. This programme is offered as a full-time programme and a part-time programme.

For full-time candidates, the typical candidature of the MSc programme is one year, in line with other 40 units Masters programmes within the university. The maximum period of candidature is two years.

For part-time candidates, the typical candidature of the MSc programme is two years, in line with other 40 units Masters programmes within the university. The maximum period of candidature is four years.

Each candidate has to complete 40 units: 20 units from the compulsory courses and project, plus other 5 elective courses chosen from the list of electives for five key thematics or other courses upon department approval.

course_title: Master of Science in the Department of Physics
course_title_cleaned: Master of Science in the Department of Physics
course_objective: The department of Physics offers MSc by research, on a part-time and full-time basis.  Master's degree programmes are primarily designed to prepare students for the practice of a profession, or to master a subject area as a precursor to doctoral training.
course_learning_outcomes:
Students are required to take three graduate level modules.  This provides a graduate level foundation and prepares the student for research work. The modules offered vary year to year, please refer to the programme website for information on the modules. The research works which forms the largest single component culminate to a thesis will be examined. 

Student will work under the supervision of an academic staff member whose research interests are in the area proposed by the student.  
The research areas in the department of Physics are as follows:
-Physics at the Nanoscale (Nanomaterials, Ion Beam Applications, Nuclear Microscopy, Nanophotonics, Organic Nanodevices, Surface Science, Graphene) 
-Advanced Functional Materials (Magnetic, Optical, Organic Electronic and Spintronics Materials, Advanced batteries) 
-Biophysics (Micro / Nano Structures, Complex Fluids, Molecular Motors, Single-Molecule Study) Nonlinear and Complex Systems ? Quantum Information and Technology 
-Theoretical and Computational Condensed Matter Physics 
-Theoretical Physics (General Relativity, Gravity, String Theory, Quantum Field Theory, Astrophysics)

course_title: Problem Solving using Pattern Recognition
course_title_cleaned: Problem Solving using Pattern Recognition
course_objective: Pattern recognition is one of the most important areas of Artificial Intelligence. It is a branch of machine learning that focuses on the recognition of patterns and regularities in data. Pattern recognition systems can be trained from labelled training data through supervised learning and or unlabelled data through unsupervised learning.  Pattern recognition has been widely used to solve many real-world problems such as image processing, speech recognition, data mining, business analytics, etc. There are many pattern recognition techniques available to perform different tasks such as regression, classification, clustering, etc. using various statistical and machine learning algorithms.  This course will be useful for participants to acquire pattern recognition knowledge. It will help participants analyse data more effectively by deriving useful hidden patterns in the data. Participants will also learn how to select and apply the most suitable pattern recognition techniques to solve the given problems and develop pattern recognition systems.  This course is part of the Artificial Intelligence and Graduate Certificate in Pattern Recognition Systems Series offered by NUS-ISS.
course_learning_outcomes:
• Introduction to problem solving using pattern recognition
• Solving classification and prediction problems
• Solving clustering and anomaly detection problems
• Component analysis and dimension reduction
• Deep learning basics
• Practical case studies and workshops
course_entry_req: Please see course weblink for more information

In today's era of Information, Data is the new driving force, provided we know how to extract relevant Intelligence. This course will cover the basic principles of Data Science, and will equip you with the standard tools and techniques of data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, data visualization, data-based inference, and data-focussed communication through hands-on exercises, which are the foundations that are used in AI.

# course learning outcomes
Python will be the language of choice to introduce hands-on Data Science techniques using Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn and Plotly.

course_title: The Science of Ageing Gracefully: Diet, Exercise & Skin Care
course_title_cleaned: The Science of Ageing Gracefully  Diet, Exercise & Skin Care
course_objective: This is a course suitable for both genders of all ages and levels of fitness.  The first half of the course provides a quick overview of our body’s dietary requirements, with emphasis on carbohydrates, proteins and lipids, and the body’s response to exercise.  The second half of the course covers an overview of the skin structure, the various causes of ageing and preventive measures. Participant gets hands on experience of making a skin cream.
course_learning_outcomes:
AM Session: Diet & Exercise
- The Urban Lifestyle
- Basic understanding of metabolism of carbohydrates, lipids and proteins in the body
- Role of lifestyle, diet & exercise in weight management 

PM Session: Skin Care
- 3 Layers of the Skin
- Intrinsic and extrinsic signs of aging 
- How to slow down ageing 
- Hands on session on skincare cream making

course_title: Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality
course_title_cleaned: Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality
course_objective: This course provides a general introduction to Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR). The course will cover an overview on AR & VR hardware, software, business and technical considerations for deployment, and industry development trends. It will also address AR and VR immersive technologies as sustainability enablers in the social and environmental context. The participants will get to develop different types of AR applications and explore them on mobile devices, as well as experience immersive visualisation and interactions in the VR environment.
course_learning_outcomes: A short hands-on session will be included for the participants to develop a simple AR app without coding/ programming. Besides, the participants will experience immersive visualisation and interactions in the VR and sustainability environment.

course_title: Color Machine Vision & Applications
course_title_cleaned: Color Machine Vision & Applications
course_objective: With increasing use of robots for a wide range of applications in advanced manufacturing, the ability to see color information will significantly maximise robot's effectiveness and robustness in these applications such as sorting, part identification, etc.
course_learning_outcomes: The availability of color data associated with the manufactured components also adds another dimension of quality inspection which may be hampered by monochrome images.  At the end of this course, learners will be able to design color-based machine vsion algorithms.
